Title: Head of Operations
Summary:
I'm a hyper-organized, nutrition-obsessed, operational nerd with a passion for helping others.

I love taking processes apart, reassembling them or building something new, while creating more organization and documentation along the way.

I love diving into complex concepts, researching answers to every question I can think of, and then creating ways to share that information in a simple-to-understand way for the people that are curious and  looking to expand their own knowledge.

I'm insanely passionate about nutrition with a firm belief in the adage, “let food be thy medicine.” I'm continually blown away by the immense power nutrition can have on people—as well as the growing number of resources and technology designed to empower individuals and enable them to make better decisions for their health.

Together, these skills and passions have enabled me to find that rare, yet happy, place where I can do what I love. My entire professional goal and purpose is to create experiences for people to learn and navigate their health to the best of their ability. That means helping my team work together more efficiently so we can dedicate more time and focus to the customer; putting on my research hat and going head-first down the rabbit hole so I can be better equipped to help customers navigate their own health journey; and working alongside amazing people to amplify impact and reach even more people that crave that knowledge and empowerment.
Description (2): See how food affects your health.
Headline: chaos coordinator | business operations nerd | process improvement specialist | nutrition enthusiast

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary: CEO at Vouchsafe.
Description (2):
Vouchsafe is the infrastructure your business needs to trust fearlessly.

Our platform handles KYC, AML, and ongoing risk assessment in one place. You can verify people securely even without standard photo ID, using digital evidence, documents, or a trusted referee.

Businesses can safely accept a wide range of identity and address evidence including passports, driving licences, eVisas, proof-of-age cards, student IDs, and utility bills. Every verification includes biometric checks to detect spoofing, tampering, and AI-powered fraud.

Vouchsafe combines strong compliance with inclusive design so organisations can onboard more genuine customers, reduce fraud risk, and meet regulatory standards with less friction.

Title: Advisor
Summary:
I partner with visionary founders and leaders who are reshaping industries with breakthrough innovations for human wellness, planetary health, and technology. Whether you're an early-stage founder building from the ground up or leading an organization through critical growth or transformation, I help cut through complexity with the right story and strategic problem-solving.

As a story strategist with deep operational experience, I help shape a company's trajectory. Startups are constantly blazing trails, figuring out the best path forward to build, scale, and stand out. I've helped over 15 founders grow their startups, spanning from initial funding to successful public companies, using my hands-on experience to turn ambitious ideas into market-leading brands.

My work centers on four core strengths: launching revolutionary technologies, building enduring brands, category creation and driving large-scale adoption. I've shaped new categories across mobility (Tesla, SpaceX, Argo), machine learning and fintech (Credit Karma, Affirm), and food systems (Plenty, Meati, Shiru). By combining data-driven insights with compelling narratives, I help translate complex technologies to catalyze industry transformation and behavior change.

My expertise uniquely spans the full spectrum of brand, communications and marketing leadership. From early positioning and fundraising through market expansion and public company growth, I've developed proven approaches for everything from crafting decks and GTM strategies to building high-performing teams and executing tactical campaigns that deliver measurable results. I thrive on solving the unique challenges each stage presents, always finding creative and lean solutions.

What energizes me most is partnering with founders and leaders who think systemically about change. My work with Tesla introduced mass-market EVs, with fintech startups brought AI-powered solutions to consumers, and with food innovators pioneered new approaches to food innovation, production and vertical farming. Each venture represents not just a new product, but a fundamental shift in how we live and work.

I remain deeply curious about each founder's unique vision while bringing years of experience in category creation and market development. My goal is to make life better today and for generations to come by working alongside exceptional people to create meaningful change.
Description (2):
Raconteur Strategies partners with visionary founders and leaders who are reshaping industries with breakthrough innovations for human wellness, planetary health, and technology. Led by story strategists with deep operational experience, we help cut through complexity with cut-through narratives, moats and strategic problem-solving to turn ambitious ideas into market-leading brands.

Our expertise lies in launching revolutionary technologies, building enduring brands, category creation and driving large-scale adoption. We have a proven track record of guiding companies at various stages from initial funding to the public listing, shaping new categories in mobility (Tesla, SpaceX), fintech (Credit Karma, Affirm), and sustainable food systems (Plenty, Meati). By combining data-driven insights with powerful storytelling, we translate complex innovations into transformative market shifts.

Title: Chief Operating Officer
Summary:
As Chief Operating Officer of Ovation Development, my primary focus is on cultivating a healthy, dynamic operation that supports our people through well-designed systems, while ensuring that the right talent is in place to continuously enhance those systems. Ovation Group of Companies, which includes four operational divisions—Development, General Contracting, Property Management, and Asset Management—is powered by a dedicated Operations team nearly 300 strong. We are committed to identifying and nurturing the right individuals to grow alongside us.

My approach to refining business operations is centered on aligning data-driven strategies with executive decision-making, ensuring they are grounded in robust processes that foster collaboration and team synergy. As we oversee a diverse portfolio of over 10,000 multifamily units, my mission is to empower our directors and their teams to excel. At Ovation, our core focus is on BUILDING COMMUNITIES. This collective commitment to collaboration and empowerment drives our initiatives, creating a culture where innovation and efficiency thrive. My dual perspective as COO and co-owner informs every strategy, guiding our journey toward setting industry benchmarks in real estate development, construction, and property Management.
Address - Locations: 10650 W Charleston Blvd, Las Vegas, Nevada 89135, US
Description (2):
Ovation is a family-owned, fully integrated multifamily housing company with over 30 years of experience building and managing communities exclusively in Southern Nevada. We serve as the developer, general contractor, property manager, and asset manager for every community we create—ensuring a long-term commitment to quality and care.

To date, Ovation has built more than 9,700 apartment units and currently owns 40 communities totaling 8,703 units. Our property management arm oversees 46 communities with 10,641 units, reflecting our deep commitment to long-term stewardship and resident experience.

We develop both market-rate and affordable housing, with 15 affordable communities totaling 2,274 units already part of our portfolio. Our active pipeline includes 4 communities under development (711 units) and 14 planned communities (1,137 affordable and 2,489 market-rate units)—representing over $1 billion in future development and more than 3,600 new homes. We’re shaping the future of housing in Las Vegas.

Our in-house design team is focused on creating well-designed, walkable communities that prioritize livability and comfort. We’re committed to sustainable practices and thoughtful design that reflect the needs of residents today—and for generations to come.

Guided by our core values—Have Passion, Always Improve, Do It Right, Build Belonging, and Elevate Experiences—we strive to raise the standard of modern living.
Headline: Chief Operating Officer @ Ovation Co | Process Optimization, Team Collaboration

Description (2):
The core of all AI, business intelligence and applications is data — various bits and bytes that come in all different formats. Only when we sift through this data, reason with it and build on top of it in real time does it give way to vast amounts of information and knowledge.

Real-time insights are key to the way we live our lives today; the way we entertain ourselves; the way we listen to music; the way we order groceries. Real-time insights keep your BI tools fresh; they keep your ride-sharing app with the most current price; and they ensure you never miss a fraudulent payment.

SingleStoreDB is the world’s only database that empowers users to transact, analyze and search data in real time. It empowers the world’s makers to build, deploy and scale modern, intelligent applications — backed by streaming data ingestion, a unique table type that supports both transactional (OLTP) and analytical (OLAP) workloads, limitless point-in-time recovery and a distributed (shared-nothing), MySQL-compatible architecture.
Headline: I/O Psychology | Talent Management | Compensation Analytics

Description: Electrical Engineer + Computer Scientist + SRE turned Founder
Title: CEO & Co-Founder
Summary:
Specializes in the intersection of DevOps, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Cloud Computing. Master's degree in Computer Science from Georgia Tech with a specialization in Interactive Intelligence. Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from George Mason University.

Driven by impact and passionate about empowering female technologists.
Description (2):
Kubernetes scaling is broken. HPA reacts too late, forcing teams to overprovision just to avoid slow scale-ups and service degradation. Meanwhile, observability tools ingest massive amounts of redundant data, driving up costs without improving reliability. You’re either wasting money or risking downtime; there’s no middle ground.

Thoras.ai fixes this.

Thoras is your AI for Kubernetes. It predicts workload demand before it happens, so your infrastructure scales exactly when needed with no excess, and no guesswork. Instead of reacting to spikes after they occur, Thoras analyzes historical patterns, real-time telemetry, and seasonality trends to forecast demand with precision. The result? Higher utilization, fewer wasted resources, and lower cloud bills, with zero sacrifice to performance.

At the same time, Thoras tackles observability bloat. Monitoring stacks collect thousands of low-value metrics, logs, and traces that provide little diagnostic value but significantly increase ingestion and storage costs. Thoras automates the identification and removal of redundant data, cutting observability costs while keeping the critical insights you need.

Thoras delivers predictive scaling, AI-driven observability cost reduction, and Kubernetes-native security without requiring API calls or sending data outside your cluster. It eliminates overprovisioning, stops wasted compute, and ensures reliability without excess.

Backed by top investors like Wellington Ventures, Sinewave Ventures, and Focal VC, Thoras is transforming how engineering teams scale Kubernetes. If you’re ready to stop overpaying for idle compute and useless observability data, let’s talk.
Headline: AI-Driven Reliability & Cost Efficiency

Description (2): Instacart, the leading grocery technology company in North America, works with grocers and retailers to transform how people shop. The company partners with more than 1,500 national, regional, and local retail banners to facilitate online shopping, delivery and pickup services from more than 85,000 stores across North America on the Instacart Marketplace. Instacart makes it possible for millions of people to get the groceries they need from the retailers they love, and for approximately 600,000 Instacart shoppers to earn by picking, packing and delivering orders on their own flexible schedule. The Instacart Platform offers retailers a suite of enterprise-grade technology products and services to power their e-commerce experiences, fulfill orders, digitize brick-and-mortar stores, provide advertising services, and glean insights. With Instacart Ads, thousands of CPG brands – from category leaders to emerging brands – partner with the company to connect directly with consumers online, right at the point of purchase. With Instacart Health, the company is providing tools to increase nutrition security, make healthy choices easier for consumers, and expand the role that food can play in improving health outcomes. For more information, visit www.instacart.com/company.

Title: Company Owner
Summary:
Amare Healing Arts was founded in 2016 by our Plastic Surgery Recovery Specialist, Certified Lymphedema Therapist, Certified Manual Lymphatic Drainage Therapist, Certified Compression Garment Fitter, Licensed Massage Therapist, and owner: Ashley Nagrocki.

Owner Ashley Nagrocki is a Licensed Massage Therapist (LMT), Certified Manual Lymphatic Drainage Therapist (MLD-C)x3 with the MLD Institute, Academy Of Lymphatic Studies (ACOLS) and Norton School of Lymphedema, Certified Lymphedema Therapist (CLT), Certified Medical Compression Garment Fitter, Certified Cosmetic Surgery Therapist (CCST), Certified Yoga Instructor (RYT200), and Certified Ayurvedic Holistic Health Counselor (HHC) with the American Association of Drugless Practitioners. She continues to develop her skills to expand Amare and better serve her clients.

Located at 24 N 3rd Ave, Suite 203, Highland Park, NJ & 433 N Broad St. Suite 2A, Elizabeth, NJ, we specialize in Vodder Manual Lymphatic Drainage (MLD) for post-plastic surgery recovery, cancer recovery, autoimmune diseases, and many other medical conditions involving chronic inflammation, side effects of edema, and persistent, painful swelling.

Our Plastic Surgery Recovery Center not only offers MLD treatment for all surgeries but also provides full support for our clients through their post-op journey.

We offer gentle, hands only, Vodder Manual Lymphatic Drainage Massage. Every client is unique which is why we take the time to customize treatment plans tailored to your individual needs. We believe in working with the body's healing process already taking place, providing natural support, and creating an environment for homeostasis and healing.

Our specialist, Ashley spends time every session offering support and educating clients on how post-op swelling works, the lymphatic system and its role in reducing swelling, the role of compression post-op, how to avoid and get rid of fibrosis and swelling to maximize their sessions and recovery.

We make sure clients have the correct fitting garments, recommend any other supplies they would need (arnica, lipo foams, BBL Pillows, ect.), which can be purchased online in our post-op shop, or during their session, track their progress, and tailor their diet to reduce swelling. Clients see results immediately following the session and continue to see results weeks after treatment has ended. That’s why board-certified plastic surgeons recommend Amare for Manual Lymphatic Drainage and post-op care.

Title: CEO
Summary:
Hemster was born with a simple vision in mind -- could we make the perfect fit accessible at every point of sale? We built first-in-market tech platform to power garment services at scale.

Since then, the company has evolved to take on a more complex supply chain challenge that every brand faces: What should we do with slightly damaged returns, store try-ons, minor manufacturing defects?

Currently, the brands only have a few (not ideal) choices: costly recycling - difficult when the materials are not built to be recycled easily; donations - also difficult since donation centers cannot process that much volume; and as the last resort, incineration or destruction of the goods.

Hemster offers Revive as a first-in-line solution. Before recycling or donating, let our AI-powered platform make a decision of whether this small damage is worth cleaning or repairing to be sold. Only when the damage is too much, we will enter the responsible disposition channels.

In 2023, Revive diverted over 30,000 lbs of landfill. In 2024, we are planning to save over 250,000 lbs of garments from premature death. Join us in prioritizing restoration first.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Description (2): (Re)vive is a leading solution provider addressing the challenges of unstockable and returned inventory for brands. With a proprietary data platform, (Re)vive empowers brands to recover the highest asset value from unstockable inventory while streamlining the supply chain. Headquartered in New York City, (Re)vive is committed to driving sustainability and profitability for brands in the fashion and retail industries. In 2024, (Re)vive became B-Corp certified.
Headline: Founder & CEO Revive | Forbes 30 under 30

Title: President & CEO
Summary:
I’m an award-winning software entrepreneur focused on building stronger public infrastructure for the future of work. My career has centered on creating scalable systems that help people access opportunity—particularly through libraries, universities, and entrepreneurship.

I currently hold two leadership roles:
• Founder & CEO of Skilltype – a workforce analytics and training platform helping knowledge organizations invest in their people using real-time skills data.
• President & CEO of Nexus Louisiana – a 30-year-old nonprofit innovation hub in Baton Rouge advancing high-growth entrepreneurship and inclusive economic development statewide.

Over the past 15 years, I’ve worked across the public and private sectors—from building early-stage startups to advising civic institutions on digital transformation and capacity-building. My work has been trusted by state agencies, university systems, national foundations, and local partners alike. I’m particularly focused on legacy systems that need new models—places where better data, modern tools, and aligned incentives can unlock generational change.

At Skilltype, we serve a global network of knowledge institutions, helping them close skill gaps and prepare their teams for what’s next. At Nexus, we’re reimagining what regional innovation looks like—mobilizing capital, talent, and partnerships to support Louisiana’s next generation of founders.

I write and speak regularly on topics such as workforce equity, public-sector innovation, and the evolving role of libraries in digital society. I’m passionate about partnering with mission-aligned funders who see entrepreneurship, learning, and access to information as drivers of systemic change.

(Professional Note: This profile is maintained for institutional transparency. I do not respond to unsolicited job requests, sales outreach, or recruiting messages. To connect regarding philanthropic partnerships, strategic collaboration, or media inquiries, please reach out via Skilltype or Nexus Louisiana. Thank you for your understanding.)

Description: VC @MetaPropNYC. Author (https://t.co/SHP4zTbFL0), certified coach, speaker. Global real estate, technology, innovation (#PropTech) insights. @YPO. Dad.
Title: Founding Member
Summary:
Aaron is Co-Founder and Managing Partner of MetaProp, a New York-based venture capital firm focused on the real estate technology (“PropTech”) industry. Founded in 2015, MetaProp’s investment team has invested in 150+ technology companies across the real estate value chain. The firm manages multiple investment funds for both financial and strategic real estate investors, representing a pilot- and test-ready sandbox of 20+ billion square feet across every real estate asset type and global market.

Aaron previously served as Chairman of Chicago-based BayRu, LLC, the US-Russia ecommerce shopping and shipping specialist, and eBay.com’s exclusive dropshipping partner for Russia/CIS consumers. After Aaron joined the company in 2010 as an investor and CEO, BayRu grew to become the 8th largest international online retailer in Russia. In 2013, BayRu was #11 on the Inc5000 “Top 100 Retail Companies” list and was named “Exporter of the Year” by the official export promotion magazine of the U.S. Department of Commerce.  Prior to BayRu, Aaron was a commercial real estate executive with Cushman & Wakefield and oversaw more than 270 professionals as leader of the Chicago region. Aaron received numerous honors and awards during his real estate career, including Top Producer, Most Creative Deal, Agency of the Year, and Most Promising Brokerage Professional.

Aaron is widely recognized as a leader in real estate innovation.  He is a certified CEO coach, a guest lecturer at Columbia University and NYU, co-author of Amazon bestseller PropTech 101 (proptech101.com), and was named 2019 Executive of the Year by Commercial Property Executive Magazine.  Aaron's work has also been featured in dozens of international books and media, including The Wall Street Journal, Forbes, Yahoo Finance, Business Insider, TechCrunch, The Chicago Tribune, Crain’s, CBS Radio, Vedomosti, and Kommersant.

Aaron earned a BA from the University of Illinois, an MBA from DePaul University, and has been certified by the Hudson Institute of Coaching.  Outside of work, Aaron served as a board member of numerous organizations, including the Bergen New Bridge Medical Center Young Foundation, Young Presidents Organization (“YPO”), New York City Community Board Five, and Friends of the Chicago River.  A native English speaker, Aaron enjoys regularly practicing foreign languages, including Spanish, Russian, and Japanese.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States

Description (2):
The Marcella Foundation exists to unlock the full potential of youth and families in South Lake Tahoe.

We believe every child deserves the chance to feed their body, expand their mind, and lead their own future. That’s why we invest in bold, community-powered solutions across three core pillars: Feed, Read, and Lead

Feed – We tackle food insecurity through FeedTahoe, a growing hunger relief network that rescues and redistributes thousands of pounds of fresh, local food to neighbors in need.

Read – We expand access to literacy through early childhood book programs, community partnerships, and a districtwide campaign to boost grade-level reading.

Lead – We cultivate youth leadership and entrepreneurship through hands-on programs that help young people design, build, and launch ideas that matter.

We’re locally rooted and community driven — founded by Sean Fannan, a South Lake Tahoe native and tech entrepreneur, and led by a team committed to equity, creativity, and impact.

Awards:

Title: Co-Founder and COO
Summary:
As a serial entrepreneur, I have pioneered companies that have transformed emerging market economies. Leveraging technology, I have had success building and scaling profitable operations to influence social change while generating revenue and growth.

My first company, Juhudi Kilimo, started with the idea of providing small farmers in Kenya with access to financing, enabling them to reinvest in their businesses. Over the course of 6 years, I raised $22M+ in debt and equity, expanded to 20 field offices, and contributed to $30M+ in life-changing loans for 50K+ people. Juhudi Kilimo was the first-ever Certified B-Corporation in Africa and featured in CIO Magazine’s Top 100 list.

As Co-founder & CEO of Leaf Global Fintech, I deployed a blockchain-backed digital wallet across 10 African countries to help refugees and migrants to protect and move assets during flight. Leaf was recognized in 2018 at South by Southwest (SXSW), the National Science Foundation, Techstars, the United Nations, and The Vatican. Leaf was acquired in 2022 by IDT Corporation (NYSE: IDT), a global provider of fintech, cloud, and traditional communications services.
Description (2):
Terraton is a full-stack biochar platform for agribusiness operators ready to build carbon removal into their business. We bring together financing, vetted equipment, standardized facility designs, our custom-built smart facility management software, and access to credit buyers—so operators can build a new line of income alongside their existing business.

Biochar is one of the most proven, scalable, and durable carbon removal methods available today. In 2025, it has already enabled over 100,000 tonnes of verified removals, more than any other method. By heating crop waste—like husks, shells, and prunings—at high temperatures without oxygen, biochar locks carbon away for centuries and creates credits that sell for far more than typical offsets.

Agribusinesses value biochar because it turns low-value waste into reliable revenue and improves soil health. Buyers value it because it’s verifiable, cost-effective, and available now. But despite the demand, supply still lags. High upfront costs, sourcing challenges, and complex carbon markets have slowed new producers from getting started.

Terraton exists to change that. We make biochar simple to start, profitable to run, and scalable across thousands of producers—so carbon removal can keep pace with what the climate demands.
Headline: Co-Founder at Terraton.ai | Carbon Removal | Financial Services CEO and Founder | Building profitable companies that drive social change in emerging markets | Techstars Alum | JD/MBA | Author and Advisor

Title: Chief of Staff
Summary:
I've been fortunate to spend over a decade scaling early-stage startups across AI, SaaS, and consumer sectors. Currently, I serve as Chief of Staff and Venture Partner at SPLY Capital and SPLY Finance, where I lead firm-wide execution, portfolio operations, and cross-functional growth.

My path to venture was shaped by hands-on operating experience — starting at REI and quickly shifting into entrepreneurship. As Co-Founder and President of FLIKR Fire, I was thrown headfirst into building a company from the ground up. Over four years, I led the business through rapid growth, scaling to over $15M+ in lifetime sales, with $7.1M in peak annual revenue and an average 243% year-over-year growth rate— which ultimately led to a successful exit. That chapter shaped much of who I am as a builder and operator.

After FLIKR Fire, I stepped into consulting and fractional leadership roles across AI, hospitality, and consumer startups—helping founders scale ops, refine GTM, and raise capital. I also launched another venture of my own that didn’t take off, but shaped how I think about focus, timing, and execution.

Before stepping into SPLY Capital, I served as EVP and Chief of Staff at EKOM AI, where I led product direction, go-to-market strategy, and operational scale. The role spanned roadmap development, systems design, investor readiness, and cross-functional execution—translating vision into growth across the business.

Outside of work, you’ll usually find me cooking, hosting, getting outside with my pup, staying active, or digging into a house or garden project!

Innovative design. Cutting-edge construction. A forward-thinking, entrepreneurial ethos.

For more than 80 years, STARK has been the leader in the luxury carpet industry, specializing in custom-designed carpets and rugs of unmatched excellence for both to-the-trade designers and the larger consumer market.

STARK is a family company founded in 1938 by Arthur and Nadia Stark, who were early importers of handmade patterned carpets to America. Today, the company continues to prosper under third-generation family members: CEO Chad Stark and Creative Director Ashley Stark.

Throughout decades in business, STARK has become synonymous with luxury interiors and is one of the most beloved brands in the design industry. Our offerings are available on our e-commerce site and in showrooms across the globe, where our experts help designers and consumers bring their rug or carpet vision to life.

STARK is home to a passionate and diverse collective of corporate team members, account managers, showroom experts, craftspeople, and fulfillment specialists who have a shared mission of creating best-in-class products and experiences for clients all over the world. We believe that the heart of a company lies in its people, and are dedicated to fostering a workplace culture that promotes both career and personal growth.

Title: Managing Director
Summary:
Kerry Bannigan is a social entrepreneur pioneering global fashion and media initiatives to advance the creative economy as a driving force for sustainable development.

As the Founder and Executive Director of the Fashion Impact Fund, Kerry spearheads high-level partnerships with business, Governments, and United Nations agencies to support female founders in the fashion industry that are leading sustainable solutions. The charitable fund provides grants to women-led education, media, and workforce development programs that advance fashion industry change. The fund is committed to accelerate women's economic empowerment and leadership as female founders trailblaze initiatives that are addressing the critical issues of our time and collectively transforming communities for people and the planet.

The Conscious Fashion Campaign is a flagship initiative of the Fashion Impact Fund, in collaboration with the United Nations Office for Partnerships and the PVBLIC Foundation, that spotlights female founders advancing fashion industry change on digital billboards to amplify the visibility and increase the media representation of women.

Kerry serves as the President of the Board at the PVBLIC Foundation, providing strategic advisory for impact programs and partnerships including the SDG Media Zone, UN Family Office for Sustainable Development, SDG Media Summit, G8 Young Summit, and G7 Environment.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Address - Locations: New York Ave, New York, US
Description (2):
About PVBLIC Foundation

Bold Innovation. Enduring Legacy. Institutional Impact.

PVBLIC Foundation is a global institution transforming how the world solves its greatest challenges. Positioned at the intersection of diplomacy, development, and disruption, PVBLIC serves as a trusted platform connecting governments, the United Nations, global family offices, and the private sector to turn bold ideas into systemic change.

Through its four institutional pillars: Nature, Technology, Capital, and Multilateralism, PVBLIC redefines what’s possible by building the infrastructure of the future. From enabling sovereign data governance and geospatial capacity-building, to activating real-world natural assets (RWNA), from mobilizing catalytic capital across philanthropy and global family offices, to executing high-level convenings across the UN system, PVBLIC turns vision into implementation.

Renowned for its ability to navigate complexity and deliver results, PVBLIC leads high-impact programs that bridge policy and action, accelerate economic development, and embed sustainability into the global agenda. With technology transfer, innovative financing models, and trusted multilateral partnerships, PVBLIC is advancing the frontier of public-private collaboration.

In a world demanding new models of cooperation and execution, PVBLIC is not just part of the conversation, it is building the global systems that make change possible.
Headline: PVBLIC Foundation | United Nations Fashion and Lifestyle Network | Fashion Impact Fund

Title: Member
Summary:
At the intersection of healthcare, business, and innovation, I am rethinking the systems that define healthspan in Canada.

As Founder & CEO of Integra Health, I’ve built a platform around one belief: healthcare should be the way it was meant to be — integrated, seamless, and built around the patient.

What began as a grassroots clinic has grown into one of Canada’s most comprehensive healthcare enterprises, delivering whole-person care that spans medical, rehabilitation, mental wellness, and wellness services. Our model is simple: one team for every part of your health journey. From same-day medical appointments to physiotherapy and preventive health checks, we make care faster, simpler, and more connected.

Over the past decade, I’ve partnered with leading corporations, governments, and innovators to design solutions that break down barriers to healthcare and deliver measurable impact. Whether supporting frontline needs, advancing corporate health programs, or building integrated systems of care, my focus has always been on creating models that don’t just treat illness — they transform the patient experience.

With more than 20 years in healthcare — from clinical practice to entrepreneurship — my vision remains constant: to set a new standard for healthcare in Canada, one where every person has access to expert-led, coordinated care that extends not just lifespan, but healthspan.

The future of healthcare will demand bold models, fresh ideas, and systems designed around the patient. I’m committed to building them — and this is only the beginning.
Address - Locations: 130 King Street West, Suite 1320, Toronto, ON M5X1C8, CA

Title: Founder
Summary:
Mital Patel is a third-generation entrepreneur from Longview, Texas, with a background in hospitality and business development. After graduating from the Conrad N. Hilton College of Hotel and Restaurant Management at the University of Houston, Mital joined the family business in 2003 and quickly made a significant impact.

By 2007, Mital had shifted his focus to business development, spearheading initiatives in site selection, due diligence, and market analysis. His leadership contributed to doubling the company’s portfolio and increasing its room count by 93% in just two years. During the economic downturn in 2009, he introduced technology-driven solutions that streamlined administrative processes and achieved crucial cost savings.

Following the 2012 merger that created NewcrestImage, Mital played a pivotal role in launching the company’s private equity division, NewcrestImage Investments. As the public face of this division, he has cultivated and managed relationships with investors, driving the success of the company’s real estate investment funds.

Beyond his professional accomplishments, Mital is a passionate adventurer and fine art photographer, with a deep appreciation for the natural world. His love for wildlife and the outdoors has shaped his personal and philanthropic pursuits, including his recent launch of The Simba Trust, a nonprofit dedicated to improving access to education and resources for children in underserved communities. Through his work and philanthropy, Mital strives to create a lasting impact on both people and the planet.
Description (2):
The history of NewcrestImage is a classic tale of big dreams, hard work, and a rise to prosperity through free enterprise. The company’s principals have owned and operated lodging properties since 1977, when they bought their first property, a 22-room roadside motel in Marlin, TX.

Smart acquisitions and timely new builds spurred rapid growth for the principals in the late 1990s. Then in the early 2000s, the creation of two new and complementary divisions — development and management — ushered in a new era of growth, with the company opening over 50 newly constructed
hotels in the decade that followed.

Like any great story, the team at NewcrestImage has battled difficult odds, including weathering the global financial crisis that began in 2008. Within four years, through unity, nimbleness, and creativity, the principals had successfully navigated the worst of the recession and opened an intense pipeline of new projects.

In early 2013, NewcrestImage was formed through the merger of the principals’ prior companies — Newcrest Management and Image Hospitality — by harnessing the unique synergy between development and management.
Headline: Managing Partner at NewcrestImage

New York Collegiate Baseball League

Founded: 1978

Associations: National Alliance of College Summer Baseball (NACSB), partially funded by MLB

Regular Season Length: June 1st-July 23rd

Regular Season Games: 42

Baseball: Diamond

Bat: Wood or Composite

Roster Limit: 35

Division Format:
Eastern Division: Cortland Crush, Onondaga Flames, Rome Generals, Sherrill Silversmiths, Syracuse Spartans, Saratoga Revolution

Western Division: Genesee Rapids, Hornell Dodgers, Niagara Power, Olean Oilers, Rochester Ridgemen, Wellsville Nitros


Eligibility Requirements:
Player must have remaining college eligibility to participate.

Player must have completed at least one full year of school or have at least one year remaining. Graduating high school seniors are eligible depending on circumstances.


Doubleheaders: Doubleheaders will consist of two nine-inning games. If a rain out causes a doubleheader, there will be two seven-inning games. If a resumed game is played and a second game follows, each game will consist of nine full innings. Only a rescheduled doubleheader where neither game has been previously started will consist of two seven-inning games.

Playoff Teams:
Six–The top three teams in the each division advance to the playoffs.

Playoff Format: TBD with 2018 Schedule
The first round will feature the #2 seeded team vs. #3 seeded team in each division in a one game playoff. The winners of these games will advance to the play in the Division Championship series best-of-three series against the #1 seeded team in each division in a 1-1-1 format. The winner's of those two series will play for the NYCBL Championship in a best of three series in a 1-2 format.
Headline: Assistant Sports Information Director at SUNY Broome Community College

Description: Principal at Viscogliosi Bros., LLC
Title: CEO
Summary:
Anthony G. Viscogliosi is a chief executive, entrepreneur, and business strategist with a 26-year record of building neuro-musculoskeletal (NMS) companies from concept through commercialization to strategic exit. He co-founded Viscogliosi Brothers, LLC (VB) with his brothers, John J. and Marc R. Viscogliosi, in 1999—a single-family office/merchant-banking platform dedicated to orthopedics that is 100% owned by the three brothers.

Across their careers, the Viscogliosi brothers have participated in 260+ transactions and founded/invested in 45–46 companies, with VB and its partners realizing >$2.9B in exit value across more than twenty exits.

Anthony currently serves as Executive Chairman & CEO of Companion Spine and—alongside John and Marc—Co-CEO of VB Spine; he also sits on the boards of Centinel Spine and Woven Orthopedic Technologies. He began his career on Wall Street as the first analyst dedicated to the NMS industry, and is known for turning surgeon-innovated concepts into market-leading businesses by assembling high-performing teams, securing capital, and driving focused execution.

He holds a BS in Economics from the University of Michigan, an Honorary Ph.D. from the New York College of Podiatric Medicine, and an Honorary Associate Degree in Humane Letters from Manchester Community College. He is a former Lieutenant Commander, United States Navy Reserve.

If you’d like to connect, please email aviscogliosi@vbllc.com
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Address - Locations: 505 Park Avenue, 14th Floor, New York, NY 10022, US
Description (2):
Viscogliosi Brothers, LLC (VB), headquartered in New York City, specializes in venture capital, private equity and merchant banking for the neuromusculoskeletal industry.

Founded by Anthony, John and Marc Viscogliosi in 1999, the firm creates, builds, operates and finances companies founded on surgeon-developed innovation to address unmet clinical needs uniquely focused on life-changing neuromusculoskeletal technologies. VB principals have participated in more than 200 transactions, have invested in more than 20 companies and have formed nine industry-defining strategic partnerships.

VB invests in technologies whose applications benefit patients and the healthcare system by improving quality of care, reducing costs, and expanding patient and provider access. With enhanced data, VB attempts to identify the technologies that best satisfy these criteria and works to transform them into successful medical breakthroughs that enable patients to regain active lifestyles.

VB, its affiliates, and its partnerships have generated more than $1.5 billion in exit value on behalf of their shareholders and investor base.

Through its portfolio companies, VB has defined five entirely novel orthopedic industry categories.

Its investments have helped commercialize more than 75 med-tech devices, including ten number one orthopedic technologies.

VB portfolio companies have sold products in more than 70 countries.

VB invests its own capital in every venture, and is wholly committed to the operational, clinical, and financial success of each of its portfolio investments. Current portfolio companies within the VB ecosystem include, but are not limited to, Paradigm Spine, Centinel Spine, Woven Orthopedics Technology, Musculoskeletal Clinical Regulatory Advisers, and Aperion Biologics.
Headline: Principal at Viscogliosi Bros., LLC

Title: Vice President, North America
Summary:
I’ve spent my career leading teams of all sizes—commercial, service, product, marketing and more —across both a large, global public company as well as a smaller, niche business. I’m energized by bringing clarity to complexity, helping build great people, and supporting customers through focus, strategy, and action.

One of the most important leadership principles I hold is a “No Surprise Culture.” I believe in transparency, direct feedback, and making sure people always know where they stand. Feedback is a gift, and when teams operate with honesty and trust, performance accelerates.

I’m also a believer in moving quickly -- but deliberately. Analysis paralysis is the enemy of progress. We try things, learn fast, fix what needs fixing, and keep going. Urgency, iteration, and thoughtful risk-taking are essential to building momentum.

Jim Collins has been a key influencer in how I lead: get the right people on the bus and in the right seats—and continually ask whether those seats even belong on the bus. Prioritization is everything. Clear “what’s in / what’s out” alignment helps teams stay focused, and I subscribe to the idea that we all need not just a To Do list, but a To Don’t list as well.

I’m passionate about leveraging technology and AI to make us sharper, faster, and more efficient. I don’t believe AI will replace us—but I do believe that people who embrace it will outperform those who don’t. If we’re not moving forward, we’re moving backward.

Above all, leadership is about people. There is nothing more rewarding than seeing someone grow, gain confidence, and achieve their career goals. That’s the work that matters most to me.

Outside of work, I’m a proud dad of three and someone who values balance across family, community, friendships, and time to recharge. I’m always learning, always improving, and always trying to lead with clarity, energy, and purpose.
Address - Locations: 1500 Mittel Boulevard, Wood Dale, IL 60191, US

Videojet Technologies is a world leader in the product identification market, providing in-line printing, coding and marking products, consumables and software solutions. We serve more than 20 industries including food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, electronics, chemical and aerospace industries as well as many more with an aim to preserve the safety, quality and authenticity of daily essentials for billions of consumers.

We have been the world leaders in marking and coding technology for over 40 years, having come to fruition in the 1960’s as a division of the A.B Dick Company. Today we operate in 135 countries with more than 4000 passionate employees worldwide, specializing in sales to application, technical, and service support we are committed to making a positive impact globally.

Our extensive product portfolio includes all technologies from pack to palette;

· Continuous Ink Jet printers (CIJ),

· Laser Marking Systems,

· Thermal Transfer Overprinters (TTO),

· Print and Apply Labeling (LPA),

· Thermal Inkjet Printers (TIJ),

· Commercial Graphics and Addressing, CLARiSUITE, and Code Assurance.

Our success is built on four key brand pillars: adaptability, consistency, usability, and expertise, which guide us in providing innovative solutions tailored to our customers' coding and marking needs across various industries.

Join us on our journey as we safeguard the world's most vital resources through cutting-edge product identification solutions and shaping the future of industry standards and reliability.

Title: President & CEO
Summary:
Christina Sass is a lifelong champion of youth and a fierce advocate for women and diverse leaders across the globe. She brings a wealth of experience in global development and youth employment as the President and Chief Executive Officer of IYF.

Prior to joining IYF, Christina co-founded Andela in 2014, an on-ramp to the digital economy for thousands of young technologists across the globe. Christina served as Andela’s COO and President, where she played a pivotal role in scaling Andela to six countries in Africa, selecting, training, and placing developers as full-time team members in growing tech companies around the world. Together with her co-founder, she raised over $181M in venture capital, growing from two people to over 2,000 employees and acquiring 200+ clients, achieving a $50M annual revenue run rate in six years. Today, Andela is the world’s largest private marketplace of skilled technical talent, operating in over 150 countries. Christina has demonstrated her commitment to driving positive change and fostering innovation as an active investor in impact-oriented, early-stage Future of Work companies, both as an angel and through Dive In, a fund which invests and offers extensive executive coaching to founding teams.

Christina has also held pivotal positions at renowned organizations dedicated to advancing education and employment opportunities for youth. Notably, she directed the Program department of the Clinton Global Initiative and provided strategic counsel to the President and CEO of The MasterCard Foundation, a $30B global foundation committed to enhancing education and financial inclusion for African youth.

Christina's dedication to youth empowerment extends beyond her professional endeavors. She has built education and employment programs in diverse regions, including China, Gaza and the West Bank, Kenya, and Nigeria, reflecting her commitment to expanding opportunities for young people worldwide. Christina serves on the Advisory Council of the NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights and the board of Global Give Back Circle, a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering at-risk adolescent girls.

Christina holds a BA in Ancient Philosophy from the University of Georgia (Go Dawgs) and an MA in International Law and Diplomacy from The Fletcher School at Tufts University.

Title: CEO & Co-Founder
Summary:
Hi, I’m Levon, the guy behind the scenes at Collectly, where we’re tackling the everyday challenges of healthcare finance with a bit of tech magic. I believe in making life easier for both healthcare providers and their patients, and that’s what I work towards every day.

My journey started at the intersection of law and business, leading me to the world of startups, where I found my true calling. As a co-founder, I’ve had my fair share of late nights and exhilarating breakthroughs, and I’ve seen firsthand how the right technology can make a real difference.

Here at Collectly, we’re proud to have sped up the payment process, but what really gets me going is knowing we’re making people’s experiences better. It’s not just about numbers; it’s about real humans and the healthcare journeys they navigate.

I’m always up for a good chat about tech, startups, or anything healthcare-related. If you’re in the industry, thinking about a startup, or just want to talk shop, feel free to reach out. Let’s share stories and learn from each other.

You can find out more about what we do at www.collectly.co or just drop me a line here on LinkedIn.
Location Name: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
Description (2):
Collectly is an AI-powered technology company transforming how healthcare organizations manage the patient financial experience—from digital intake and pre-visit financial engagement to final payment.

Our platform automates every step of the revenue cycle to help providers:
1 Accelerate and increase cash flow
2 Increase patient satisfaction
3 Reduce administrative burden
4 Slash the cost to collect

We serve a wide range of specialties and org types—from ambulatory groups and acute care systems to RCM companies and behavioral health providers—helping them modernize patient billing and boost financial performance at scale.

Collectly also includes Billie—your new AI-powered billing support rep that never sleeps. Billie responds instantly across chat, email, SMS, and voice—reducing support volume by up to 85%, resolving questions faster, and helping patients understand what they owe, why, and how to pay.

It’s not just about which channels you use—it’s how you use them. Collectly intelligently delivers the right message at the right time, in the right format, tailored to each patient’s context. With seamless EHR/PM integration, workflows stay connected and efficient.

With Collectly, providers can:
• Automate follow-ups and accelerate payments
• Enable 2-click, no-login digital payments
• Offer self-serve payment plans and family billing
• Eliminate paper with mobile-first statements and digital intake
• Capture accurate data with upfront insurance verification
• Gain real-time visibility into revenue performance

Trusted by 3,000+ healthcare organizations, Collectly helps providers improve collections and deliver a better financial experience for every patient.
Headline: CEO & Co-Founder @ Collectly | Patient Financial Engagement

Title: Founder

An entrepreneur, geek, and relentless tinkerer, I thrive on turning ideas into real-world stuff. Over the past two decades, I’ve bootstrapped and scaled multiple startups and built remote-first teams long before it was mainstream.

I’m currently obsessed with SBOMs and cybersecurity compliance, which I’m tackling through my latest venture, sbomify. I’m also the co-founder of Screenly, a security-first digital signage platform trusted by NASA, Lowe’s, and Capital One.

I’ve worn many hats - developer, founder, advisor, and podcast host at Nerding Out with Viktor, but the common thread is always the same: build cool stuff, solve meaningful problems, and have fun doing it.

Description: cofounder and ceo of @speak
Title: CEO
Summary:
There are 1.5 billion people around the world who want to learn to speak English but can't find anyone to talk with. We're building Speak, an AI English speaking tutor, to help solve this problem! Fastest growing language learning company in our first market South Korea. Join us!


Previously founded Flashcards+, which was used by more than 5M people worldwide and acquired by Chegg (NYSE: CHGG).
Description (2):
Our mission is to reinvent the way people learn, starting with language.

Learning a language can change a life by opening doors to new cultures, careers, and communities. Two billion people around the world are actively trying to learn a language, but the best way to learn (one-on-one tutoring) is hard to access at scale and hasn’t been meaningfully improved in decades. Speak is building a human-level, AI-powered tutor in your pocket: a conversation-first experience that lets learners actually speak, get instant feedback, and progress through carefully designed lessons. The result is a complete path from beginner to confident speaker across multiple languages.

Speak first launched in South Korea in 2019, where Speak has now become the number one language learning app, and we now serve learners across many markets and 15+ languages. Speak is one of the world’s leading AI companies, with over $150m raised in venture investment from OpenAI, Accel, Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, and more, with a distributed team across San Francisco, Seoul, Tokyo, Taipei, and Ljubljana.
Headline: CEO & cofounder at Speak — we're hiring!

Description: Sanjay Kamlani is an entrepreneur with more than 20 years of experience in building profitable, high-growth US/Europe/India cross-border businesses.
Title: Founder
Summary:
With over 30 years of experience as an entrepreneur, legal industry innovator, and cross-cultural business leader, I have launched and scaled businesses across the United States, Europe and India, delivering value to clients, investors, and stakeholders. I have raised approximately $100 million in seed and venture capital and achieved returns of as much as 10X. I have been recognized by The American Lawyer as a Top 50 Innovator in Big Law in the Last 50 Years, by the National Law Journal's 50 Business of Law Trailblazers and Pioneers, and featured in the ABA Law Journal’s 100 Years of Law.

I am the founder and CEO of Maker5 Inc., a law firm innovation advisory and software development services business that also builds new legal industry start-ups through its venture studio. I leverage my expertise in law and technology to help law firms and legal departments transform their processes, workflows, and outcomes. I also create and support new ventures that address the emerging needs and challenges of the legal market. My mission is to make the law more accessible, efficient, and impactful for everyone.

In 2004, I co-founded Pangea3, a Sequoia Capital portfolio company acquired by Thomson Reuters in 2010 and by EY in 2019, ranked as the #1 legal process outsourcing (LPO) provider and awarded with numerous accolades and industry awards. As Co-CEO, I grew Pangea3 to over 1,000 lawyers and engineers with operations across India and the United States serving Fortune 500 companies and law firms globally.

Earlier, as a founding management team member of OfficeTiger—the pioneer in off-shore outsourcing of professional support services with operations in the US, UK, Philippines, Sri Lanka and India (currently RR Donnelley Global), I served as CFO, General Counsel and a member of the Board.

I started my career as a lawyer at PricewaterhouseCoopers in New York City specializing in international business structures, acquisitions, and operations with a particular focus on US-India business ventures.

I graduated cum laude with a BA from Duke University in 1991 and a JD from the University of Pennsylvania Law School in 1994 where I served as an Associate Editor of the Law Review and the Chairman of the Moot Court Board. I am admitted to the Bar in New York.
Description (2): FairPlay empowers working professionals with the legal knowledge and tools they need to navigate their careers confidently. Our platform combines intelligent AI analysis with access to expert employment lawyers to give you clear answers, market insights, and strategic guidance at transparent fixed fees. We're here to ensure you never have to face employment challenges alone or uninformed.
Headline: Founder & CEO @ Maker5 Inc. | Law Firm Innovation Advisory & LegalTech Venture Studio

My approach as an investor is more as a coach and mentor, where there is an on-going dialog and constant brainstorming versus the occasional board meeting check-in. Javelin Venture Partners was founded by former entrepreneurs with a first-hand appreciation of what it takes to develop a company from concept to thriving enterprise. We have been in your chair…resource constrained and exhausted, but driving forward with full confidence that your start-up has incredible potential to change the world. We’re here to help – providing capital, guidance, access to an expansive network and most importantly, entrepreneurial DNA.

We invest in early-stage tech companies with incredible potential, managed by teams of energetic, trustworthy and capable leaders. Key focus areas include cloud, big data, enterprise software, SaaS, e-commerce, mobile, health/wellness and digital media. We look for advanced innovations, where the addressable market size is substantial and strong competitive advantages exist. Our typical investment is between $250K to $4 million, with reserves for follow-on investments. Our office is located in San Francisco, but we invest throughout the world.

Description (2):
WE’RE IN THE BUSINESS OF PUTTING SMILES ON PEOPLE’S FACES

These simple words encapsulate the driving philosophy behind everything we do at C3 Presents. We create, market and produce live experiences, concerts and events — just about anything that makes people stand up and cheer.

C3 is the force behind two of the country’s top music festivals — Austin City Limits Music Festival and Lollapalooza. Every year, each of these festivals attracts more than 200,000 people over a three-day weekend and is staged in beloved greenspaces in the urban heart of its host city.

These events and many others showcase our ability to bring together a complex, broad spectrum of players — all with their own agendas, deadlines, opinions, and needs but also with a vested interest in the event’s success. C3 possesses the depth of expertise and experience to coordinate and maneuver through a major U.S. city’s complex infrastructure amid the massive logistics surrounding high-profile events — from federal entities such as the U.S. Secret Service, to city service agencies including city emergency management offices, the police department, transportation departments, and sanitation department — to political and civic agencies such as mayors’ offices, city tourism boards and parks departments.
Headline: Event Travel Coordinator at C3 Presents

Description: gently down the stream
Title: Founder
Description (2):
In 2017 Ticket Rescue’s Founder & CEO, Bryce Wilson was stuck with tickets to a Tampa Bay Lightning game he could no longer attend.  No sweat, he’ll sell them online.

But that process ended up being more complicated than he thought.

Which site is the best to sell through?
Why are the fees so high?
How do I get the most money back?
Is there a service to speed this up?

*Lightbulb*

At Ticket Rescue, we offer a fast and secure way to sell your tickets outright based on the current market value.

Need to sell your tickets in 15 minutes or less?  Got you.
Concert starts in 1 hour?  No problem.
Festival is 9 months away but you just got invited to a wedding? Life happens.

Our story is pretty simple. We’ve been buying and selling tickets since that Lightning game in 2017.  To sell tickets effectively online takes time, market knowledge, and resources.  To avoid scammers, you need to know their tricks.  We use our industry expertise to get you the best offer and secure payment – fast.

If you have a ticket burning a hole in your pocket, send us an SOS.
We’d be happy to help.
Headline: Founder and CEO of Ticket Rescue

Title: Founder & Principal Attorney
Summary:
Founded in 2003, Cammisa Markel is a New York based immigration law firm that represents both organizations and private individuals from all over the world, and have helped numerous businesses with their expansion into the U.S. market. Cammisa Markel is dedicated to making the U.S. immigration process as simple and painless as possible, and pride themselves in building long-term relationships with their clients.

Founder and principal attorney, Zjantelle Cammisa Markel, arrived to the United States in 2000 from her hometown of Adelaide, South Australia, with the intention of a brief visit. Two decades, a husband, four children and a giant bernedoodle later, New York has become her home, and enabling other people’s American aspirations to happen isn’t just her work, but her passion.

Offering a highly personalized service, Zjantelle is driven to achieve positive outcomes for all of her clients and believes that with a no-defeatist attitude, where there is a will, there is always a way. Professional and friendly, Zjantelle obtains working visas for people at all levels of their career and life – from students to corporate executives. Having been through the U.S. immigration process herself (she has previously held J-1, H-1B and E-2 visas prior to marrying her U.S. citizen husband in 2006, and becoming a green card holder in 2007 and a U.S. citizen in 2014), she has been committed to building a practice that not only provides exemplary legal services, but also a high level of personalized service that ensures every client feels secure and well taken care of throughout the often anxiety provoking immigration process.

Zjantelle’s career spans Sydney, London, Rome and New York. This international experience gives her a unique understanding of European, Australian and American culture, laws and business practices. Her Australian background and specialization in processing E-3 visas make Zjantelle particularly popular with Australian clientele. Several well-established Australian media and news organizations including the Australian Financial Review, have quoted Zjantelle and sought her opinions related to U.S. immigration law during times of uncertainty and international crises like the COVID-19 pandemic.

Zjantelle has been honored by her professional peers and colleagues as a “Super Lawyer” (top 5% in her field of law) for the New York Metro area every year since 2013 and has been recognized in Super Lawyers magazine and in the New York Times Magazine (March in each of those years) as one of the top female lawyers in New York City.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Address - Locations: 30 Vesey St, 14th Floor, New York, New York 10007, US
Description (2):
Cammisa Markel, PLLC is a U.S. immigration law firm based in New York. Our immigration law firm is exclusively dedicated to the practice of U.S. immigration and naturalization law for our global citizens from all over the world, and most notably in E-3 visas for Australian nationals.

Our immigration practice is dedicated to making the U.S. immigration process as simple and painless as possible, for both our international corporate and individual clients. We determine an immigration “Plan” for each client that looks beyond the client’s immediate U.S. immigration needs and considers the client’s individual long-term U.S. immigration goals and objectives. We are not afraid of holding our client’s hand from the beginning to the end of the U.S. immigration process because we understand that at times we need to be more than just an immigration law firm. Our immigration staff pride themselves on providing friendly, knowledgeable and accessible U.S. immigration services that are up-to-date with U.S. Immigration laws and are results oriented. Unlike other immigration law practices, our U.S. immigration lawyers and immigration law staff come from other countries like Australia, so they are familiar with the immigration process on both sides of the immigration wall. Having gone through the U.S. immigration process themselves, our immigration lawyers and immigration staff strive to make you feel comfortable throughout the U.S. visa and/or green card immigration process. Our U.S. immigration staff want you to feel confident that you have chosen the best immigration team possible to represent your U.S. immigration needs. Just as we are proud to represent our international clients, our immigration team wants you to feel proud to be represented by Cammisa Markel, PLLC.

Our U.S. immigration clients consistently, confidently and proudly refer our immigration services to their mates, friends and colleagues, and we hope that our immigration law firm can assist you too.
Headline: US Immigration Attorney: Founder & Principal, Cammisa Markel PLLC Immigration Law Firm

Description: Serial founder (Dynamic Signal, Firstup, now building new start-up Larridin) | Early exec @ comScore & Adify | Scottsdale based 🌵
Title: Co-Founder & President
Summary:
With more than 30 years at the intersection of data, technology, and human behavior, I’ve helped build and scale startups through acquisitions, mergers, and IPOs. As Co‑Founder and President of Larridin, my mission is to empower organizations with AI‑driven clarity and impact—making every investment in AI measurable, governable, and aligned with business outcomes.

At Larridin, we believe organizations cannot manage what they can’t see, govern what they can’t control, or measure what they can’t understand. That’s why our platform brings together three core pillars:

- Scout: Instantly discover and map every AI tool across your organization—from sanctioned enterprise platforms to “shadow AI”—providing real‑time visibility, usage insights, security risk detection, and compliance gap alerts.

- Nexus: A unified hub that transforms all employees into confident AI users. Nexus centralizes safe access to approved LLMs, curated prompts, agentic workflows, and governance controls so leaders can foster innovation without sacrifice.

- Vantage: Translate AI activity into measurable impact—benchmarking productivity, ROI, and risk reduction across teams and tools.

My focus is always customer-first: I align product strategy with evolving needs to ensure AI actually delivers value. I’m proud to partner with a passionate team of innovators and friends, building a platform that transforms how companies operate and thrive in the AI‑driven era.
Description (2):
Larridin is building the measurement and enablement layer for enterprise AI—helping organizations unlock literacy, engagement, and ROI from their AI investments.

Most enterprises struggle to bridge the gap between AI experimentation and true business impact. Larridin solves this by giving leaders and employees the visibility, guidance, and tools to use AI effectively and responsibly.

 Scout provides continuous measurement of AI usage across the enterprise. It shows which tools are being used, by whom, and for what purpose—turning shadow AI into actionable insights. Leaders can benchmark adoption, understand engagement patterns, and ensure usage aligns with business goals.

 Nexus is the enablement hub that empowers employees with approved AI apps, enterprise data access, and prompt libraries. It drives safe, confident adoption by making AI easy to use while embedding the necessary governance and guardrails.

Together, Scout and Nexus help organizations accelerate AI literacy, increase employee engagement, and realize measurable ROI—while maintaining the compliance and oversight enterprises require.

Backed by a $17 million Series A led by Andreessen Horowitz, with participation from Bloomberg Beta, Gradient, Haystack, Homebrew, and others, Larridin is shaping how Global 2000 enterprises scale AI adoption and productivity.

Join us in building the future of AI Execution Intelligence.
Headline: Co-Founder & President Larridin | Measure AI Usage, Proficiency, and Impact | Quantify how AI is transforming work—tracking adoption, proficiency, and ROI with compliance built in.

Description: CEO of Executive Presence  |  A fully managed social media service for CEOs  |  Stanford MBA  |  Navy Veteran
Title: Member
Summary:
I am the CEO and Founder of Executive Presence, where we help companies build trust, visibility, and influence through authentic executive thought leadership on LinkedIn.

In less than three years, I have bootstrapped the company to over $3M in annual recurring revenue, interviewed more than 750 CEOs, and helped over 250 leaders strengthen their presence, credibility, and reach on LinkedIn.

At Executive Presence, we turn leaders into thought leaders. Many executives have networks of people who know and trust them, but they are not consistently top-of-mind. We help them remain relevant, articulate their expertise, and extend their influence—whether the goal is to hire, fundraise, build a brand, or create a category.

Our work is grounded in three principles:
• Authenticity: Capturing the leader’s true voice and perspective.
• Efficiency: Requiring as little as 90 minutes of their time per month.
• Measurability: Tracking progress with weekly KPIs and clear outcomes.

I work with CEOs, founders, and senior executives - often at high-growth companies with 50+ employees - who are defining their industries, scaling quickly, and hiring aggressively.

My path here has been shaped by diverse experiences:
• Officer aboard nuclear submarines, leading teams of more than 200 in high-stakes operations.
• Stanford MBA and serial entrepreneur, having founded and sold two companies.
• Host of Beyond the Uniform, the #1 iTunes podcast for military career transitions, with over 450 episodes.
• Former CEO of StoryBox, a marketing technology company funded by Google’s Eric Schmidt and used by more than 1,000 companies worldwide.

I believe that executives are among a company’s most underutilized assets, and when they show up as visible, credible thought leaders, they have an outsized impact on culture, recruiting, industry leadership, and legacy.
Description (2):
Executive Presence is a premium executive communications firm helping top leaders build credibility and visibility through LinkedIn.

We work with CEOs and senior executives at high-growth companies to craft and share thought leadership that drives measurable business outcomes—whether that’s raising capital, hiring top talent, acquiring customers, or building brand awareness.

Our fully-managed service includes:
	•	Personalized content strategy
	•	High-quality content creation
	•	Analytics and performance optimization

Our team includes former consultants from McKinsey, BCG, Bain, and Accenture who bring strategic rigor and a deep understanding of executive positioning. We’ve helped 150+ CEOs and executives transform LinkedIn from a passive profile into a powerful platform for influence.

Here’s what most leaders don’t realize about LinkedIn:

1. People > Companies
Executives—not brand pages—are the best asset for building a company’s visibility. A well-positioned executive post generates more trust and engagement than a company announcement.

2. Educate, Don’t Sell
80% of what we create is educational. Sharing value through insights, frameworks, and stories builds a loyal audience—making the occasional company-focused post far more effective.

3. Original Content Wins
LinkedIn rewards native, original content. Reposts and links underperform. Our team helps you share your expertise in a voice that’s authentic, compelling, and algorithm-friendly.

4. Consistency is Key
To grow an audience and stay top-of-mind, executives should post 2–5 times per week. We make that cadence effortless.

 Download The CEO’s Guide to LinkedIn to see what’s working for 200+ top executives: https://executivepresence.io/ebook/ceo-guide-to-linkedin/
Headline: CEO @ Executive Presence  |  LinkedIn thought leadership for CEOs

He is 1 of 4 attorneys in Georgia to be Board Certified in DUI Defense by the National College for DUI Defense (NCDD). Ben focuses his practice on the defense of clients charged with DUI and other drug and alcohol-related offenses. Description: Consumer awareness news for women on medical device and drug recall lawsuits. Chaffin Luhana LLP is a national law firm dedicated to Doing Good by Doing Right
Title: Partner
Location Name: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
Address - Locations: 600 3rd Ave, 12th Floor, New York, New York 10016, US
Description (2):
Chaffin Luhana LLP is a plaintiffs-only national trial firm dedicated to representing individuals and families in serious personal injury and mass tort cases. With offices in New York, Connecticut, Pennsylvania, and West Virginia, we’ve recovered over $1 billion for clients and earned 1,200+ five-star reviews across all offices—proof of both our results and the relationships we build.

Founded in 2010 by former federal prosecutor Eric Chaffin and trial lawyer Roopal Luhana, our firm was built on a simple but powerful mission: Doing Good by Doing Right. We don’t represent corporations or insurance companies—only real people whose lives have been upended by negligence, unsafe products, or catastrophic injuries. Every case is personal, and every client’s story matters.

Our team includes former federal and state prosecutors, defense attorneys, judicial law clerks, nurses, and a full-time social worker. This diverse team brings deep experience, empathy, and professionalism to every case we take on.

What sets us apart is our commitment to service—both inside and outside the courtroom. Through the Chaffin Luhana Foundation, we give back by funding scholarships, fighting distracted driving, feeding families in need, and supporting charities chosen by our own team members.

Chaffin Luhana is more than just a law firm. It’s a place where mission-driven professionals thrive. We work hard, support one another, and treat each other like family. Our culture is rooted in integrity, empathy, and excellence—and we’re always looking for people who share those values.

If you’re passionate about making a difference in people’s lives, we invite you to learn more about our work, our team, and the opportunities to grow with us.
Headline: Partner  at Chaffin Luhana LLP

Title: Senior Lead Scientist, Statistical Genetics
Summary:
Statistical genetics leader with a decade of experience developing, assessing, and applying statistical models to large -omic datasets. My applied work covers discovery and validation of drug targets and biomarkers, as well as risk stratification for clinical trials and population health.

I completed a PhD in functional genomics, discovering the meiotic role of ZCWPW1 via analysis of single cell transcriptomics and ChIP-seq data. Prior to my doctoral work I was a molecular biologist within vaccinology, genome engineering, and oncology.
Address - Locations: King Charles House, Park End Street, Oxford, Oxfordshire OX1 1JD, GB
Description (2):
We are a pioneering transatlantic TechBio company that aims to transform health through the power of genomics. The company was formed in 2014 by four world-leading statistical and human geneticists at the University of Oxford, including Professor Sir Peter Donnelly and Professor Gil McVean. We use large-scale genetic information to realise preventative medicine and improve drug discovery.

We're a world-leader in genomic prevention: a paradigm-changing approach to sustainable healthcare which for the first time allows reliable, personalised estimates of risk for all the common diseases and cancers, well ahead of disease manifestation, allowing accurate and early interventions and tailored screening.

Our proprietary algorithms and databases offer something no competitor can: the ability to accurately link minute variation across the entire genome to changes in thousands of biological measurements and disease outcomes, to generate population-level insights for healthcare systems, individual-level insights for clinicians about the risk of common diseases, and new understanding of disease processes.

We work with leading life sciences and biotech companies, including Novo Nordisk and Vertex.

Our team is a multi-disciplinary group of world experts focused on finding powerful and creative solutions for bringing subject-leading science to as wide an audience as possible, and, in doing so, offer the chance of transforming lives around the world.
The workforce is highly qualified and consists of over 150 people, including world-leading genomic scientists, computational biologists, statisticians, software engineers, product developers, data scientists and commercial strategists.

We are headquartered in Oxford, with offices in Cambridge (UK), London (UK), and North Carolina (US), with labs in Framingham (US).
Headline: Senior Lead Scientist, Statistical Genetics at Genomics Ltd.

Stephanie Hogue is a globally focused executive with more than 20 years of leadership experience across capital markets, real assets, and strategic advisory.  She has served as the company's CEO since 2025, President and a member of its Board of Directors since 2021, and additionally held the role of CFO from 2021 until 2024. She led the firm’s Inbound Cross-Border M&A and Debt Private Placements practices, overseeing complex capital raises and strategic transactions. Known for her analytical rigor, cross-border execution capabilities, and problem-solving mindset, Stephanie brings a disciplined, stakeholder-aligned approach to long-term value creation. Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
Running an ABA therapy practice is rewarding — but the financial side? That’s where most owners feel overwhelmed. Insurance reimbursements don’t match the books, payroll is a nightmare, compliance never stops… and suddenly, “bookkeeping” turns into a full-time job.

That’s why I founded ABAbookkeeper.com.

I help ABA providers:
 Keep more of their revenue (by fixing the insurance-to-bookkeeping disconnect)
 Streamline payroll and compliance
 Get clear financials that support growth — not just “check the box”

With over 10 years of bookkeeping experience and a career background in business operations, I’ve seen how messy books can hold back even the best businesses. My mission is simple: to give ABA practice owners clarity, confidence, and time back to focus on what they do best — changing lives.

If you run an ABA therapy company and want less financial chaos + more clarity, let’s connect.

I’m also the founder of Qlarity, a fintech solution that integrates CentralReach with QuickBooks Online, giving ABA practices seamless financial clarity.
Description (2): The ABA Bookkeeper provides specialized bookkeeping and financial systems support for ABA therapy practices. We help owners keep more of what they earn through accurate reporting, efficient systems, and strategic insight.
Headline: Helping ABA Practices Gain Financial Clarity | Founder of ABAbookkeeper.com & Qlarity (CentralReach  QBO Integration)
