We are a Los Angeles-based PR & communications agency that helps changemakers share their story with the world. We are passionate about creating impact through the power of media.

At HCM, we create leaders. Some say that leaders are born. We believe that leaders are built. Through our proprietary strategies, branding, communication, and PR we create leaders in our clients’ respective fields to achieve our clients’ wildest dreams.

Clients who come to us prefer the path less traveled. Us too. Forget one-size-fits-all communication strategies, Canva templates, outdated PR strategies, and aimless social media creation. Our clients don’t do things like everyone else, and we don’t either.

Title: Board Member
Summary:
I am passionate about helping entrepreneurs achieve their dreams. After a decade of investing and working alongside some of the best tech founders in Canada, I founded Staircase Ventures on the belief that founders are the bedrock upon which companies are built and by changing how we work with and treat founders, we can dramatically change the trajectory of their businesses.

I am committed to developing the Canadian tech ecosystem. I am co-chair of C100, on the Board of LEAP, a mentor at C100, and on the Ivey Business School Advisory Board.  My background includes leadership at early-stage tech companies (eBay), operating experience (P&G), entrepreneurial success (Kijiji), and management consulting (McKinsey) work.
Description (2):
Staircase Ventures leads seed-stage rounds into Canada’s highest potential tech companies with unparalleled dedication to accelerating founders’ development and performance.

Staircase offers a 5-pillar Founder Development Platform – a comprehensive offering to advance founders’ personal development and successful leadership of their ventures.

With the 5-pillar Founder Development Platform, Staircase Ventures founders have access to:

1.	CEO coaching: An experienced, one-on-one executive coach to support them with their personal development objectives.

2.	Peer support groups: Confidential, facilitated, stage- and function-appropriate peer groups with other founders across North America.

3.	Health & wellness program: A dedicated Cleveland Clinic Canada health coach to help them enhance their physical and mental health.

4.	Personal financial advisor: An experienced financial advisor who specializes in supporting early-stage tech founders.

5.	Family stipend: A cash stipend to cover unexpected childcare, elder support, or other family needs.

In addition, each founder receives carry in the fund so that when the fund does well, all founder benefit.

Staircase Ventures is managed by Janet Bannister, a veteran of the Canadian tech industry with deep experience as a founder, operator, and investor.  Founders also benefit from a set of Advisors, each of whom have launched and scaled $1B+ businesses.
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

Title: Senior Advisor and Group Head of Silver Lake Waterman (SLW)
Summary:
Shawn O'Neill has over three decades of experience in the technology sector, where he has gained expertise in navigating the diverse and complex challenges faced by rapidly growing tech companies. He is the Managing Partner of SLW, a strategy he founded within Silver Lake in 2011. Shawn focuses on helping companies succeed by guiding them through critical inflection points, which include assisting with financing strategies, growth initiatives, scaling operations, and adapting to market shifts.

Drawing on deep industry knowledge and informed judgment built over his years as an investment banker, CFO, and investor, Shawn has earned the trust of CEOs who rely on his expertise and integrity for business-shaping decisions. His extensive network of respected relationships within and beyond the technology industry allows him to connect companies with the right resources, partners, and opportunities to drive meaningful growth.

Shawn remains a Senior Advisor at Silver Lake.  Before founding SLW, Shawn launched Bandon Partners, a boutique investment bank, and served as CFO for two venture-backed technology companies. Earlier in his career, he was an investment banker with Morgan Stanley, DMG Technology Group, and Lehman Brothers—advising category-shaping companies.

Shawn holds a B.B.A. with honors from the University of Texas and serves on the Dean's Advisory Board of the McCombs School of Business.
Description (2):
SLW was founded in 2012 as Silver Lake Waterman, a growth strategy within Silver Lake, one of the world’s largest private equity firms. In 2024, we became an independent firm while maintaining a close and collaborative relationship with Silver Lake.

At SLW, we partner with leading technology companies by making minority investments ranging from $10 million to over $100 million. Our approach is unique as we look to invest repeatedly throughout a company’s lifecycle, in both equity and flexible non-dilutive structures to address evolving capital needs. Our investments often begin early in a company’s lifecycle and increase significantly over time. This long-term, relationship-oriented strategy enables us to be enduring partners to exceptional founders and management teams, providing flexible capital and strategic support through every phase of growth.

Title: Freelance Retoucher
Summary:
I’m a London based retoucher specialising in beauty, fashion, and live event imagery.
After spending over 10 years modelling internationally across Europe and Asia, I moved behind the camera and into retouching. Bringing with me a strong understanding of the industry from both perspectives, as well as invaluable experience and knowledge in how to create visually appealing images and how to succeed in such an industry.

Over the last 18 months I’ve worked as a freelance retoucher, working with photographers on beauty, fashion, editorial, and social media campaigns. My focus is on high end beauty retouching - creating clean, natural imagery, with a strong eye for colour, skin texture, and detail. Using both Photoshop and Lightroom, my skill set includes colour grading, dodge and burn, skin refinement, exposure balancing, background adjustments, and efficient batch editing for larger sets.

Alongside my freelance clients, I’ve been working as an in house retoucher. This role has involved fast paced editing for major brands and high profile live events, often delivering hundreds of images under tight deadlines and managing multiple Lightroom catalogues simultaneously with same day delivery. Strengthening speed, consistency, workflow, and ability to problem solve under pressure, all without compromising on quality.

I’m passionate about creating work that feels polished but still real, collaborating with creative teams, and supporting strong visual storytelling. I’m constantly looking to continue expanding my experience, connect with more photographers, studios, and creative teams, and grow further within the beauty and fashion retouching space.
Headline: Photo retoucher

Description: Global Director & Analyst | B2B eCommerce Association.  Author | ‘Digital Branch Secrets.’ Speaker on all things eCommerce and Digital.
Title: Host
Summary:
In 2007, I started a blog to write about B2B eCommerce when no one cared about B2B eCommerce.  When Grainger launched their new site in 2011, people googled "B2B eCommerce," and my little site was peppered over the first 10 pages of results.  My little blog had years of content, point of view,  and opinions - many of which are the foundation of the B2B eCommerce industry today.  I am very proud of that.

The blog, and eventually my book ("Digital Branch Secrets"), launched my speaking career.
"My favorite thing to do professionally is to influence people through speaking.  I believe the best expression of my experience and my passion is my ability to communicate and simplify complex topics with large groups of people."

In 2010 I joined Endeca to build the B2B positioning for hybris, and my life changed when I was introduced to the world of Software instead of consulting. After being acquired by Oracle, I eventually started B2X Partners and sold it to Salsify (founded by Endeca alums) in 2019.

In 2023, I left Salsify and a leadership team I loved to join Brett Sinclair at B2B eCommerce Association (B2BEA). Together, we are building the most extensive, global network for the B2B eCommerce industry. We are advancing the future of B2B eCommerce through education.

I love people and relationships.  I love speaking and writing.  I love stories, humor and laughing. Most of all, I love helping and watching people and organizations change.
Address - Locations: 25 Delano Dr, Suite A, Greenville, South Carolina 29601, US
Description (2):
Welcome to the B2B eCommerce Association! We are a global community of business-to-business (B2B) eCommerce professionals dedicated to advancing the industry through education and connection.

Our members include manufacturers, wholesale distributors, technology and service providers who are all passionate about eCommerce and committed to sharing knowledge, best practices, and resources to help each other succeed.

Through our events, webinars, training programs, and research initiatives, we help our members stay up-to-date on the latest trends and developments in B2B eCommerce, as well as connect with potential partners and customers.

Join us and become part of a vibrant community of B2B eCommerce professionals who are shaping the future of commerce!
Headline: Educating and Training the B2B eCommerce Industry. Global Director @ B2B eCommerce Association

Title: Founder
Summary:
Entrepreneur and founder with 15+ years of experience building businesses, leading teams, and creating movements that drive real impact, in both life and work.

As the Founder and CEO of RCG Mortgage, I’ve spent over a decade helping thousands of families achieve homeownership while building one of the most recognized independent brokerages in the country. Under my leadership, RCG has become known for its people-first culture, elite coaching systems, and commitment to developing top-producing loan officers who close with purpose.

Now, through DadderUp, I’m expanding that mission beyond business, helping fathers redefine success through accountability, growth, and presence. What started as a passion project has become a growing community, movement, and platform designed to help men show up stronger at home, at work, and within themselves.

What I’ve learned along the way is that leadership is holistic. The same systems that build high-performing teams also build stronger fathers, partners, and individuals. Whether scaling a mortgage company or growing a fatherhood movement, it’s about people, process, and purpose.

What I believe:
- Leadership starts at home. Who you are off the clock determines how far you’ll go on it.
- Growth requires structure. Systems, accountability, and discipline are the real unlocks for freedom.
- Legacy > Leverage. Building something that lasts matters more than chasing what’s trending.

What drives me:
- Creating Real Impact: Helping others achieve measurable results while staying aligned with what matters most.
- Pushing Boundaries: I don’t believe in balance; I believe in rhythm, knowing when to sprint, when to rest, and when to lead.
- Leaving a Legacy: My ultimate mission is to build businesses, communities, and people that outlive me, proof that you can be both wildly successful and fully present.
Description (2):
What is DadderUp?
DadderUp is a premium community and lifestyle brand designed to redefine what it means to be a father. It’s where dads come together to support, challenge, and inspire each other to be their best every single day. Through intentional action, connection, and gamified engagement, DadderUp turns the role of “dad” into a movement that’s respected, celebrated, and legacy-driven.

Why We Exist
For too long, culture has reduced fatherhood to punchlines, memes, and outdated stereotypes. The image of the distracted, disengaged dad has been normalized, while the reality is that intentional, present fathers have a profound impact on their children, their families, and the generations that follow. DadderUp exists to flip that narrative, showing the world that being a great dad is one of the highest forms of success.

How We Do It
DadderUp provides a community platform where fathers can connect daily, track their “Dad Flex,” share wins, and hold each other accountable. Through the TEDAM (Together Each Dadder Achieves More), members engage in challenges, celebrate each other’s victories, and commit to making fatherhood an active, intentional pursuit.

What is Our Big Vision?
We aim to make “Dadder” a household term and to inspire a cultural shift where exceptional fatherhood is both aspirational and achievable for men everywhere.

Who is DadderUp For?
We are for intentional fathers who refuse to settle for stereotypes, DadderUp is the premium community and lifestyle platform that inspires daily action, fosters genuine connection, and gamifies the journey of becoming an exceptional dad. Unlike casual parenting advice or “dad joke” culture, DadderUp delivers a high-performance approach to fatherhood, combining accountability, shared wisdom, and a legacy-driven mindset that creates lasting impact for generations.
Headline:
I help families and fathers achieve homeownership and personal growth, so they can build wealth, stability, and legacy.

Founder of DadderUp & RCG Mortgage

Brandon Allen | Owner and Project Director at Masterpiece Construction

As a dedicated professional, I am passionate about transforming spaces and creating dream homes for our clients. Currently, I serve as the Owner and Project Director at Masterpiece Construction, a dynamic design-build remodeling company located in Argyle, TX. In this role, I lead a talented team of designers, suppliers, and craftsmen to guide our clients through the exciting journey of remodeling their homes.

Our expertise at Masterpiece Construction spans a wide range of projects, including bathroom and kitchen remodels, outdoor living spaces, additions, and whole home transformations. We take pride in delivering exceptional results and making our clients' visions come to life.

My journey to the remodeling industry is unique. I hold a Doctorate of Pharmacy from the University of South Carolina and spent a decade working as a pharmacist, owning my own pharmacy for seven years. This experience instilled in me strong leadership skills and a knack for managing teams and projects effectively.

My professional goals include expanding and developing Masterpiece Construction into a leading remodeling company and assembling a team of motivated individuals who share my commitment to providing the most incredible remodeling experience in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.

Beyond my professional pursuits, I am an active member of Gracepointe Church in Denton, TX, where I cherish moments with my wife, April, and our three wonderful daughters, Austin, Emerson, and Ruby. We are an outdoors-loving family who values spending quality time with friends and extended family.

Let's connect and explore opportunities to collaborate, share insights, or simply connect with like-minded professionals. I look forward to building meaningful connections and contributing to the continued success of the remodeling industry.

Title: Creator Partner
Summary:
Hey! I'm Sam, I created Finding Founders to learn from the life stories of the most successful people in the world  I've taken these learnings and coached entrepreneurs to build better businesses
Starting that podcast changed my life  Here's how

I was studying engineering at UCLA and hating it.

I wanted to explore my creativity, so I started a podcast interviewing my more entrepreneurial friends.

I called it Finding Founders.

I wanted the podcast to be more than just two people talking... so I decided to infuse it with music, sound effects, and voice over.

Before I knew it I was talking to the founders of companies like Bulletproof Coffee, MasterClass, and Soylent...

I built up a team of 50 around me to help produce more impactful stories.

We traveled to Puerto Rico after the hurricanes and Cabo to cover ecotourism. We've interviewed drug dealers, leaders in the psychedelic movement, and celebrity chefs.

This has all showed me that a small side project can turn into something that can completely change your life.

If you want to hear stories about about founders, about people who take the leap, follow me for daily inspiration and subscribe to Finding Founders wherever you get your podcasts!

Also, If you want to create a podcast for:
 personal networking
 brand awareness
 TV & film

 DM me and let's connect!

Description: Father, sailor, pilot, CEO of https://t.co/psymsvro6G and Amatis Controls
Title: CEO
Summary:
I’m an engineer and systems thinker with a habit of building companies around hard problems — especially when they involve power, buildings, or better ways to wire the world. With 15 years in the lighting and IoT industry, I’ve been involved in bringing over 40 products to market — from embedded hardware to full-stack cloud platforms.

Currently CEO & CTO at Luum, where we're reimagining how buildings get powered and controlled through X-PoE, a safer, smarter, low-voltage platform for lighting and beyond.

Over the past few years, I’ve led our acquisition of key IP, built a team, proven the tech in the field, and brought products to life that blend power electronics, embedded systems, wireless mesh networks, a full cloud platform, and an energy dashboard — all wrapped in thoughtful industrial design. While of course also navigating global logistics, UL certification, and investor expectations.

But I don’t just build systems — I build stories. Whether it’s prototyping a better LED dimmer, restoring a 47’ sailboat for charter, or turning shipping delays into comic strips, I believe the best tech is human, and the best teams are honest, fast, and a little over-caffeinated.

Let’s talk if you’re into:
- Low-voltage DC infrastructure
- Embedded product design
- Sustainable buildings and decarbonization
- Cloud + energy data platforms
- Tech startup strategy and capital planning
 - (Or you just want to race sailboats or argue about thermal pads)

Outside of work, I’m a dad of two, a hardcore sailor, a pilot, and an unapologetic technophile.
Address - Locations: 209 Aspen Airport Business Center, Aspen, Colorado 81611, US
Description (2):
Low-voltage lighting that behaves like software. LUUM pairs the X-PoE power path with Amatis controls. We engineer the path end-to-end, test in the lab and in the field, and remove failure modes: predictable wiring, a commissioning loop that sticks, and remote support that actually fixes things.
Outcomes: faster installs, clean cable management, fewer truck rolls, and lower lifetime cost.
We work shoulder-to-shoulder with installers, electricians, facility operators, specifiers, and partners, different roles, same table. Plain-English docs, captioned videos, and alt text so everyone can follow.
Used for mockup bays, office retrofits, labs, and new builds moving from high-voltage habits to a low-voltage reality.
Headline: CEO at Luum.io, formerly Amatis Controls | Systems builder | J. Galt’s probably watching

Title: CEO
Summary:
FROM CHAOS TO COMPETITIVE MOAT: FULL-STACK AI FOR INDUSTRY DOMINATION

We help ambitious companies become Full-Stack AI to dominate their industry.

At Dry Ground AI, we don’t just build smart tools. We engineer highly optimized business systems with Lean Six Sigma and power them through AI. With nearly 20 years of transformation leadership, including scaling Rackspace to $3B+ and IPO, preparing EA Games for flawless launches, and helping Wyndham cut operating costs by 40%, I’ve seen firsthand what happens when growth outpaces infrastructure. Most businesses are built on duct tape and tribal knowledge. We fix that.

Here’s what we solve and how:

 OPERATIONAL OVERWHELM

Challenge: A company drowning in inefficiencies, repetitive tasks, and team burnout.
Solution: Designed and implemented a Lean Six Sigma-powered workload optimization program and automation suite.
Results:
•	Cut manual labor by 120,000 hours per year
•	Reduced ticket backlog by over 95%
•	Improved customer satisfaction and team morale

 GROWTH WITHOUT INFRASTRUCTURE

Challenge: High growth straining delivery timelines, inventory, and cash flow.
Solution: Established global inventory management and cross-functional accountability frameworks.
Results:
•	Decreased 90+ day backlog by over 50% in six months
•	Reduced excess inventory by $4 million in two quarters
•	Enabled faster delivery and better customer experience

 STALLED PROFITABILITY & SPENDING SPRAWL

Challenge: Skyrocketing costs with no visibility or control.
Solution: Led a company-wide support transformation, optimizing global workforce and implementing financial controls.
Results:
•	Achieved $36.4 million in run-rate savings in 18 months
•	Avoided $12.5 million in new spend through asset reuse
•	Right-sized global support across four countries without compromising quality

 NO BANDWIDTH FOR STRATEGY

Challenge: Leaders stuck in the weeds, unable to focus on strategic growth.
Solution: Delivered fractional executive support and built scalable leadership structures.
Results:
•	Delivered $12.5 million in new upsell revenue
•	Boosted first-contact resolution by 50%
•	Helped companies regain clarity and lead with confidence
If you’re running a business that’s outgrown its systems or never had solid ones to begin with, let’s talk.

Description:
Founder of @expressionmed
 @thielfellowship
Title: Thiel Fellow
Summary:
Building a multimillion dollar medical adhesive business without investors has taught me a lot.
For the first 3 years I was growing the business on my own or with one friend. Today I have a team of 16.

I have learned about and personally executed
-Automating file edits and organizational systems using adobe scripts.
-Fundraising through Business plan competitions: $114k won in one year
-Product development and supply chain
-Manufacturing contract negotiations
-Social media branding and strategy
-Hiring and team building at both a $70k/yr business and a 7-figure a year business.
-Fulfillment systems and optimization
-International sales and distribution systems
-High Level Strategy Management
Description (2):
ExpressionMed creates designed medical adhesives to secure infusion sets and continuous glucose monitors. Our company focuses on adding safety, confidence and education to diabetic care routines.

ExpressionMed began in the Summer of 2015 with the mission to create adhesives for wearable devices that were as fun as they were functional. After two years of research we found the perfect tape for longevity and comfort. Our company began sales in November in 2016 by offering patches for Insulin Pumps, and shortly after we introduced Dexcom tapes into our product line. We are excited to have expanded our product mix to include adhesives for Enlite, Libre, Pod and Medtronic CGMs.

According to our customer surveys, our adhesives will stay on for 10 days to "3+ weeks" without fraying or lifting. Our material is thin and breathes with your skin so you don't feel it as you move throughout the day.  Our tape has been worn on everyone from a busy dad of five to a competitive swimmer.

More inspiring than the product itself, the people I've met through this process have been amazing. Every parent who knows that diabetes isn't a lifestyle change for a child, but a whole family; every energetic kid that doesn't let a disease stop them from doing what they want to do; and every person who has faced difficult times and bounced back more confident and happy than people who can't imagine what diabetes is.

ExpressionMed was built for you, and you are the reason our staff continues to work tirelessly everyday to bring this product to life, spread your message, and educate the world.

We are happy that ExpressionMed is a part of your family, and invite you to join ours.
Headline: CE0 & Founder @ ExpressionMed  & 2018  Thie1 Fellow :)

Description: Building PlayerZero, Stanford AI🌲
Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
PlayerZero is AI that simulates how software will break before it goes to production.

At Stanford, I built data-intensive systems to make machine learning accessible to everyone. My work here was advised by Prof. Peter Bailis, Prof. Matei Zaharia, and Daniel Kang.
Description (2):
PlayerZero is pioneering predictive software quality, helping enterprises ship flawless software faster by fixing, learning from and preventing problems before they impact customers. The company's AI-powered platform deeply understands how code works across entire systems, predicts failures before they happen and continuously learns from every issue to strengthen software resilience. PlayerZero is backed by Foundation Capital, Green Bay Ventures and prominent angel investors including the founders of Databricks, Dropbox, Figma and Vercel.

PlayerZero’s mission is to embed adaptive healing directly inside every production software system—so the next generation of developers inherits living systems that protect themselves.
Headline: Founder, PlayerZero

Title: Chief Electrolytes Officer (CEO) & Founder
Summary:
Started Hyro with a question: why are 4 out of 5 Australians still dehydrated, even though everyone gets told to just drink more water?

Turns out it’s not more water... it’s more electrolytes in your water that’s the unlock. So we built Hyro — a hydration brand backed by athletes, creators, and operators like Sarah’s Day, Quade Cooper, Daly Cherry-Evans and other legends.

Since launch, we’ve cracked multi-seven figures, built an all-star team, moved offices (twice), had a baby, got married- and we’re just getting started.

Before Hyro, I was co-founder & CEO of Shine Drink — we scaled to 7,000+ stores, hit $60M+ in retail sales, and won a Telstra Business Award along the way. I also built a Facebook Marketplace-style app before Facebook did (RIP FaceBuy).

These days, I’m all in on building Hyro into a $100M+ brand while trying to be a great dad, run a sub 3-hour marathon, and survive waking up at 424am everyday.

CLINICAL EXPERTICE – As providers, we understand the challenges clinicians and facilities face, allowing us to offer effective, practical support.
NETWORK-BASED MODEL – Our trusted network of experienced anesthesia providers ensures ideal matches between CRNAs and facilities.

OUR SERVICES

Built by a data team for data teams, Atlan is the active metadata platform for the modern data stack. It stitches together metadata from various sources (Snowflake, dbt, Databricks, Looker, Tableau, Postgres, etc.) to create a unified data discovery, cataloging, lineage, and governance experience across all your data assets, from columns and queries to metrics and dashboards. Atlan facilitates a two-way movement of metadata, bringing context back into the tools and workflows that your data team uses every day — for example, in your BI tool when you wonder what a metric on the dashboard means.

A pioneer in the space, Atlan has been named a Visionary in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data and Analytics Governance Platforms and a Leader and the only Customer Favorite in The Forrester Wave: Data Governance Solutions, Q3 2025. Atlan was also recognized by Gartner seven times in 2021, including as a Cool Vendor in DataOps and in the inaugural Market Guide for Active Metadata Management. Today, we power data democratization and AI-readiness at companies like General Motors, Cisco, Autodesk, Unilever, Ralph Lauren, FOX, News Corp, Nasdaq, NextGen, Plaid, and HubSpot. We recently raised a $105M Series C, backed by top investors including GIC, Insight Partners, Sequoia Capital India, and Salesforce Ventures.

For more information, visit http://www.atlan.com/ or follow us on Twitter at AtlanHQ.

Title: Managing Director - Multifamily
Summary:
Pat Swanson is one of Southern California’s most accomplished multifamily investment advisors, known for consistently exceeding client expectations. Based in Stream Realty Partners’ Irvine office, Pat specializes in the acquisition, disposition, and advisory of apartment buildings throughout Orange County, Los Angeles, the Inland Empire, and San Diego.

His expertise includes creating optimal solutions through value-add repositioning and 1031 Exchanges, delivering strategic, results-driven outcomes for high-net-worth families, private investors, and institutional clients. Pat also has extensive experience in distressed debt/properties, capitalizing value through comprehensive mass marketing efforts, and executing joint ventures, recapitalizations, and advisory assignments across Southern California.

With over two decades of experience, Pat’s career is built on trust, deep market knowledge, and the ability to navigate complex transactions. His accomplishments include the CoStar Power Broker Award and recognition as the Top Multifamily Agent in California for both Colliers and Sperry Van Ness, along with numerous top producer awards at both firms.

Notable Achievements

>  Colliers International's Top 10 Producer (2016 to 2024)
>  Max Green Circle of Excellence Award – Colliers (2011 to 2024)
>  Consistently ranked as a Costar Power Broker
>  Platinum Achiever Award – Sperry Van Ness (2005 to 2010)
>  Top Producing Rookie – Sperry Van Ness (2003 to 2004)

A proud USC graduate in Business Administration with an emphasis in Marketing, Pat was a three-year starter for USC’s nationally ranked Trojan football team and holds a Black Belt in Karate.

Outside of work, Pat enjoys time with his family, watching his daughters cheer and dance, and supporting his sons as they play football and run track. He approaches every client relationship with one goal: deliver exceptional service, long-term value, and ensure both sides walk away feeling they have won.

While others focus on scaling data-hungry neural networks, we’re building AI that understands the structures of thought, not just patterns in data.

Symbolica is an AI research lab pioneering the application of category theory to enable logical reasoning in machines. We’re a well-resourced, nimble team of experts on a mission to bridge the gap between theoretical mathematics and cutting-edge AI, creating symbolic reasoning models that think like humans – precise, logical, and interpretable.

Our approach combines rigorous research with fast-paced, results-driven execution. We’re reimagining the very foundations of intelligence while simultaneously developing product-focused machine learning models in a tight feedback loop, where research fuels application.

Our vision is to create AI systems that transform industries, empowering machines to solve humanity’s most complex challenges with precision and insight.

Title: Advisory Board Member for WebDoctors.com
Summary:
I’m a board member, senior technology executive, and certified SAP consultant with deep expertise in technical solutions management and advisory for back-end enterprise systems and processes. I bring a comprehensive background in driving large-scale ERP implementations (testing, deployment, and change management) across a broad range of industries, including oil and gas, healthcare, heavy equipment, aerospace and defense, technology, banking, financial services, consumer goods, and beauty.

Frequently called upon by boards, executive leaders, and stakeholders to solve problems at the tactical and strategic levels, I serve as an architect and a bridge for organizations to mitigate risk, cut costs, and optimize efficiencies. Additionally, I possess a strong entrepreneurial spirit and passion for creating empowered company cultures that leverage a value-driven framework and excel in high-growth technology environments and evolving digital landscapes.

I began my career as a software developer, holding subsequent roles in engineering and technology as a business analyst, project lead, technical architect, and IT director. In 1997, I founded deBCor Engineering to build and integrate mobile and payment systems with SAP R3 and S4 that create a seamless user experience and deliver cost-effective solutions.

Over the past 25+ years, I’ve grown deBCor into a leading global solution architecture company which delivers a white-glove service to client companies at all stages and levels of restructuring. As the CEO and Chief Architect, I oversee all aspects of the deBCor brand, operations, finance, contracts, and sales, including leading a team of 60 platinum-level consultants who are spread across our offices in the US, India, Chile, and Costa Rica. Through my deep understanding of how software interacts, deBCor delivers an elegant and simple approach toward uncovering pitfalls and guaranteeing sound solutions within every level of an organization, including offshore capabilities.

In addition to my technology leadership, I’ve served in multiple board leadership and advisory roles for a variety of tech-enabled companies, such as RaVina Labs, STS Capital Partners, WebDoctors.com, and BugZero. I’ve written numerous books (13+) on the technical aspects of SAP, and I’m a vetted tools and technology instructor for SAP America. I’m also a proud graduate of Stanford University’s GSB LEAD program, a year-long program on key business fundamentals related to finance, strategy, critical thinking, and the innovation process.

I can be reached at: gareth@debcor.com

Description: Founder & CEO @PRACTICE_PBC | 200K+ students supported | On a mission to reach 1M by 2030
Title: Advisory Board Member
Summary:
At PRACTICE, we partner with schools to close learning gaps, boost math and reading proficiency, and increase graduation rates. To date, we’ve supported over 200,000 low-income students — driving higher achievement, stronger confidence, and greater success in school and beyond.

This work is more important now than ever, and we’re on a mission to reach 1,000,000 students by 2030.
As the son of a single immigrant mother who relied on public assistance, I attended some of NYC’s most underfunded public schools. Thanks to mentors and role models, I graduated with honors from Cornell and earned a Master’s degree at Columbia. These experiences drive my life’s work and inform how we’ve built PRACTICE: tailoring supports that best serve some of our country’s most deserving youth.

I’ve been named a TED Fellow, Echoing Green Fellow, and Forbes 30 Under 30 honoree. I’ve authored Breaking Through: From Rough to Ready and The Purpose-Driven Social Entrepreneur. Our work has been featured in Forbes, Newsweek, and USA Today.

Yet millions of young people are still growing up believing they are limited by the labels placed on them. At PRACTICE, we’re changing that narrative, and helping schools build structures to sustain that change long-term.

Title: Estate and Probate Attorney
Summary:
Brad is an estate and probate attorney with offices in New Orleans and Covington, Louisiana. His practice is primarily focused on serving clients with succession and estate planning issues. He guides families through the legal process necessary to open succession for a lost loved one, and also assists families with the many financial and legal issues that result after someone’s death. Through his estate planning services, he helps people plan for the orderly transfer of their estate upon their death, as well as structure and protect their estate and wealth during their lifetime.

He is a native and resident of Lafourche Parish, Louisiana, and attended Nicholls State University in Thibodaux, Louisiana, where he obtained a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance. After working as a licensed stockbroker, he attended law school at Louisiana State University in Baton Rouge, where he obtained his Juris Doctorate in Law.

For families and individuals, he provides the following services:

-Successions and Probate
-Estate Litigation
-Heirship Litigation
-Estate Planning
-Preparation of Wills
-Trust Creation

Title: Founder/Coach
Org: The Audacious School of Astonishing Pursuits
Enrich Company: The Audacious School of Astonishing Pursuits
Description (2):
What is Creative Megamachine?
It’s an 8-week group coaching and mentor program with 16-year W+K veteran and former Executive Creative Director Jason Bagley. With class sizes capped at 18 students, CREATIVE MEGAMACHINE is an intimate coaching environment that allows Jason to answer questions, and walk students step-by-step through the secrets and techniques of creating the best work of their lives.

Who is it for?
CREATIVE MEGAMACHINE is designed for ambitious creatives at all levels who want to rapidly accelerate their career. It is not a portfolio school. The only homework assignments will be to put the tools and techniques they learn to use on the client briefs they’re already working on. Participants range from rookie creatives, to ECD's at top agencies.

How does it work?
Participants get access to a series of in-depth video presentations where Jason walks them step-by-step through each lesson. Each presentation is packed with career-changing advice, stories, secrets, and techniques. Then once a week, they meet with Jason live on Zoom for a full hour of Q&A to ask about the material or anything else they want to discuss. If a participant can’t make it to one of the Zoom sessions, the recording can be accessed at any time.
Headline: I help creatives start doing the best work of their lives in less than 60 days at theasap.co but only creatives--marine biologists are on their own. | Former CCO of Wieden+Kennedy, Portland.

Title: Member
Summary:
Anand Sheth is the founder and CEO of Mon Ami Real Estate based in Chicago.  Since its inception in 2015,  Mon Ami has acquired over 350 properties in 30+ States spanning traditional real estate classes across residential, commercial, retail, land, office, and industrial assets.  Unlike conventional real estate investment funds focused on asset class silos, Mon Ami’s unique strategy consistently uncovers asymmetric risk-reward opportunities across property types.  Its approach to finding value in turn generates unique returns for investors and other JV partners – to date, in the top decile across its investment vehicles.

Anand received a JD from the University of Chicago Law School and a BA in Finance from the University of Southern California. He is an active member of YPO and Vistage and sits on the board of nonprofit Arden Shore. Anand founded Mon Ami Real Estate in Chicago where it is still headquartered. While he is  still very involved in the Chicago business  and civic communities and visits often, he  now  lives in the Los Angeles area where he grew up with his wife, two kids, and beloved german shepherd Harrison Cooper.

Prior to Mon Ami Real Estate, he led his family’s wholesale diamond business and then launched Mon Ami Jewelry, a boutique jewelry store serving athletes, celebrities and professionals. Anand also founded Masks4Chi, a non-profit organization that donated over 100,000 reusable masks to those in need during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Online Health & Fitness Consultant
Summary:
You’ve built success in business. But when it comes to your body—things feel out of sync.

You’re carrying extra weight (especially around the belly and chest), energy crashes mid-afternoon, and the routines that used to work… don’t anymore.

You’ve tried calorie tracking, fasting, random workouts. But nothing sticks—because none of it was built for your life as a high performer.

That’s where I come in.

I work privately with high-performers over 40—executives, lawyers, entrepreneurs—who want to lose 10–20 lbs, reclaim control, and build a system that keeps them lean and energized for life.

And over the past 5 years, I've helped 150+ high achievers transform their physiques, unlock their metabolism, and take full control of their health.

No food tracking. No restrictive diets. Less than 90 minutes in the gym each week.

A simple system that fits your schedule and makes health effortless.

Together, we install your High Performance Health Code:
 A no-tracking meal system that adapts to travel and work dinners
 A 3x/week strength training framework built for performance and longevity
 A metabolic reboot process that eliminates fat storage mode and brain fog

As a 6-time national representative athlete, certified performance nutrition coach, with an MSc in Psychology, I have a solid background on which to help my clients change their lives.

If this resonates with you, send me a message saying "interested" and I'll see if I can help you.
Org: High Performance Human - Elite Health Consulting

Title: President
Summary:
Dr. Lama Rimawi is a graduate of the McGill University Faculty of Medicine and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. She completed her Pediatrics residency at Children’s Memorial Hospital (now Lurie Children’s Hospital) and Yale New Haven Children’s Hospital. Dr. Rimawi has been taking care of children and their families in hospital settings, and in private practice, for over 20 years. She founded Care Pediatrics in Wellesley, MA, and now is in private practice in Palo Alto, CA.

Dr. Rimawi is also a board member of the Sisterhood of Salaam Shalom. Based on shared values, the mission of the Sisterhood of Salaam Shalom is to build relationships between Muslim and Jewish women of all ages, to promote and advocate for human rights, and to end acts of hate for all human beings. Dr. Rimawi is currently the co-chair of the Israel/Palestine Committee.

Dr. Rimawi's passion for human rights lead her to co-found the Anti-Palestinian Racism Research Group (APRRG). The preliminary findings of their landmark study on anti-Palestinian racism was published in April 2024. She has also authored academic and opinion pieces in national publications and newspapers.
Org: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR)
Enrich Company: The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism (IUAPR)
Description (2):
Our mission is to end racism against Palestinians and their allies including advocates for Palestinian rights and freedom.

The Institute for the Understanding of Anti-Palestinian Racism consists of researchers, physicians, psychologists, and anti-racist, legal and communication experts who are committed to empirically researching, educating and advocating on the impact of anti-Palestinian racism on individuals and communities across all sectors of society.
Headline: Pediatrician, writer and passionate advocate for peace, human rights and children's health. Anti-Palestinian Racism researcher and educator.

Title: Strategic Advisor
Summary:
Arun Singh, CFA, is a seasoned finance executive with over 18 years of experience in the real estate and financial sectors. He is currently the CEO at Radial Capital, where he is committed to delivering results through a holistic approach to debt borrowing, offering tailored solutions across the entire debt life cycle—from originations to loan management to payoffs. He emphasizes long-term relationships and continuous partnership, ensuring clients receive personalized advisory and expert guidance throughout the loan process.

Prior to founding Radial Capital, Arun served as the Chief Financial Officer at MDH Partners, overseeing finance, capital markets, accounting, investor relations, ESG initiatives, and operational strategies. During his tenure, he secured over $2.4 billion in debt financing and raised $1.7 billion across two funds, expanding the portfolio to 25 million square feet of industrial space.

Before joining MDH Partners, he held leadership positions at MetLife Real Estate Investors, managing over $8.5 billion in commercial mortgage loans in the Southeast. There, he led a high-performing team, served as a portfolio manager, and was a voting member of the investment committee. His expertise spans institutional finance, investment strategy, and team management, with a track record of driving operational efficiency and scaling businesses.

Arun holds a Master of Science in Real Estate from New York University and a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from The Ohio State University. Outside of his professional career, he is a college football enthusiast and car aficionado who enjoys beach vacations and working on landscaping projects.

Our mission is to generate both strategic value and financial returns for our investors.  We accomplish this by sourcing, vetting, investing in, and introducing best-in-class bank-enabling technology solutions that enhance the competitive positions of our community bank partners (Limited Partners).

I’m on a mission to 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘀𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗯𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝘀𝗮𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲. In fact, when done right, growth should give you more freedom—not take it away.

That’s exactly what I help business owners achieve: More revenue, more impact, and more time back—by using AI Systems to handle the repetitive, soul-crushing tasks so you can focus on what truly moves the needle.

I first cracked this code in my own business (𝟳-𝗳𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗲𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗻 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺), then went on to help 𝟯𝟬𝟬+ 𝗯𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗲𝘀 do the same across multiple industries.

What Happens When You Transform Your Business with AI-Powered Systems?
𝗠𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗽𝗹𝘆 𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗽𝘂𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗻𝘁→ Achieve 2-3X growth with your current team

𝗢𝘂𝘁𝗽𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗶𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗰𝗸 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘂𝗮𝗹 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗲𝘀→ Gain a market advantage that compounds daily
𝗦𝗵𝗶𝗳𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺’𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵-𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸→ Unlock innovation, creativity, and exponential impact

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗠𝗮𝗸𝗲𝘀 𝗢𝘂𝗿 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗮𝗰𝗵 𝗗𝗶𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝘁?
Unlike generic AI courses or high-ticket consultants who build one-off solutions, we provide a 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘁𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗻𝘀𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺—𝘁𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀 𝟯𝟬𝟬+ 𝗯𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗲𝘀.

We don’t just teach AI tools—we embed AI into your company’s DNA using proven frameworks that multiply revenue, impact, and long-term enterprise value.
 Most AI solutions = Just saving time.
 Our AI system = Transforming your entire business model for exponential growth.

The businesses that thrive in 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟱 𝘄𝗼𝗻’𝘁 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗯𝗲 𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗔𝗜 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗮𝘀𝗸𝘀—𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆’𝗹𝗹 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗔𝗜 𝘄𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗼 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗳𝗹𝗼𝘄. Our system ensures your business is valued at its full potential—not just the 10% that manual-dependent businesses command in today’s market.

Description (2):
We don’t just teach AI. We build businesses that run on it.

At The Uncommon Business, we design smart AI systems for small business owners earning $500K–$5M — helping them scale without chaos, reduce mental clutter, and activate team independence.

We're not here to work harder. We're here to work wiser.

AI is not a novelty. It’s a non-negotiable.
And we don’t settle for surface-level outputs.
We teach you to think like an AI Architect — someone who leads with clarity, automates with precision, and uses AI as a second brain (not a button-pusher).

We help founders build AI-powered workflows that eliminate bottlenecks, custom prompt libraries + team training systems, SOPs and automations that scale your operations, and internal tools that boost productivity and preserve creative energy.

We believe in The Uncommon Method
Rewire. Build. Scale.

We rewire your mindset for AI-first thinking, build custom tools and prompts, and help your team scale systems confidently without you in the weeds.

Our clients work with us because they're scaling fast… but the backend is a mess.

Their team can’t keep up with what’s in their head, they want their business to run whether they’re at their desk or not, they’re spending 3+ hours a day on repetitive work, and they’ve tried AI tools but need strategy, not more noise.

At The Uncommon Business, we help you:

 Buy back your time
 Activate team independence
 Turn clunky ops into seamless systems
 Lead your business with energy and vision — not overwhelm

This is not about hustle. It’s about discernment, alignment, and intelligent scale.
AI won’t replace you. But someone using it really well will.

Welcome to The Uncommon Way.

Title: Vice President, Sales
Summary: Trusted by top medical professionals worldwide and used in over 2,500 studies, InBody has been a global leader in advanced body composition technology for over 20 years. By using revolutionary BIA technology that measures body segments separately at multiple frequencies, accurate, quick, and non-invasive body composition analysis occurs in just seconds. Through a continuous “exchange of knowledge” mindset, InBody delivers key data to physicians, researchers, innovators, and healthcare leaders so that individuals and communities can make insightful decisions to improve their body composition for sustainable good health.
Address - Locations: 13850 Cerritos Corporate Drive, Unit C, Cerritos, California 90703, US
Description (2):
InBody is a worldwide leader in the health metrics field, revolutionizing the industry with innovative technology and devices. InBody’s products are trusted by top research facilities, fitness centers, hospitals, and health centers around the world because of their accuracy, reproducibility, and ease-of-use.

InBody has become well-known in the BIA field by constantly innovating and improving the techniques we use to gather body composition data. Our body composition analyzers use advanced technology, such as DSM-BIA (Direct Segmental Measurement Bioelectric Impedance Analysis) as well as the 8-Point Tactile Electrode System, to precisely analyze the body and deliver important insights about overall health.

InBody’s professional body composition analyzers provide full page Results Sheets, customized for each individual user. In two minutes or less, users can discover their Percent Body Fat, basal metabolic rate, muscle mass, muscle balance, and more.

InBody has a range of different body composition and body water analyzer models designed to meet a wide variety of needs for our clients, which range from corporate wellness programs, to gyms and fitness clubs, to top-tier medical institutions.

InBody also offers clinically validated blood pressure monitors and stadiometers for medical settings. From large organizations to small clinics, one thing always stays the same: the precision, accuracy, and reproducibility of all InBody Tests.

Our new consumer line includes a home blood pressure monitor optimized for self-testing, a home body composition scale, a fitness wearable, and a kid-friendly digital stadiometer.

InBody continues to changes lives by informing people users of how their diets, lifestyles, and exercise routines affect their health. Let InBody help your customers or patients reach their wellness goals. Find out more at inbody.com.
Headline: Vice President, Sales at InBody USA

Description: Husband and father of three, Iron-Triber, hiker, tenor, frequent flyer, coffee drinker, and lifelong learner
Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
A business and finance executive, I’ve provided decisive leadership and big-picture perspective for large-scale turnarounds and unprecedented revenue and profit growth. My expertise spans growth by acquisitions, new initiatives and increasing market penetration. I’ve also helped deliver shareholder value through driving cost efficiency and strong expense management on the P&L and minimizing the cost of debt and decreasing working capital on the balance sheet.

As a key member on the senior leadership team, I was instrumental in propelling Momentum Telecom’s revenue growth, quintupling company size and establishing a profitable new growth engine. My M&A background includes sourcing, negotiating and integrating high-value enterprises.  Recent highlights include co-leading the acquisition and merger with Momentum's largest competitor, IBBS, the take-private of Alteva, and the subsequent platform sale to a top-tier private equity sponsor.

Throughout my career, I’ve provided transformational leadership to position organizations for sustainable success, revitalized struggling operations and guided teams through culture change and uncertainty. In addition, I am known for in identifying, scoping and modeling new businesses and markets, strategic and accretive acquisitions, raising capital and planning cash flows, as well as building talented teams that launch and grow these plans.
Address - Locations: 1900 28th Avenue South, Suite 200, Birmingham, Alabama 35209, US
Description (2):
Founded in 2002, Cahaba Media Group is a growing company with an entrepreneurial mindset. We publish trade magazines, websites and e-newsletters that are leaders in their respective industries. We hire the best people, we work hard and we value integrity over everything else. We are keenly focused on engaging our audiences and connecting them to our customers through exceptional products and services. We believe that a good work-life balance is critical to long-term success.

The phrase “A Great Place To Work” is more than a catchphrase for our company. It is printed on the wall of our conference room, surrounded by a collection of phrases that, together, reflect the intentionally managed, values-based company culture that is critically important to us.

VALUES & PRINCIPLES
At Cahaba Media Group, our first and most important value is INTEGRITY. We are honest, we do the right thing and you can count on us to honor our commitments. We believe that our reputation—as individuals and as an organization—is our most valuable asset, and we work every day to improve it.

We value honesty and treating people right more than we value profits. We endeavor to treat our customers and vendors with respect. We seek accounts and relationships—not just orders. We only want customers who receive value from doing business with us. We produce products for our readers that are designed to be imminently practical, timely and readable. This builds loyal readership, which our advertisers greatly appreciate. Each of our brands has an Editorial Advisory Board made up of well-respected, knowledgeable experts in that brand’s industry. These professionals work with our editorial teams to ensure that our content is always relevant and useful to its audience.

We seek to be good customers and treat our vendors as we would want them to treat us. We play fair. We are honest with our requirements and feedback and we pay our bills on time.
Headline: Chief Executive Officer at Cahaba Media Group

Description: CEO of $CETX, entrepreneur, investor, also knicks;  (views are my own)
Title: CEO
Summary:
Presently the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Cemtrex Inc. (www.cemtrex.com, NASDAQ: CETX), a company that owns and operates multiple businesses. Today we are building in industrial solutions and intelligent security systems.

Saagar has been CEO since December 2011. He has been working at Cemtrex since 2008, initially as a field engineer, subsequently moving into sales and management roles. Under his leadership he has spearheaded the company's transition into new markets and product lines growing the business from under $3M in revenues to over $100M. During his time as a leader at the company, the company earned a spot on the Deloitte Fast 500 Technology companies list in 2012, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 while growing over 3000% in revenue. Cemtrex has over 350 employees in 6 offices worldwide.

Saagar was recently recognized as a Forbes' 30 Under 30 in 2016, Business Insiders #17 on Top 100 of Silicon Alley in 2015, and Top 40 Under 40 by Stony Brook University in 2014 and 2016. He has a Bachelors of Engineering in Materials Science and Engineering. He is also a member of the Young Presidents Organization (YPO).

Saagar is a serial entrepreneur interested in IoT, Wearables, Robotics, Advanced electronics, and Space Tech. In his leisure time he enjoys watching the Knicks, golfing, traveling, and sailing.

Description: Deal Lawyer. Value Added Advisor. Entrepreneur.
Title: Entrepreneur In Residence
Summary:
Brian A. Hall is the Managing Partner of Traverse Legal, PLC and founder of its Austin, Texas office.  He is a deal attorney.  He has represented companies from start-up to exit, including tech, AI, SAAS, CPG, enterprise Internet and brand owners throughout the world with their Intellectual Property, including IP Portfolio management; Internet Law, including such areas as digital and social media, advertising and promotions, privacy and data matters; and Business Law issues.  Brian regularly advises clients on the acquisition of, enforcement of, licensing and monetization of intellectual property, with extensive experience with countless multi-million dollar corporate transactions involving an entity's business-critical IP.  He has also led various mergers and acquisitions in numerous industries.

Brian’s list of clients also includes C-level executives, HNWI, family offices, authors, influencers, professional athletes and celebrities.  He is widely respected as a trusted advisor to founders, investors and changemakers.

Brian has served as fractional and outside general counsel, as well as in-house counsel in a secondment role, to private, venture backed companies, public companies, venture capital funds and accelerators. Since 2015, he has been General Counsel to Notley Ventures, a social impact company in Austin, Texas.  Brian is the founder of TraverseGC, a monthly fixed-fee subscription-based provider of General Counsel services to companies.  His practice also involves serving as trusted, general counsel to ultra high net worth individuals and family offices.

Brian has also litigated cases across the United States involving trademark, domain name, copyright, software trade secret, online defamation, privacy/personal rights, partnership disputes and commercial issues.

Brian is currently an Entrepreneur in Residence at the Herb Kelleher Entrepreneurship Center at The University of Texas.  He is a regular author and speaker on legal topics of particular interest to technology companies given his background as an IT Consultant with the global IT firm Accenture.  Brian has provided trademark legal commentary on Fox 7 News (Austin) and presented CLE on a variety of topics.  He the President of EO Austin.   He previously served on the Board of Directors for PeopleFund.

Brian has been chosen by his peers as a Rising Star in Intellectual Property, as rated by SuperLawyers, for the years 2010-2020 and has received the highest peer rating for level of professional excellence, AV Preeminent, by Martindale-Hubbell.
Org: Herb Kelleher Center for Entrepreneurship, Growth, and Renewal, The University of Texas at Austin
Address - Locations: 810 COTTAGEVIEW DRIVE, Suite G-20, TRAVERSE CITY, Michigan 49684, US
Description (2): Traverse Legal, PLC is a law firm dedicated to founders, start-ups and emerging growth companies.  With both transactional attorneys and litigators, we focus on Intellectual Property, Technology, Internet and Business Law.  We utilize client and fee friendly models in order to deliver advice and counseling that has successfully served clients just like you with problems just like yours.  Whether we are acting as outsourced technology counsel and managing your IP portfolio, as general counsel or as your litigation team, Traverse Legal has the experience necessary to achieve your goals.

Title: Director
Description (2):
We are a clinical stage regenerative medicine biotechnology company developing cellular therapies for life-threatening and chronic aging-related conditions. Our lead investigational product is laromestrocel (Lomecel-B), which is derived from culture-expanded mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) that are sourced from bone marrow of young healthy adult donors. We believe that by using the same cells that promote tissue repair, organ maintenance, and immune system function, we can develop safe and effective therapies for some of the most difficult diseases and conditions associated with aging.
Our clinical development programs have delivered several positive initial results across 5 clinical trials in 3 indications:  Phase 1 & 2 in Alzheimer’s Disease, Phase 1 & 2 in Aging-related Frailty, Phase 1 in Hypoplastic Left Heart Syndrome (HLHS), a rare pediatric disease.  We are currently conducting a pivotal Phase2b clinical trial in HLHS. Our mission is to advance laromestrocel (Lomecel-B) and other cell-based product candidates into pivotal trials, with the goal of achieving regulatory approvals, subsequent commercialization and broad use by the healthcare community.
Our philosophy is that healthy aging can be improved through regenerative medicine approaches. Life expectancy has substantially increased over the past century as a result of medical and public health advancements. However, this increase in longevity has not been paralleled by the number of years a person is expected to live in relatively good health, free of chronic disease and disabilities of aging – a period known as healthspan. As we age, we experience a profound decline, in both number and function, in our own MSCs, a decrease in immune system function, decline in blood vessel functioning, chronic inflammation and other issues. Our clinical data suggest that laromestrocel (Lomecel-B) addresses these conditions through multiple mechanisms of action, or MOAs, that target key aging-related processes

Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
I’ve always been driven by the urge to build something from scratch. Not just a business, but a product with real impact. That clarity landed for me one morning, when I asked myself: If I made it all the way to the top here, would I be happy and satisfied? The answer was no. I knew I had to make a change.

The corporate world gave me incredible exposure. I learned how to lead and how to navigate complex, high-pressure environments. But it limited the impact I could make on the world. I wanted to create, not just optimise. I wanted to deliver value, not just extract it.

Entrepreneurship offered a different kind of challenge: the chance to lead through inspiration, to assemble a team that believed in a shared mission and to test whether I could not only envision a better way, but actually deliver it. So I left to build something different. Something better.

That is Aslan, a payroll-embedded reward provider designed to deliver fairer financial services to employees and cut compensation costs for employers. It gives employees more control, flexibility and value from the money they earn — while helping employers make cost savings, boost retention and offer a benefit people use 30x a month, on average.

We’re on a mission to change how people experience their salaries, with fairness, clarity and rewards built in by design. For CFOs and HR leaders, that means turning payroll into a strategic tool that reduces National Insurance, makes rewards more efficient and keeps teams engaged.

Aslan is just getting started.
Description (2):
Aslan supercharges employees' pay, whilst reducing your costs. With everyday rewards, pension salary sacrifice, payroll savings, tax-efficient gifting and on-demand pay, Aslan helps your employees' pay go further.

Aslan’s financial wellbeing solution is trusted by companies to help them engage, attract and retain top talent by supporting the financial needs of the entire workforce. Whether it’s budgeting better, saving smarter, or feeling rewarded every day, Aslan empowers people to feel more in control of their money, and more valued at work.

Employees get access to the Aslan app and Mastercard, giving them the flexibility to choose how and when they get paid, make their money go further, and save effortlessly from payroll.

Employers save costs with pension salary sacrifice, and easy, tax-efficient gifting of Aslan points. Our clients not only save money but benefit from a fully engaged, financially confident and productive team.
Headline: Founder & CEO of Aslan | Payroll-embedded reward and cost savings | Building the future of workplace financial wellbeing | Angel Investor

Title: Angel Investor
Summary:
Founder of Shotgun - the open source Spec Driven Development tool. Shotgun writes codebase-aware specs for your Al coding agents so they don't derail and build what you want. Built for developers who work with AI coding agents.

→ Try Shotgun: github.com/shotgun-sh/shotgun

Angel investor in frontier technology, backing founders in AI, infrastructure, and deep tech. Includes ElevenLabs, Zetalabs, Kick.co, SalePatriot, Ramp, and many more. Co-investing alongside a16z, Sequoia, Felicis, and OpenAI Fund.

Writing a newsletter about technology and business since 2018 → https://substack.com/@pucek
Description (2):
Turn Endless Iterations into One-Shot Features.

Shotgun writes codebase-aware specs for your AI coding agents so they don't derail and build what you want.

The Problem: Your AI agent (Cursor, Lovable, Claude Code) starts strong, then loses context and goes off-rails. You spend hours re-prompting because it doesn't understand your existing codebase. You're stuck in iteration hell—not because AI is bad, but because it's working without the right prep work.

How Shotgun Works (it does what your AI agent needs but can't do itself):
1. Index your entire codebase
2. Research how features should fit your architecture
3. Generate technical specs with full context baked in
4. Break down implementation into clear tasks
5. Export to whatever AI coding agent you use

The result: Your AI agent builds entire features correctly instead of fragments that need constant correction.

What You Get
→ AI agents that work longer without derailing (sustained quality, not just speed)
→ Features that respect your existing architecture (no technical debt)
→ Stop re-explaining your codebase every time (index once, use everywhere)

Early users report: "Made Cursor and Lovable basically one-shot the new features."

What's Next:
We're building multiplayer mode for engineering teams and non-technical stakeholders—real-time collaboration on specs, web-based codebase research for PMs and EMs, shared context across the entire team.

Looking for design partners: CTOs scaling AI development who feel coordination pain.

Open source. CLI-first. Built for developers who work with AI coding agents.

→ Try Shotgun: github.com/shotgun-sh/shotgun
→ Design partners: bartek.pucek@shotgun.sh
Headline: founder of Shotgun, angel investor (ElevenLabs, Ramp, Wordware, Kick, Zetalabs, SalesPatriot)

Title: Co-Founder / President
Summary:
My mission is to help heal our people and planet through ventures that inspire the production and consumption of healthy, nutrient-dense foods.

My family has been deeply involved in the food system for close to 100 years.

My grandfather was an orphaned, second-generation Italian American who started selling produce because it was one of the few economic opportunities available to him. Today, that business has grown into one of the leading produce distributors in the nation.

I cut my teeth in our family's business learning all the ins and outs of the fresh produce supply chain while leading a 60-person team that delivered 3,500+ items to 2,500+ retail customers on a weekly basis.

My personal journey with an autoimmune disease led me to the realization that our current food system is radically disconnected from human health.

This led me to regenerative agriculture, which is where I center my work today.

Since 2021, I've invested my time, talent, and capital to advance a diverse set of regenerative projects across the food system.

My focus today is stewarding the ReGen Brands ecosystem which is dedicated to nourishing brands that regenerate life. We envision an Earth perpetually healed through what we produce and consume, and we're advancing the impact of Regenerative CPG brands with unparalleled commercial, financial, and community expertise.
Description (2):
We are an ecosystem that nourishes all life by advancing the impact of brands that support regenerative agriculture.

Our commercial, community, and financial support for the regen brands ecosystem is rooted in three key areas:

We are an insights engine, providing news, perspectives, and education on the world of regenerative CPG to brands, retailers, investors, and other food system stakeholders.

We are a trade association, built to advance the regenerative CPG community by collectively identifying its shared challenges and catalyzing its collaborative solutions.

We are a brand capitalization advisor, provider, and connector, aligning regen CPG growth strategies and needs with the most symbiotic funding sources.

This unprecedented, multifaceted approach to supporting brands that support regenerative agriculture holds the promise of advancing the entire regenerative movement.
Headline: Entrepreneur, Investor, & ReGen Brands Evangelist

Title: Host
Summary:
Aaron Hale, a 14 year veteran of both the Navy and Army, had deployed once to Iraq and was on his second mission to Afghanistan when an IED took his eyes and ended his operational career as an EOD Team Leader. Instead of allowing himself to become a victim, he sees his injury as an example of divine direction.

 Aaron was gifted a home in Santa Rosa Beach, Florida by the organization Building Homes for Heroes.  Retired Staff Sergeant Hale, never accepting  defeat and always looking for new challenges, began teaching at the EOD school as he awaited military retirement.  Continuing his education in finance, running, cycling, golfing, participating in a 90 mile multi-sport relay marathon, ran the Boston Marathon in 2015, and climbs mountains regularly are all major parts of his life next to spending time with his incredible wife McKayla, 9-year old son, Cameron, and 16-month old identical twin sons Owen and Wyatt. Aaron travels the country motivating and inspiring others by sharing their uplifting story of perseverance in tough times and thriving in our lives through adversity.

  In August, 2015 Aaron contracted a sudden case of bacterial meningitis and completely lost hearing in both ears. McKayla was right by Aaron's side during yet another challenging life experience. Aaron is the recipient of two Cochlear implants which he is practicing everyday to relearn how to hear. Living the “Challenge Accepted!” mind set and not letting any obstacles deter him from his goals, he has recently started a new business with McKayla. Together they have created Extra Ordinary Delights, an artisan fudge and chocolate company based out of Santa Rosa Beach, FL.
Location Name: Santa Rosa Beach, Florida, United States
Org: Point of Impact Podcast with Aaron Hale
Headline: US Army EOD (Ret) / Real estate investor / Entrepreneur / Speaker / Podcaster / Ultra-endurance athlete. Lost sight & hearing in deployment injury. 1st blind/deaf finisher of the world’s toughest foot race. UNSTOPPABLE!

Description: Life moves fast, live slow. Founder & CEO @kanahomaagency. Writing weekly at https://t.co/9oEbCCAFRY.
Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
So I've had a lot of jobs.  I've worked as a clubhouse manager for a minor league baseball team, managed a deli in Yellowstone National Park, worked the graveyard shift at a donut shop, and even remodeled Dr. Phil’s kitchen. But for the past 20 years, I've had the pleasure of calling the education industry home.

During my time in higher ed I’ve been lucky enough to be at the right place at the right time on more than one occasion:

- Pioneered Digital Marketing at UCLA: Built early social media strategies and became one of YouTube’s first EDU partners.

- Drove Explosive Growth at SNHU: Produced 7 integrated marketing campaigns, including 34 TV commercials, helping scale enrollment from 7,000 to 70,000 students in just four years.

- Founded Higher Ed Live: Launched the first live-streaming network for higher ed professionals, successfully scaling and exiting the startup in two years.

- Led Marketing at Scale: As Vice Chancellor, built a 50+ person in-house agency team managing a $50M+ marketing budget, supporting a portfolio of universities, charter schools, nonprofits, and an online high school.

Today, as Founder & CEO of Kanahoma, I lead a full-service education marketing agency specializing in paid media management, creative services, and web solutions that deliver results. Our clients include colleges and universities, K12 schools, nonprofits, and edtech organizations who trust us to build their brands and grow their business.

 Subscribe to My Newsletter: Want to stay ahead in education marketing? Join over a thousand education leaders who subscribe to my weekly newsletter for insights, strategies, and actionable advice.

 Let’s Work Together: Looking for an experienced partner to manage your marketing? Let’s connect and explore how Kanahoma can help you achieve your goals.

Description: Founder building AI healthcare | Scaled @Microsoft & @Instacart eng teams | Focused on curing complexity in healthcare IT with better systems @prettygoodai
Title: Co-host
Summary:
I have spent most of my career trying to make annoying but important things less painful at scale: email, marketplaces, and now the administrative side of healthcare.

I started deep in the guts of enterprise email with Zimbra. I joined early, lived in the forums, talked to thousands of admins, and helped grow it into a product that eventually got acquired and shipped to millions of users. That experience taught me how important it is to listen to customers who live in your product every day, not just the people who sign the contracts.

After Zimbra, I helped start Acompli, a mobile email app focused on people who live in Outlook and Exchange. We raised money, shipped quickly, and ended up building what became Outlook Mobile after Microsoft acquired us. In parallel, we built highly secure versions of the product for government customers, where the margin for error is essentially zero. That mix of consumer-grade usability and serious security shaped how I think about product design to this day.

From there, I went deeper into marketplaces and operations at Instacart. Before I took the job, I signed up as a shopper so I could feel the product from the other side. It is one thing to look at dashboards. It is another thing to climb three flights of stairs with someone’s groceries and see where the app helps or gets in the way. That experience reinforced a simple idea: you cannot build for people you never bother to stand next to.

Today, I am the Co-Founder of Pretty Good AI. We are focused on taking routine, repetitive work off medical practices' plates so doctors and staff can spend more time on patient care. Healthcare is full of smart, exhausted people, buried under systems that were never designed for how they actually work. I want to bring everything I learned from Zimbra, Acompli, Outlook, and Instacart into that world.

If you are building in healthcare, wrestling with workflow and compliance, or just trying to get more real work done with less chaos, I'd love to meet you and see if we can help.
Location Name: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
Description (2):
Pretty Good AI is a voice‑first clinic intelligence platform that learns from your real call recordings to automate patient access and routine operations 24/7 — while updating your EHR in real time. No generic scripts. No workflow rewrites. Just measurable relief for staff and faster access for patients.

What it does
• Handles scheduling, refills, records requests, insurance checks, FAQs, routing & escalation, and after‑hours answering.
• Captures structured signals from every interaction to optimize schedules, prior auth timing, and patient access.
• Works with leading EHRs via native integrations and updates in real time.

Proven impact in production
• 50%+ call containment within ~30 days.
• 96% reduction in hold times (first‑ring pickup).
• 13% of bookings shift to after hours, unlocking new revenue and access.

Why it’s different
• Learns from your recordings to mirror your best staff (not a pre‑baked script).
• Deterministic guardrails for reliable, auditable outcomes.
• HIPAA & SOC2 as foundational architecture.

Built by operators who’ve scaled at consumer grade
From Outlook Mobile to Instacart’s AI & logistics, our team has shipped systems that handle millions of high‑stakes interactions — now applied to healthcare.

Get started
See your custom ROI, launch in <30 days, and pay for what you automate.

Summary:
These days I’m Chief of Staff / acting CFO of an 8 figure media company, directing a non-profit focused on arts+tech, board observing for a jigsaw puzzle company, raising a pandemic-born toddler, dreaming up creative projects, and forever thinking about “what’s next”.

I'm still figuring out how to receive less emails but I still love Mondays, which is one of my KPI’s for the GoodLife. I have a penchant for signing up for things I know little about while challenging myself to learn at break-neck speeds (my preference). I’m usually drawn to impossibilities and turning them into triumphs with some wild life stories along the way that someday I’ll share in detail. This has all resulted in a very "enneagram 7" kind of life with lots of learnings (and unlearnings) along the way.

I’ve worked in biomedical manufacturing, clinical studies, travel + leisure, social media, consumer goods, art, crypto, and AI – which really just means I’m interested in everything and [mostly] everyone.

I write, make drone videos, teach my toddler how to use ChatGPT, send out Valentines, take photographs, make zines, and tinker with emerging tech for fun.

I studied finance in school while secretly dreaming about film school... and as a result I love to create art + spreadsheets alike, and still cry over corporate tax strategy + a well made film.
