Title: Vice President
Summary:
For the past 12 years, I’ve worked with medical device teams of all sizes, from early R&D groups to global OEMs, helping them find faster, smarter ways to move complex projects forward.

I like the part of the job where drawings meet real materials and ideas meet manufacturing reality. That’s where things get interesting and where experience helps cut through the noise. Over the years, I’ve been part of programs involving tiny components made from 0.0007-inch diameter wire, production scaling, rapid turnarounds under audit pressure, and design-for-manufacturing reviews that turned multi-month detours into a few weeks of efficient progress.

Most sourcing slowdowns aren’t about bad designs. They come from missing context: what’s realistic to measure, what’s truly scalable, where the dead ends have happened before, and why things take as long as they do (and sometimes why they don’t need to). That’s where I come in.

My work often involves helping teams anticipate manufacturability risks early so validation builds arrive with fewer surprises and fewer failed incoming inspections. I spend time on the floor, ask the right questions, and connect teams with suppliers who’ve already worked through similar challenges. Each project adds another layer of learning, and I bring that perspective to help others get there faster while staying aligned with the quality and traceability expectations medical programs demand.

Through Haldeman & Frazier’s ISO 13485-certified network, we support programs across cardiovascular, neurovascular, electrophysiology, orthopedic, wearable, and robotic-assisted devices, among others, helping teams keep momentum from concept through validation.

Right now, my focus is on helping engineering and sourcing teams remove the friction that slows down good ideas.
Address - Locations: 1313 Flanders Rd, La Cañada Flintridge, California 91011, US

Title: Founder
Summary:
Currently _____.

Previously...

Did some stuff with energy, crypto & web3.

Co-founder & CEO Pingboard, employee engagement software. Ran it through 2014-2021 then hired an awesome CEO to scale.

Co-founder Capital Factory, Austin’s startup center of gravity. Our co-working space helps to connect investors to startups and startups to employees. Our Mentor network identifies the best startups for our Accelerator, where we provide coaching and intros to investors, employees and customers.

In 2002, co-founded & CTO of Webmail.us, the largest business-grade email hosting company at the time, serving 72,000 businesses and over 1 million paid daily active users. We bootstrapped the business to 65 employees, raising outside capital only to manage cash flow, and sold the business to Rackspace in 2007. Continued to scale it to 3 million users, then joined Rackspace’s corp dev team to work on partnerships and M&A for their cloud business.

In 2000, built a social app on the college campus of Virginia Tech, which unfortunately we launched literally the day the dot-com bubble burst, March 10, 2000, and we ultimately failed. However, after 2 years and 6 pivots we created Webmail.us.

Going waaaaay back, I started working for my parents printing company at age 7 and never stopped working. In high school, I built our digital prepress department, moving us away from camera & film, to print from a Mac directly to metal plate (in 1994!).  In 2010, I sold the business so that my mom could retire.

Title: Founder and Head Coach
Summary:
I prevent world-class CEOs and founders from making million-pound mistakes by helping them achieve clarity and resilience. I know what it feels like to chase success at the cost of your health and relationships.

After building businesses of my own and working with leaders across industries, I’ve seen the same pattern: success at the top often comes at the expense of health, relationships, or clarity of purpose. That’s why I created the Compound Leadership Framework, a system designed to align performance with fulfilment.

The framework focuses on three critical pillars:
Health — building resilience and peak energy to avoid burnout.
Wealth — compounding time, capital, and decisions for long-term growth.
Relationships — deepening trust and influence to shape lasting legacy.

I work with leaders facing high-pressure decisions and complex transitions, from scaling a company to preparing for an exit or pursuing their “Second Mountain” of purpose. My role isn’t just to coach, but to act as a strategic partner who stands beside you, helping you navigate the hidden pressures of leadership without losing what matters most.

The best leaders don’t just deliver results, they design lives and businesses worth compounding. My clients are CEOs, founders, and senior executives navigating growth, exits, and legacy. They come to me when they need a trusted adviser to see blind spots, sharpen decisions, and create alignment across their personal and professional worlds.

Follow me here for reflections on compound leadership, or connect directly to start a conversation.
Description (2): DR. J. SHAMEL LTD is a consumer services company based out of United Kingdom.
Headline: People and their potential are my passion. I'm obsessed with leadership as a skillset and mindset in business and life.

Title: Senior Principal
Summary:
Nick Giometti is a Senior Principal at B Capital and a member of the investment team focusing on data, AI/ML, infra, and developer tools. Prior to B Capital, Nick was a Vice President at Geodesic Capital, where he invested in companies including Figma, Sourcegraph, Dremio, TRM Labs, Fly, and Chronosphere. Before working in venture capital, Nick worked as a systematic investor at BlackRock for eight years, where he managed quantitative corporate bond funds and developed workflow automation software.

Nick received a B.A. in Economics and English from Dartmouth, and an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management. In a former life, Nick was a sponsored Ironman triathlete, and now spends his time swimming much more slowly in the Bay.

Title: Seed Investor
Summary:
Rogers Healy is a seasoned entrepreneur, with over 20 years of investing experience. As a founder of multiple companies, ranging from the real estate to the memorabilia space, Rogers considers his secret weapon to be his eye for talent. Being a business owner, Rogers knows what it takes and what makes a company successful.

As an entrepreneur, investor, leader, and music guru, Rogers embodies the spirit of a business owner. Rogers jumped into business at an early age, and in 2005 started what is now Texas’ largest independently owned real estate company, Rogers Healy and Associates Real Estate. Since its inception, Rogers went on to be the founder of Rogers Healy and Associates Land and Lake, Rogers Healy and Associates Commercial Real Estate, Healy Global Real Estate and Relocation, and Healy Property Management.

As fate would have it, Rogers made his first investment in the world of Venture Capital in 2012, in Mizzen + Main. He fell in love with the idea of connecting the dots in the world of VC. After over a decade of investing in deals ranging from CPG to SaaS, Rogers founded Morrison Seger Venture Capital Partners. “MoSe” quickly made a name for themselves, with early-stage investments in companies ranging from tequila to trading cards, and have been able to add a new layer of experience to venture capitalism.

Most importantly, Rogers lives a life of faith, alongside his wife Abby, their daughters Henley and Collins (named after Eagles’ frontman, Don Henley, and Phil Collins), their son Winwood (named after musician Steve Winwood), and their dogs and all their music memorabilia. Rogers has one of the largest collections of music memorabilia in the world. During his free time, Rogers enjoys relaxing with his family and friends at ‘Hotel California’, his back house turned music oasis.

As a veteran investor, Rogers is a part of some of the most well known brands in North America.

Description: Social Entrepreneur. Passions inc community engagement, play based research & tech4good. CEO @playverto former @bitetheballot, systems changer @ashoka Fellow
Title: Chief Exploration Officer
Summary:
About Me
If you’ve ever second-guessed your strategy, wondered if your data truly reflects reality, or felt too far removed from the communities at the heart of your work – that’s where I come in. I bring confidence, clarity, and authentic evidence that keeps your decisions grounded, your strategies relevant, and your impact undeniable.

 Play Verto: From Voices to Action
At Play Verto, we’re pioneering the use of play-based research and the art of gamification to transform how people engage with questions that matter. By turning participation into an experience, we foster belonging and unlock authentic responses that traditional surveys miss. We then bring those insights into the heart of strategy – weaving lived experience with the knowledge and capabilities of leaders to catalyse real impact. Our inclusive platform supports 60+ languages and achieves an 80% average completion rate – three times higher than traditional survey platforms – delivering data that is representative, actionable, and credible.

 Global Reach, Proven Impact
Since 2019, we’ve partnered with global brands and institutions, specialising in reaching local voices and organisations closest to the challenge. By weaving these ecosystems together, we ensure that change is driven by authentic insight and co-created across whole systems.

 Partner With Us
I work with leaders, investors, and changemakers who want their strategies to be underpinned by authentic evidence, tested assumptions, and real-time voices from the ground. Collaboration is an art – and it’s often where change succeeds or fails. I partner with those willing to lean in when it gets difficult, who can be agile, self-aware, and ready to examine their own pain points and judgments. Together, we keep our egos in check, build deeper human connection, and ensure our shared goals don’t just look good on paper – they translate into real, lasting impact.
Description (2):
Play Verto is a first-of-its-kind gamified data collection platform connecting communities to decision makers through play-based experiences.

Our mission is to be the world's foremost impactful data platform, revolutionising how insights drive positive change. We envision a world where play acts as the bridge connecting diverse realities, uncovering insights that close the gap between intentions and actions. When it comes to research and measurement - we inspire hard to reach and diverse communities to share authentic data whilst supporting leaders and decision makers to act with confidence on the actionable insights
Headline: CEO, Play Verto | The Decision Catalyser | Transforming Decision-Making Through Real-Time, People-Powered Insight | Partner to Leaders Driving Authentic, Global Impact

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
I’m the CEO of Zenflight, a boutique private aviation company with global reach and a fiercely loyal clientele. We manage and operate one of the most respected fleets in the business, and I’m proud to say we built it one owner and one aircraft at a time—by staying relentlessly focused on service, integrity, and execution.

My path here was anything but linear. I was born into a middle-class family outside Chicago, raised by two small-business owner parents who believed in hard work and showing up. I grew up an athlete, and I’ve carried that same discipline and drive into every chapter of my life. I always imagined I’d run a creative agency—something that shaped how people see and experience the world. Looking back, I realize I was always chasing something bigger than a career: I wanted to live a full life. That meant carving my own path.

I spent over 15 years growing inside a company I loved, starting young and rising through the ranks by observing, learning, and never waiting for permission. But as much as I cherished the journey—and the people who became family—I knew I wasn’t built to stay in one lane. After we took the company private, I walked away from a secure future because I didn’t want to tell my young daughter that her dad was a one-trick pony. That wasn’t the story I was here to write.

So I stepped out—with no shortage of fire, a non-compete over my head, and a deep conviction that I was just getting started. I had short but formative stints with two iconic brands, helped launch several startups (including two belonging to my wife), and ultimately found the right partner to build a business with.

Zenflight is a reflection of everything I’ve learned—and everything I believe in. We operate with precision, move with purpose, and serve people who expect the best. When our managed aircraft aren't flying their owners, we charter them to a select client base. For everything else, we run a high-touch brokerage business that puts transparency and excellence first.

Outside of work, I’m a husband to the most brilliant woman I know, and a father to two fearless girls who keep me grounded and inspired. Travel is in our blood—we’ve made the world our classroom, our playground, and our office. That global perspective is one of my greatest assets, and it’s deeply shaped the way I lead.

I have big goals—for my family, for Zenflight, and for the mark we’re here to leave.

Enrich person: Dimitrios Kostopoulos, DPT, MD, PHD, DSc, ECS
Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
Dr. Dimitrios Kostopoulos is a Board-Certified Clinical Electrophysiology Specialist with over 38 years of clinical experience and more than 30 years in electrodiagnostic testing. He is among a select group of specialists who hold a Doctorate of Science (DSc) in Clinical Electrophysiology Testing, ECS board certification, and laboratory accreditation with exemplary status by ACEWM (Academy of Clinical Electrophysiology & Wound Management)

Dr. Kostopoulos also serves as the Residency Director for Hands-On Diagnostics’ Clinical Electrophysiology program, training the next generation of specialists in advanced diagnostic techniques.

A world-renowned expert and best-selling author in Myofascial Pain and Business Development, Dr. Kostopoulos is the co-founder of Hands-On Companies, established in 1992. The organization has treated over 300,000 patients, performed more than 120,000 diagnostic tests, and educated over 100,000 healthcare professionals worldwide. Dr. Kostopoulos has taught extensively in manual therapy, with a focus on Trigger Point, Myofascial, NeuroFascial Therapy, Manipulation and Diagnostic Testing.

Dr. Kostopoulos holds four doctorate degrees, including a PhD and Master’s from New York University, a Doctorate of Science (DSc) from Rocky Mountain University in Clinical Electrodiagnosis, an MD from UHSA School of Medicine, and a DPT from Evidence in Motion.

He is a past Clinical Affiliate Assistant Professor at Florida Atlantic University, a former member of SACE for the electrophysiology board exam, and a previous Executive Committee member of the Academy of Clinical Electrophysiology and Wound Management (APTA). Additionally, he has served as Adjunct Faculty at Springfield College, teaching Clinical Electrophysiology.

Dr. Kostopoulos is the Editor of the Diagnostic Section for the Journal of Bodywork and Movement Therapies, published by Elsevier, and has authored numerous publications. Recognized with multiple business and humanitarian awards, his work continues to influence both clinical and professional practice globally.

Description (2):
Established in 1992, the Hands-On Companies and our sister company, PhysioCare Physical Therapy, are the leading authorities in the areas of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation in Queens-Astoria, NY. With state-of-the-art physical therapy centers, physical therapy equipment, and highly specialized Physical Therapy Professionals, we offer your answers to today’s health problems.
Why We are Different:
Unfortunately, not all physical therapy providers have the same qualifications, training, and professional expertise. Individuals who do not specialize in the discipline of physical therapy may cause more harm than good.
We are different because:
In our physical therapy centers in Queens-Astoria, NY, all of our physical therapy specialists and assisting staff is highly qualified clinicians with many years of experience and solid credentials.
We practice Hands-On therapies that we have developed through continuous research studies. The different physical therapy modalities, such as Electrotherapy, Ultrasound, Hydrocollator, etc., are only a small portion of the physio care a patient receives in our physical therapy centers. We emphasize on Hands-On Manual Therapy, Trigger Point Therapy, Myofascial Physical Therapy, Manipulation, Expert Guidance and Individualized Physical Therapy Exercises that the physical therapist provides in one-to-one sessions.
Our physical therapy centers are equipped with state-of-the-art physical therapy equipment and we also perform Electromyography (EMG) and Nerve Conduction Studies (NCS).
Many of our patients who have been injured in a work accident or a car accident need accurate documentation for their doctors, attorneys and insurance carriers. We have a highly sophisticated computerized system that provides us with a report of your status in just a few minutes.
Striving to provide you with highly personalized care, a Patient Care Coordinator will ensure that you are satisfied with all of our physical therapy programs.

Description: The mind is everything. What you think, you become.
Title: Assistant General Manager
Summary: To pursue a challenging and rewarding career in a dynamic organization, it will offer me with excellent work experience, development skills in a highly competitive environment, so that I can grow professional and prove myself for the concern.	The incumbent would be overall responsible for production, planning, coordination & operation of a  knitting factory.
Address - Locations: 2- Ishaka Avenue, Sector-6, Uttara, Dhaka, Uttara, Dhaka 1230, BD
Description (2):
In olden times dating back to late sixties of the last century during the erstwhile Pakistan period the ancestors of the present Directors of the Group started trading & contractual business on a small scale at their native district Rajshahi situated at the northern part of Bangladesh. After the emergence of Bangladesh the businesses flourished a little under the banner of Aman Trading Corporation. But it was in the late 1980s that the businesses in trading through importing various consumer items and their marketing started witnessing a steady growth in the business. At some point in the mid 1980s the Group think tank felt that mere trading business and earning wealth through that activity may bring prosperity to individuals of the family only. But as a well placed family in the society the social obligation to the poor rural mass for doing something for their economic upliftment was pricking their conscience. This greatly influenced to think about ventures where investment can generate employment for the rural mass whatever may be the size of generated employment. At the first instance some agro-based industries were thought of. This led to establishment of cold storages in the northern Bangladesh. This further continued with the establishment of a cement grinding industry. At the advent of 21st century formation of a Group with the trading houses, contractual firms working individually under the banner of Aman Trading Corporation & few industries like cold storages & one cement-grinding mill with a corporate character was completed. With the sharp changes in the socio-economic situation of the country the Group vowed to tap the prevailing scopes for establishment of industries. At the same time Group realized that in order to expedite the works of establishment of medium and large-scale industries, availing the facilities offered by the Government and for easier correspondences with the agencies of theirs as well as to avail quick banking facilities the shifting of the Corporate Office from Rajshahi to capital city Dhaka was unavoidable. The Group therefore decided to participate in the process of industrialization in the places wherefrom marketing, transportation would be easier, generation of income & employment will be evident and in doing so shall pay taxes to the Government. With this end in view the Group in the year 2004 housed a miniature Registered Office in Motijheel Commercial Area leaving behind a strong Regional Office at Rajshahi to look after the existing industries activities there. In the year 2007' the Group housed its Corporate Office at Uttara Model Town for controlling the entire activities of the business & industrial units including the Registered at Motijheel & the Regional Office at Dhaka.

VISION
"To be a leader in fulfilling Country's basic needs through industrialization with total quality"

MISSION
"Our mission is to establish labor intensive industries blending the latest technologies upholding ownership by the employees along with conservation of environment with precise commitment to the society and contribute substantially to GDP through sustainable growth"
Headline: Assistant General Manager(Knitting) at Amantex Ltd.

Whitney Rowell is the Founder & CEO of Miracle Mama, a modern wellness brand on a mission to give mamas everywhere a boost — starting with its hero product, Miracle Milkookies. After navigating her own postpartum challenges, she baked her first batch of lactation cookies in her kitchen. What began as a grassroots solution to support milk supply has grown into a nationally loved brand, helping hundreds of thousands of moms feel nourished and supported.

Today, Whitney leads the brand’s overall strategy, product innovation, and community growth. With expansion into Amazon, retail, and hospital systems nationwide, Miracle Mama is redefining the postpartum experience. Whitney is also the founder of Collective Thirty One, an invite-only network for female founders, and the host of the Message from Mom podcast — amplifying the voices and stories of modern motherhood.

What began with a cult-favorite lactation cookie has grown into a full product line designed to support women through every hormonally intense stage of life, from first period to pregnancy, postpartum, and perimenopause.

We create clean, craveable cookies made with purposeful ingredients that nourish her through each chapter—physically, emotionally, and hormonally. Our hero product, Miracle Milkookies, remains at the heart of our brand, but it’s just the beginning. Our mission is simple:
To give women the boost they need- when they need it most.

Description: Commenting on tech, geopolitics, and finance—exploring how innovation, history, and power shape the future.
Title: Founder and CEO
Summary:
Dr. Agha is one of the foremost experts in robotic autonomy and physical AI for complex off-road and industrial environments. He is the co-founder and CEO of Field AI, a company dedicated to advancing next-generation autonomy and Robotics AI.

Prior to founding Field AI, Dr. Agha was a leading figure at NASA JPL, where he served as Principal Investigator (PI) for several of the nation’s flagship autonomy programs. These included the DARPA Subterranean Challenge, DARPA RACER (self-driving off-road cars), NASA’s Autonomous Mars Cave Exploration, and the Coordinated Autonomy for the prototype Mars Helicopter-Rover. He also led the CoSTAR team (JPL-MIT-Caltech-KAIST-LTU), guiding efforts that won the 2020 DARPA Subterranean Challenge, focused on navigating complex urban and industrial environments. He also developed multi-robot systems composed of heterogeneous teams—including walking robots, wheeled rovers, and flying drones—that autonomously coordinated with each other and were deployed in various NASA, DARPA, and commercial/industrial missions.

Dr. Agha’s work has earned global recognition and accolades, with over 200 scientific publications and patents, as well as several best paper awards. Over his career, he has won and managed hundreds of millions in federal grants, industry, and institutional funding, both as a PI and Co-I prior to Field AI, and now as CEO, driving innovative autonomy solutions. He has also successfully led and managed teams of over 100 members to deliver cutting-edge results.

Currently, Dr. Agha leads Field AI, advancing robotic autonomy and embodied AI. Previously, he served as Group Leader of the Robotic Aerial Mobility group at NASA JPL (whose members contributed to the first Mars Helicopter mission) and as a PI at the Center for Autonomous Systems and Technologies (CAST) at Caltech. He also helped establish Qualcomm’s Autonomy division, developing self-flying drones and autonomous vehicles, and conducted research at MIT on multi-agent planning and learning under uncertainty for autonomous package delivery.

Passionate about translating scientific breakthroughs into impactful products, Dr. Agha advises policymakers and executives on the practical real-world deployment of emerging robotic AI technologies. Dr. Agha is always on the lookout to hire people who share the passion of working on cutting-edge AI and robotics.
Description (2): FieldAI is pioneering the development of a field-proven, hardware agnostic brain technology that enables many different types of robots to operate autonomously in hazardous, offroad, and potentially harsh industrial settings – all without GPS, maps, or any pre-programmed routes.
Headline: CEO / Field AI / Offroad Autonomy

Description: Serial founder (Dynamic Signal, Firstup, now building new start-up Larridin) | Early exec @ comScore & Adify | Scottsdale based 🌵
Title: Co-Founder & President
Summary:
With more than 30 years at the intersection of data, technology, and human behavior, I’ve helped build and scale startups through acquisitions, mergers, and IPOs. As Co‑Founder and President of Larridin, my mission is to empower organizations with AI‑driven clarity and impact—making every investment in AI measurable, governable, and aligned with business outcomes.

At Larridin, we believe organizations cannot manage what they can’t see, govern what they can’t control, or measure what they can’t understand. That’s why our platform brings together three core pillars:

- Scout: Instantly discover and map every AI tool across your organization—from sanctioned enterprise platforms to “shadow AI”—providing real‑time visibility, usage insights, security risk detection, and compliance gap alerts.

- Nexus: A unified hub that transforms all employees into confident AI users. Nexus centralizes safe access to approved LLMs, curated prompts, agentic workflows, and governance controls so leaders can foster innovation without sacrifice.

- Vantage: Translate AI activity into measurable impact—benchmarking productivity, ROI, and risk reduction across teams and tools.

My focus is always customer-first: I align product strategy with evolving needs to ensure AI actually delivers value. I’m proud to partner with a passionate team of innovators and friends, building a platform that transforms how companies operate and thrive in the AI‑driven era.
Description (2):
Larridin is building the measurement and enablement layer for enterprise AI—helping organizations unlock literacy, engagement, and ROI from their AI investments.

Most enterprises struggle to bridge the gap between AI experimentation and true business impact. Larridin solves this by giving leaders and employees the visibility, guidance, and tools to use AI effectively and responsibly.

 Scout provides continuous measurement of AI usage across the enterprise. It shows which tools are being used, by whom, and for what purpose—turning shadow AI into actionable insights. Leaders can benchmark adoption, understand engagement patterns, and ensure usage aligns with business goals.

 Nexus is the enablement hub that empowers employees with approved AI apps, enterprise data access, and prompt libraries. It drives safe, confident adoption by making AI easy to use while embedding the necessary governance and guardrails.

Together, Scout and Nexus help organizations accelerate AI literacy, increase employee engagement, and realize measurable ROI—while maintaining the compliance and oversight enterprises require.

Backed by a $17 million Series A led by Andreessen Horowitz, with participation from Bloomberg Beta, Gradient, Haystack, Homebrew, and others, Larridin is shaping how Global 2000 enterprises scale AI adoption and productivity.

Join us in building the future of AI Execution Intelligence.
Headline: Co-Founder & President Larridin | Measure AI Usage, Proficiency, and Impact | Quantify how AI is transforming work—tracking adoption, proficiency, and ROI with compliance built in.

Description: ceo, finternet labs @finternet_org
Title: CEO, Finternet Lab; Co-Creator, Finternet
Summary:
Siddharth Shetty is the CEO of Finternet Labs, where he leads the development of the Finternet—a global financial internet built on the principles of openness, privacy, and interoperability. The Finternet is a foundational architecture that enables individuals and institutions to unify, verify, and transact financial assets seamlessly across jurisdictions. It leverages consent-driven protocols, privacy-preserving technologies, and open standards to support financial innovation while maintaining regulatory alignment and user sovereignty.

At the heart of Siddharth’s mission is the belief that data and financial rights are core enablers of economic opportunity. Finternet Labs represents his commitment to scaling inclusive, programmable financial infrastructure that can serve as a public good—bridging national systems and catalyzing participation in the global economy.

Before founding Finternet Labs, Siddharth co-founded Sahamati, where he served as Chief Technology Officer and was instrumental in building India’s Account Aggregator (AA) framework. This pioneering system for consent-based data exchange has been widely adopted by banks, fintechs, and regulators, and now serves as a blueprint for open finance across emerging markets.

He is also the Co-Founder of Networks for Humanity (NFH), a global initiative dedicated to co-creating population-scale digital ecosystems that uphold individual agency and democratic values. NFH operates across Asia, Africa, and Latin America, working with regulators, technologists, and development institutions to deploy trusted digital infrastructure.

Siddharth has advised the Ministry of Finance, Government of India, and engaged in international dialogues on Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI), digital identity, open data, and cross-border interoperability. His DPI-related work focuses on the techno-legal-operating stacks needed to deploy digital systems at scale—safely and inclusively.
Description (2):
The Finternet aims to enable multiple ecosystems to interconnect, much like the internet, thus empowering 8+ billion individuals and 300+ million businesses by placing them at the centre of their financial lives.

In today’s world, the transactability of assets is siloed across multiple purpose-specific infrastructures. The Finternet aims to architect universal infrastructure that’s interoperable unifies multiple assets, and supports multiple use cases to usher in low-cost, high-volume, and high-trust transactions!
Headline: CEO, Finternet Labs

Title: Managing Broker
Summary:
You can buy a home and pay $0 a month to live there. Sounds too good to be true? It’s not—let me show you how.

At HouseHack Seattle, we’re all about helping you create wealth through smart, creative real estate strategies. Real estate is still one of the best ways to build long-term, generational wealth, and we’ve mastered a few strategies that can help you get there faster.

 Here’s what we focus on:

HouseHacking Buy a property with extra bedrooms or units, live in one, and rent the rest. The rent covers your mortgage and expenses, so you live for free. With down payments as low as $20k, this strategy helped my wife, Jess, and me reach a $2 million net worth before we turned 30. It’s a game-changer!

 Short-Term Rentals (Airbnb) Short-term rentals are one of the hottest trends in real estate right now. With travel booming and Airbnb loans available with as little as 10% down, investing in vacation rentals can bring in big cash flow. Imagine owning multiple vacation homes that generate income while you sleep. It’s not just a dream—it’s something we help our clients do every day

 Long-Term Rentals Even with changing market conditions, long-term rentals are still a great way to build passive income. And we’re not just doing the basics—we specialize in adding value through ADUs, DADUs, rehabs, and tiny homes to give you above-average returns

 BRRRR Strategy Buy, Renovate, Rent, Refinance, Repeat. This strategy lets you recycle your money and acquire multiple properties while other investors are still working on their first one. We’ve used this strategy to scale our portfolio, and we help our clients do the same

 Off-Market Deals In today’s competitive market, we leave no stone unturned. We work directly with sellers, through mail and calls, to find off-market deals that others miss. If you’re looking for the best opportunities, we’ve got you covered

HouseHack Seattle isn’t just a real estate agency—we’re active investors, house hackers, and passionate about what we do. Jess and I have personally completed four house hacks and own 5 long-term rentals and 5 short-term rentals.
Every member of our team has lived and breathed these strategies, so we know what works.

Real estate has given us the freedom to live life on our own terms, and we want to help you do the same. If you’re ready to build wealth through real estate, we’re here to guide you every step of the way.

 LINKS

 http://meetup.com/house-hack-seattle/

 https://househackseattle.com/

It stitches together metadata from various sources (Snowflake, dbt, Databricks, Looker, Tableau, Postgres, etc.) to create a unified data discovery, cataloging, lineage, and governance experience across all your data assets, from columns and queries to metrics and dashboards. Atlan facilitates a two-way movement of metadata, bringing context back into the tools and workflows that your data team uses every day — for example, in your BI tool when you wonder what a metric on the dashboard means.

A pioneer in the space, Atlan has been named a Visionary in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data and Analytics Governance Platforms and a Leader and the only Customer Favorite in The Forrester Wave: Data Governance Solutions, Q3 2025. Atlan was also recognized by Gartner seven times in 2021, including as a Cool Vendor in DataOps and in the inaugural Market Guide for Active Metadata Management. Today, we power data democratization and AI-readiness at companies like General Motors, Cisco, Autodesk, Unilever, Ralph Lauren, FOX, News Corp, Nasdaq, NextGen, Plaid, and HubSpot. We recently raised a $105M Series C, backed by top investors including GIC, Insight Partners, Sequoia Capital India, and Salesforce Ventures.

For more information, visit http://www.atlan.com/ or follow us on Twitter at AtlanHQ.
Headline: CFO @ Atlan - Home for Data teams

Title: Enterprise Sales GTM School Lecturer
Summary:
I'm on a mission to revolutionize B2B sales through AI-accelerated coaching that improves sales teams in just 90 days - guaranteed.

For 15+ years, I’ve been in sales as a coach, seller, sales leader, and advisor to companies like HPE, Adobe, Exelon, Citigroup, and many high-growth startups, and PE-backed companies.

Over time, I've seen sales organizations struggle because of reliance on traditional approaches—annual training events, static playbooks, and overwhelmed managers - that fail to create lasting behavior change.

Which is why I founded Dana Consulting to change the sales industry from the inside out.

We transform sales teams by combining two proven elements:

High Performance Culture: Elite athletes and other top performers excel through daily practice, specialized coaching, and data-driven feedback. We apply these same principles to sales teams, creating systems that convert raw talent into consistent excellence.

AI Performance Acceleration Like elite athletes using technology to enhance training, we leverage AI to amplify coaching impact. Our systems provide real-time guidance and handle administrative work, letting your team focus on high-impact customer conversations.

By combining science-backed performance principles with AI acceleration, we help clients transform their sales culture and achieve breakthrough results in just 90 days - reducing ramp time, increasing win rates, and boosting overall sales productivity.

Ready to revolutionize your sales approach? Let's connect and explore how we can drive your business forward.
Location Name: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
Address - Locations: 179 Court Street, Brooklyn, New York 11201, US
Description (2):
Dana, the Sanskrit word for generosity, is a practice not typically associated with business transactions.  Indeed, most people view sales as a necessary evil, bordering on manipulation, if not outright dishonesty.  We therefore tend to avoid sales situations at all costs, hoping that the best products or services will naturally sell themselves.  Sales courses are also absent from most accredited business school curricula.

But entrepreneurs cannot afford to ignore sales.  Revenue is the only metric that truly matters.  And the best businesses succeed not by ruthless taking, but by consistently delivering value to their customers.

Dana was created to change the perception of sales and arm entrepreneurs with the knowledge and skills they need to grow their business. We believe that all entrepreneurs deserve access to high-quality advisors who can help them navigate the complexities of starting and growing a business. Strategic consulting services should not be limited to established corporations, or the lucky few who can be guided by experienced investors.  This is especially true for demand generation and sales, the lifeblood of any successful business.  Our network of advisors will help you build a customized sales plan to attract and retain your ideal customers.  We do so in the spirit of generosity, and a commitment to delivering value.
Headline: Founder & CEO at Dana Consulting | Pioneering Superintelligent Sales | AI-Powered B2B Sales Transformation | Author of the Superintelligent Sales Blog

I'm passionate about empowering startups to reach their full potential. Having witnessed firsthand the transformative power of technology, I founded Zero To One Strategic with a clear mission: to help innovative startups and high-growth scaleups secure the funding they need to make a lasting impact.

I am also an Entrepreneur in Residence at NEXT Canada, where I mentor and support aspiring entrepreneurs in launching their own high-impact ventures. I am always looking for disruptive projects and exceptional people who share my vision and values.

Each year, millions in government incentives go unclaimed by Canadian businesses. Not because the funding isn’t available, but because accessing it is complex, misunderstood, mismanaged and not always considered as part of the broader funding puzzle.

At Zero to One Strategic we are experts in all forms of non-dilutive funding and we work with our clients to maximize their R&D investments through clear and compelling tax credit (SR&ED) claims, grant knowledge and support, government loans and more.

We are disrupting the non-dilutive funding space as a result of our innovative, tech-enabled approach. Businesses often leave substantial money on the table due to conservative claims or a lack of deep technical understanding.

Our team consistently delivers up to 10x more funding with a 99%+ success rate on SR&ED claims. Get in touch to learn more!

Title: Senior Trial Attorney
Summary:
Every law is an infraction of liberty.
-Jeremy Bentham
Address - Locations: P.O. Box 1151, Lake Worth, FL 33460, US
Description (2):
The Human Rights Defense Center is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that advocates on behalf of the human rights of people held in U.S. detention facilities. This includes people in state and federal prisons, local jails, immigration detention centers, civil commitment facilities, Bureau of Indian Affairs jails, juvenile facilities and military prisons. HRDC is one of the few national opponents to the private prison industry and is the foremost advocate on behalf of the free speech rights of publishers to communicate with prisoners and the right of prisoners to receive publications and communications from outside sources. HRDC also does significant work around government transparency and accountability issues by filing and litigating public records and Freedom of Information Act requests at the state and federal levels.

HRDC's advocacy efforts include publishing Prison Legal News, a monthly publication that covers criminal justice-related news and litigation nationwide. HRDC publishes and distributes self-help reference books for prisoners, and engages in litigation, media campaigns and outreach, public speaking and education, and testimony before legislative and regulatory bodies. HRDC also maintains separate websites for Prison Legal News and the Prison Phone Justice campaign.

https://www.prisonlegalnews.org/
https://www.prisonphonejustice.org/

HRDC is financially supported by individual donations, earned revenue, foundation grants, and subscription and advertising income. Donations to HRDC are tax deductible to the extent permitted by the IRS.

Please visit our websites for more information. Thank you for your interest in the Human Rights Defense Center!
Headline: Counselor and Trial Attorney

Title: Chief Operations Officer
Summary:
Industry veteran Gina Nigrelli-Smith spent years immersed in the multi-faceted fashion scene. Working in a myriad of positions including roles as both visual merchandiser and editor, she came to recognize a gap in the contemporary jewelry market where both quality and value play an equal part. After traveling the country opening and merchandising stores for Diesel, Nigrelli-Smith found herself on a mission to create an elevated, quality product. One year later, Gina founded Jules Smith.

With a distinguished career spanning multiple facets of the fashion industry, Gina Nigrelli-Smith brings a wealth of experience and strategic vision to her role as Chief Operating Officer at BROdenim. Her journey from visual merchandiser to editor, and ultimately to founder of Jules Smith and COO, exemplifies her comprehensive understanding of the fashion ecosystem and her ability to drive operational excellence.
Nigrelli-Smith's career began with high-profile projects, including opening and merchandising stores nationwide for Diesel, where she honed her skills in retail operations and brand development. As a visionary leader, Nigrelli-Smith has consistently demonstrated an innate talent for forecasting fashion trends, resulting in innovative product assortments that resonate with diverse consumer segments.

In her current role as COO, Nigrelli-Smith oversees all operational aspects of the business, from supply chain management to retail operations, ensuring seamless execution of the company's strategic vision. Her hands-on experience as a founder, combined with her deep industry knowledge, enables her to optimize processes, drive growth, and maintain the brand's position at the forefront of the fashion industry.

Gina is married and a mother of 2 children, Nico and Ruby and lives in Austin, Texas.
Headline: Founder I CEO I COO I Mom of 2

Title: Series B Investor
Summary:
I am a native and proud Tennessean but left the state 30 years ago to accomplish my educational and career goals. As a successful media, software, technology, and e-commerce executive, I lived in Atlanta, NY, Chicago, SF, LA, Europe, and Asia before returning home.

Nashville has grown into a world-class city and arguably has more momentum than any city in the country. I’m thrilled to bring my experience and passion back to TN, develop my executive coaching consultancy, and give back to those who want to grow, develop, and accelerate business results. I specialize in:

•	Helping established CEOs and business owners evolve and prosper in Nashville’s golden age because those who don’t understand the new heightened level of global competition will not survive.
•	Helping the influx of executives from all over the world get their businesses going in a Southern town with its nuances and unique culture.

After experiencing the height of my financial success when I was a Vistage member, I knew I wanted to partner with Vistage and launch a CEO peer advisory group in Nashville to help local leaders navigate and prosper in a technology-driven, global economy. My group of unbiased, non-competitive peers meets monthly to share business challenges, problem solve, gain a fresh perspective, and embrace new ways of operating.

The selection criteria are rigorous and include personality and demographic factors. If you are interested in my Vistage experience and would like to learn if you qualify to be a part of this elite group of leaders, please message me on LinkedIn or  Scott.Morrow@VistageChair.com.
Headline: Vistage Chair | CEO, Entrepreneur, Coach | Accelerating the success of Nashville’s top business leaders

CoStar Group (NASDAQ: CSGP) is a global leader in commercial real estate information, analytics, online marketplaces and 3D digital twin technology. Founded in 1986, CoStar Group is dedicated to digitizing the world’s real estate, empowering all people to discover properties, insights, and connections that improve their businesses and lives.


CoStar Group’s major brands include CoStar, a leading global provider of commercial real estate data, analytics, and news; LoopNet, the most trafficked commercial real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the leading platform for apartment rentals; and Homes.com, the fastest-growing residential real estate marketplace. CoStar Group’s industry-leading brands also include Matterport, a leading spatial data company whose platform turns buildings into data to make every space more valuable and accessible, STR, a global leader in hospitality data and benchmarking, Ten-X, an online platform for commercial real estate auctions and negotiated bids, OnTheMarket, a leading residential property portal in the United Kingdom, and Domain, a leading property technology and services marketplace in Australia.


CoStar Group’s websites attracted over 111 million average monthly unique visitors in the second quarter of 2025, serving clients around the world. Headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, CoStar Group is committed to transforming the real estate industry through innovative technology and comprehensive market intelligence. From time to time, we plan to utilize our corporate website as a channel of distribution for material company information. For more information, visit CoStarGroup.com.

Formerly a trained chef, author, and podcast host, he began his career cooking for celebrities in Los Angeles before moving into foodservice management, where he specialized in designing menus and kitchens for eating disorder recovery programs. Those early experiences paved the way for his transition to Restaurantware, where he took on the challenge of developing more eco-friendly products—combining his passions for sustainability, creative problem-solving, and foodservice.

As CSO, Michael has led the company’s sustainability transformation—including learning firsthand how to build and launch a foundation from the ground up. This work now drives Restaurantware’s environmental initiatives and partnerships.


Michael was raised to believe in leaving everything better than he found it—and that includes this beautiful, blue marble we all call home.

I solve a problem most companies don't even realize they have: they treat people strategy and business operations as separate functions, when they are really two sides of the same coin.

For 12+ years, I have built and scaled organizations by understanding that hiring the right people, deploying them effectively, creating a structure where they can thrive, and optimizing their utilization does not belong to any one group or department.  Rather, it is the core of business performance.

My approach is different because:
--I serve as fractional Operations Leader and CPO for clients, which means I see how people strategy and operations must work together to drive growth.
--I forecast revenue budgets, own career ladders, and sit on executive teams because talent strategy IS business strategy.
--I have experience as a system SME and I build reporting dashboards that connect recruiting metrics to business performance.

Description (2):
Subset is an essential innerwear brand that is sustainable from the start, on a mission to make organic cotton your daily default. Offering certified organic cotton underwear, lounge apparel, maternity and accessories, the brand’s base layers for men and women are designed to enhance your everyday life.

Dedicated to protecting both the planet and its people, Subset is committed to sustainable practices from farm to factory, with certifications including GOTS, Oeko-Tex, Fair Trade Certified, and FSC. Subset maintains that all products are free from heavy metals, carcinogens, PFAs, and VOCs, ensuring the utmost safety for the body and the planet.

Taking responsibility for the full lifecycle of its products, the brand created the world's first intimates Recycling Program to divert textile waste from landfill. Having recycled over one million items since its inception, Subset has downcycled used bras, undergarments, socks and hosiery into secondary uses like furniture batting and carpet pads. With sustainability at the forefront of the brand’s strategy, Subset is thrilled to introduce fiber-to-fiber outcomes for its returned inventory for a fully circular supply chain.

Title: CEO
Summary:
The Founder of Citygreen Systems, and designer of the Stratacell and Stratavault systems, Ben Gooden believes that cities without an urban forest (or, cities with stunted, underperforming trees) are awful, barren places.

In order to thrive, mankind needs trees in urban spaces. But, trees have always battled to survive in cities, with no economically or arboriculturally viable solution. The problem was clear. And, determined to make a difference, Ben founded Citygreen to solve it.

Today, his vision remains powerfully simple: a world where sustainable green space is within the reach of every person, every day – and natural resources are utilized (not wasted) for the benefit of mankind and measurable environmental impacts.

From his dedication to research and development, and hands-on experience in the field, comes a firm belief that there are ways of successfully harnessing, filtering, and storing our scarce water resources close to the source, providing means to make our cities greener and more liveable.

Informed by this belief and Ben’s natural inclination for problem solving, Citygreen offers engineered green building systems to improve urban planting success and increase forest canopy in urban areas. These solutions are best practice in their field and endorsed by professional organisations around the globe, putting Citygreen at the cutting edge of sustainable tree pit solutions for cities.

For more information, visit Citygreen at www.citygreen.com.

Book a time to chat: https://calendly.com/ben-gooden/15min/06-07-2017

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
I’m a problem-solver at heart, energized by challenges that seem impossible to overcome. As CEO of Advanced Monitoring Services (AMS), I lead a company that's redefining what reliability, trust, and purpose look like in neurodiagnostics and intraoperative monitoring. We serve patients and physicians with a simple but powerful commitment: Deliver WOW. We understand that it's what we bring after our best that moves the needle.

Over the past several years, I’ve helped AMS grow exponentially—not just in revenue and reach, but in mission. We’ve built a team of incredible people who believe in doing things the right way, who hustle with heart, and who are relentless in delivering on our promises. We’re driven by data, but we’re powered by people.

I'm passionate about scaling with integrity, solving complex healthcare challenges, and building systems that serve patients, physicians, and hospitals. My approach blends strategy and empathy, faith and execution. We run on EOS, we hire for character and drive, and we measure our impact by lives changed, not just margins.

Outside of AMS, I’m a husband, dad, and believer who’s always thinking about how to multiply love and purpose in the world. Whether it’s mentoring leaders, investing in high-potential businesses, or empowering my family to thrive, I believe in using whatever I’ve been given to help others become more than they thought possible.
Address - Locations: 3497 Wagon Wheel Rd, Springdale, Arkansas 72762, US
Description (2):
Founded in 2006, Advanced Monitoring Services (AMS) is a trusted partner in delivering comprehensive neurodiagnostic care — from the operating room to the patient’s home.

We provide both Intraoperative Neuromonitoring (IONM) and EEG services, including Ambulatory EEG (AEEG), which allows patients to complete testing comfortably in their own homes. Our experienced technologists, interpreting physicians, and support teamwork hand-in-hand with surgeons, neurologists, and hospitals to deliver reliable, high-quality data that informs patient care.

At AMS, our mission is simple yet vital: to safeguard and improve neurological health. In the operating room, our neuromonitoring specialists and state-of-the-art equipment provide real-time feedback to the surgical team, helping protect the spinal cord and neural pathways during complex procedures. Outside the hospital, our AEEG and EEG services provide critical insights into brain function, supporting the diagnosis and management of a wide range of neurological conditions.

We are proud to serve as an extension of our partners’ teams, delivering consistent communication, trusted results, and the highest level of care to every patient. Whether we’re supporting surgeons in the OR or patients in their living rooms, AMS remains committed to one purpose: protecting and improving lives through excellence in neurodiagnostics.
Headline: CEO | CNIM | Building a People-First, Mission-Driven Healthcare Company where Operational Excellence Meets Uncommon Compassion

The martech industry is broken, and I’m devoting the next 15 years of my life to fix it.

After a decade leading growth and marketing teams at places like Dropbox, Pilot, Magento and BILL, I realized there was no measurement tool on the market that was statistically valid, simple and holistic.

So I went and talked to every CMO and VP of marketing in my network. Their number one complaint? Attribution.

And this is why we built Paramark.

Because I believe that measuring your marketing efforts is not that hard.

Through the power of MMM, experimentation and data science, we’ve created the holy grail of measurement tools. So marketers like you can confidently understand the impact of your marketing investments – and communicate them to your CFO and CEO.

Learn our method at Paramark.com.

Title: Co-Founder & CEO
Summary:
I'm the CEO and Co-Founder of Finley, where we’re building the operating system for modern debt capital. Finley helps high-growth companies and their lenders manage credit facilities with the same precision and scale as equity financing - streamlining everything from covenant compliance to reporting and funding requests.

The idea for Finley came out of my time as a structured credit investor at Goldman Sachs’ Special Situations Group, where I saw firsthand how much time and risk were tied up in managing debt capital manually.

Even the most sophisticated borrowers and lenders relied on spreadsheets, legal docs, and email threads to handle hundreds of millions in credit. The inefficiencies weren’t just frustrating; they also introduced risk, slowed down deals, and limited transparency for all parties.

With Finley, we’re building the tools I wish we had back then on both sides of the table: software that helps lenders and borrowers manage corporate debt data, workflows, and analysis.

Earlier in my career, I was a consultant at Oliver Wyman, advising global institutions through the Financial Services and Education practices. That experience gave me a front-row seat to how critical systems transformation is in enabling innovation - especially in highly regulated, capital-intensive sectors.

I’m a proud graduate of The University of Texas at Austin - Hook’em Horns!  With a deep understanding of credit markets and enterprise software, I’m passionate about building infrastructure that makes capital more accessible, auditable, and intelligently deployed.

Let’s connect if you’re working in fintech, private credit, or enterprise SaaS, or rethinking the future of capital markets.
Address - Locations: 2 Mint Plaza, San Francisco, California 94103, US
Description (2): Finley's software simplifies debt capital management for banks and asset managers. By automating due diligence, ensuring compliance, and streamlining ongoing reporting, Finley helps ensure that capital is always available when companies need it. Finley's investors include CRV, Bain Capital Ventures, Y Combinator, Haystack, and Nine Four Ventures.
Headline: CEO @ Finley - The Operating System for Debt Capital | Modernizing Private Credit Infrastructure | Ex-Goldman Sachs

Description: Bradford Tax Institute clarifies your taxes so you can keep more of your money.
Title: President / Executive Editor
Summary:
Contact me today:  1-415-446-4340  |  mbradford@bradfordtaxinstitute.com

W. Murray Bradford, CPA, has more than 30 years' experience helping tax advisors, one-owner, and spouse-owned businesses reduce their income taxes. Mr. Bradford is the nation’s pre-eminent tax reduction expert, having demonstrated to over 500,000 one-owner businesses and self-employed professionals an average of $17,700 in new tax deductions.

Mr. Bradford’s CPA experience is anchored by eight years with the international accounting firm Price Waterhouse, where he enjoyed the elite distinction of being selected for two tours of duty in the firm’s Washington, D.C. national office. Among his impressive achievements, Mr. Bradford maintained a Top Instructor rating at the Becker CPA Review Course for 15 years.

He is the publisher of Tax Reduction Letter, a monthly tax-smart publication for the self-employed and author of numerous books and courses including his most current title, Murray Bradford's Tax Strategies for the Self-Employed  (2011), a comprehensive on-the-go tax course, published by Bradford and Company, Inc.

Mr. Bradford holds his active CPA licenses in Minnesota, California, and Washington, D.C. He is a member of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, the California Society of CPAs, the Minnesota Society of CPAs, and the Greater Washington, D.C. Society of CPAs.

He has helped the self-employed and one-owner business communities stay informed with appearances on many different media outlets, including: CBS News Nightwatch, Financial News Network, KCBS, KGO-TV, KGO-radio, WFAN, WABC-TV, Fox, NPR, and CNBC Mr. Bradford is also quoted in many publications, including: The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, Changing Times, Chicago Tribune, Money, Fortune, and USA Today.

Title: Co-Founder and Creative Director
Summary:
Back in 2008, I had a choice: stay in a stable job I no longer loved or take a leap into the unknown. Fueled by a mix of enthusiasm and just enough ignorance to be brave, I started my first video production company. It wasn’t easy — but through smart planning, solid partnerships, and a relentless “just do it” mindset, I helped grow that company into something truly special.

In 2016, everything changed. My son Henry was on the way, and I made the decision to step away from the business I built to be fully present at home. It was the best decision I’ve ever made.

Eventually, the pull of storytelling brought me back. But this time, I was clear on what I wanted: to create videos that serve a real purpose — reliable, repeatable, and most importantly, rooted in story.

Today, I’m the Co-Founder and Creative Director of All Story Films, where we craft unforgettable visual stories that help businesses connect with their audiences in meaningful ways. We don’t just make videos — we uncover the heart of your brand and bring it to life.

If you believe your brand has a story worth telling (hint: it does), let’s connect. I’d love to help you bring it to life in a way that people remember.

Summary:
Ashley Mills is a founder, strategist, and lifelong learner focused on the intersection of wellness and education. Drawing from her lived experience with ADHD and dyslexia, she’s exploring how creativity, cognitive science, and technology can come together to create more inclusive and effective ways to learn.

Previously, Ashley co-founded and served as Co-CEO of obé Fitness, a digital health and wellness platform built to help women discover the joy of daily movement. She scaled obé into a category-defining brand, leading strategic partnerships with companies like Disney, American Express, and Samsung. obé was acquired in 2025 by Dear Media.

Ashley began her career as a talent agent at Creative Artists Agency (CAA), where she worked with some of the most influential voices in media, packaging long-running unscripted series and helping shape the early landscape of lifestyle and personality-driven content.

She has been named one of Goldman Sachs’ “100 Most Intriguing Entrepreneurs,” honored as a Glamour Changemaker at the Women of the Year Awards, and led a company recognized by Fast Company as one of the Most Innovative Wellness Companies of 2022.
Headline: Entrepreneur | Product Leader I Former CAA Talent Agent

Title: Chief Marketing & Brand Officer
Summary:
Brittany is a leading brand strategist with a distinguished 15+ year career in PR and marketing, consistently holding senior-level strategy and division positions. Known for her unique ability to discern the potential of a product, new behavior, or emerging market, she excels at understanding the puzzle pieces required for success.

Most recently, Brittany made a significant leap into the startup world with IRCODE, a groundbreaking first-to-market technology set to transform real-world engagement through the power of visuals and digital footprints. This revolutionary technology is redefining shopping, experiences, and beyond, and she is at the forefront of this exciting venture.

Brittany's deep expertise lies in emerging media, the psychology of consumer decision-making, and reputation building. Her 360-degree perspective seamlessly integrates reputation management, customer pathways to conversion, breakthrough creative, and storytelling. Brittany's strategic vision and ability to anticipate market trends have positioned her as a thought leader and trusted advisor in the industry.

In the ever-evolving landscape of digital marketing, Brittany leverages trends such as personalized marketing, data-driven decision-making, and immersive experiences to drive brand growth and enhance customer engagement. She is adept at utilizing AI-driven insights and predictive analytics to craft targeted campaigns that resonate with audiences and deliver measurable results.

Brittany thrives in environments that demand strategic planning, innovative campaign execution, and insightful market analysis. Her dedication to delivering results that resonate and inspire has made her a key driver of brand growth and enhanced customer engagement.
Location Name: Los Angeles Metropolitan Area, United States
Description (2):
At IRCODE, we revolutionize how you interact with the visual world. Our cutting-edge image recognition technology transforms every image into a digital gateway, making the world more accessible through a simple scan with your camera. Imagine a world where every image, object, and video unlocks something amazing—a chance to learn, play, shop, or explore. Just scan with your camera phone, and IRCODE takes you to a digital destination.

Our mission is to revolutionize visual connections. We invite you to imagine a world where every visual element, from billboards to live-streamed content, comes to life. Say goodbye to QR codes—IRCODE is the future of seamless, engaging, and smart visual interaction. The image itself is now the code.

Powered by advanced computer vision and AI neural network technology, we revolutionize interactions across multiple industries, including advertising, real estate, healthcare, and education. With a simple scan, IRCODE enhances efficiency, improves user experiences, and transforms customer behavior in discovery and shopping. Built for the future of advertising, IRCODE makes every interaction meaningful and impactful.
Headline: Chief Marketing & Brand Officer @ IRCODE | Executive Brand Strategist and Tech Leader

$100M Blueprint is the podcast where entrepreneurial success meets real-world business lessons. Hosted by Jonathan Ferrari and Neil Cuggy, best friends and the founders of Goodfood. Launched in 2014, Goodfood has grown from a simple idea over coffee in Jonathan’s Montreal apartment to a Canada-wide direct-to-consumer meal brand delivering over 15 million meals annually.

From their humble beginnings to scaling the business to $150M+, Jon and Neil share what it really takes to build and grow a business into something massive, without compromising on values.

In each episode, they pull back the curtain on the journey of scaling Goodfood, the lessons they learned along the way, and the insight gained from running or co-owning 11 businesses worth over $290M. Expect honest stories, behind-the-scenes insights, and practical, no-BS advice from top-tier entrepreneurs and leaders who have scaled their businesses to $100M+ empires.

Both companies have been featured in The New York Times, and I was named in Entrepreneur's “50 Most Daring Entrepreneurs” and Forbes "30 under 30".

Description (2):
We help entrepreneurs form new teams and build AI-first startups. Apply on our website for $500k investment, up to $1M in free AI compute, and network of AI founders and researchers.

We bring together world-class engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs to create new companies together from scratch. From ideation to execution, we help generate ideas, find co-founders, secure pilot customers, integrate cutting-edge AI, and more. Our hands-on support guides founders through building, scaling, and raising millions in venture funding.

In 6 years, we've backed 40+ companies now valued at $1B+, raising $220M+ and creating 700+ jobs. Our startups are transforming industries: improving immigrant communication (Yoodli), accelerating cancer research (Ozette and Modulus), enhancing legal efficiency (Lexion, acquired by DocuSign), turning smartphones into medical devices (PreemptiveAI), and so much more.

Any VC can write a check, but what truly sets us apart is our unparalleled technical and AI expertise. With our heritage at the Allen Institute for AI—founded by Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen—we’ve been singularly focused on commercializing AI long before it became a buzzword. AI2 has 200+ PhDs, researchers, engineers, professors, and support staff—and is well known for its contributions to the A.I. research community including 600+ papers, 20+ best paper awards, and numerous products/open-source offerings including SemanticScholar, AllenNLP, and more. Our core team includes pioneers like Oren Etzioni, a leader in AI for over three decades, and our deep technical expertise means we don’t just back you financially—we help you build breakthrough products, navigate complex challenges, and accelerate your company’s growth.

We're soon launching AI House in Seattle, a central hub for AI innovation. In partnership with the Mayor of Seattle and supported by Washington state, this space will serve as a central hub for the region’s AI community.
Headline: 2x CEO, Managing Director @ AI2 Incubator, Founder of AI House

Description: CEO, Genius Academy | Activist | Mental Health Advocate | technologist
Title: CEO
Summary:
K. Rocco Shields is an internationally acclaimed and award-winning filmmaker, EdTech entrepreneur, and CEO of Genius Academy.  Over the past decade, she’s collaborated with top-tier universities to create a revolutionary immersive curriculum to heighten student engagement with experiential learning. This vision and foresight into the changing plane of online education birthed Genius Produced, the industry leader in creating unparalleled engaging ‘visual’ instructional design.. To her credit: Shields was recently named one of the Top 20 "Most Dynamic CEOS of 2021".

Recently, with mental health on the forefront of the news, she’s launched a revolutionary online e-learning media streaming platform, Genius Academy, which offers affordable access to dynamic experiential learning experiences: which are much needed by higher education in the rapid transition to the online format. These academically backed, media experiences are proven to increase competency development and improve mental health practice in the field. She hopes with this offering she will help to change the root of the mental health crisis and transform society.

Shields is involved with numerous educational programs and online institutions, including Noodle Partners,  Tulane University, SMU Cox School of Business, and 2U. Through her work on the feature film circuit, she has become heavily involved in the nonprofit world as well, partnering with organizations including The Matthew Shepard Foundation, The Tyler Clementi Foundation, and Boo2Bullying among others.

Rocco has been featured in over 100 news outlets, publications, and talk shows. She has lectured on the university and high school circuit in addition to a national press tour where she partnered with 30 non-profits in tandem with the release of her award-winning feature adaptation of “Love Is All You Need?”, where she screened the film with public demonstrations which generated an international debate on human rights and prejudice.

Rocco’s story and unique approach to filmmaking and media production has been profiled in prominent publications, including the Los Angeles Times, Upworthy, Buzzfeed, Authority Magazine, and the CEO Publication. She has also been honored to accept over two dozen filmmaking awards internationally. Rocco is perhaps most proud of the Certificate of Merit she received from the United States Congress for her work coupling cinematic arts and social change.
Description (2):
Combining the art of technology, ai, and the immersive art of Hollywood-style storytelling to make humans...more human.
Find out more at www.experiencegeniusacademy.com
Headline: CEO, Genius Academy | Transforming Education Through AI & Immersive Cinema | Award-Winning Storyteller & Social Innovator | Mental Health Advocate & Public Speaker

Title: Co-Founder and CEO at Deep Fission
Summary:
I believe that if we're going to successfully address our power needs, energy security, and climate change, we need nuclear power.

Yet nuclear power faces two big challenges: the "unsolved" nuclear waste problem, and the high cost of building nuclear power. I'm tackling these challenges with two companies - Deep Isolation that uses innovation to solve the nuclear waste problem, and Deep Fission, which can provide low cost nulcear power a mile underground using existing technology and standard (low-enriched) nuclear fuel.
Address - Locations: 2705 Webster Street Berkeley, PO Box 5985,, Berkeley, CA 94705, US
Description (2): At Deep Fission, we're reimagining nuclear power with a bold new approach: placing small modular reactors (SMRs) a mile underground for cheaper, faster, and more scalable deployment. Our mission is to power humanity from a mile underground. We want to leave the world a better place than we found it.
Headline: CEO Deep Fission. Founder, CEO, Board Director. Nuclear power and climate change. Entrepreneur. Inventor. Author. Dance instructor. YPO.

Description: Frequent Flyer | Secret keeper | CEO x2 | Kids x5 | personal opinions only - professional account @ZamnaLtd
Title: Speaker
Summary:
I’m an award-winning tech CEO, founder of four organisations, and a mother of five. My success comes from relentless persistence—and a long list of failures.

Here are five things I’ve majorly FAILED at:

Failed as a founder of three prior startups
Failed to get my PhD (to my parents’ disappointment)
Failed at 'family'—divorced single mum by 30
Failed at pitching VCs—800 NOs before my first YES funding Zamna
Failed to ask for help—was briefly homeless
These failures shaped me as a first-generation immigrant turned CEO and humanitarian. I share them in keynotes and workshops that inspire action, blending lessons from:

Leading Zamna, the AI company revolutionising global aviation
Founding Sunflower Relief, which raised £3M+ for life-saving aid in Ukraine
Balancing five kids while breaking barriers in male-dominated industries
Audiences leave moved and motivated. As one organiser put it: “Irra’s energy is unmatched—her story stays with you long after she’s off the stage.”

Want me to speak at your event? Get in touch: www.irraariellakhi.com
Represented by London Speaker Bureau:  https://lnkd.in/eJZKQSM8

Irra Ariella Khi is an award-winning CEO. Named Most Influential CEO 2024 and Private Equity Software CEO of the Year 2023, she’s also a winner of Pitch@Palace royal competition and one of Management Today’s ‘35 Women Under 35’. Irra has been selected as  ComputerWeekly’s ‘Most Influential Women in IT’ for 5 years in a row 2020-2025.

Recognised for her impact in tech, investment, and security, she’s secured UKBAA awards for Disruptive Tech and Female Founder Innovation—all while scaling a VC-backed company and raising five children.

Now, for the part where I have NOT failed (yet!).

As CEO of Zamna AI and Sunflower Relief, I lead two organisations leveraging data to transform aviation and humanitarian aid. With 20 years of experience in founding, financing, and scaling data-driven startups, I’ve built expertise in venture fundraising, identity verification, web3, and blockchain.

I believe in using data as a force for good—and I’m grateful to work with a diverse, talented team that shares this vision.
Location Name: London Area, United Kingdom, United Kingdom
Headline: Unforgettable speaker | Author | CEO | Patent holder x3 | Founder x4 | Mum x5 | London  Speaker Bureau  | All American Speakers  | Unique SA  | Raised UK’s biggest female seed round | Didn’t give up. Ever.

Title: Account Manager
Summary:
Hey there!

Little bit about me

I'm an 18 year old entrepreneur, that has always had the business mindset. Going into Spring 2020, my high school life turned on its head. Couldn't wait to go back to school after Spring Break, to be then told to stay home for 2 weeks, if we only knew what really was about to occur.

Without being in school, the possibilities were endless.

16 years old with absolutely all the time in the world. While most of my classmates used this time to just play video games and sleep, I used this time as an advantage to start learning this whole business thing.

From flipping sneakers, microwaves (ask me about this when we talk), and even more, there was nothing holding me back except the outside world.

17 year old me learned something -- everyone has a need for different problems to be solved and everyone is (hopefully) always looking for solutions. It's all about getting into the right conversations with the people who have the problems you fix.

With this realization, I got obsessed with attention/conversations. In today's world (without the outside world as much), how do we find these people and start the conversations?

That's what I immersed my self in.

At 18, I started Amplify Studios. An agency with a team with over 10+ years of experience (I was only 8 when they built their team ). Now, with all of the experience under both of our belts, there is nothing we cannot do.

Title: Founder and CEO
Summary:
When did you realize you couldn't fail, and what did it allow you to do? For me It came when I understood that failure wasn't when I was wrong, or stuck, but rather when I quit. This has helped me learn that decisions and actions only become mistakes when I choose not to learn from them. These two things in tandem have allowed me to speak my mind, pursue my passions, and learn more than I ever thought I was capable of.

I've found life in solving truly difficult problems that aim to leave the world better off. From keeping the skies safe at Boeing, revolutionizing energy at Tesla,  disrupting educational finance with Scholarship Junkies, and helping usher in a new era of transportation with Hyperloop. The harder, and more impactful the problem the more interesting.

Every day I aim to work on the world around us as much as I work on myself. When not exploring educational solutions with Scholarship Junkies, or tackling aerodynamic problems with UWashington Hyperloop, I pass the time by listening to and writing poetry, playing video games, and enjoying the time I have with friends and family.
Description (2): At Scholar Fund our mission is to help cultivate, maintain, and spread positive impact. Through technology we center community in an effort to understand needs and drive real-time scalable change. From education to financial services to non-profit growth, we pair technical solutions to community needs.
Headline: President & CEO at Scholar Fund
