Summary: Nick Jones is the VP of Clinical Flow Cytometry at Discovery Life Sciences and was previously the Director of Global Flow Cytometry & Immunoassay for NeoGenomics Laboratories.  Active in the field of flow cytometry assay development since 2000, Nick is responsible for establishing a world-class, global flow cytometry offering, servicing the pharmaceutical and biotech industry in  support of research, translational and clinical trial studies. In this role, he is responsible for the overall scientific conduct of Discovery Life Sciences clinical trials flow cytometry operations. As VP of Clinical Flow Cytometry, he provides consultation and guidance with clients to  design effective and scientifically appropriate validation procedures for customized solutions to support pharma development.
Description (2):
Discovery Life Sciences, the Biospecimen and Biomarker Specialists, is a leading provider of highly characterized human biospecimens and cellular starting materials integrated with expert multi-omic analytical services to advance cell and gene therapy and precision medicine programs for cancer, infectious disease, and other complex conditions.

Our robust biospecimen and biomarker platform is optimized for speed and large scale capacity. We routinely manage hundreds of studies and expertly test thousands of biospecimens simultaneously as a single vendor - eliminating time consuming and inefficient transfers of biospecimens or data between different vendors. We offer one of the largest recallable donor pools, Research Use Only (RUO) and clinical-grade (GMP) fresh and cryopreserved human cellular materials to support cell and gene therapy programs at any scale from start to finish.  Leading biopharma, diagnostic and academic institutions trust us to quickly deliver high-quality biospecimens and reliable, reproducible biomarker data, so they can outpace their competition and push the leading edge of innovation.

Visit www.dls.com to learn more
Headline: VP Operations - Clinical Flow Cytometry - Discovery Life Sciences

She has more than 20 years of experience as a financial executive in the areas of commercial finance, factoring, and business development. Rachel has a successful track record of working with hundreds of companies, from start-ups to high-growth companies to turnarounds, to increase their working capital and growth capital as well as provide debtor-in-possession financing needs. She helps clients to understand available financing options and how to best leverage their assets to gain liquidity for their businesses. Rachel has an extensive network of capital providers to draw upon, from private equity firms to equipment finance providers to inventory lenders, to help clients realize their optimal capital structure and grow their businesses.

She is an active member of the Commercial Finance Association, International Factoring Association and Turnaround Management Association. Rachel was selected as a Woman in Commercial Finance for The Secured Lender, Women in Commercial Finance issue by the Commercial Finance Association and recognized as a Power Woman in Business on Long Island by Long Island Press. She was also interviewed on 77 WABC Radio’s “Mind Your Business” with Yitzchok Saftlas where she discussed how to access capital for your business utilizing accounts receivable financing.

In addition, Rachel has authored numerous articles and is a regular speaker and panelist discussing factoring for early stage and mid-size companies. Some of her speaking engagements include the Daymond John Academy, LaunchPad Long Island, FoodTech FastTrack, New York New Jersey Minority Supplier Development, and various accounting firms for continuing professional education credits. She holds a bachelor’s degree in psychology from Brooklyn College.

Address - Locations: Park 80 West, Plaza One, 250 Pehle Avenue, Suite 313, Saddle Brook, NJ 07663, US
Description (2):
Prestige Capital is a commercial finance company specializing in factoring for Early Stage and Mid-Size companies. We purchase invoices from businesses whose accounts receivable range from $1 million to $250 million in annual sales.

Why Work with Prestige?

1. Simple - Unlike other factors, we do not require that clients factor all of their invoices. Clients choose which customers and which invoices to factor based on their need for either cash or credit protection. All non-factored cash we receive will be returned without any fees. The only fees we charge are factoring fees, a one-time application fee, and wire transfer fees.

2. Fast - No other factor can close faster than Prestige Capital. We have funded transactions in as little as three business days from the initial phone call. The average transaction, however, takes between 4 and 5 business days to fund. We are able to accomplish this because we focus on the quality of the clients’ customers and the ability to verify invoices, rather than on the clients’ financial condition.

3. Straightforward - We maintain the highest level of professionalism, integrity, and transparency. Our fee structure is very simple and there are no hidden charges or ambiguous language in our contracts.

Additionally, there are:
NO Minimum Factoring Fees
NO Long Term Contract Requirements (as short as 3 months)
NO Closing Costs (other than a one-time due diligence fee)
NO Traditional Personal Guarantees
NO Financial Statement Requirements
NO Operational Audits
NO Legal Fees
NO Minimum Invoice Fees
NO Obligation to Sell All Receivables. You choose which receivables to fund.

4. Flexible - Whether dealing with family-owned business or financial sponsor-owned business, clients benefit from our experience and unique approach that allows us to find flexible solutions to leverage their accounts receivable. Also, since we assist in collections, our clients do not have to worry about staffing those functions.
Headline: Prestige provides flexible receivable financing in as few as 5 business days

Description: CEO & co-founder at https://t.co/UKrZ1IvQ11 - Improving the tech stack for travel advisors, suppliers, and the travelers they serve. Prev employee #1 @joinhandshake
Title: Chief Executive Officer & Co-Founder
Summary: Co-founder and CEO at Tern Travel - connecting travel advisors, travelers, and travel companies with magical technology. Previously part of the early team at Handshake. Passionate about startups, entrepreneurship, and constant learning. Love adventure. Frequent traveler. Avid audiobook listener.
Description (2):
We believe travel has a uniquely powerful ability to bring people together and change the way we see the world - something we believe the world needs more of right now. To quote Terry Pratchett in a Hat Full of Sky: "Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving."

The challenge is that travel is hard. The pandemic has made it even more challenging. It can feel like you need a degree in logistics to plan more than a simple trip.

Travel is also deeply personal and human. Review sites and booking engines make the actual process of booking easy, but are case studies in the paradox of choice. Information overload results in countless hours of research and a lingering feeling of uncertainty: how similar to me are these reviewers?

If you haven't worked with a 'travel agent', you might think of them as a relic of the past. It's true, that agents today are no longer a requirement to book a ticket like they once were. Instead, travel advisors (as they're now called) act more as a trusted advisor combining local knowledge and experience with their understanding of your values and priorities to craft the perfect trip.

The technology that powers the modern travel advisor hasn't kept up with the tools available to consumers. Advisors are left juggling multiple antiquated and fragmented systems. Not only is this frustrating, but it comes at a real cost of business. Disconnected systems can result in lost commissions and a compromised traveler experience.

Tern exists to change this by building an integrated platform that connects the modern travel advisor to their travelers and suppliers.
Headline: Building Tern - The future of travel is human

At Akash Systems, Inc. (San Francisco, CA), we design and make some of the world's most energy efficient RF Power Amplifiers, and the CubeSats (small LEO orbital satellites).  Our innovation is made possible by the breakthrough materials we use: gallium nitride (GaN)-on-Diamond wafers.

In GaN-on-Diamond, the hottest parts of a transistor is brought to within tens of nanometers of diamond - the world's most thermally conductive material.  The effect is a cooler state of operation - dramatically improving energy efficiency, and reducing a system's size, weight, and operating costs.

We offer our customers a full set of end-to-end capabilities from concept development to shipping, with critical attention to the steps in between including formulation, testing, quality control, packaging, manufacturing, and filling. With customers across Indie, Emerging and Established brands, we work on a variety of projects including custom development, reverse engineering, stability and efficacy improvement, and formulation clean-up to meet natural and organic criteria.

We consistently invest in R&D, technology, our facilities, and our team, to enhance our capabilities. Our R&D chemists have developed thousands of best-in-class skin, hair, body and sun care formulations, leveraging innovative technologies and ingredients. With one of the broadest sets of certifications and full in-house testing capabilities, our facility is one of the few in the country that can truly deliver your entire personal care line end-to-end.

We deliver a level of service, support, and transparency unmatched in the industry, and our project management team can handle projects of any size or complexity with ease and meticulous precision. From idea to launch - as production partners, we want you to shine.

Title: Member of the Board of Directors
Description (2):
Chime was created because we believe everyone can unlock financial progress, and we want to develop solutions and services to empower people to succeed. The premise upon which we started Chime is simple: basic banking services should be helpful, transparent, and easy. Our easy-to-use tools and intuitive platforms give members the ability to have more control over their money and to take action toward achieving their financial ambitions.

By designing a member-centric banking app with easy-to-understand financial tools, we’re creating a more competitive market with options for everyday Americans. We offer access to accounts with no overdraft fees, provide members the chance to receive their pay up to 2 days early* with direct deposit, help them build credit history, and build financial literacy to hit their goals—among many other things.

Since 2012, we’ve grown our team to more than 1300 Chimers across 3 offices. But more than that, we’ve expanded the products and services we offer to our members based on member feedback. And in doing so, we’ve disrupted the banking industry and changed the conversation for everyday people about money on a national level.

Chime is a financial technology company, not a bank.  Banking services are provided by The Bancorp Bank, N.A. or Stride Bank, N.A., Members FDIC.

*Early access to direct deposit funds depends on the timing of the submission of the payment file from the payer. We generally make these funds available on the day the payment file is received, which may be up to 2 days earlier than the scheduled payment date.

Terry Howerton is a lifelong entrepreneur. He has spent a career starting and leading ventures, mentoring other entrepreneurs, and building for-profit and not-for-profit organizations.

Howerton is the founder and CEO of TechNexus, a Chicago-based firm with a collaborative, joint-venture model with leading corporations to drive growth by uniquely engaging the global entrepreneurial ecosystem. After a decade as one of the most successful startup incubators in the country, in recent years TechNexus has emerged as one of the most active venture investors globally.

Howerton is a member of the Executive Council of TechNet alongside several CEOs of the largest companies in the tech industry. TechNet is the national advocate for important policies to the tech industry, including economic growth, immigration, STEM education, and workforce development. Howerton serves as a director or advisor to several private companies. He was the founding chairman of one of the largest technology trade associations in the country, and founder of a (now replicated) inner-city public high school to inspire a diverse population toward careers in technology and entrepreneurial thought.

TechNexus is at the forefront of driving innovation between large enterprises and the startup ecosystem. It has grown over 450 startups that have raised in excess of $650 million in capital and created thousands of jobs.  Today, TechNexus curates ecosystems of entrepreneurial activity all over the world, and actively invests into those ecosystems to drive innovation in close to a dozen major industries.

on any given day of the week, maman welcomes sleepy new yorkers, local celebrities, moms-on-the-go, business partners, and reunited friends into one of our many locations. greeted by the scent of culinary splendor that wafts through the space, our guests step into an experience that engages all the senses: rustic décor at every turn, the aroma and comfort of cuisines inspired by family traditions, and the highest quality, locally sourced ingredients. maman founders benjamin sormonte and elisa marshall have brought to life a melding of our earliest childhood experiences in the kitchen and a nod to our mothers from the south of france and north america.
maman, after all, means “mother” in french.

what started as an independent soho café and bakery in october 2014 is now a leading lifestyle brand that boasts cafés across new york city, montreal, and toronto, plus retail items so you can ‘take maman home’ with you. we host coveted events for high-end designers and collaborate with leading brands for partnerships and activations. we host engaging workshops like decorating naked cakes, learning how to make cheese fondue, and creating floral arrangements.

open seven days a week, maman offers a selection of delicious baked goods, coffee, fresh breakfast and lunch options, and seated lunch, brunch, and a full bar at selected locations. we serve a broad menu of hearty farm fresh salads, quiches, sandwiches, and of course pastries and sweets - you can’t leave without trying our famous nutty chocolate chip cookie, named one of ‘oprah’s favorite things’ for 2017 and and one of the best chocolate chip cookies in new york from ny magazine.

Description (2):
RDI is a tech-enabled CRO, Biobank, and Lab that helps In Vitro Diagnostic manufacturers who struggle to get FDA clearance for their products by sourcing the blood samples they desperately need through physicians and labs.
Unlike many other CROs and bio-sample vendors, RDI is vertically integrated and can source, test, and send the finalized report to the FDA faster and more efficiently through its custom remote trial management software and its wholly owned clinical lab.
This vertical integration allows RDI to vastly simplify the clinical trial process while serving as a credible, unbiased and independent source for the FDA submission.

In 2021, RDI was recapitalized as part of an ongoing search-fund investment model, where a young entrepreneur acquires a small business from a retiring founder.

This investment transitioned RDI from a founder led business into a world-class diagnostic CRO with scientific experts and a CLIA lab that allow it to manage larger and more complex projects.
Headline: CEO @ RDI — the go-to CRO for the most powerful and innovative diagnostic companies.

On the side, Swish is the co-host of the Track Limits podcast. The podcast is focused on telling the in-depth stories of various personalities in Formula 1 from mechanics and drivers to team bosses and content creators.

In 2022, Swish released the book “The Young Entrepreneur” under the Kogan Page imprint in several languages. He currently sits on the Next Gen Council for Covenant House Toronto and is the Board Chair for the League of Innovators. Swish previously worked as a UN Youth Ambassador, a consultant for Fortune 500 companies like Western Union, Google and American Express and an analyst at JB Fitzgerald Venture Capital (founded by NBA player Trevor Booker).

For his entrepreneurial and philanthropic achievements, Swish was inducted into Bay Street Bull’s 30 under 30, recognized as a LinkedIn Top Voice and awarded Startup Canada's Young Entrepreneur of the Year award and the United Nation’s Outstanding Youth Leadership award. 

As a former debater who represented Canada twice at the World Schools Debating Championships, Swish also has a passion for public speaking. He has given four TEDx talks and enjoys speaking under North America’s prestigious bureau Speakers Spotlight. He has spoken at over 300 events around at the world including at Harvard University, Wall Street Journal, STAPLES Center, World Business Dialogue, American Express, IIT Bombay and the United Nations.

The magic has been loved and spread far and wide by customers including Paris Hilton, Kim Kardashian, Bella Hadid, and Taylor Swift (to name a few).

As an entrepreneur, creating and doing are my main drivers and inspiration. Recognizing and understanding a need, researching, creating transformational brands/products, and bringing them to market to fulfill a demand were all lessons learned during the process of building companies from scratch. Before #GETFLOATY, I gained experience as a strategy and leadership consultant, a marketing manager, as well as the CEO of Prezi B, an independent design and training organization, Cruise One Inc., a cruise vacation franchise, and Hands-Free Storage, a pop up retail storage business serving college students.

My education includes an M.B.A from Pepperdine University and a BS from Babson College in Entrepreneurship and Global Business Management.

Description: Founder, CEO, & Janitor of @elevatecampusiq
Title: Associate Researcher
Summary:
A mathematician/data scientist, Aaron has always been highly focused on the value of data over intuition to address the most challenging problems and opportunities. As a college student, he saw first-hand how students can easily fall through the cracks – but more importantly how students can stay on track to graduation. Determined to figure out a way for every student to succeed, no matter what obstacles they face, Aaron founded Degree Analytics.

Aaron Benz, CEO and Founder of Degree Analytics, specializes in large-scale data analytics. He holds a patent for location-based monitoring systems and has steered Degree Analytics towards pioneering IoT data applications in higher education. His contributions in peer-reviewed published research as an associate at the Broad Institute demonstrate his proficiency in big data analytics. Aaron's expertise is pivotal in revolutionizing educational spaces with data-driven strategies.

A pure mathematician by training, Aaron received Academic-All America and All America awards as a lacrosse goalie at Eastern University. He was then a Sr. Data Scientist at Accenture where he built and executed big data analytics applications primarily across health, call center, and big oil enterprises. He has been a speaker at several conferences including Strata-Hadoop World and the Global Big Data Conference.

Other than the dataverse, Aaron is still actively involved in the lacrosse community as a goalie coach.

LION CHASER MANIFESTO

Quit living as if the purpose of life is to arrive safely at death. Run to the roar.
Set God-sized goals. Pursue God-given passions.
Go after a dream that is destined to fail without divine intervention.
Stop pointing out problems. Become part of the solution.
Stop repeating the past. Start creating the future.
Face your fears. Fight for your dreams.
Grab opportunity by the mane and don’t let go!
Live like today is the first day and last day of your life.
Burn sinful bridges. Blaze new trails.
Live for the applause of nail-scarred hands.
Don’t let what’s wrong with you keep you from worshiping what’s right with God.
Dare to fail. Dare to be different.
Quit holding out. Quit holding back. Quit running away.

Chase the lion.
Org: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
Enrich Company: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
Description (2):
The Broad Institute brings together a diverse group of individuals from across its partner institutions — undergraduate and graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, professional scientists, administrative professionals, and academic faculty.

The culture and environment at the Broad is designed to encourage creativity and to engage all participants, regardless of role or seniority, in the mission of the Institute. Within this setting, researchers are empowered — both intellectually and technically — to confront even the most difficult biomedical challenges.

The Institute’s organization is unique among biomedical research institutions. It encompasses three types of organizational units: core member laboratories, programs and platforms. Scientists within these units work closely together — and with other collaborators around the world — to tackle critical problems in human biology and disease.
Headline: Elevating Campus IQ | Innovator | EdTech | Data Scientist

Title: President / CEO
Summary:
As the co-founder and CEO of SureFire CPR, I have been fortunate to help transform our company into a leading provider of life-saving training solutions. With a background in accounting and business, I naturally took on the role of overseeing operations, complementing my husband Zack's expertise when we embarked on this journey together in 2009 from our living room.

To date, SureFire CPR has trained over 280,000 individuals, and we're on a path to reach 1,000,000. We're committed to establishing a foundation that ensures every high school student has access to free CPR training, equipping them to respond confidently in emergencies. By integrating American Heart Association-backed Interactive Manikins, we've made life-saving education more accessible, offering 24/7 nationwide training without the need for in-person instructors.

In addition to my career, I'm a lifelong learner with a passion for self-development. I enjoy hand lettering, crafting personal messages with artistic flair, and maintaining balance through regular yoga practice. Above all, I cherish time spent with our two daughters, who bring immense joy to my life.

I am committed to empowering others through education and personal growth, which guides our efforts and supports SureFire CPR's mission.
Address - Locations: 1835 W. Orangewood Ave, Suite 105, Orange, CA 92868, US
Description (2):
At SureFire CPR, we believe knowledge saves lives—but action takes confidence. Too often, people freeze in emergencies, unsure of what to do. We’re on a mission to change that by making CPR training accessible, engaging, and confidence-building for everyone.

Founded in 2009 by firefighter and paramedic Zack Zarrilli and his wife, Vanessa, SureFire CPR started with a simple idea: lifesaving training should be convenient, effective, and empowering. What began in their living room has grown nationwide with 40 locations and counting.

Today, SureFire CPR is pioneering the future of CPR training with the new American Heart Association-backed Interactive Manikin model, providing 24/7 instructor-free, hands-on training. Now, medical professionals can complete certifications on their schedule—without sacrificing quality or compliance.

To date, we’ve trained over 280,000 people, but we’re just getting started. Our goal is to reach 1,000,000 individuals and establish a foundation that guarantees every high school student in America graduates with the knowledge and courage to save a life.
Headline: Co-Founder | CPR & Emergency Training Advocate | Lifelong Learner

Title: CEO and Co-Founder of BillionMinds (A Techstars Company)
Summary:
I drive innovation by bridging business and technology to maximize human potential.

As Co‑Founder and CEO of BillionMinds, I lead a venture‑backed learning company that helps organizations build adaptable, resilient workforces. We deliver science‑backed learning at scale, embedding durable human skills into everyday workflows so employees can thrive through change.

BillionMinds is a graduate of the 2024 Techstars Workforce Development Accelerator, run in partnership with the Strada Education Foundation and World Education Services (WES). This reinforced our mission to prepare workers and employers for the future of work.

We’ve partnered with enterprises and education leaders across energy, higher education, and technology—including Williams, Ellucian, ASU (Arizona State University), Linde, and Gusto—to scale adaptability and resilience in the workforce.

Before BillionMinds, I spent nearly a decade at Microsoft building cross‑sector partnerships and large‑scale innovation programs across regulated industries. My work focused on strategic thinking, enterprise learning programs, and acting as a translation layer between business leaders, technical teams, and ecosystem partners.

My strengths:
• Maximizing human potential through capability building
• Strategic thinking that connects vision to execution
• Serving as a translation layer between business and technology
• Building partnerships across public and private sectors to unlock opportunity

I’m passionate about creating inclusive innovation ecosystems where technology fuels growth for organizations, communities, and individuals. Connect with me if you’re working at the intersection of people, performance, and innovation.

Description (2):
Build an adaptable, resilient workforce to future proof your company with BillionMinds.

We provide a unique upskilling experience that develops employees, making them ready for anything. Our solution combines experiential learning with reporting and analytics, allowing employers to:

Identify and unlock hidden potential
Increase engagement and reduce turnover
Improve capabilities at all levels of the organization

Our solution is targeted for organizations with a flexible work environment, and is constantly adapted as work changes. Employees will embed skills allowing them to adapt to:

Distributed work environments
Virtual teams
Multidisciplinary teams
Hybrid and remote work setups
AI, robotics and automation

BillionMinds is backed by research into the habits of flexible workers from all arenas, including business, sports and performing arts.

We are currently launching the resilience study, which is desiged to discover patterns in resilience across all fields. If you are a researcher interested in collaborating with us, contact us at info@billionminds.com.

Title: CEO
Summary:
Eric Sheinkop is an accomplished entrepreneur, acclaimed author, and tech innovator known for bringing innovative solutions to antiquated industries. His journey began with a passion for music and a drive to create opportunities for underserved communities.

Eric founded a platform that became the world's largest community of unsigned musicians, enabling them to monetize their music through brand partnerships, TV and film placements, and live performances. This platform helped independent music artists earn $15 million, significantly impacting their lives and careers. Becoming the top music provider to the world's leading brands, Eric sold a minority stake in his company to Coca-Cola before extending his visionary approach to the retail sector.

As the co-founder of The Desire Company, Eric saw an opportunity to build brand partnerships for experts often overlooked in favor of celebrities and influencers. The Desire Company’s pioneering model connects seasoned professionals with brands, redefining how products are discovered, reviewed, and trusted. With a mission to ensure genuine expertise drives consumer decisions, Eric is reshaping traditional business paradigms for brands and consumers.

Eric's career has garnered prestigious recognitions, including features in Billboard's "30 Under 30" and Crain’s “Tech 50” list, alongside awards such as Cannes Lions, CLIO, LIA, and an Emmy. He continues his mission to uplift under-recognized talent through The Desire Company, raising $25 million to increase the representation of diverse professionals in brand content. Eric's commitment to creating opportunities for all underscores his impact as a trailblazer in business and entrepreneurship.

Twin Oak is a specialized ETF provider that seeks to bridge the gap between institutional-grade investment solutions and the unique needs of families. Founded on deep family office expertise, we offer tax-efficient ETF structures designed to preserve and grow multi-generational wealth.

Created for families. Backed by family offices.

Our approach is guided by four foundational pillars:

Tax Aware:
Focus on delivering after-tax returns utilizing modern investment vehicles, like ETFs, that are generally more tax-efficient than legacy structures.

Simplicity:
Designing simple, elegant solutions for complex problems should enable us to deliver lower cost solutions for our clients.

Creativity:
We partner with clients to deliver bespoke investment solutions.

Stewardship:
The best interest of our investors is at the forefront of all decisions.

Twin Oak empowers families with tax-efficient ETF solutions that combine institutional-grade investment strategies with the flexibility to meet complex, multi-generational wealth management needs. Our deep understanding of family challenges allows us to maximize after-tax returns while preserving and growing wealth across generations.

Cofounded by actor, filmmaker, women's health advocate and entrepreneur Halle Berry, Respin Health is a digital health platform delivering continuous and comprehensive support for women navigating menopause and midlife health.

As a technology platform, Respin Health is the only menopause offering delivering a holistic comprehensive approach, combining clinical care with lifestyle medicine, powered by precision protocol algorithms. Our results speak for themselves: 90% of women in our pilot program reported measurable symptom improvement in 8 weeks, with 64% meeting the clinical threshold of treatment responsiveness.

Respin’s medical leaders and advisors include Dr. Sarah de la Torre (Respin Health Clinical Lead), Dr. Elizabeth Knight PhD (Respin Health Head of Research & Science), Dr. Pauline Maki (leading researcher and professor at University of Illinois Chicago, 24th President of NAMS), Dr. Lisa Mosconi (neuroscientist and women’s brain health specialist, author of The Menopause Brain), Dr. Vonda Wright (orthopedic surgeon and longevity expert, author of Unbreakable), and Dr. Janet Choi (Chief Medical Officer of women’s health company Progyny).

Title: Board Member
Summary:
I’m a mission-driven leader who loves helping organizations find clarity, build strong systems, and scale what works so more people can flourish. Over the past 25 years, I’ve worked across the private, public, and nonprofit sectors, focusing on strategy, execution, and impact. My background spans organizational leadership, operational effectiveness, fundraising strategy and infrastructure, and strategic communications.

I’m currently a Partner at Oak Rose Group (ORG), where we help visionary leaders advance the policies, ideas, and organizations that lead to human flourishing. I also serve as Chief Operating Officer of Oak Rose Fund, a Colorado nonprofit that blends philanthropy, social entrepreneurship, and advocacy and serves as a fiscal sponsor for aligned projects.

Before joining ORG, I spent nearly 14 years with ACE Scholarships, a Colorado-based nonprofit that helps low-income children access quality K–12 education. As Chief Operating Officer, I helped lead ACE’s growth from one state supporting 600 students to a multi-state network serving more than 7,000 students across eight states, with annual revenue growing from $5 million to $32 million. During that time, ACE became the only scholarship organization in the country to operate both privately funded and tax credit programs in multiple states.

Earlier in my career, I served as Communications Director for the Colorado Secretary of State, advising on elections, campaign finance, and public affairs. I also worked in legislative affairs and political campaigns, including a nationally targeted congressional race.

I’m a member of the American Enterprise Institute’s Leadership Network and serve on the boards of Goodwill of Colorado and Chance Sports. I was also a founding board member of Girls Athletic Leadership School and past president of Highline Academy Charter Schools.

Paxos is the leading regulated blockchain infrastructure and tokenization platform. Its products are the foundation for a new, open financial system that can operate faster and more efficiently. Today, trillions of dollars are locked in inefficient, outdated financial plumbing that is inaccessible to millions of people. Paxos is replatforming the financial system to enable assets to instantaneously move anywhere in the world, at any time, in a trustworthy way.

Paxos partners with leading global enterprises to tokenize, custody and trade assets. Its blockchain solutions are used by leaders like PayPal, Interactive Brokers, Mastercard, Mercado Libre and Nubank. Paxos is licensed to engage in virtual currency business activity by the NYDFS and is the issuer of numerous regulated digital assets including PayPal USD (PYUSD), Pax Dollar (USDP) and Pax Gold (PAXG). Its affiliate company Paxos International issues the yield-bearing regulated stablecoin Lift Dollar (USDL). Paxos Singapore is the issuer of Global Dollar (USDG), a USD-backed stablecoin that powers the Global Dollar Network and is substantively compliant with MAS’ upcoming stablecoin regulatory framework.

Prudentially regulated by the NYDFS in the US, the MAS in Singapore and FSRA in Abu Dhabi Global Market, Paxos is a top-funded fintech company with more than $540 million raised from leading investors including Oak HC/FT, Declaration Partners, Founders Fund, Mithril Capital and PayPal Ventures.

We’ve become aware of fraudulent accounts posting as Paxos recruiters on LinkedIn and other platforms. Thanks for your interest in Paxos!

Description: Changing the world through care and compassion in the workplace. Formerly @datadoghq.
Title: Advisor
Summary:
Progressive HR Executive & Board Partner. I scale organizations from startup through $10B+ IPO with discipline, speed, and culture intact. My focus: investor-ready governance, executive bench strength, and unlocking performance through accountability and compassion.

Over 20+ years, I’ve partnered with CEOs and boards to build People functions that deliver measurable results. I believe high performance is achieved when governance is strong, leadership is prepared, and culture enables people to thrive. Care and compassion aren’t the goal — but they are how you create accountability, engagement, and discretionary effort at scale.

At Datadog, I scaled the company from 160 to 2,400+ employees across 30 countries, building the People function from scratch and preparing the company for IPO. My role included designing innovative compensation and equity programs to attract and retain top talent in a competitive market, transitioning equity from options to RSUs, and establishing executive comp aligned with investor expectations. I also implemented governance processes that satisfied auditors and regulators, while launching progressive change management and communications programs so employees understood what going public meant for them. Through this period of hypergrowth, we sustained engagement above 90% worldwide.

At Cognism, I partnered with the CEO and board to restore governance, re-architect the executive team, and simultaneously professionalize the People function. I rebuilt the HR leadership bench across talent, rewards, and operations, implemented global controls for compensation and promotions, and launched forward-looking manager training that boosted effectiveness across the company. I also introduced progressive policies such as global parental leave, ESG reporting, and structured DEI training — strengthening compliance and culture together. These interconnected efforts stabilized the business, restored investor confidence, and positioned the company for its next stage of growth.

What drives me now is helping CEOs and boards navigate the critical challenges of growth: scaling without breaking culture, building strong leadership pipelines, ensuring investor-ready governance, and guiding organizations through the workforce disruption of technology and AI.

Leadership Competencies:
Global HR Strategy | IPO Readiness & Scale | Mergers & Acquisitions | Board Partnership | Organizational Design |Culture & Engagement | Talent Development | Compensation & Governance | Diversity, Equity & Inclusion | HR Technology & Analytics | Global Expansion

Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
My professional experience has provided unique insight for the opportunity to innovate and help nudge the old school Heavy Equipment industry into the 'new age'.  It's one thing to discover a "problem", it's another to actually live that problem day after day and understand the intricacies that make the entire industry work.

There is a heavy equipment dealer technician shortage. Customers suffer with longer lead times for repairs, a lack of transparency on when they'll get a trained technician, and an overall poor service experience.  Our 'App' connects customers with multiple available independent trained technicians in their area.  Heave is a contractor's alternative to OEM dealer service, at a cost savings and with faster response times.  It's a true win-win for our technicians and contractors. Our team is focused on a solution to the dealer technician shortage today, not waiting for more trade school enrollment down the road.

As a leader, the most important lessons that I learned (so far):

-Be authentic
-There’s no secret to success
-Organizations only change when you can build teamwork and have many people contributing
-People want to be held accountable to a standard
-listen, the best ideas often come from those in front of the customer
-lead by example
-no excuses, own everything you do
Address - Locations: 802 E Whiting St, Tampa, Florida 33602, US
Description (2):
Imagine this: your CAT 336 just went down. Forget waiting days or weeks for the dealer. With Heave, you can book a qualified independent technician and get back to work in 24 hours.

Simply visit our website or download the app, tell us your location and what needs fixing, and book a nearby independent technician of your choosing.

Heave connects you with trusted, insured technicians who specialize in everything from DEF/regen issues and hydraulic leaks to welding and line boring on earthmoving equipment like excavators, bulldozers, and loaders from brands like CAT, John Deere, Komatsu, and hundreds more.

Download the app or book a technician at www.heaveapp.com today. #DefeatDowntime
Headline: Founder at Heave:  On-Demand Heavy Equipment Service

Summary:

Description (2):
Process Street is a Compliance Operations Platform powered by AI agents that help teams run critical processes with consistency, control, and proof.

If you’re managing onboarding, audits, or vendor reviews using documents, spreadsheets, and scattered tools, you’re not alone. Most teams are already doing “something” to stay compliant, but it usually involves manual work, patchwork systems, and last-minute scrambles. That approach creates risk, slows down execution, and makes it hard to prove work was done correctly.

Process Street replaces those workarounds with a structured, scalable platform where documentation, workflows, and compliance monitoring all live in one place. Teams create, automate, and run repeatable workflows with no code, while Cora our AI Compliance Agent watches every task in real time. Cora flags skipped steps, enforces standards, and ensures processes follow your internal policies and external frameworks like ISO, SOX, and HIPAA.

Description: Natural Resources Law & Policy Expert | Passionate about Africa’s Transformation through Sustainability |Thought Convener for Social Impact | MD@RICH_AFRICA
Title: Director
Summary:
Ndapwilapo Selma Shimutwikeni is a trailblazing Energy and Natural Resources Advisor, Entrepreneur and Board Executive, with over a decade of experience shaping Namibia’s extractive and energy sectors through business strategy, policy design, and high-impact convening. She is widely regarded as a go-to reference for investors navigating Namibia’s and Africa’s evolving energy landscape.

She is the Chief Executive Officer of RichAfrica Consultancy, a boutique advisory firm that supports governments, investors and institutions in unlocking sustainable value in the oil and gas industry and broader natural resource sectors. Drawing on a legal foundation and extensive experience in high-level strategy, policy development and stakeholder engagement, Selma provides insightful, forward-looking business advisory focused on governance, local content and partnerships.

She is also the Founder and Convenor of the Namibian International Energy Conference (NIEC)—one of the few women-led energy platforms in the world. Established in 2012 (originally as the Namibia International Oil & Gas Conference), NIEC has evolved into a premier convening platform for energy leaders, policymakers, and investors—renowned for its thought leadership, creative curation and tangible impact across investment flows, policy dialogue, tourism and national development.

Ms. Shimutwikeni began her career in Namibia’s diamond industry and has contributed to foundational national frameworks including the National Energy Policy, Local Content Policy and the Cybercrime Bill, developed in collaboration with the International Telecommunications Union and the European Commission.

She is also the Founder of the Future Energy Leaders initiative, which mentors and empowers young African professionals in the energy sector, and Emerge, a platform for creative and transformative leadership that nurtures storytelling, imagination and purpose-driven thinking.

Selma holds two Master of Laws (LL.M.) degrees—one in International Trade Law from the University of Leeds, and another in Mineral Law and Policy from the University of Dundee’s Centre for Energy, Petroleum and Mineral Law and Policy (CEPMLP). She has completed globally accredited board training programmes and serves on several corporate and advisory boards.

Deeply embedded in both Namibia’s national ecosystem and international energy networks, Ms. Shimutwikeni brings a rare combination of expertise, access and influence—connecting capital, policy, and leadership to shape the future of energy in Africa.
Address - Locations: C/ Sam Nujoma & Dr. Kwame Knrumah Drive, Windhoek, Khomas 264, NA
Description (2):
Namib Desert Diamonds (Pty) Ltd is a cutting edge diamond marketing and sales company, perfectly positioned to create a sustainable route to market and sell a portion of Namibia’s unique and highly sought-after diamonds. PUBLIC ENTERPRISE OF THE YEAR 2023 AWARD WINNER

Established in 2016 by the Government of the Republic of Namibia, it trades as a private company, governed by the Companies Act, with limited liability.

NAMDIA was established as a result of the signing of a Sales and Marketing Agreement between the Government of the Republic of Namibia and the De Beers Group of Companies relating to Namdeb Holdings’ diamonds. In terms of this agreement, NAMDIA is to purchase (on behalf of the Government of the Republic of Namibia), a Purchase Entitlement consisting of 15% per annum of Namdeb’s total run-of-mine production.

Its objective is to serve as a price discovery mechanism for the Namibian government by trading in rough diamonds on the global market and create a Namibian footprint in the downstream market.

NAMDIA will leverage on the high quality and corresponding premium prizing of its Namibian diamonds and will create an iconic brand that positions Namibia diamonds as a niche product in the luxury brand segment, highly sought after by the world’s elite diamantaires and consumers.
Headline: Natural Resources, Oil & Gas Leader| Strategic Convenor & Collaboration Catalyst | Driving Cross-Sector Impact

Description: 3X Founder | 4X Father | Generated $300M+ in revenue | Daily Tips on Mindset, Systems, and High-Growth Habits
Title: Writer
Summary:
Over the past decade, I've built three multimillion-dollar businesses while growing a family and raising four children.

I started with no resources, no connections, and didn’t have access to the playbooks that would have made the journey 10X easier.

As a kid, I made money garden landscaping for families at church, manufacturing merchandise for private clubs, and then developing websites and running ad campaigns for local companies.

By 21, I was founding companies. In the decade since, I've:

➤ Generated $300M+ in revenue
➤ Built operations in 1,000+ U.S. cities
➤ Served over 3 million customers globally
➤ Helped grow hundreds of small businesses
➤ Raised $30M+ in capital from Angels, VCs, Private Equity, and Family Offices
➤ Successfully navigated both successful and failed multimillion-dollar acquisitions
➤ Been featured in leading publications like Forbes, Bloomberg, Entrepreneur, USA Today and more
➤ Worked with and advised the world's most iconic brands, including Diageo, Mars, Tesco, 7-Eleven, AB-InBev, Molson Coors, and Constellation

BUT, the journey was hard (harder than it needed to be).

I’ve faced many of the things you don't think about when starting a company:

→ Fought off (and won) predatory lawsuits
→ Closed a Seed round days after my wedding
→ Negotiated with demanding government agencies
→ Worked with lobbyists to introduce or change legislation
→ Raised a Series A while in the hospital for my first son's birth
→ Navigated a failed multi-million dollar merger while my daughter was born
→ Survived near-extinction events where we had single-digit weeks or days to save the company

Personal interests: Boxing, strength training, being in the ocean, spending quality time with my wife Danielle and our four little ones.

———

 Follow me for daily tips on mindset, systems, lifestyle design, and high-growth habits.

Get my newsletter – Playbook Academy (www.playbook.academy). See why thousands of founders and executives read Playbook Academy every Saturday morning.
Description (2):
Saucey is the easiest, fastest and most reliable way to order alcohol and have it delivered within an hour. With your payment information on file, we make it simple to pick what you want, check out, and have it delivered to you.

ASAP or scheduled delivery. No order minimums.

We drive additional revenues and customers to our local small business partners who provide the alcohol, and we donate a percentage of every sale to Charity Water (making it so when you drink, you're now helping those in need).

Our focus on delivery, logistics, consumer metrics & analytics is what drives the most important part of our business... the user experience. We're changing one of the largest, oldest and most resilient industries in the world using tech... and we love it.

We currently serve the cities of Los Angeles, San Diego, San Francisco, Sacramento, Chicago, New York, Miami, Seattle, Orlando, Dallas, Houston, Austin, Jacksonville, Washington DC, Tampa Bay, San Jose, and more.
Headline: 3X Founder | 5X Father | Generated $300M+ in Revenue |  Daily Tips on Mindset, Systems, and High-Growth Habits

Title: VP
Summary:
With nearly 20 years of experience in government partnerships, policy, advocacy, and operations, Jonathan Adler is a trusted advisor and leader to both early-stage and growth-stage startups across a range of disciplines. He helps them navigate complex regulatory environments, design and execute effective communication strategies, build and scale multi-disciplinary teams, and forge strong partnerships with stakeholders across city, state, federal, and international levels. Jonathan currently serves as the VP of Government Partnerships at Wonderschool, the market leader in early childhood education technology.

Previously, Jonathan advised the CEO of BusPatrol, the leader in automated stop arm enforcement, on policy, operations, and business development. Before that, he was the Sr. Director of Global Policy at Bird, where he led cross-functional teams to secure competitive city permits, craft and navigate complex regulatory environments of new and existing markets and build foundational processes for various functions across the enterprise. He brings deep knowledge and experience managing large, international teams and third-party vendors; tracking complex budgets; and reducing op-ex costs while increasing productivity both internally and externally.

Jonathan holds an M.A. in Government and Global Security Studies from Johns Hopkins University and a B.A. in Political Science and Spanish from Syracuse University.
Description (2):
Wonderschool is an AI-powered marketplace solving the child care crisis by connecting governments, providers, parents, teachers, and nonprofits on one integrated platform.

There is a nationwide shortage of child care and preschool options, and we believe one of the most effective ways to expand access is by helping teachers and caregivers start and grow successful programs—especially home-based child care businesses.

For providers, Wonderschool offers comprehensive support to launch and operate high-quality programs. We assist with licensing, classroom setup, pricing strategy, website creation, enrollment support, daily operations, and more. Our platform is designed to let educators focus on what they do best: caring for and educating children.

For governments, we offer AI-powered tools to help manage and expand early education ecosystems. Our technology helps states and municipalities identify child care deserts, support local providers, increase quality, and ensure families can access programs that meet their needs. By unifying data, services, and funding mechanisms, we help public agencies scale solutions effectively and equitably.

We are proud to partner with leaders across sectors—from families and educators to policymakers and nonprofits—to create a future where every child has access to early learning.

Wonderschool is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Goldman Sachs, First Round Capital, Lerer Ventures, Imaginable Futures, and Long Journey Ventures.
Headline: Startup Operator | Expert in Government Partnerships, Policy, GTM | Scaling Growth Through Strategy & Execution

Title: CEO & Founder
Summary:
There is nothing I like more than keeping our clients in their homes and keeping the American dream of homeownership alive.

The 2008 Financial Crisis, coupled with the corruption of the banks and Wall Street to illegally and improperly secure new loans, displaced millions of homeowners and their families. After many years as a Real Estate and Business Law Firm specialist, I decided to begin my own practice with a focus on Foreclosure Law and Real Estate Litigation. Having worked for both large and medium-sized Bay Area firms, I was exposed to the huge overhead costs most firms today charge their clients. I knew I could provide clients with the highest level of representation while not charging the enormous overhead if I opened my own practice.

I am very proud of our efforts not only as Real Estate litigation experts but also as a law firm dedicated to preserving the rights of homeowners against the Big Banks. When a property is illegally foreclosed upon, people have rights, and we are here to enforce those rights for them.

With over a 90% success rate in helping families facing imminent foreclosure stay in their homes, we are continuing our focus to undue the damages caused by the Financial Crisis and prepare for the next housing crises.

Today, the firm has hundreds of clients, many of whom are in the foreclosure litigation area. We are on the forefront of foreclosure litigation representing homeowners against the banks for over nine years. We have successfully gone up against banks such as Wells Fargo, Bank of America, JP Morgan Chase, US Bank, The Bank of New York Melon, HSBC, Aurora Loan Services, Nationstar (Mr. Cooper) and several more.

Our personalized approach and superior service sets us apart from our competitors.  We don't use boilerplate legal arguments and we will always treat you with respect, empathy and understanding.
Org: Estavillo Law Group @estavillolaw /Real Estate & Foreclosure Law
Description (2):
California’s Real Estate & Foreclosure Law Experts

When the housing crisis of 2008 resulted in millions of people losing their homes through unscrupulous practices by banks and Wall Street, we saw a need for fair, affordable representation. Estavillo Law Group was established to fight for the American Dream of Homeownership.

We are leading real estate experts, trained and experienced in all facets of the law.  We keep up-to-date with current trends in real estate laws and how they affect our clients.  As a smaller law firm with many years of experience, our goal is to provide personal attention at a fair price and to fight on our client’s behalf to keep the dream of owning a home alive and well.

Estavillo Law Group has an over 90% success rate at keeping people in their homes who were facing an imminent foreclosure. Due to our knowledge of the law, persistent discovery practices, winning focus, and experience utilizing expert witnesses we are champions in our field. Our record of success remains steadfast, winning cases against Wells Fargo, Bank of America, JP Morgan Chase, US Bank, The Bank of New York Melon, HSBC, Aurora Loan Services, Nationstar (Mr. Cooper) and several more.

Our personalized approach and superior service sets us apart from our competitors. We don't use boilerplate legal arguments and we will always treat you with respect, empathy and understanding.

Contact Estavillo Law Group for a free phone consultation.
Headline: Real Estate Litigation & Foreclosure Law Attorney/ Founder & CEO Estavillo Law Group

Title: Partner
Summary:
Most companies don’t have a strategy problem, they have an execution delusion. I help organizations build the structures, systems, and decision frameworks that move strategy from slide decks into scalable execution.

Across my career, I've led transformation efforts in Fortune 100 enterprises and scaling startups, shaping executive talent pipelines, workforce design, and organizational planning at global scale. I’ve seen how strategy often breaks down, not because the ideas were wrong, but because the operating reality couldn’t support them.

That experience led me back to school. Today, I’m completing my Master’s in Strategic Management at Harvard University to expand the way I shape enterprise outcomes, blending academic frameworks with operating insight to help companies realign around performance, resilience, and growth.

𝐁𝐮𝐢𝐥𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐒𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐬 𝐓𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐲

➟ 𝐓𝐚𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐭-𝐋𝐞𝐝 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐌𝐨𝐝𝐞𝐥 𝐈𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
I partner with leadership teams to evolve commercial models, reposition service portfolios, and align operating plans with long-term growth through the lens of talent. From fixed-fee transitions and high-margin offering launches to founder transitions and go-to-market realignment, I help companies move from gut instinct to scalable strategy, driving outcomes like 3.4× revenue growth and 2.8× EBITDA lift.

➟ 𝐎𝐫𝐠𝐚𝐧𝐢𝐳𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐏𝐥𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐏𝐞𝐫𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐟𝐫𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐮𝐜𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞
Sustainable strategy depends on strong systems. I’ve built internal operating frameworks that clarify decisions, embed accountability, and support alignment across functions and business units. Whether designing succession protocols or operationalizing strategic workforce planning, I create enterprise infrastructure that holds under pressure.

➟ 𝐂𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐬-𝐅𝐮𝐧𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐄𝐱𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 & 𝐒𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐢𝐜 𝐄𝐧𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭
The best strategies stall without structured delivery. I’ve built recruiting systems that reduce time-to-fill by 36 days and avoid $11.5M in external costs, co-architected global mobility platforms, and led enterprise-wide initiatives recognized with Caterpillar’s CEO Award. My work turns strategy into systems and vision into sustained performance.

𝐁𝐞𝐲𝐨𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐎𝐟𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐞
I stay active as a mentor with the BMLA, a basketball coach, and an explorer of new cultures—next up, Spain. Whether I’m studying global business strategy or navigating a fast break, I’m driven by curiosity, connection, and the pursuit of meaningful growth.
Headline: Strategic Advisor Building Systems that Scale Strategy Across People, Process & Performance  | Global Talent Leader | Co-Led Cultural Transformation | $11.5M+ Cost Avoidance | Harvard ‘25

Title: Founder
Summary:
Hey I'm Jimmy, startup founder of ZIZO Technologies and serial entrepreneur.  Are your sales representatives playing games at work?

With over 20 years of experience launching companies, and after starting and selling several call centers, I'm set on a mission to change the burned-out reputation of call centers by increasing employee engagement, motivation, and productivity.

 Here at ZIZO we reduce employee attrition and improve ROI in sales departments by gamifying the internal sales processes- making work as fun as playing a video game.

I founded ZIZO on a vision to make work as fun, competitive, and challenging for next-generation workers as playing their favorite video game. Think about your employees walking into work every day and logging into their console to face new opponents, win new bonus features and battle alongside their allies for grand prizes.

All of my initiatives would fail without my team- to whom I attribute my success and growth. Our team is built around the pillars of accountability, agility, trust, professionalism, and communication.

As a manager, you can use ZIZO to:

Rewards and Recognition Based Management System - The data from gamification insights support creating personalized programs that receive better adoption and response.
Manage Performance in Real-Time - You provide on-spot feedback by giving evidence of personalized benchmarks, milestones, performance KPIs.
Create a Competitive Environment in Your Workplace - You can arrange team competitions, set collaborative goals, organize battle royale tournaments, and much more. You can challenge your employees to achieve targets for earning currencies that they can use to purchase tangible items, office perks, digital assets, and even align with bonuses.
Improve Levels and Ranks of Your Employees - It lets your employees see a well-defined career path, how to get there, and what level they’ll achieve after completing tasks.
Get Actionable Insights Through AI - You can integrate, import, access, store and map all your business data in one place and access it through a customizable dashboard.

In addition to growing ZIZO, I help in the support of Layla's Food Company, a family-run restaurant and food business that sells products like garlic whip in grocery stores.

Always looking to connect with Bills fans, companies looking to grow their call centers or sales departments, startup founders, or leaders who want to collaborate on best practices to create healthy work cultures.
Headline: Modernizing Workforce Management

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary: My professional life has focused on arts, community development, and social justice in the United States and beyond. Through philanthropy and the nonprofit sector, I have directed teams and collaborated across sectors to design and implemented program strategies for equitable development, arts and culture, and artists in the workforce.
Address - Locations: 200 W Madison St, 3Fl, Chicago, Illinois 60606, US
Description (2):
United States Artists (USA) is a national arts funding organization based in Chicago. USA is dedicated to supporting both the life and the work of living artists and cultural practitioners across the country by granting unrestricted awards.

In 2003, the Urban Institute conducted a study which revealed that 96% of Americans valued art in their lives, while only 27% valued artists.* Motivated by the study and in response to the NEA’s severe budget cuts, four inspiring leaders of the Ford, Rockefeller, Rasmuson, and Prudential Foundations spearheaded the launch of an organization to illuminate the value of artists to American society and address their economic challenges. Originally established in Los Angeles by Founding CEO Katharine DeShaw with the first set of 50 fellowships being announced in 2006, USA moved the headquarters to Chicago in 2014 under the leadership of Carolina García Jayaram. In 2017, Deana Haggag was named President & CEO and today, USA continues to operate from Chicago with some remote staff working from Baltimore and New York.

Since its founding, USA has awarded more than 600 artists and cultural practitioners with over $27 million of direct support in all disciplines including Architecture & Design, Craft, Dance, Film, Media, Music, Theater & Performance, Traditional Arts, Visual Art, and Writing. With this unrestricted award, recipients decide for themselves how to best use the money – whether it is creating new work, paying rent, reducing debt, getting healthcare, or supporting their families. To make their work possible, USA actively fundraises each year and is supported by a broad range of philanthropic foundations, companies, and individuals committed to cultivating contemporary culture in the United States.
Headline: CEO, United States Artists

Title: Co-Founder and CEO
Summary:
Learn about my company: redteamthinking.com
Listen to my podcast: redteamthinking.com/podcast

I am a bestselling author, speaker, and unconsultant who believes that individuals have the power to transform companies and cultures through great leadership and applied critical thinking.

My books include:

 American Icon: Alan Mulally and the Fight to Save Ford Motor Company
 Red Teaming: How Your Business Can Conquer the Competition Challenging Everything

I am one of the world's foremost experts on decision-support red teaming, a revolutionary methodology developed by the U.S. military and intelligence agencies to help leaders make better decisions in today's complex and rapidly changing world.

In 2017, I founded Red Team Thinking to teach individuals and organizations around the world around the world how to use this same approach to:

 Engage critical thinking
 Enable distributed decision making
 Encourage diversity of thought

Why? Because who thinks wins!

I also coach senior executives using the management principles I learned from my mentor, legendary CEO Alan Mulally.

 I also like to talk – about leadership. In fact, Inc. Magazine named me one of its “Top 100 Leadership Speakers.”

In 2021, I launched "The Thinking Leader Podcast" so that I could keep talking during the pandemic.

Oh, and I used to be a  business journalist , but I got over it – though I still write a column about leadership, strategy, and of course red teaming for Forbes.com.
Address - Locations: 100 Pine Street, Suite 1250, San Francisco, California 94111, US
Description (2):
We are the world's leading provider of decision support red teaming for business. In fact, our president literally wrote the book on red teaming. Powered by a cadre of military-trained red team leaders and business strategists, we help companies of all sizes stress-test their strategies, strengthen their plans, uncover hidden threats and discover missed opportunities. By showing our clients how to think differently about their businesses, we help them become disruptors in their industries, rather than one of the disrupted. And we can do the same for your business.

In addition to our consulting and Red Team training services we now also offer a Strategy Bootcamp. This five day intensive training gives managers the tools to better understand the challenges and opportunities in front of them and devise effective strategies to face them.

DAY 1: IDEATION
The first day of the Red Team Thinking Strategy Bootcamp will give your team a powerful set of tools for understanding problems, getting to the root causes, mitigating groupthink, overcoming cognitive bias and surfacing the best ideas from within your organization.

DAY 2: STRATEGY DEVELOPMENT
Day Two is all about strategy. Your team will learn a clear, step-by-step process for building an effective strategy, as well as the ingredients required for successful implementation —  based on the same system used by the military to plan global operations.

DAYS 3 & 4: STRESS-TESTING
In this two-day module, your team will learn how our cognitive biases and blind spots cloud our decision making and will gain powerful red teaming tools they can use to overcome them.

DAYS 5: EXECUTION,
The final day will provide your team with a proven process for executing and implementing game-changing strategies. Based on the system developed by Alan Mulally — the legendary CEO who saved both Boeing and Ford from the brink of bankruptcy — this approach will help your team drive accountability, foster collaboration and achieve their goals.
Headline: Bestselling Author • Top-rated Speaker • Unconsultant

Title: Founding Member & Chairman of the Board
Summary:
Since 2005 I am an independent entrepreneur in gaming with our own company rcp, still sitting at the helm. I learned my trade playing games since I was 4 years, sold games for years (my first less official venture as a kid and later in a store), writing about them during university and nearly 5 years of Take2 Interactive where i gained a lot of exp and had quite an unplanned positive impact on their revenue. It was a great time and well suited education for what came next.

When we started rcp in a souterrain (fancy word for basement) we wanted to empower developers while making better games with a sustainable process. Now we are a management company with an a whole group of studios (>12) under the rcp family umbrella with hundreds of game makers in multiple countries and 3 continents. I also decided early on that I could only do this in my home town if we also change perception of the industry as a whole; so I am an avid lobbyist/politician for games in Bavaria (MD of "GBM") and also on an European level (president of "EGDF"), support a lot of educational initiatives (ex. currently the chair of production at S4G in Berlin), founded the biggest German speaking game culture club, own 2300 games on steam (pretty decent % of played :) ) and started pro bono mentoring startup founders from other industries >10 years ago.  Happy to connect!

I love my job, I push myself for growth and I will never give up in general or playing games in particular.

Keep on gaming

Title: Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
Leading Highview Power on their journey to provide a vibrant clean energy economy made possible for us all.

After completing my studies in New Zealand, I qualified as a chartered accountant and worked with Price Waterhouse in New Zealand, Japan and the UK, before commencing a career in corporate finance with Schroders and then Goldman Sachs, where I quickly advanced to Head of UK mergers & acquisitions.

I transitioned within that organisation to the private equity division where I was involved in the acquisition and oversight of several fast growing and evolving companies, including Pret a Manger, Ontex, Expro and Dong Energy, now known as Orsted. I was particularly active in the energy sector where I led the group’s investing activity in Europe and was a member of Goldman Sachs Merchant Bank Global Energy and Infrastructure Investment Committees.

Since I have also founded two EPC companies in the oil & gas sector which have established a private investment firm focused on purpose-driven growth investments.

Bringing my vast experience from the energy industry, I know Highview and its technology will play a critical role in the long duration energy storage market, which will itself represent the fastest growing segment of the energy economy over the next two decades.

Title: Administrator, Service Delivery, Education, and Support
Summary:
I am a healthcare IT leader driven by the belief that technology should make care better for both patients and the clinicians who serve them. My work centers on building systems and cultures that remove friction, elevate the clinician experience, and enable organizations to deliver on their mission of exceptional patient care.

At UVA Health, I lead an 85‑member IT team supporting a leading integrated health system through a period of transformation and growth. Our initiatives have ranged from improving clinician satisfaction through AI‑enabled documentation — achieving double‑digit gains in engagement scores — to strengthening governance and advancing digital strategy, always with a focus on balancing innovation with operational excellence.

I lead with humility and a commitment to collaboration, bridging the worlds of technology and patient care. My approach is grounded in listening, building trust, and empowering teams — ensuring IT is not just a service provider but a strategic partner in advancing the health system’s mission.

Looking ahead, I am focused on guiding healthcare organizations through the next era of digital transformation — advancing responsible AI, strengthening cybersecurity, and ensuring core IT systems remain reliable in ways that are seamless and clinician‑friendly. My goal is to create environments where clinicians can thrive and patients receive the highest quality care.
Description (2):
Based in Charlottesville, Va., UVA Health embodies the leadership and inventiveness personified by its founder, Thomas Jefferson. In 1825, Jefferson established the nation’s 10th medical school, which has since grown into a nationally renowned academic medical center. UVA Health includes a 612-bed hospital, level I trauma center, children's hospital and primary and specialty clinics throughout Central Virginia.

Ranked among the best hospitals by U.S. News & World Report, UVA has doctors, nurses and other healthcare professionals recognized as leaders in their fields and who make every effort to push the envelope of medicine.

Search for our jobs at https://jobs.virginia.edu.
Headline: Mission‑Driven Healthcare IT Leader | Improving Clinician Experience & Advancing Digital Transformation

Title: President
Summary:
When I founded Happe Homes I set out on a mission to redefine what it means for you to build a home in Iowa. I had seen so many families eager to build their dream home and saw that eagerness turn to frustration through a process that didn’t include the most important part- the people living in their home. I knew there was a better way to help Iowan’s with the home building process and that is exactly why we consider ourselves the best Customer Service Company in Iowa, it just so happens that we also build the best homes. Our process starts with YOU first and at the center of the entire build. I set out with the goal to help you design the home of your dreams, while we may build many homes in a year, there is only one that matters to you.  From that first home that I completed in 2003 to the wide range of homes we have built since then one thing remains; they all have my name on it. That means everything to me personally and it shows in how we deliver for our customers.

Every single person who is involved in the process of building your dream home from the first conversation to the golden nail shares my passion for service. This is why we offer the longest and most extensive warranty in Iowa, the most options available without being charged an “upgrade” fee, 3 professional movers for 8 hours on the day of your move and so much more. The process doesn’t need to be stressful or full of anxiety when you work with Happe Homes. We have been building homes for 2 decades, and yes things may go wrong along the way, since there is no “perfect build”, that is why partnering with the right builder who delivers in those times is so important. We take care of the variables for you, because that is what you deserve. That is why I am proud to put my Family’s Name on every single home that we build and it would be my honor to have your family create a lifetime of memories in a Happe Home.

I mean come on, its HAPPE Homes, don’t you think that sets the standard right there?!
Headline: Expert in Real Estate Investments, Commercial, and Residential Construction #happehomes #happecommercial #gladiatorhomes #kyadtabuildingsupplies

Title: Co-Founder & CEO
Summary:
Making green energy transportable by turning it into hydrogen carriers usable today.

After spending 5 months traveling from South Africa to Kenya, I understood how urgently we need solutions to tackle the climate crisis.

We often experienced floodings & droughts. Bridges were wiped away, roads were blocked, and people were displaced by the disasters.

We have less than 2500 days left until we can no longer keep the 1.5-degree global warming target.

If we want our children to experience nature in the way we do today, we have to curb emissions NOW.

But how can we REALLY do more against emissions than taking the train, recycling waste, and picking McVegan over the Big Mac at McDonald's?

Good question.

Fortunately, having the experience of:

• Growing my deep learning company from zero to 7-figures
• Raising millions from worldwide investors
• Making one exit

…I had the financial means, the knowledge, and the courage to start a company with the goal of shaving 14.5% of the world's CO2 emissions within a decade.

Today, we're not short of energy, it's just produced in places we don't consume it.

By mass-producing hydrogen carriers from green energy, we close the geographical gap between production and consumption.

We start with manufacturing renewable natural gas, as it can be used without any change of infrastructure.

Within a year, our solution helps companies cut their emissions by up to 90%, all while ensuring stable supply of green energy.

It’s not too late to make an impact for our children -but we have to act now.

If you are a chemical engineer, mechanical engineer, investor, or policymaker, and you want to:

 Do more for Ukraine than hanging out a flag outside your window
 Make sure no one needs to freeze or file bankruptcy in the coming winters
 Solve humanity's biggest challenge, the climate crisis

Then send me a message with one sentence about where your superpower lies.

Let the fossils rest in peace!
Description (2): Decarbonizing the industry with Renewable Natural Gas.
Headline: Displacing fossil natural gas | Founder TURN2X

It's about instinct and curiosity. Observing and adapting. Feeling and sensing. Unearthing and uncovering. Waiting and reacting. Description: Award Winning Clinician and Medical Educator | Philosophy | Entrepreneurship | Medical Education
Title: Founder CEO
Summary:
Alan Akira is a board-certified psychiatrist and the founder of Mugen Psychiatry, a multi-service behavioral health group based in Chicago. He earned his B.S. in Molecular Biology from the University of Alabama at Birmingham’s Science and Technology Honors Program and completed his medical degree at the University of South Alabama, where he served as class president, was named a Gold Humanism Scholar, and received the Medical Alumni Association’s Leadership Award.

Dr. Akira completed his psychiatry residency at Rush University Medical Center, where he was the founding Chief Resident of Emergency Psychiatry and Medical Student Education. During his training, he helped establish emergency psychiatry services and medical education programs, earning multiple honors for leadership and teaching, including Resident of the Year from the Illinois Psychiatric Society, the Aesculapius Award, and the national Roeske Award for Teaching from the American Psychiatric Association.

His clinical expertise spans inpatient psychiatry, emergency psychiatry, and psychiatric services in specialized mental health rehabilitation facilities (SMHRFs). He has also served as an expert in psychiatry for Cook County, with a focus on involuntary commitment and medication petition under Illinois mental health law.

Under Dr. Akira’s leadership, Mugen Psychiatry has grown into one of the region’s leading behavioral health groups. The practice has been recognized as a Great Place to Work (2024) and (2025), and Fortune Magazine’s Best Workplace in Chicago (2025).
Description (2):
Mugen Psychiatry collaborates with leading clinicians to set new standards in exceptional clinical care, dedicated to advancing mental healthcare.

After a satisfying career leading modernisation & agility in the accounting industry, I now focus my energy on wealth empowerment for women. I co-founded the AI Women Circle with the fabulous Inbal Rodnay, a kickass community where women in professional services (like yourself ;) ) thrive in the exciting world of AI. Our mission is clear: unleash women's potential with AI while prioritising ethical practices.

The start of my accounting journey at a Top 100 firm left me craving a better way. Endless typing & mind-numbing tasks? No thanks. I wanted more: meaningful conversations, proactive future planning & awe-inspiring stories, not just numbers. So, I dove into technology to streamline service delivery, tapped into data-driven insights, and built emotional intelligence to forge genuine human connections. And let me tell you, the fire inside me was blazing!

Can I share a little success story? One of my proudest achievements was leading the development of a future-fit accounting division at a national mid-tier firm in Australia. We created an unparalleled client experience, leveraging technology & data-driven strategies to blow minds.

The best part? Being a role model and mentor to fierce, independent women lights up my soul. As a devoted mum to Tayah and Avery, I've learned the true importance of nurturing the next generation of powerhouses. They are the future, and I'm here to guide and inspire them every step of the way. My journey has been fueled by an unwavering commitment to driving positive change and empowering women. This path? Feeling motivated and ready to conquer the world? Progress comes when we embrace challenges. Together, we can create a future that's bright, equitable & filled with joy.
