Description: Founder of New Leaders, a creative and technical services firm specializing in apps, business automation and design.
Title: Managing Partner, Co-Founder
Summary:
There’s something about the panoramic views I enjoy behind the controls of a Cessna that gives me a unique vantage point on the world. And while I don’t aspire to be a commercial pilot, navigating a single engine airplane provides valuable lessons applicable to creating and running successful businesses. The first requires balancing the big picture vision with a myriad of small but critical details. The second requires managing risk early on to ensure our initial concepts survive to grow into vibrant, growing ventures.

I’m enthusiastic about building new systems that elegantly fill gaps in people’s lives. I envision systems that allow your customers to manage their own data so they can focus on bigger things. I’ve hand picked my team to serve both start-ups and growing businesses, and I strive to assemble the perfect blend of design and technology talent for each project.

My team excels at:

• User-centered design
• Digital product development
• High-velocity back office systems
• Customer portals

Our goal? To leverage technology as “a heavy lifter” that frees up time. This leads to remarkable improvements in company performance, employee effectiveness, and customer happiness.

We make things easy to buy, simplifying the most difficult software and API integrations. We build web applications using Ruby on Rails in order to provide the core of a full-stack solution that serves customers using many platforms: iOS, Android, Web, Desktop, Enterprise, Appliances, etc.

Working with clients isn’t always about doing exactly what I’m asked. I approach each project by listening first and then breaking things apart to understand the governing dynamics so we can create something better. To me, digging deep to find the core problem means we’re forming a sustainable relationship which leads to a sustainable outcome.

Our operations in New York and Geneva ensure prompt service and maintain near-zero return rates through strict quality control.

Our product lines include:
- Round Brilliant Melee Diamonds
- Fancy Shape Melee Diamonds
- Cut-to-Plan Melee Diamonds (Baguettes, Tapered Baguettes, Custom Cuts)
- 8 x 8 Melee Diamonds
- Fancy Color Melee Diamonds (Pink and Yellow)
- Fancy Color Certified Diamonds (Pink, Red, Blue, Orange, Green)
- Argyle Pink Diamonds

The majority of our polished inventory meets the following:
- Polished Size: 0.0025 ct to 0.18 ct
- Clarity: IF – VS
- Color: D to I
- We custom grade per the customer’s color, clarity and cut requirements
- Cut: Excellent to Very Good
- Polish: Excellent to Very Good
- Symmetry: Excellent to Very Good
- Provenance: Mine of origin must be disclosed; acceptable mines are located in countries such as Botswana, Canada, South Africa, Australia, Namibia, Lesotho.

Ethical Sourcing & Manufacturing: We directly source rough diamonds from environmentally responsible mines and process them in our socially compliant facility in India, ensuring 100% synthetic-free products. Each diamond's origin is fully traceable via blockchain.

Sustainability & Community Engagement: As a Responsible Jewellery Council member since 2009 and committed to the Watch & Jewelry Initiative 2030, we aim for sustainability, achieving net zero emissions in 2023. We support charities like Diamonds Do Good, UNICEF, and Doctors Without Borders.

Excellent Facets is built on a foundation of quality, trust, and responsibility, continually striving to meet and exceed industry ethical standards for a lasting positive impact.

Description: Co-Founder at Lorikeet. I deleted 10 years of my bad tweets so I could have a public account for my new bad tweets.
Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
Lorikeet uses AI to deliver higher quality, more scalable and cheaper customer support for complex businesses. Our powerful workflow engine goes beyond simple "help center summary" responses, and can hold conversations with your users, look up data, take actions in your systems and make decisions based on data and qualitative inputs.

If a customer asks "where is my order" we can retrieve a list of orders associated with the account, clarify the order in question if there's ambiguity, and then share the status or take actions like re-ordering if the order is delayed. The net result is a better experience for your customers that scales more easily as you grow and that is significantly cheaper than handling the same tickets with a human team. We work with high growth innovators in FinTech, HealthTech and related areas.

We're backed by Blackbird, Square Peg Capital, Skip Capital, and angel investors including the founders of Airwallex and Canva, as well as Claire Hughes Johnson (longtime Stripe COO) and executives from OpenAI, Stripe, Rippling and Nium.

If you're thinking about how AI can transform your customer support experience, email me directly at steve@lorikeetcx.ai.
Location Name: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
Description (2):
Lorikeet is a platform that complex and regulated businesses use to provide their customers with a universal concierge. Lorikeet does this with AI agents that work across voice, chat and email. The agents are built on a unique architecture that focuses on flexibility and the ability to take actions to solve customers’ problems (not just tell them to self serve) in the most challenging circumstances.

Our customers include global FinTech, HealthTechs, crypto marketplaces, and other complex businesses.

They chose Lorikeet because scaling customer support while maintaining response quality is exceptionally hard. For companies with complex support needs and a focus on customer experience, continuing to throw people at the problem doesn't work, nor does implementing low-quality "help center summary" chatbots.

Lorikeet leverages best-in-class AI and a powerful workflow engine to deliver high-quality and scalable support automation at a fraction of the cost of manual solutions. We can solve tickets that involve looking up data, taking actions in your systems, and making complex decisions.
Headline: Co-founder at Lorikeet | Building universal concierges for fintechs, healthtechs, and other complex businesses

🍄 capitalist lost in Berkeley

Title: Co-Founder, Board Member
Summary:
I encourage you to click "Connect" and also Reach Out to me. DMs are open.

Especially if you're a Berkeley Startup — a startup with at least one Berkeley-affiliated Co-Founder (alumni, faculty, postdoc, grad or undergrad student, dropout) at Idea, Pre-Seed, Seed, & Series A stage.

Or if you're looking for a breakout career opportunity — joining a top Berkeley startup at any stage.

If you're Berkeley affiliated and you click "Connect" here to add me, I'll happily accept. I'm on a mission to help strengthen the Berkeley community and make it feel more connected. Go Bears!
___________________________________
Jeremy Fiance started The House Fund in 2015 after graduating from UC Berkeley, where he co-founded an AI healthcare startup called Dropsense.

While at Berkeley, Jeremy also proved the campus' startup potential, co-launching several initiatives, including Kairos Society Berkeley and Free Ventures, student groups that increase access to entrepreneurial resources, which sparked over 50 startups that raised $50M by the time he graduated.

Before The House Fund, Jeremy was an investor at CrunchFund, Dorm Room Fund SF, and Keiretsu Forum.

Universities have always been inspirational to Jeremy Fiance as profound places for ideas to feed off each other and inspire new thinking –– and UC Berkeley in particular. From the Free Speech Movement in the 60s, to the twenty-two nobel prizes, to discoveries like the cyclotron. Berkeley has always been pushing the edge of what’s possible in today’s world.

With that in mind, Jeremy is dedicated to strengthening Berkeley's startup community and equipping Berkeley founders with the tools needed to build great businesses. For 15+ years now, Jeremy has been dedicated to ensuring the Berkeley startup community is thriving.

Outside of the technology and startup world, Jeremy is a black belt in Tang Soo Do, table tennis gold medalist, amateur cartoonist, live music enthusiast, and die hard Cal fan. Go Bears!
Description (2):
The House Fund is a pre-seed and early stage venture capital fund focused on the boldest Berkeley startups.

Cal has some of the most brilliant minds and daring businesses in the world. Tesla. Apple. Intel. But it has never had a place to unite its entrepreneurs, until now.

We started in 2016, with investments in 100+ startups, including 15+ exits. Over 100 firms have follow-on invested $5B+ in our startups. The House Fund has become a thriving ecosystem for the boldest Berkeley startups to grow.

Our Cal roots run deep. The House Fund’s Founding Partners have been building the Berkeley startup community since 2010. Our four Part-Time Alumni Partners have founded companies with combined exits over $1 Billion. Our six Faculty Partners are among the world's leading AI experts.
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
Headline: Founder, The House Fund (Hiring!); Cyborg In-Training; in Berkeley

Description: Building @Spine_AI (YC S23). Chat is broken. We built the infinite canvas. Stop prompting, start thinking. Prev @ Georgian, FarmLogs (YC W12), Scribd (YC S06).
Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
The future of work is a partnership between human creativity and AI. But today's chat interfaces are holding us back—they're linear, limiting, and break our creative flow by forcing us to juggle a dozen different tools.

At Spine AI (YC S23), we’ve built the unlimited thinking workspace you deserve. It’s an infinite canvas where you can orchestrate over 500+ AI models as visual blocks. Instead of managing subscriptions and messy threads, you can seamlessly build, branch, and connect ideas in one place.

This is the culmination of my work in applied AI at Georgian, my time at iconic YC companies (FarmLogs, Scribd), and my early research in Generative AI at the University of Toronto. It became clear the real bottleneck wasn't the models—it was the interface.
Description (2):
Spine AI (YC S23)

The default way professionals use AI is broken. We juggle subscriptions, copy-paste between tools, and lose our best ideas in disconnected chat threads. This isn't productive work; it's digital friction.

Spine replaces the broken chat interface with an infinite visual workspace. Here, you can visually connect 500+ models from GPT-4o to Claude 3, see how context flows between them, and go from a messy brainstorm to a finished report in a single, unified environment.

Serious work needs something different. Something structured enough to scale complex projects, yet flexible enough to support your unique creative process. Spine is designed to be powerful when you need it and invisible when you don't.

We build tools that get out of the way, so you can think more clearly.
Headline: CEO at Spine AI (YC S23) | Building the first true thinking workspace for the AI age. The chat interface is broken—we’re fixing it.

Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
These 3 areas of work are what manifested purpose looks like in my life:
The VPI Firm (www.thevpifirm.com),
BCIITY, Inc. (www.bciity.org), and
The EASE Cooperative (www.easedata.coop).

Below are the beliefs, commitments, and truths I stand on across all areas of work.

I'm not looking to convince, only looking to ATTRACT: Those who seek to BUILD WHAT HEALS and release what doesn't
____________________________________________

I believe that healing PEOPLE and healing SYSTEMS are one and the same.

Organizations, businesses, and institutions can (and should) serve to restore rather than deplete. I don't shy away from naming this standard, modeling it, helping to build and steward it, and acknowledging where I fall short.

Systemic transformation is a DELUSION if it still leaves people FRAGMENTED. Real transformation redeems what's been fractured WITHIN us, AMONG us, and AROUND us.

I slow down to listen before designing, I ask who is being healed or harmed by a process, and I build systems that restore BOTH those they serve AND those who sustain them.

I reject transformation that demands self-neglect.

I refuse to mask control under the guise of "accountability".

I refuse to glorify sacrifice and martyrdom over rest and sustainability

I resist the lie that service requires burnout to prove devotion (probably the greatest lesson I continue to unlearn).

I—and those that I get to call clients, partners, team members, and collaborators—are building LIVING, regenerative systems that give back what they request—in time, trust, energy, and results. It continues to be an iterative process rooted in being seen, valued, respected, and collectively held.

And I invite all who have searched for a more promising way to BUILD WHAT HEALS. Not through performative actions or compliance-based chokeholds; but through real lives transformed, agency restored, and hearts fulfilled.

Did you make it this far??
Interested in joining me?
Let's connect: https://bit.ly/10min-connect ...OR

 cchance@thevpifirm.com  Email me here if you're looking to build systems that heal for institutions (higher ed, financial, etc.), foundations, non-profits, collectives/coalitions, and entrepreneurs.

 candace@bciity.org  Email me here if you're looking to build systems that heal for  youth-serving organizations.

 candace@bciity.org (The EASE Cooperative)  Email me here if you're looking to build systems that heal for community data & narrative ownership.
Address - Locations: 10 E North Ave, Baltimore, Maryland, US

Whether you’re running a nimble startup or an established organization, you’ve reached a pivotal moment where your aspirations are outgrowing your current expertise. That’s a good thing — and it’s where we come in.

The VPI Firm is your strategic partner for transformative impact. We work with impact-driven leaders and their teams to gain the clarity, structure, and confidence needed to tackle complex challenges inside and outside of their organizations. As you venture into new territory, we’re the partners you can turn to when you need a clear pathway to bring your audacious ideas to life.

While we excel at crafting data-driven strategies and achieving results, we also understand that the journey is just as important as the destination. That's why we're equally focused on processes and outcomes. We believe that a strong strategy is inseparable from the culture and attitude of the team executing it. Our unique approach empowers organizations to develop confident leaders and collaborative environments, ensuring the journey toward your vision is just as remarkable as the destination.

Our offerings are designed to be as dynamic as your goals, and we leverage our comprehensive knowledge base, in conjunction with our multidisciplinary team, to develop unique solutions for your needs. Title: SVP Strategic Accounts, Founding Member
Description (2):
Typeface is the enterprise AI platform built for modern marketing teams.
We bring together your brand guidelines, AI agents, and enterprise-grade infrastructure so marketers can create, personalize, and activate campaigns at scale—without sacrificing brand consistency.

With Typeface, your brand becomes the foundation for content. The platform ingests your logos, fonts, colors, and tone of voice to ensure every asset—whether text, image, or video—feels authentically you. Your content library is automatically organized and searchable, making it easy to reuse what you have and generate what you need. A built-in brand agent evaluates content for governance and consistency, so every campaign is on-brand from the start.

Marketing workflows are reimagined with AI agents that plan, orchestrate, and execute campaigns across channels. A simple chat interface and visual canvas let teams create and refine content collaboratively, while connectors to email, web, and paid media tools streamline activation. Whether you’re building a campaign from scratch or optimizing an existing one, agents automate the heavy lifting so your teams can focus on creativity and strategy.

Enterprise readiness is at the core. Typeface is SOC II compliant, supports SSO, and offers cloud hosting options across major providers. We partner with leaders like Microsoft, Google, and Salesforce to integrate seamlessly into your stack. Security and governance are built in, with role-based access, isolated brand assets, and a responsible AI layer that ensures safe, high-quality outputs.

With Typeface, marketers get faster time to market, personalization at scale, and confidence that every piece of content is brand-safe, consistent, and impactful.
Headline: Founding Member @Typeface, Enterprise Generative AI | ex-GM @Adobe | McKinsey | Harvard MBA MPA-ID

Decision Desk HQ counts and reports votes.

In 2016 we became the first organization to successfully compete with the Associated Press to collect, analyze, and report election night in over 50 years. In addition to being the first organization to declare Donald Trump the winner of key states, DDHQ Executive Director Brandon Finnigan was the first election night analyst to call the 2016 presidential election for Republican Donald Trump. Finnigan made his call on the Buzzfeed/Twitter election night webcast (watched by over 6 million viewers).

In addition to our election night coverage, we provide daily campaign and election news and analysis at https://decisiondeskhq.com.

The Decision Desk HQ’s proprietary results collection and reporting technology, combined with a diverse stable of political and election experts enable us to speed the collection and reporting of accurate election results at any level from presidential to local school board.

Our investment in technology also enables us to distribute results quickly and in a variety of ways opening up the opportunity to have our results carried as widely as possible to sites large and small.

Results are made available free to sites on an ad-based model as well as via a customizable subscription-based plan.

Description: Obsessed with improving parental leave for everyone via @Parentaly_
Title: CEO and co-founder
Summary:
My entire adult life I’ve been hyper focused on my career - both ensuring that my current role is an exciting challenge, and that I’m on a path forward.

I got pregnant in 2017 with my first child and nearly quit a sales leadership role I loved - all because of the disruption my 3-month maternity leave caused.

It became obvious to me that there is a huge gap in how companies support working parents before, during and after parental leave without impacting their career trajectory.

I turned that realization into an opportunity to help other working parents avoid the issues I ran into, which brought me to where I am today: co-founder and CEO of Parentaly.
Description (2): Parentaly is a comprehensive parental leave support program that drives business continuity while creating a world-class employee experience. Through a combination of coaching, training and workshops we help employees (and their managers) build strong coverage plans, transition work effectively, navigate complicated career conversations and re-onboard efficiently after leave.
Headline: CEO at Parentaly | Parental leave expert and entrepreneur

Description: Founder/GP Near Horizon, Pres Jimini, former CBO Immunai, CUEO Guardant, CEO iSkoot, EVP loopt, Pres DChoc, SVP iXL, founder/CEO Small World Sports/Software
Title: Visiting Partner
Summary:
Mark has built and run companies at the forefront of new technologies for thirty years. In 1994, he founded Small World Sports, the world’s first online fantasy sports business, which he later sold to Paul Allen’s The Sporting News. In 1995, he spun out one of the world’s first web agencies, Small World Software, which he sold to iXL before its 1998 IPO.

In 2003, Trip Hawkins convinced Mark to move to the Bay Area to co-found Sequoia and Kleiner Perkins-backed mobile games pioneer Digital Chocolate. Mark was then recruited to join loopt as the “adult supervision” for Sam Altman (Sam didn’t need any supervision). Later, Vinod Khosla recruited Mark to run mobile VOIP pioneer iSkoot, which he sold to Qualcomm in 2010.

Mark spent four years as the Chief User Engagement Officer at Guardant Health, which raised more than $500M before its 2019 IPO, and was the CBO for Immunai, a world-leading AI-driven biotech operating at the intersection of machine learning and genomics that raised more than $300M during Mark’s tenure. In 2023, Mark co-founded Jimini Health, which is leveraging LLMs and cutting-edge science to develop radically more effective, engaging, and scalable mental health solutions.

In 2023, Mark co-founded Near Horizon to pioneer a new approach to venture building. Near Horizon partners with entrepreneurs at company formation to build AI-powered companies, providing both capital and hands-on help.

Mark has advised or invested in numerous startups, including Gerson Lehrman Group, Gusto, Elation EMR, Akash Network, SafeGraph, and Luminopia.

Mark earned his BA from Harvard, where he concentrated in Computer Science. He lives on the Stanford campus with his wife and two (adorable) daughters.

My goal is to continuously push the boundaries of what's possible in innovation enablement, aligning with Bonneville Labs' commitment to groundbreaking solutions and a culture that values dynamic, forward-thinking leadership.

Description (2):
MISSION
Bonneville Labs’ is creating a global life science ‘hard tech’ community empowered to go forward, faster.  We provide comprehensive and supported environments enabling companies to focus on discovery and outdistance the conventional.

BONNEVILLE LABS
There’s no need to start from square one. Bonneville Labs is an adaptable workspace that eliminates operational barriers and reduces the cost of development through shared services and pre-negotiated discounts. Backed by years of industry experience, we manage laboratories and services so members can focus on their science.

BONNEVILLE LABS COMMUNITY BENEFITS
Headquartered in Berkeley, California, Bonneville Labs features flexible lab space from single benches to dedicated suites, lab equipment, streamlined operational support that includes Environmental Health and Safety training and oversight, purchasing services, facilities support, meeting rooms, community lounges, kitchens, high-speed internet, and events.

BONNEVILLE COMMUNITY
Small teams don’t have to worry about the setup and maintenance costs of a traditional office. They can work like larger organizations at a fraction of the cost in a workspace that can accommodate their needs as they grow. Large companies looking to expand benefit from our streamlined workspace model - sidestepping the costs of building it out, operating it and the long-term liability - while gaining access to pioneering talent. Bonneville Labs’ dynamic environment facilitates cross-pollination while nurturing a unique bio-community that connects innovators from across the broader life sciences community.
Headline: Founder and CEO @ Bonneville Labs | Biochemistry, Synthetic Biology

Title: Professional EOS Implementer
Summary: I scaled one of my businesses to 8 figures in revenue using EOS, have hired and led hundreds of employees from front line workers to engineers to key executives, been a professional pool player and poker player, coached EO Accelerators, ran the EO Accelerator program, and have started and exited other enterprises along the way.If you are interested in implementing EOS throughout your organization, are coachable, and are willing to be open and honest with yourself, with your team and with me, I would be honored to be your guide on the journey.
Location Name: Los Angeles Metropolitan Area, United States
Description (2):
Let’s face it… if you’re running an entrepreneurial business, you’ve had your share of ups and downs. In fact, you may be facing a number of frustrations that keep you from realizing your business goals. Frustrations like:

-	Your business is controlling you instead of you controlling the business
-	You’re frustrated with your employees, customers, vendors, or partners
-	There’s just not enough profit
-	Business growth has stopped and you can’t seem to get to the next level
-	You’re spinning your wheels, nothing is working, and you need traction

EOS – The Entrepreneurial Operating System – is a business operating system designed to help you run a frustration-free organization and gain renewed energy, focus, excitement, and business growth.

EOS consists of timeless, practical, universal principles popularized by Gino Wickman in his best-selling book, Traction. It’s ideal for privately held entrepreneurial companies with 10 to 250 employees whose owners and leadership teams are ready and willing to address the Six Key Components of their business:

-	Vision
-	People
-	Data
-	Issues
-	Process
-	Traction

"To the degree you focus on strengthening these six components as leaders and managers, everything will fall into place. That will move your business into the top 5%.” -- Gino Wickman, founder of EOS

Today, EOS Tools are used by over 130,000 companies around the world and work in any entrepreneurial company – across all industries and business models.

Discover how to get everything you want from your business with EOS.

“If you’re just following all of these foundational tools, you’ll consistently know exactly what’s going on in your business, you’ll know where you’re going and why, and you’ll have more control.” – Rob Dube, co-founder of Image One

Download the EOS Tools for free: https://www.eosworldwide.com/eos-toolbox

To get a copy of Traction by Gino Wickman, visit https://www.eosworldwide.com/traction-book
Headline: EOS Implementer | Executive Coach

Org: ProSolution Private Clients - Holistic Financial Services
Enrich Company: ProSolution Private Clients - Holistic Financial Services
Address - Locations: Level 8, 31 Queen Street, Melbourne, Vic 3000, AU
Description (2):
Our goal is to help our clients achieve their financial and lifestyle goals by providing independent advice using evidenced-based financial strategies. Our ultimate reward is when our clients reflect upon the journey we have shared with them and they acknowledge the valuable advice we have provided along the way.

In short, helping you achieve your goals ultimately becomes our goals too.

HOW WE CAN WORK TOGETHER

Not everyone that needs independent advice has a lot of complexity. Most independent advisors attract clients that have a lot of complexity as they tend to pay higher fees. But we know that not everyone’s situation is complex. In fact, we value simplicity and we avoid ‘creating’ unnecessary complexity. Whilst we do have clients with a high degree of complexity, we can scale our advisory services to suit clients that have a relatively simple situation. Complexity is often the enemy of successful implementation.

Whilst our overarching goal is to help our clients achieve their financial and lifestyle goals, there are four key services we can draw upon at various stages of our relationship:

- Independent financial advice – our service is called Wealth Coach
- Mortgage broking and advice.
- Tax and accounting services specialising in automated accounting solutions for businesses, professionals and investors.
- Personal risk insurance advisory.
Headline: Partner | Business Advisory Services at ProSolution Private Clients - Holistic Financial Services

Title: Director of Operations & Finance
Summary:
I’m an operations and finance leader with deep roots in early-stage startups and mission-driven orgs, currently serving as Director of Finance at Edge City.

My specialty is building systems that make complex organizations run smoothly. Whether it’s untangling contributor payouts across multi-sigs, designing workflows for grant disbursement, setting up international compliance structures, or leading monthly closes, I’m the one you call when things are messy and need to just work.

I thrive at the intersection of:

Finance + ops: budgets, P&Ls, crypto + fiat workflows, payroll, tax compliance
Execution + strategy: legal structures, contracts, special projects

I’m endlessly curious, systems-minded, and calm under pressure. The kind of operator who can shift between setting up entity structures and figuring out where the power cords are for a last-minute event. I believe great ops makes great ideas possible, and understanding the numbers is essential to success.

Let’s connect if you’re into crypto ops (especially finops), operational clarity, or building ambitious things with integrity.

Title: Visionary & Partner
Summary:
See a problem, see the solution, and move fast by helping others first — that’s the through-line of everything I’ve built and will continue to build.

I became an entrepreneur with nothing but hope as the strategy. In my family, entrepreneurship meant instability, even failure. I left an executive role without a map, just conviction that there had to be something more.

What changed everything? The right content and the right community.

Entrepreneurial Leap clarified that entrepreneur isn’t what I do—it’s who I am. Rocket Fuel revealed the power of the Visionary + Integrator partnership. EOS gave my teams the operating system to scale, and EOS Life defined what success should feel like. Shine and the 10 Disciplines provided the daily practices to actually live it.


Carried by that wisdom, and by the entrepreneurs who shared it, I’m focused on giving it back 1000x more.

I founded Next Level Revenue (NLR) - to once and for all modernize entrepreneurial and small business Marketing & Sales. I authored a book, built a self-managing company, and can confidently say I have the business of my dreams.

I became Visionary of ENRG (Entrepreneurial Networking Resource Group) to be the community for the Entrepreneurial Path to Mastery: the place to find the who’s and the how’s so no one travels the journey alone.

I also co-founded Entrepreneurial Media Company (EMC) to preserve and promote the world’s best entrepreneurial content for the next 100 years. Our acquisition strategy is simple: invest, not interfere, protecting and amplifying the content entrusted to us for generations to come.

I don’t know what story the historians will write, but I know this: we’re fighting for entrepreneurs to win—today and for the next century.
Description (2):
Entrepreneurial Media Company (EMC) is a service company dedicated to preserving and promoting the world’s best entrepreneurial content for the next 100 years.

We are not a holding company. Our acquisition strategy is simple: invest, not interfere. We partner with founders to ensure their life’s work is protected, amplified, and enduring.

What sets EMC apart is our ability to elevate content through media. We bring entrepreneurial frameworks and stories to new audiences by expanding into digital platforms, podcasts, streaming, live events, and publishing. By combining preservation with modern distribution, we make proven entrepreneurial wisdom more accessible and more impactful than ever before.
Our vision is to build an enduring home for entrepreneurial wisdom — one that transforms lives and creates lasting value far beyond one EBITDA maximization event.

 Follow EMC to learn how we’re protecting and promoting entrepreneurial content for generations to come.
Headline: Visionary & Partner, Entrepreneurial Media Company | Visionary, ENRG | Founder, Next Level Revenue

Description: My tweets are my own views
Title: Co-Founder and CEO
Summary:
I am the CEO and Co-Founder of DAS (Digital Agriculture Services), an Australian based, globally focused fintech focused on agriculture, operating at the intersection of digital transformation, nature-based peril and global food security.

Over 5+ years, we have grown DAS – a startup born out of a partnership with CSIRO – into a product-focused technology company accelerating innovation across the entire agri-enterprise ecosystem, with a particular focus on how financial services materially transforms the way it lends, insures, invests and allocates capital in a dynamic climate.

The idea for DAS was hatched while standing in the middle of a cotton field in 2017. Our vision: to transform how decisions were made in the businesses surrounding agriculture for a safer, more resilient, more prosperous, more sustainable world. Today, DAS has evolved to meet an acute area of need: location intelligence for decision makers holding direct, long-lasting relationships with farmland owners.

I have always worked at the intersection of strategy, global innovation and transformation: first at Procter & Gamble; later in Singapore for more than a decade with PwC and IBM; and then as President of a software company which was later acquired by Accenture. At Accenture I held the role of Managing Director, Strategy, where my remit for global innovation focused on the agribusiness, energy and mining sectors. During my 4+ years at Accenture, I started up and led the firm’s Digital Agriculture Services practice for Australia and New Zealand.

Born in country Australia, I spent most of my childhood in rural communities before moving to Melbourne and working regionally and globally. Outside of work, I am a family man and adventurer who bicycled solo from Kathmandu to London.
Description (2):
We’re on a mission to build the best SaaS company dedicated to financial services and agri-enterprise.

DAS is a technology company that delivers location intelligence for financial services and enterprises, with a unified system of data, insights, software and CRM integrations. We are a new kind of technology company. A product-focused fintech, we are accelerating innovation across the entire agri-enterprise ecosystem.
Headline: Co-Founder and CEO, DAS (Digital Agriculture Services)

Title: Author
Summary:
Sahil Bloom is the New York Times Bestselling author of The 5 Types of Wealth: A Transformative Guide to Design Your Dream Life.

Sahil is an inspirational writer and entrepreneur, captivating millions of people every week through his book, social insights, and bi-weekly newsletter, The Curiosity Chronicle.

His debut non-fiction book, The 5 Types of Wealth, was an instant New York Times, USA Today, and Sunday Times Bestseller. Apple CEO Tim Cook called it "a powerful call to action to think deeply about what lights you up—and a guide for how to build a life of meaning and purpose around those things." The book is a unique blend of strategies, tactics, and actionable insights, enabling readers to make real, positive changes and lead healthier, wealthier lives.

Sahil is also an entrepreneur and owner of SRB Holdings, a personal holding company, and the Managing Partner of SRB Ventures, a $10 million venture investment firm committed to investing in and accelerating the most compelling startups in the world. Prior to launching SRB Ventures in January 2022, Sahil was an early-stage investor in 40+ startups across the technology landscape, including multiple unicorns.

Previously, Sahil spent seven years as a private equity investor and served on the board of several middle market companies during that period.

Sahil graduated from Stanford University with an M.A. in Public Policy (2014) and a B.A. in Economics & Sociology (2013). While at Stanford, he was a four-year member on the Stanford Baseball Team (2009-2013), twice helping to guide the team to NCAA Super Regional appearances (top-16 finishes). Additionally, Sahil earned two PAC-12 All-Academic Team awards and twice received the Bruce R. Cameron Memorial Award, given annually to a student-athlete exhibiting excellence in athletics, academics, and leadership. Academically, Sahil was advised in his pursuits by former Secretary of State Dr. Condoleezza Rice.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Description (2):
Our mission is to ignite a universal passion for reading by creating books for everyone. We believe that books, and the stories and ideas they hold, have the unique capacity to connect us, change us, and carry us toward a better future for generations to come.

Penguin Random House, the world’s largest trade book publisher, employs more than 11,000 people globally. With more than 300 imprints and brands on six continents, Penguin Random House comprises adult and children’s fiction and nonfiction print and digital English- German- and Spanish-language trade book publishing businesses in more than 20 countries worldwide.

With over 16,000 new titles, and more than 700 million print, audio and eBooks sold annually, Penguin Random House’s publishing lists include more than 80 Nobel Prize laureates and hundreds of the world’s most widely read authors.

Penguin Random House was formed on July 1, 2013, upon the completion of an agreement between Bertelsmann and Pearson to merge their respective trade publishing companies. As of April 1, 2020, Bertelsmann is full owner of the company.

Visit http://global.penguinrandomhouse.com/
Headline: NYT Bestselling Author of The 5 Types of Wealth

Description: CEO & Founder, @LayerOneGroup | Former @ProsekPR, @EdelmanPR & @USNavy Reserve
Title: CEO & Founder
Summary:
Joe Scannell is the CEO & Founder of Layer One Group, a specialized communications and advisory firm with expertise in emerging technology and financial services. With more than a decade of agency experience at Edelman and Prosek Partners, Joe has worked with hundreds of clients across a broad range of sectors and issues.

As a senior leader at Prosek and Edelman, Joe specialized in advising clients on strategic communications, including media relations, digital and social media marketing, executive positioning, thought leadership, and reputation management. He also advised executives on communications strategy during special situations, including M&A, IPOs, restructurings, shareholder activism, leadership transitions, and other issue-specific engagements.

Some of his clients have included PayPal, Citadel, Invesco, The Carlyle Group, CME Group, Stellar Development Foundation, GSR, and Circle.

Joe spent six years as a commissioned officer in the United States Navy Reserve, serving as a Public Affairs Officer (PAO) at the rank of Lieutenant, supporting the Navy’s Public Affairs Headquarters at the Pentagon.

He has also spent time working in different industries across the country, including a tech startup in Silicon Valley and in the nonprofit industry at the American Lung Association and the United Service Organization (USO).

Joe holds a Master’s degree in Public Relations & Corporate Communications from Georgetown University, a Bachelor’s degree in English from Marquette University and has completed coursework from Harvard Business School’s Executive Education program.

Description (2):
Wandering Bear delivers smooth, strong cold brew on tap to homes and offices.

We’re proud to say that we were the first to realize that putting cold brew coffee in a box with a tap was a really cool idea. Keeping our cold brew fresh was always a challenge when we brewed at home. So we eliminated the two things that make coffee go stale: air and light. Now you can have a personal tap in your home or office fridge. Push a button, customize and enjoy.

Title: President
Summary:
I am in the business of helping people live epic lives.

I'm a personal injury lawyer with a real passion is in life improvement.

The core focus of our law firm is "To Build a Business Where People Can Thrive."

What does this mean?

For our employees, it means that we focus on providing goal-setting advice, achievement, and coaching directed at achieving their one-year and ten-year aims.

For my clients, it means that because I've got employees who are fulfilled and have a sense of mission at the firm, my clients receive best-in-class customer service.  We pay attention to all of the little details, which is why we have over 260 five-star google reviews.

Two things happen as a result.

One, like most lawyers, all of our best cases come from referrals.  How many times have you talked to a potential new client who couldn't remember who represented them five years ago in their last case.  That doesn't happen here.  We receive more referrals from former clients and from other lawyers and medical providers because we do such a great job of the customer service/personal side of being your lawyer.

The second result is selfish.  You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.  I don't want to spend time with a bunch of losers who don't have life goals outside of the office or who just go home to binge watch netflix!  I want my people to live exciting, fulfilling lives outside of the office, chasing their own big goals.  Because it energizes me to hear about their wins and drives me to bigger goals of my own!
Address - Locations: 3998 Fair Ridge Dr, Ste 250, Fairfax County, Virginia 22033, US
Description (2):
We continually push against the “old” ways of practicing law, and the stereotypes most people have about personal injury lawyers. Our firm is nationally recognized for our out-of-the-box thinking about how legal services should be delivered.

For personal injury clients, our proven process starts with a 1-on-1 consultation and strategy session. After that, we’ll gather all the relevant information—records, police reports, bills, etc.—and notify the insurance company to never contact you again. You can expect frequent follow-up calls, and can contact us any time for real, honest answers to your questions.

For long-term disability clients, we’ll review your denial letter for free. Our disability team will read every page of your claim file, conduct independent vocational analyses if the insurance company “finds” jobs you can do, and handle every aspect of your appeal. If that appeal is denied, we’ll file a lawsuit and fight for you in court.

No matter what, you owe BenGlassLaw nothing if you don’t make a recovery. There’s no risk to you. That’s our guarantee.
Headline:
Lawyer Helping Lawyers Build Firms They Love
 Raising Three Boys
 Largest DUI Punitive Verdict in VA History

Title: Environmental Scientist/GIS Analyst/CAD Designer
Summary:
For more than a decade Mr. Wharton has performed an extensive amount of bioassessment data collection and modeling throughout the United States, from coastal bays and estuaries to marine habitats and freshwater lakes and streams. Mr. Wharton has gained recognition as an expert in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) over the years developing custom applications for clients across the country that meet the needs of an increasingly digital world. His modeling and environmental sciences background provides him a solid foundation in understanding the various components of ecological communities and how they translate to overall habitat quality and human health. Mr. Wharton also has a well-rounded knowledge of the various tools used for today’s environmental assessment practices from hands on in-the-field equipment to statistical (Python, Arcade, Power BI, etc.) and geographic information systems (GIS, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Pro, etc.). He has managed and developed custom watershed models for states and counties across the U.S. and has aided in the maintenance of large metadata databases of both natural and human health environments.

Mr. Wharton understands the rapidly evolving nature of the digital world and the tools that are changing the way science is implemented. This change has made digital tools and programs essential to the 21st century scientist, such as GIS, GPS, AutoCAD, smartphone application development, digital field forms and host of other wifi enabled devices. Mr. Wharton has stayed on the cutting edge of these technologies and has been able to implement many of them into projects for both the private and public sectors. He is also able to utilize this skill set to transfer into the industrial and construction environment, helping clients to meet environmental management goals and regulations, while still understanding the need to adhere to engineering best practices and monetary constraints.

Summary:
I've been a curious person for as long as I can remember.  I have memories of taking toys apart as a child and then trying my best to put them back together, usually with a 50% success rate.  Learning about how things work has been a passion of mine from a young age even up until this day.

In my professional career, I've used that curiosity to focus on strategy, leadership, and execution.  If you can create a strategy, lead a team of talented individuals, and chart a roadmap to execution, you can accomplish anything.  I've found that most transformation failures are due to a lack of strategy, leadership, or execution.

I specialize in data & analytics.  Data is a powerful enabler of business strategy.  Being able to identify the value of data and potential monetization use cases is a business-critical skill set.  I've spent my career building data products that drive business outcomes that have economic value.

There exists a large skills gap with data leaders.  My goal is to help fill that gap by providing insights into the lessons that I've learned throughout my career.  I aim to help data professionals in all phases of their career journey (new to the role, mid-career, seasoned professional, senior leaders, etc..).

Title: President
Summary:
I grew up in a small beach town outside New York City and moved to New Orleans to study psychology at Loyola University. It was during these years I became fascinated with the psychology of business and coaching—skills that have remained core to everything I’ve built since.

After graduating with honors, I was touring in a band when my car broke down. To fund the repairs, I took a job selling coupons door-to-door for a direct sales company. That detour turned into the beginning of my entrepreneurial journey.

Once ready, I opened my first business, coaching people to run their own outsourced sales and marketing firms. We acquired customers for some of the largest companies on the planet, and through relentless work, referrals, and mentorship, I expanded the business to 15 countries worldwide.

Over the years, I’ve directly trained more than 1,000 entrepreneurs—teaching them to run their companies, unlock their potential, and scale with confidence. Along the way, I’ve helped create dozens of millionaires, both through sales and later at Carbon6.

That same passion led me to co-found Carbon6, an Amazon SaaS platform built to empower marketplace sellers. We began by acquiring best-in-class point solutions and evolved into one of the most powerful platforms in the space. The company’s growth and impact ultimately led to a $210 million exit to SPS Commerce (Nasdaq: SPSC).

Along the way, I’ve become an angel investor, backing founders and products that push boundaries across e-commerce, fintech, and frontier markets. I’m currently in stealth mode with a new venture that will be announced soon—designed to solve a big, audacious problem I’ve been obsessed with for years.

As an investor, entrepreneur, international business owner, and motivational speaker, I’ve had the privilege of living and working around the world. One of the things I’m proudest of is helping raise over $5 billion for charities through face-to-face fundraising campaigns run by thousands of reps across the U.S.

You are the author of your own story. I challenge you to write one bigger than you ever thought possible.

—Justin Cobb
Location Name: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
Description (2):
Justin Charles Cobb is an American investor, international business owner, entrepreneur and motivational speaker. He grew up in a small beach town outside of New York City and in 1997 he moved to New Orleans to study psychology at Loyola University. It was during these years Cobb became interested in the psychology of business and coaching and these skills are something that have stuck with him throughout his career.

After graduating with honors Cobb started working alongside an entrepreneur as an intern in his direct sales company. Starting out at the very bottom Cobb did field sales throughout the North-east of America. He credits this time as giving him the life-long skills to teach and develop other individuals.

“Ask any great entrepreneur, they have all done sales at some point. You hear some people say sometimes that they aren’t sales people or that they aren’t cut out for sales. The reality is that business is sales…it is how a customer base and revenue is generated. It doesn’t matter what field you end up in, whatever the business, you’re going to have to learn to sell something whether it is a product or a service if you are going to become an entrepreneur. The skills I learned have shaped me as a business owner.”

After learning a wide range of skills working alongside business owners with much more experience, Cobb was keen to learn the ins and outs of business ownership on a more practical level. In 2004 Cobb started his first company in Charlotte, North Carolina. That company grew rapidly and in 2005 Cobb expanded his business to a further 7 cities in the southeast of America representing industry giants like the Atlanta Braves, Hilton Hotels, Papa John’s pizza and Blockbuster Video. The unprecedented results they were delivering for those clients starting gaining them international attention and Cobb always had the intention of expanding overseas.
Headline: Helping Entrepreneurs Take Control Of Their Success | Motivational Speaker | Former Chairman and Co-Founding CEO of Carbon6 Technologies - Exit to SPS Commerce for $210m

Description: 21 year old Climate Justice Activist. Otomi-Toltec. Co-Founder of @Re1nitiative organizer with @fridays4future 🌎 🇲🇽 @penn’24 @TIME 100Next
Title: Advisor
Summary:
Xiye Bastida, is a 23-year-old Indigenous climate justice activist. She is TIME100 Next, and holds the UN Spirit Award.

With roots in the Otomi-Toltec Indigenous community in Central Mexico, she has been actively involved in organizing climate strikes with Fridays For Future since 2019, co-organizing the largest youth-led march in New York City with over 300,000 participants.

In 2020, she co-founded the Re-Earth Initiative, focusing on providing resources and knowledge to frontline communities. Re-Earth Initiative has members in over 26 countries, and is fully youth-led.

Xiye's advocacy led her to address 40 world leaders at the Biden Climate Summit in 2021 and close the World Leaders Summit at COP26, emphasizing the importance of climate justice, youth engagement, and a just transition. Both speeches gained virality for their directness and clarity. She now serves as an ambassador to the United Nations High Level Champions.

Her powerful words and storytelling have led her to take stage at the Nobel Prize Summit, VOGUE, TED, Global Citizens, Bloomberg Philanthropies, The World Economic Forum, Columbia University, TIME Summit, the New York Times, Women Moving Millions, Ibero, TEC de Monterrey, YouTube, Clinton Global Initiative, among others.

Xiye has been in the Jury of the ANDAM Prize, Global Choices, and is a nominator of the Earthshot Prize.

Her interest in sustainable fashion have led her to collaborate with pioneering designers. She has been in two Vogue covers, and was recognized by Harper’s Bazzar as one of their 22 Icons. She walked during New York Fashion Week for Gabriela Hearst, and has been a loud advocate for climate justice in the fashion industry.

She also serves as a Fossil Fuel Non-Proliferation Treaty Champion and a Climate Governance Commissioner. Xiye authored the first chapter of the "All We Can Save Anthology.”

In 2023, she was named ELLE Woman of the Year.

Xiye is an honor's student at the University of Pennsylvania  studying disadvantaged communities in New York City.

Additionally, she is the Executive Producer in the upcoming Feature Film, The Way of the Whale.
Location Name: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
Description (2): Re-Earth Initiative is a youth-led international NGO on a mission to make the  climate movement accessible to all. We want to break the echo chamber and bring climate action to the masses, by hosting informational webinars and writing toolkits. Our core team comprises members from all over the world, and we have over 300 volunteers spanning 40 countries!
Headline: Climate Activist | Co-Founder and Executive Director @ Re-Earth Initiative | TIME100Next, Planetary Guardian, TED Speaker

CocoKids is a nonprofit organization governed by a volunteer Board of Directors. Our mission is to champion and advance quality child care and early education.

Now in its 42nd  year, Cocokids offers expertise and exemplary programs and services to children, families, early educators and communities. With offices in Richmond, Concord and Antioch, it is at the center of the child care delivery system so that parents can work and children are ready for success in school.

CocoKids provides free or low cost programs designed to support and empower parents and child care providers so that children, families, businesses and communities benefit. Services include:

•Free child care referrals, including infant/toddler care, preschools and after-school care

•Parent education and resources to help families make the best child care choices

•Financial assistance to low income working families to make quality child care services more accessible

•Child health, nutrition and safety education

•Training and development to help child care providers build their businesses and provide quality, age-appropriate care

Title: Executive Director
Summary:
Exclusive human milk feedings are the gold standard of care for preterm infants. Human milk is an amazing and dynamic fluid that has been evolving for millions of years. Thousands of important molecular structures, which cannot be replicated, serve protective and nutritive functions. In the absence of mother's own milk, pasteurized donor human milk improves infant outcomes and saves lives.

Visit www.milkbankwgl.org

Specialties: NICU lactation, human milk research, outpatient lactation management, public speaking and outreach
Org: Mothers' Milk Bank of the Western Great Lakes
Enrich Company: Mothers' Milk Bank of the Western Great Lakes
Address - Locations: 560 Bonnie Ln, Elk Grove Village, Illinois 60007, US
Description (2):
Mothers' Milk Bank of the Western Great Lakes saves tiny lives by collecting, pasteurizing, and dispensing donor human milk to premature babies and pediatric patients. As a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit member of the Human Milk Banking Association of North America, we are proud to serve over 90 hospitals and hundreds of families throughout Wisconsin and Illinois.

When a baby is born, so is a mother. But sometimes, it doesn’t go the way everyone expects it to. More often than you might realize moms give birth early, have complications, or lose their baby in childbirth or shortly after.

Those women aren’t just moms...they’re, well, heroes. But even the best superheroes need a sidekick.

That’s why we’re here. The Mother’s Milk Bank of the Western Great Lakes was created to harness the power of donor human milk to heal and support those who need it most. We exist to serve premature and critically-ill babies, chronically-ill middle- and low-income children, and the moms who make our work possible.

We deploy top-of-the-line health screenings and technology to ensure the milk that reaches our tiny babies and critically-ill kids delivers the best nutrition possible. We accept donations from moms at any stage of their breastfeeding journeys, including those who have lost the baby they so wanted.

Our goal? Not to leap tall buildings or fly through the air – but perhaps even more impressive, to supply every family in Illinois and Wisconsin who needs it with this life-saving milk.
Headline: Executive Director at Mothers' Milk Bank of the Western Great Lakes

Title: Chief Medical Officer
Summary:
Kim Boyd, MD has helped lead and found some of the most innovative brands in healthcare. She began her startup career as an early leader at One Medical and after establishing the Chicago market, she became the company’s first National Medical Director (ultimately overseeing the care of over 250,000 patients). Kim was also the Medical Director at Galileo and Nurx, and the Chief Medical Officer at Calibrate (where she built the program that has reached >40k people and led through the raise of >$160M) and Caire. In addition to successfully co-founding a cutting-edge longevity company, over her career she has also acted as an advisor to numerous innovative health startups.

For the last six years, Kim has worked with more than seventy of the world’s best scientists and researchers in women’s health, metabolic health,  longevity, and performance to build novel models of care that include emerging testing and therapeutics as well as comprehensive programming.

A former national team gymnast, Kim was Phi Beta Kappa and an Academic All-American at Stanford University. After winning a Medical Scholars award for medicine and the humanities at Stanford Medical School, she became board-certified in Family Medicine and completed an Integrative Medicine Fellowship through the Andrew Weil Center for Integrative Medicine at the University of Arizona. Kim lives in Boulder with her husband, kids, and rascal dog.

Adrienne Rees is Managing Partner and Chief Investment Officer at The Equity Alliance. She comes to The Equity Alliance with 15 years of investment experience spanning venture capital, private equity, and M&A.

As CIO of The Equity Alliance, she leads the firm’s fund and direct investment strategy, focusing on delivering strong financial returns for investors while fostering an investment ecosystem where diverse perspectives drive greater opportunities, competitive returns, and inclusive economic growth.

Prior to joining The Equity Alliance, Adrienne was a Director at Walton Enterprises, where she developed curated investment strategies to achieve family member goals ranging from financial return and growth to social impact and ecosystem enablement.  Before Walton Enterprises, Adrienne spent six years leading M&A transactions at Summit Materials, a company formed in 2009 with backing from The Blackstone Group to acquire and grow companies in the heavy-side construction materials sector.

Adrienne began her career in New York City where she spent time as an investment banker covering financial institutions at BMO Capital Markets and as a private equity investor at Lightyear Capital. She holds both a BS in Finance and a MS in Finance from the University of Denver.

Adrienne is originally from Colorado and is passionate about spending time outdoors. You can often find her in places where there are mountains to ski, trails to bike, or waves to surf.

Description: Food justice advocate. Enjoy talking about food hubs and benefit corporations.  Favorite veggie: kohlrabi for days.
Title: Aspen Food Leaders Fellow
Summary:
We have a food system in America that is fundamentally broken - or, more accurately, working exactly as designed which involves allowing for and rewarding externalities.  Our planet is (quite literally) on fire, threatening our food production, processing, and distribution systems.  Those systems have been built upon a model that too often is extractive and oppressive, benefiting the few at the expense of the many.  Our collective future will be determined by whether or not these systems can evolve.

4P Foods is a leader in the next generation of food distribution. Our core values - People, Purpose, Planet, Prosperity - are reflected in our mission to help build healthy food communities. Every week, we connect our community in the Mid-Atlantic to Good Food from small family farms with sustainable management practices.

My life's work is focused on building a new food system that can combat climate change and systemic extraction through a new model of Regeneration. I am passionate about new forms and structures of business metrics that factor in true cost accounting - the impact on people and the environment.  I am a tireless advocate for food equity and am part of the movement to make fresh foods accessible to all.

I invite you to join me in this journey to help build a better food system of tomorrow. Contact me to begin a conversation and join our good food community at 4pfoods.com.
Org: Food and Society at Aspen Institute
Enrich Company: Food and Society at Aspen Institute
Address - Locations: 2300 S Street NW, Washington, DC 20037, US
Description (2): We bring together public health leaders, policymakers, farmers, chefs, food makers, and entrepreneurs to find practical solutions to food system challenges.
Headline: Founder of 4P Foods - A Benefit Corporation

Description: @ProtocolLabs Eng + Research WG Lead & @_FilOz CEO building #Web3 + @Filecoin. Former @IPFS Project Lead & (A)PM on #GoogleClassroom
Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
I lead the Protocol Dev, Product Dev, and Research Dev teams at Protocol Labs.

Our work includes protocol design and development for the *IPFS Project* (a peer-to-peer network and protocol designed to make the web faster, safer, and more open), which powers a massive community of >10K developers serving millions of monthly active users. Organizations like Opera, Ethereum, Brave, Microsoft, OpenSea and Cloudflare are betting on IPFS, and hundreds of nascent community-owned projects like Audius, Fleek, Textile, Qri, and more are building their businesses with IPFS. Together, we're baking new properties like individual agency, local-first collaboration, and disaster resilience into the internet - humanity's most important resource.

Our work also includes protocol design and development for the *Filecoin Network* (a distributed storage marketplace to preserve humanity’s information) - including research, proofs, core protocol enhancements, cryptoeconomics, infra, & development for the Lotus reference implementation. Our two key focuses for 2021 are building in programmability into Filecoin via support for EVM smart contracts, and making it quick and easy to store large public data on Filecoin.

We also contribute to important underlying protocols like *libp2p* (a modular p2p networking library used by IPFS, Filecoin, Ethereum, Polkadot, & many others), *IPLD* (the content addressed data model of web3, and *Drand* (a distributed randomness beacon run by the League of Entropy).
Description (2):
FilOz is an independent public good Filecoin protocol design and development team in the Filecoin Network working on protocol improvements and security.

FilOz aims to maintain credibly neutral core implementations and support and grow the vibrant open-source Filecoin research and developer community.
Headline: Protocol Labs Engineering & Research Lead + FilOz CEO

Built by a data team for data teams, Atlan is the active metadata platform for the modern data stack. It stitches together metadata from various sources (Snowflake, dbt, Databricks, Looker, Tableau, Postgres, etc.) to create a unified data discovery, cataloging, lineage, and governance experience across all your data assets, from columns and queries to metrics and dashboards. Atlan facilitates a two-way movement of metadata, bringing context back into the tools and workflows that your data team uses every day — for example, in your BI tool when you wonder what a metric on the dashboard means.

A pioneer in the space, Atlan has been named a Visionary in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data and Analytics Governance Platforms and a Leader and the only Customer Favorite in The Forrester Wave: Data Governance Solutions, Q3 2025. Atlan was also recognized by Gartner seven times in 2021, including as a Cool Vendor in DataOps and in the inaugural Market Guide for Active Metadata Management. Today, we power data democratization and AI-readiness at companies like General Motors, Cisco, Autodesk, Unilever, Ralph Lauren, FOX, News Corp, Nasdaq, NextGen, Plaid, and HubSpot. We recently raised a $105M Series C, backed by top investors including GIC, Insight Partners, Sequoia Capital India, and Salesforce Ventures.

Plymouth was born out of a personal struggle with US Immigration. In 2020, I woke up to find out that I wasn’t selected for the H-1B lottery and faced the reality that I would have to leave the United States. During COVID, I spent hundreds of hours trawling through Reddit pages and legal sites, trying to understand layers of immigration bureaucracy. I felt rejected and exhausted.

At my lowest, the immigrant community stepped in to help. A fellow immigrant introduced me to the O1 pathway and another friend explained that writing articles could count toward the application. I ended up firing one of the world’s biggest immigration firms and hiring a personal attorney to work with me on my case. When I eventually received the O1, I decided I wanted to help others navigate this path — Plymouth was born. Please note I am not an attorney, and Plymouth Street is not a law firm.
Address - Locations: 1841 Market Street, APT 1, SAN FRANCISCO, CA 94103, US

Description: Storyteller-actor nourishing elderly @heartofdinner + incubating inclusive storytelling @88cupsoftea. You can catch me on @gossipgirl as Nelly Yuki ❤️
Title: Cofounder
Summary:
New York born and raised actor, storyteller, and community cultivator, Yin Chang is a curator engaged in creative, culture-shifting acts, at the nexus is centering and uplifting people and communities that replace intolerance and despair with inclusion and love.

Chang began her career in entertainment as an actor and made her entryway into producing and directing through a social justice focused short film igniting conversation about bullying and suicide prevention, becoming one of the most-watched short films shining light on the epidemic through a lens of empathy. Conjointly, she developed digital toolkits distributed through one of America’s leading bullying prevention centers to bolster free resources and access for students, parents, and schools nationwide.

As an actor in popular mainstream media, Chang opened up a long overdue conversation about Asian-American representation in Hollywood. Experiencing the lack of representation throughout her decades-long career in television and film, she launched online platform 88 Cups of Tea in 2015 to amplify diverse voices, nurturing creative writers to write themselves into the heroes of their own stories. 88 Cups of Tea’s podcast arm ranked in Apple's top 15 Literature & Arts podcasts, and featured in Apple’s top 20 Asian and Pacific American voices.

Dubbed ‘NYC Empathy Broker’, Chang founded Heart of Dinner alongside life partner Moonlynn Tsai at the onset of Covid-19, a non-profit that supports small businesses while countering the isolation and food insecurity within NYC’s underserved and homebound Asian elderly communities with weekly deliveries of warm messages and culturally thoughtful meals; and doing so in intentional ways that bridge gaps and build community across all cultures and backgrounds. As of Fall 2022, Heart of Dinner has provided over 130,000 free meals.

Chang's efforts have been lauded by Time, Vogue, NBC and ABC News, Ellen, Oprah Magazine, and she was named Glamour's Woman of the Year; NYC Food Policy Center's "40 Under 40"; and is a recipient of the Pride & Joy Award of THEM’s inaugural Now Awards 2022.
Location Name: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
Address - Locations: 31 Howard Street, #404, New York, New York 10013, US
Description (2):
Heart of Dinner reduces food insecurity, social isolation, and loneliness among Asian American older adults living in under-resourced and underinvested communities. The founders, Yin Chang & Moonlynn Tsai, united by their life partnership and mutual empathy, channeled their late-night discussions about COVID-19's global impact and the heightened racism towards Asian Americans into a proactive mission of addressing the long-standing community issues that were further exacerbated by the pandemic.

The organization's journey began in March 2020, initially involving community research and outreach. This led to their first significant milestone on April 1st, 2020, cooking culturally thoughtful hot lunches in their ~300sq. ft. NYC apartment. These meals, paired with handwritten notes in the Elders' languages, aimed to provide holistic nourishment of the body, mind, and soul.

Reacting to community needs, the founders rapidly expanded their offerings to include fresh groceries alongside meals and notes. Curating items beloved in Asian immigrant households, this enabled Elders to cook their preferred meals at home, supporting autonomy and respecting cultural dietary habits.

The handwritten notes evolved & expanded into adorning hand-illustrated brown bags, each a work of art symbolizing the love and thought in each home delivery. These bags served as visual and emotional reminders of care and connection, addressing the dual challenges of food insecurity and isolation.

With increasing support, Heart of Dinner broadened its impact across NYC, providing over 200,000 meals by Summer 2024. Transitioning from an emergency response relief effort, Heart of Dinner operated under the fiscal sponsor Edward Charles Foundation from 2020 to 2022 before it began to officially operate as a 501c3 public charity in 2023. Actively deepening their roots in NYC & preparing for scale, Heart of Dinner continues to seek support through donations at heartofdinner.org.
Headline: Storyteller, Social Entrepreneur, Community Cultivator

Description: Leadership coach obsessed with flow state and life design! Creator Foundations of Inner Power course. Co-host Results May Vary Podcast. Angel investor.
Title: CEO - Founder
Summary:
I coach C-suite executives and rising stars from the earliest startups to Fortune 100 companies. My practice helps ambitious leaders achieve their ideal vision for their trajectory through development of keen emotional intelligence, executive presence, their power and influence to reach remarkable results. To help people scale their roles as they scale teams, I work with them to tap into new sources of energy, find their flow, and expand their personal capacity while maintaining balance and happiness.

In order for people to execute their vision, they need power. It's a term that many shy away from because it seems controlling or ego-driven. It doesn't have to be. Power stems from sharp self-awareness, expressing your authentic self, and taking pride in both your skills and your ability to learn. As a coach, I seek to draw out and cultivate each of these areas to maximize people's power -- power to change, to do what inspires them, to get rewarded for their work.

With significant training and experience in law, neuro-linguistics and technology, I apply leading-edge coaching techniques to help clients improve their communication skills, identify how they want to accelerate their growth, and design a program tailored to their needs and goals. Running a practice based in both the Bay Area and New York City, I've worked closely with leaders at organizations like Airbnb, Facebook, Refinery29, Stanford Business School, and The New York Times.

"Everyone I know who has used Katia's coaching services raves about her.  Katia is extremely smart, direct and efficient with her clients'​ time, and has a deep understanding of organizational dynamics. She is clearly a person of exceptional honesty and integrity, she also understands the organizational world as it is and does a wonderful job of helping her clients become even more successful."

Our new membership platform — AS Edge — gives you the tools, insights, and community to make sustainability stick. It’s designed to help professionals and businesses Outsource the Overwhelm by putting all your sustainability learning, intelligence and peer support in one place.

Title: Board Of Directors
Summary:
Sumaiya Balbale currently serves on the Board of Directors of Shake Shack (SHAK). She is an experienced, multi-functional startup to scale up operator, with a proven track record and passion for building and leading businesses.

Previously, Sumaiya was COO & Operating Partner at Sequoia Capital where she led the GTM platform team for the firm. In her role, she oversaw the creation and operations of Arc, Sequoia's seed stage sourcing and company building program, led Talent, Marketing, Communications, Partnerships, Scouts, IR and more. She also has been a guest lecturer for Stanford’s dydx program since 2023.

Prior to joining Sequoia, she was the Vice President of E-commerce, Mobile and Digital Marketing for Walmart US from January 2017 to February 2019.  In her role, she helped deliver two consecutive years of +40% growth for Walmart’s e-commerce business and was a key member of the senior executive team that led the digital acceleration and transformation of the retail giant, resulting in over $80B in market cap growth in just two years.  In addition to evolving the e-commerce business, Sumaiya also led the transformation of the digital media, social media, marketing analytics and marketing technology capabilities of the broader omnichannel organization.

Sumaiya joined Walmart after the retailer purchased Jet.com in September 2016. An early member of the Jet team, she led all consumer marketing for the startup including brand, acquisition and retention efforts. In addition to acquiring over 5M customers and growing the Jet business to a $1B run rate in its first 12 months, she also created award-winning advertising for the brand, which won the Cannes Media Grand Prix in 2017. Sumaiya served as VP of Marketing and CMO at Jet from September 2014 through October 2017.

Prior to Jet, she held multiple leadership roles at Quidsi, including GM of Diapers.com and Casa.com.  As general manager, she oversaw the P&L of the business and led marketing, merchandising and supply chain for the e-commerce verticals.  Quidsi was acquired by Amazon in late 2010.  Before venturing into eCommerce, Sumaiya spent time as a brand strategist and account planner in advertising, working at FCB and Deutsch for clients such as IKEA, Novartis, and SC Johnson.

Sumaiya is a graduate of Harvard Business School and Brown University. She was named one of Fortune’s 40 under 40 in 2018. She has been a featured speaker at industry leading conferences including Fortune’s Most Powerful Women: Next Generation, Advertising Week, Seneca Women’s Forum, and Ad Age.

Description (2):
Shake Shack sprouted from a hot dog cart in Madison Square Park (NYC) to support the Madison Square Park Conservancy’s first art installation. The cart was quite the success, with Shack fans lined up daily for three summers.

In 2004, a permanent kiosk opened in the park: Shake Shack was born. This modern day “roadside” burger stand serves up the most delicious burgers, hot dogs, frozen custard, shakes, beer, wine and more. An instant neighborhood fixture, we welcomed people from all over the city, country and world who gathered together to enjoy fresh, simple, high-quality versions of the classics. The rest, as they say, is burger history.

And since day one, it would not have been possible without our stellar team! As a member of the #ShackFam, you can expect an exciting work atmosphere with a culture focused on family, fun and community.

We’re committed to providing equal opportunities for success, removing obstacles and fostering a culture of diversity, inclusion and empowerment to ensure that Shake Shack continues to be a great place to work. That’s why we’re so proud to have earned 100% on Human Right Campaign’s 2025 Corporate Equality Index for LGBTQ-inclusive workplace policies and practices, a designation that highlights the core of our ethos here at Shake Shack.

For a full list of available opportunities, visit: http://www.shakeshack.com/join-our-team/

Title: Fractional CTO , Technology Consultant
Summary:
Jon is an experienced consultant and CTO based in NYC.

Jon is Fractional CTO / Technology Consultant / Architect doing short and long-term assignments for clients on technology roadmaps, technology process & organization, vendor selection/ management, architecture & scalability, technology/business alignment, and mergers & acquisitions.

Many small to mid-size companies are not of a size that warrants employing a full-time Chief Technology Officer.  Frequently, the level of strategic guidance available to an engineering department and the level of alignment between business and development teams can benefit from engaging a seasoned CTO on a "fractional" basis. The concept of a fractional CTO is simply to provide your organization with a high-level consultant who specializes in the overall management of technology.  This engagement is custom-designed to fit the immediate needs of your organization.

Jon's experience as a technology executive / CTO includes Experian CheetahMail, iVillage / NBC, Kaplan, Grey Healthcare, Time Warner, Scholastic, Oxygen Media, News Corporation, CDnow, 24/7 Media, Bigfoot Interactive and Flat World Knowledge

Jon was born in Australia and moved permanently to the USA. In 2000, Jon co-founded the New York CTO Club, a non-profit professional organization, which provides a monthly forum for 100+ technology leaders from many of New York’s best-known companies to share strategies and ideas in a collaborative and collegial environment. Jon was a mentor for 14 years in Columbia University’s Executive Masters in Technology Management program. In 2008 he was named one of Infoworld’s top 25 CTOs.

Specialties: Technology architecture, Agile & Lean methodologies, Team Building, Vendor Management, Software development, internet consumer applications, project/process management, e-commerce, business process automation, technology strategies.

Headline: Fractional CTO , Technology Consultant
