Title: Founder & CEO
Summary: I'm the founder and CEO of Wefunder. We're fixing capitalism:  https://wefunder.com/charter
Description (2):
We’re the Robinhood for pre-IPO startups.  Everyone can angel invest $100 in a Community Round.

On May 16, 2016, it became legal for everyday people to invest as little as $100 in startups and small businesses.  Since then, we’ve helped 1,860 founders raise almost $500M from their community - for flying cars, coffee shops, and everything in between.

We’re a Public Benefit Corporation with a mission to revitalize capitalism and keep the American dream alive. GDP growth is slowing. Wealth inequality is increasing. Entrepreneurship is dying across America; falling from 10.6% to 3.6% among those under 30 since 1989. We’re reversing these trends by funding more deserving businesses across all of America, not solely tech startups in Silicon Valley.

Want to help? Join us! We’re a team of founder types: enjoy autonomy, responsibility, the opportunity to learn, and no red tape. Just make it happen.
Headline: Founder & CEO at Wefunder

Description: I talk about the skills, beliefs, and businesses I’m building | Helped 10,000+ start writing at https://t.co/t2IzOoW1mW | Former @blackrock trader turned writer
Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
Here's a quick rundown of how I've spent my last 5 years:

1. Studied math and played football at Princeton. I graduated in 2018 with a degree in financial engineering and played center for the Tigers. In college, I was a 280-pound offensive lineman, so for the last 5 years, I've had to completely rewrite my personal operating system on the health & fitness front. I currently weigh 185 pounds and have learned a lot along the way!

2. Graduated and immediately started working for BlackRock in New York City. I worked as a junior hedge fund trader for 4 years, focusing on global macro markets. This was my dream job and the only corporate job I've ever had. In fact, it's the only job *interview* I've ever had (since I interned there as a junior in college).

3. Realized working for someone else was not going to be the long-term path for me. 12 months into working on Wall Street, I saw someone in their mid-40s ask their boss for permission to go to their son's Little League game. At that moment I realized I wasn't cut out to take directions or instructions from other people for very long.

4. Started to write on my old blog, then on Twitter. Rather than quit immediately, I started to passively explore other opportunities by writing online, starting out on my old blog (which no one knew existed), then transitioning to Twitter in July of 2020.

5. Changed my trajectory with a 30-day writing challenge, which led me to start Ship 30 for 30. In September 2020 I was ready to give up writing entirely. But I gave it one more shot, this time moving from a weekly blog post to a daily Twitter thread. The challenge was a huge success. It took me 9 months to reach 100 followers and 1 month to go from 100 to 2,000. And that personal writing challenge turned into the foundation of Ship 30 for 30, which started as nothing but a Slack accountability group to help people publish consistently.

6. Scaled Ship 30 while working remotely for all of 2021. I built and scaled Ship 30 with Nicolas Cole to over 2,000 students in 2021—all while continuing to work full-time (remotely) for BlackRock. But towards the end of 2021, Ship 30 hit an inflection point and it no longer made financial sense for me to continue working on Wall Street.

7. Left BlackRock in March of 2022 to write and build on my own. After weeks of weighing the pros and cons and trying to project my path forward, I made the decision to leave BlackRock and chart my own path. 15 months into making that decision and I'm confident it's the best one I've ever made.

Title: CEO
Summary:
Is your organization one ransomware attack away from disaster? In today's landscape where a data breach costs companies millions, cybersecurity isn't just IT—it's business survival.

I founded Curios in 2017 with a mission to protect businesses from increasingly sophisticated cyber threats, particularly for organizations that need enterprise-grade security without enterprise-level resources.

At Curios, we transform organizations into security-confident businesses through our proprietary Security Framework that ensures your cybersecurity strategy directly supports your business objectives. Unlike traditional security providers focused solely on technology, we bridge the gap between technical safeguards and business goals.

Having worked with organizations ranging from Fortune 500 companies to growing SMEs across Belgium and Europe, I've seen firsthand how the right security approach can become a business enabler rather than just a cost center.

My journey to founding Curios began after witnessing too many businesses devastated by preventable breaches. With over a decade in cybersecurity, I've built a team of security innovators who share my commitment to proactive protection rather than reactive damage control.

Let's connect if you're:
→ Concerned about your organization's security posture
→ Preparing for compliance audits or certification
→ Looking to balance security needs with business growth

Contact me for a connect!

TED’s mission is to discover and champion the ideas that will shape tomorrow. Powerful ideas, powerfully presented, can move us to feel something, to think differently, to take action and create a brighter future.

TED finds these powerful ideas across disciplines and around the globe, from people who passionately seek a deeper understanding of the world and want to make a difference in it. TED’s spotlight, and its engaged, open-minded audience, help these ideas to create real impact: to shift one person’s perspective, to make a difference within a community or to spark global transformation.

Ideas change everything.

Title: Chief Customer Officer
Summary:
The goal of businesses is growth — revenue, product offerings, customer base, client retention. But a business can’t grow if its teams are stagnating. Growing teams and customer relationships is my passion, and being a key player in companies’ growth, both those I work for and their clients, is what motivates me.

I’ve been building account management, customer services, professional services, managed services, and customer success teams for more than 20 years. I’ve built some from the ground up, turned teams into spectacular contributors, and helped established teams scale globally. I was instrumental in increasing one company’s revenue from $8M to $20M in less than 18 months, another organization’s $55M business line to $80M and growing within a year, and in expanded another’s advertising revenue by 85-fold within six months.

I’ve helped some of my employers successfully become acquired and integrated into a larger organization. I have played an instrumental role in presenting my employer for acquisition, integrating teams post-acquisition, and evaluating other companies for acquisition.

How do I do what I do so successfully? By being an operational, strategic, process-driven, and — most importantly — collaborative and people-focused leader. People are at the heart of my success.

I spend a lot of time mentoring my team members, coaching them, communicating with them, and ensuring they understand and embody the company’s “why” and product value. I especially enjoy helping other women in tech, and I created International Women’s Day and year-long programs focused on this audience for multiple employers. Previous team members would describe me as a transparent, empathetic leader who provides meaningful feedback and brings order to chaos. I’ve helped many junior-level team members move into management positions and supported the growth of senior leaders.

Building client relationships and retaining clients is also all about the people. Clients have reached out to me personally to tell me that I was a big reason they renewed their contract with my company, because they felt I was authentic and treated them as people, and I always followed through.

Title: Outbound Growth Systems Manager | M&A Advisor
Summary:
For years I’ve built outbound systems that helped firms connect with founders and start meaningful conversations. Now I’m stepping closer to those conversations myself. I use those same systems to find business owners who are open to exploring acquisition, partnership, or exit opportunities and connect them with the right buyers when the timing is right.

At FreedomForFounders, I help founders explore their options with trust and discretion. Most of my conversations begin long before anyone is ready to sell. The focus is always on clarity first, not pressure.

My background is in outbound strategy and systems design. Through my work with ALX, I’ve helped companies build consistent deal flow by combining smart targeting, messaging, and relationship-driven outreach. That experience has evolved into working directly with founders, guiding them through valuation, buyer interest, and transition planning.

Before that, I built and scaled businesses of my own. I started in photography and videography, then helped grow The Muskoka Store from zero to over $300K in online sales within a year. Those experiences taught me how founders think and how much a business means when you’ve built it yourself.

I studied Kinesiology and Exercise Science at the University of Waterloo, where I developed a strong understanding of human behavior and decision-making. That perspective shapes how I work with founders today — focused on timing, clarity, and outcomes that make sense for them.
Address - Locations: 508 Riverbend Drive, Kitchener, Ontario N2K 3S2, CA
Description (2):
The road to finding more time and financial freedom starts here.

Freedom for Founders provides a snapshot of your personal and professional decisions around Why, When and How you should exit your business. Whether you’re ready to sell or transition today, or you’re planning for the future, don’t let excuses like lack of time, knowledge, and money prevent you from making the most important decision of your entire career.

If you have questions about how to proceed, you’re not alone. Most business owners share the same struggles trying to determine the balance between meeting their business goals while also satisfying their lifestyle goals.

 Do you want to:
- Take a month-long vacation and not worry about the business?
- Accumulate more personal wealth and pay less tax to fund your retirement?
- Spend more uninterrupted time with your friends and family today?
- Eventually, exit your business on your terms?

We're here to listen and learn from owners and share in our experiences through podcasts & webinars sharing content while connecting owners across social platforms who are seeking more freedom.

Every owner has a story, we'd like to hear yours.

Contact us and we'll send a link to schedule a no-obligation advise call to help you make the right strategic decisions.

Description: Founder @Signadot | UIUC | IIT-KGP
Title: Contributor, Entrepreneur Magazine
Summary:
Hello there! I'm Arjun - Founder and CEO at Signadot

Previously led Engineering and Data Science teams at Appdynamics. Decades of experience building Cloud Native Systems. Prior to that completed by MS in Computer Science at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC). Undergrad from IIT-Kharagpur (India).

What is Signadot?
Signadot is a Kubernetes-native "shift left" testing solution for Microservices. This is enabled by a unique approach to ephemeral environments (called Sandboxes) that does not duplicate infrastructure. Environment isolation is provided at the application layer vs infrastructure layer. This enables engineering teams to multiplex a large number of "lightweight" environments in a single physical Kubernetes cluster.

Layered on Sandboxes is an automation testing platform that can run any test including our AI assisted "SmartTests" that automatically compare test results between the main and branch versions. Think of his as a "shadow testing" approach at the Pull Request phase that gives developers quick regression feedback with minimal effort.

Using Signadot reduces infrastructure costs, distributes testing for wider coverage and boosts release velocity. This is made possible via a "shift left" approach to testing where you can run various functional (api contracts, integration, end-to-end etc) and non-functional (performance etc) tests at the Pull Request phase.

Feedback from our users:
- A leading FinTech company saved $2M/yr in cloud costs by eliminating duplicate testing environments using Signadot
- We eliminated > 90% of bugs from reaching staging
- Developers love the 10x faster testing cycles
- We can easily distribute testing across Engineering and not have a bottleneck on a central team

Wanna Talk?
Shoot me an email at arjun at signadot.com

Description:
Founder & CEO @FranShares
-$18M+ in investment subscriptions
-41k Waitlist
-Franchise expert with media reach of 300M+
Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
Franchising is broken.

The US has 800,000+ franchise locations generating $800B, but investing in it is still complex and inefficient, despite billions of dollars changing hands each year.

Franchisors struggle as franchises are often unaffordable for those best suited to run them. This is their main limit to growth, only the wealthy can be franchisees.

FranShares introduces a platform for both retail and institutional investors to invest in franchises as part of their portfolio.

Franchise investing allows local investors to back familiar businesses, benefiting from a network effect. It is an asset class that is income producing, diversified from the stock market, a hedge against inflation, and outperform traditional investments.

My background in franchise brokerage, helping individuals find the right brand to invest in and having worked with 400+ brands gives a unique insight into the problem and ability to create the solution. My views on franchising have been featured in Forbes, Business Insider, ABC, American Express, TheHustle, Marketwatch and more with a reach of over 300 million people prior to FranShares.

FranShares has had the largest launch for an alternative investing platform and over 43,000 investors signed up for upcoming opportunities.

Imagine investing in the businesses that you go to work out at, get a haircut in, get your oil changed, and eat at. This tangibility creates a network effect because not only will you only go to those places you own a piece of, you’ll tell your friends they have to as well.

Every line on the cap table is a social network.

Welcome to the future of franchising.

Learn more about us at www.franshares.com
Description (2):

Description: Certifikovaná výživová poradkyně, fitness nadšenec s touhou posouvat své hranice a milovnice kvalitního jídla.
Title: Chief Nutritionist (Dietitian) & CEO
Summary:
Chcete vědět, jak "chutná" vyřešená výživa? Dám vám na ni recept, jednou provždy.

Jsem klinická nutriční terapeutka, výživářka tělem i duší, CEO a odborná garantka předního konceptu nutričního poradenství MG COACHING a produktové společnosti MG Nutrition s.r.o.

Věřím, že výživa má moc měnit životy. Každý můj klient je jedinečný, ale všechny spojuje touha výživu jednou provždy vyřešit a dosáhnout tak svého plného potenciálu. Na poli nutričního poradenství mám velmi bohaté zkušenosti se širokou škálou domácí i zahraniční klientely všech věkových a výkonnostních kategorií, včetně nacházení řešení tam, kde se zdálo, že žádné “neexistuje”.

Výživové vědy jsem vystudovala na předních amerických univerzitách, počínaje bakalářským studiem nutriční terapie na University of Massachusetts v Bostonu a konče RDN titulem z klinické výživy z lékařské fakulty Florida International University v Miami. Summa cum laude, top of class.

Své specializace jsem vložila do oblasti poruch příjmu potravy a sportovní výživy. Zvolila jsem cestu nejvyšší mezinárodně uznávané dietetické licence, tj. vzdělání na lékařské fakultě s přesahem 1200+ supervizovaných rotačních hodin klinické praxe akreditovaných ACEND.

Mimo stávající akademické a klinické zázemí mám za sebou desítky akreditovaných programů, certifikací a supervizí, mimo jiné nyní například na Carolyn Costin Institute, Athlete Insight nebo Athlete EDGE. Mezi mé mentory a preceptory patřila samotná Carolyn Costin, Ron Thompson a Kate Bennett - nejuznávanější odborníci oboru.

Jsem řádnou členkou profesní asociace Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics USA (AND), Academy for Eating Disorders USA (AED), European Society for Clinical Nutrition and Metabolism (ESPEN) nebo International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals (iaedp).

Bylo mi ctí stát se jedinou českou výživářkou řady největších mezinárodních konferencí svého oboru, vč. FNCE (2022 Orlando, 2023 Denver, 2024 Minneapolis, 2025 Nashville) nebo ICED (2024 New York City, 2025 San Antonio).

Pokud se ještě nesetkáváme jako klient/pacient - nutriční, možná se slyšíme v médiích, na odborných konferencích nebo ve veřejném prostoru. Na těch mě můžete slyšet na české i mezinárodní scéně. Podle Institutu moderní výživy jsem "nejsledovanější česká nutriční terapeutka". Ráda totiž mluvím. O výživě dvojnásob.

Pracuji podle vědecky ověřených postupů a řídím se etickým kodexem Code of Ethics for the Nutrition and Dietetics Profession.

V profesním portfoliu mám jména od olympijských sportovců přes členy královské rodiny až po běžnou populaci.

Budete to další?
Description (2): Přepisujeme standardy na poli odborného nutričního poradenství a kvality výživy. Pro vás, s vámi.
Headline: Klinická nutriční terapeutka (NutrSc, RDN) • CEO MG Nutrition s.r.o. • Expertka ve výživě, nutriční terapii a dietetice • Bestseller autorka, podcasterka a keynote speakerka • Mám pro vás recept na "vyřešenou výživu"

Description: Founder of Parlance (https://t.co/m2qqr1UK4i). Chief Brand Officer by day. Picture Maker and Gonzo Mixologist by night. Mostly sarcasm and musings on modern fatherhood.
Title: Founder & Chief Brand Officer
Summary:
My professional arc is one of deliberate 𝗿𝗲-𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. I’ve built companies and brands from multiple vantage points — each chapter adding new skills, new perspective, and a sharper sense of what matters.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗔𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗰𝘆. At Droga5, TBWA, and the Publicis Groupe, I learned and cultivated the fundamentals of creating desire and the power of radical ideas that make brands famous. Commercial creativity that didn’t just win awards, but drove business impact.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗘𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗽𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗲. At Apple, I learned how to operate effectively within a system as a Creative Director. This is where I developed expertise in simplifying complexity, aligning leaders, and scaling creative systems that drove both clarity and growth. I brought those lessons into Peloton and later as Chief Brand Officer at Twill, where I helped raise a Series D, built a brand organization, led a full company rebrand, and delivered business results that ultimately led to an acquisition.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗘𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗲𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘂𝗿. I got my first taste of raw entrepreneurship as employee #3 and CCO at Spkr., an AI-audio discovery platform — and I knew company building was for me. Today I run Parlance, my studio providing fractional CBO services. I embed as a Chief Brand Operator for early-stage companies looking to become more investable, and for growth-stage and established companies that need their brand and narrative to be understood. My focus is 𝗦𝗼𝗹𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗡𝗮𝗿𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘅𝗶𝘁𝘆 and building brands in AI, Healthtech, Robotics, Public Impact, and the Future of Work, Media, and Food.

My work has been recognized by Cannes Lions, D&AD, The Webby’s, and The One Show — and as a photographer, I’ve been awarded, commissioned, and exhibited internationally.

I live in Menlo Park with my family, often on my bike in the hills or behind a camera at the Guild Theatre. I make it a goal to meet one new person every day. If you’d like to connect or trade stories, book a time at the link above.

Title: Chair of the Board of Directors
Summary:
Both purpose and profit are essential to the future of business. I'm working to build a world where every venture is, and is equipped to be, an impact-driven venture.

As Co-CEO of Spring, we've helped catalyze over $83 million to impact-driven ventures across Canada, especially those led by founders from underrepresented groups.

My path here has been varied: corporate roles in the UK, co-founding a renewable energy venture for off-grid communities, international development with UNICEF in Laos. Each chapter taught me something different about what it takes to build something meaningful.
Impact happens when you combine vision with pragmatism. When you listen more than you speak. When you build with rather than for.

As Chair of Propel Impact, I have the honour of supporting their incredible work with brilliant young people who are reimagining how capital flows and who it serves.
Building a more equitable ecosystem became deeply personal when I became a mother and lost my own mother to a preventable health issue, all within a year. It’s a continuous reminder of why this work matters.

At Spring, we're not just catalysing cheques. We're building community, breaking down barriers, and proving that profit and purpose aren't mutually exclusive.
Description (2):
Propel Impact is a national, Canadian non-profit organization operating experiential learning programs focused on impact investing and social innovation.

Propel's vision is a world where every impact-first organization has the talent resources required to fully achieve their mission and potential. Through experiential learning, meaningful projects, and relationship building, our participants take an active role in providing capital and capacity-building support to impact-first organizations across Canada. Our programs open doors for leaders of all backgrounds to shape their careers around the issues that matter to them and to the world.
Headline: Co-CEO, Spring | Jury Cartier Women’s Initiative North America | Chair Propel Impact |  Helping entrepreneurs & investors create sustainable impact at scale.

Title: Founder & Managing Partner
Summary:
I come from a family that values safety over risk.
Today, I run a company built on betting on yourself.

I still remember sitting across from my dad, explaining why I was leaving my secure corporate job to start a recruitment firm. His response?

"Too risky."
That wasn't just a father's concern; it was a generational belief in the safety of the known path.

At the time, I was thriving at Lockton as their first-ever producer recruiter.
I had found my tribe:

Producers.
Builders. High-performers. Strivers. Connectors. Deal-makers. Risk-takers. Self-starters.
People who bet on themselves every day.

But I also saw something troubling:
Too many talented producers were making life-changing career decisions without guidance or real intel.
And recruiters treated them like transactions.

So in 2022, with no entrepreneurial background and against my family's advice, I took the leap.
Self-funded. No safety net. Just an unwavering belief that producers deserved better.

Because this isn't just about career moves.
It's about strategic decisions that shape futures, and most producers were making them without clarity, benchmarks, or the right partner in their corner.

That's why I launched Palladium Point, and later, The Producers Circle, a private newsletter community built exclusively for producers.

 Click "View My Blog" at the top of my profile to check it out.

Today, our team helps producers make bold, high-leverage moves — and helps insurance firms build teams that win together.

 Want to sharpen your next move or build a stronger team? Let's connect.

 St. Louis native, proud Mizzou grad
 pat@palladiumpoint.com
 636.204.5151
Description (2):
The word palladium means "a safeguard or source of protection." We think hiring and retaining the right people is a palladium for organizations - exceptional people protect company cultures and safeguard them from competitors. Welcome to Palladium Point, a leading executive search and recruitment consulting firm dedicated to serving the business insurance industry.

After years of observing what felt like a stale and outdated approach to recruiting in the insurance industry, we decided it was time to do something about it. Palladium Point exists to help employers solve a seemingly endless list of issues - talent shortages, skills gaps, redefining roles, aging workforce, succession planning, retention, flexible work models, D&I, career paths, and compensation, to name a few - and to accelerate the careers of top insurance talent we serve.

Recruiting is time intensive. Hiring mistakes are costly. Partner with Palladium Point and leverage our expertise to help your business and career thrive.

Core Areas of Expertise:
* Business Insurance Recruitment (Property & Casualty, Employee Benefits, Retirement, Private)
* Producer Recruitment
* Executive Search
* Niche Insurance SME Recruitment
* M&A Advisory Services
* Talent Acquisition Strategy & Consulting
Headline: Career Fiduciary to Elite Producers | Founder, Palladium Point | Creator, The Producers Circle | Ex-Lockton

Title: CEO & co-founder
Summary:
I have been coding since I was 6 years old. I’ve built applications for nearly every industry you can name, and developed a specialism in AdTech and broadcast in 2014. While working to create systems for major UK broadcasters and international advertising agencies I was repeatedly faced with “unsolvable” problems. I started Ad Signal to try to solve some of those “unsolvable” problems. These have been the most challenging problems I’ve faced in my career, and the original image and audio fingerprinting algorithms I wrote still power our products today. There’s no frame of reference for so much of what we’re doing (often as devs we borrow from other industries or problems to solve things, that doesn’t work here).

We have 8 SaaS products at different phases of development, 6 are the first-of-their-kind, 4 are being patented and 1 is patent pending. Assure, our playout tracking system, with its 99.99% proven accuracy is unrivalled. We care about quality first, but also have a track record for delivering on time and on budget.

Our values are honesty, loyalty, tenacity and accountability. We will look after our people to the best of our ability because it’s the right thing to do. I believe that we have a duty of stewardship to our planet. Several of our products bring significant sustainability benefits, while also saving our clients money.
Description (2):
We fix the messy, expensive problems in video that everyone else ignores. Ad Signal helps content-led teams & businesses reduce cost and waste by cleaning up video libraries, streamline (AI) processing, and protect revenue by verifying when ads are aired.

Ad Signal is a SaaS company with unique products for video, image and audio content, some of which have powerful sustainability benefits. Although we specialise in the advertising and broadcast industries, our products are relevant to all content holders. All of our products are available via API or our UI, enabling you to return the data created to your system of choice.

Our Match product has two jobs:
1) Deduplicating your content regardless of format, codec and resolution - saving you up to 60% of your storage cost & carbon, potentially flatlining your storage needs for the next 3 years
2) Sending only unique content to Ai services, saving you 75% of your Ai processing and carbon. Think of it as a common-sense prefilter to the Ai services of your choice.

Match uses only our proprietary image and audio fingerprinting technology, there’s no metadata required.

Assure tracks content played out on linear TV in near-realtime with 99.99% accuracy.

Ad Signal is a founding member of the Digital Sustainability Alliance, which aims to highlight the size of the sustainability challenge in the digital world as well as solutions to these challenges for our members.

Get in touch or check out our website to learn more.
Headline: CEO & co-founder at Ad Signal

Title: Head Problem Solver
Summary:
I invest in small and mid-sized businesses across sectors.
But I don’t do it passively.

What I do best is take traditional, often-overlooked small businesses and help them evolve — the right way:

 We operationalize calm, not chaos
 Grow profits without burning people out
 Build real teams — where people are valued, not used
 And implement 4-day workweeks that actually work

My focus is on businesses that create real local impact:
 Higher wages
 Supportive, intentional cultures
 Operations that strengthen communities — not extract from them

These companies aren’t just investments.
They’re places people are proud to work.
They’re engines of stability, dignity, and growth — and I take that seriously.

I build companies around people. When teams thrive, the business follows.
That’s how I’ve done it — and that’s how I’ll keep doing it.
Headline: Head Problem Solver

Experienced CEO, operating partner, and board advisor helping private and family-owned companies transform strategy, governance, and culture to achieve sustainable growth and long-term value creation.

With over 30 years of experience as a CEO, operating partner, and board member, I’ve helped both family-owned and private equity-backed companies navigate transformation, growth, and succession. My leadership spans industrial, manufacturing, and service-based businesses—environments where long-term vision must balance with investor discipline and operational execution.

As CEO of KTC Instruments, I’ve led the company’s evolution into a global leader in testing instrumentation and services. Through strategic pricing, process rigor, and expansion of recurring service offerings, I’ve positioned the business for sustainable growth and profitability.

Beyond the CEO role, my experience as a private equity operating partner has strengthened my ability to align strategy, capital allocation, and execution—bridging the priorities of ownership groups, management teams, and boards. This dual perspective informs my work as a director and advisor to private companies, where I’ve chaired audit and compensation committees and guided organizations through governance improvements, generational transitions, and strategic repositioning.

As an author and advocate for value-based management, I focus on aligning strategy, culture, and leadership to drive enduring value for both shareholders and stakeholders.

Title: Chief Floatation Officer
Summary:
As the founder and chief flotation officer of #GETFLOATY a premium inflatable company created to provide customers with smiles and adventures, my mission is to bring happiness and magic into everyday life. Now creating smiles with Hello Kitty

Creating magic isn’t easy, it includes overseeing everyday management, creative direction, digital marketing, sourcing, user experience, and test float sessions on narwhals and unicorns. These floatys started as just an idea sketched onto paper, but after extensive research and planning, an amazing product was brought to life. Since 2015, #GETFLOATY products have been featured by Vogue, Elite Daily, and Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Edition. The magic has been loved and spread far and wide by customers including Paris Hilton, Kim Kardashian, Bella Hadid, and Taylor Swift (to name a few).

As an entrepreneur, creating and doing are my main drivers and inspiration. Recognizing and understanding a need, researching, creating transformational brands/products, and bringing them to market to fulfill a demand were all lessons learned during the process of building companies from scratch. Before #GETFLOATY, I gained experience as a strategy and leadership consultant, a marketing manager, as well as the CEO of Prezi B, an independent design and training organization, Cruise One Inc., a cruise vacation franchise, and Hands-Free Storage, a pop up retail storage business serving college students.

My education includes an M.B.A from Pepperdine University and a BS from Babson College in Entrepreneurship and Global Business Management.

Title: Real Estate Agent
Summary:
As a born and raised Savannah resident, I have been proud to serve as a real estate agent in this beautiful city for the past three years. My extensive knowledge of the area and its neighborhoods, combined with my passion for helping people find their dream homes, has made me a trusted and respected agent among my clients and colleagues.

Throughout my career, I have had the pleasure of working with a wide variety of clients, from first-time homebuyers to experienced investors. I have helped families find their perfect starter homes, assisted retirees in finding their dream retirement properties, and helped investors find profitable rental properties. No matter the client or their needs, I have always put my heart and soul into finding them the perfect home.

One of the things I love most about my job is the chance to show off all that Savannah has to offer. From the charming Historic District to the trendy Starland District, I have been able to introduce my clients to the many unique neighborhoods that make Savannah such a special place to live. I am also able to share my knowledge of the local schools, parks, and other amenities that make each neighborhood so desirable.

In addition to my extensive knowledge of the area, I have also been able to build a reputation for my attention to detail and my commitment to providing excellent customer service. I understand that buying or selling a home can be a stressful and overwhelming process, and I strive to make it as smooth and stress-free as possible for my clients.

Overall, my three years as a real estate agent in Savannah have been an incredibly rewarding experience. I am grateful to have had the opportunity to serve this community and help so many families find their dream homes. I look forward to continuing to serve my clients in the years to come

Summary:

Description (2):
Optery is at the forefront of personal data protection, offering state-of-the-art removal software that empowers users – from individuals to large enterprises – to take control of their online information. We opt you out of all the top data brokers that trade in your personal information and post sensitive details like home addresses, emails, phone numbers, and other private info online. Leveraging the most advanced data broker scanning software in the world, Optery far surpasses Google and other services in uncovering user profiles.

Combining sophisticated automation with our Privacy Agents' expertise, we ensure the industry's highest quality results in PII removal from over 600+ data broker sites. Our service features monthly automated scans and visual, evidence-based reporting for continual data removal and clear before-and-after results. Whether for personal use or enterprise-level deployment, Optery equips users with a robust defense against escalating PII-based threats such as phishing, social engineering, identity theft, doxing, and harassment.

Optery has completed its AICPA SOC 2, Type II security certification, and distinguishes itself with unparalleled search technology, data removal automation, visual evidence-based before-and-after reporting, data broker coverage, and API integration options.

Optery was awarded “Editors’ Choice” by PCMag.com as the most outstanding product in the personal data removal category in 2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025, was named winner in the Employee Privacy Protection, Attack Surface Management, and Digital Footprint Management categories of the 2024 Cybersecurity Excellence Awards, received the Top InfoSec Innovator Award for Attack Surface Management by Cyber Defense Magazine in 2024, and received Fast Company’s Next Big Things in Tech award for security and privacy in 2023.

Hundreds of thousands of people and hundreds of businesses use Optery to prevent attacks and keep their personal information off the Internet.

Title: Insights Advisor
Summary:
I’ve been a People Leader at four companies that have scaled to unicorn+ status (Palantir, One Medical, Instacart, and InVision) where I built and led the people team through hypergrowth.

I now advise CEOs, People Leaders, and Venture Capital Firms to bring those learnings to Series A-C startups around the world.

I specialize in helping companies build a strong people operations foundation, design best-in-class employee experiences, avoid expensive mistakes, and plan for the future. Companies tend to bring me on when scaling their people team post-financing, making key decisions around their people team roadmap, and/or designing a thriving globally distributed culture.

Here are ways we can work together:

*Advisory*

The main way that I engage with companies is on a monthly advisory retainer. Our work together can cover all aspects of your people team roadmap, in addition to best practices for scaling remote and hybrid workforces. I take on a max of 5 advisory clients at a time.

*Playbooks*

I’ve iterated for 20 years on best practices to stay at the forefront of people and culture innovation. Now, every startup can take advantage of what the highest-performing, most well-funded startups do as they navigate various growth stages. Check out my FREE guide on "Building a Remote-First Company Culture", plus my other playbooks covering topics such as People Team Hiring, People Tech Systems, Remote Onboarding, Remote Performance, Getting Started as a Consultant, and more at shelbywolpaconsulting.com. Location-based pricing is available for those outside of the US.

*Micro Consulting Sessions*

I offer “Ask Me Anything” micro consulting sessions where you can grab time to think through challenging problems. If you’re looking for ad hoc advice on your people team roadmap, what it takes to build a thriving globally distributed team, have general HR questions, or want to get feedback on a product you’re building in the people technology space, you can book time with me here: https://www.shelbywolpaconsulting.com/ama. Personal career coaching is offered at a discounted rate, for those self-funding their development as an HR operator or consultant.

*Distributed Work Report*

The Distributed Work: People & Practices Report is the most comprehensive distributed work report for people teams. Check out the 2025 findings here: https://www.shelbywolpaconsulting.com/distributed-work-report.

*Workshops & Public Speaking*

I regularly facilitate workshops for startup founders and people leaders, speak at conferences, and host events.

Title: CEO and CO-Founder
Summary:
Wind turbine owners, operators and manufactures lose money due to high blade O&M costs caused by lightning strikes, icing and unexpected blade damage. Our sensor solutions dramatically reduce these costs and uncertainties - saving operators both time and money.

 Is your wind turbine achieving the best possible performance?
 Do you want to detect problems on your turbines as early as possible?
 Would you like to know what’s happening directly on your rotor blades?

Most wind turbine operators lose their money due to unnecessary downtimes, high personal costs or damage repairs. And why? Because icing conditions, pitch angle misalignments and/or damages reduce the energy yield and lifetime of a wind turbine.

𝗕𝗨𝗧: 𝗧𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘄𝗮𝘆!
Optimize the performance of your turbines with our sensor systems. Detect rotor blade problems early and increase the performance of your turbines. Learn how EOLOGIX-PING helps you reduce costs and achieve the best possible performance.

𝗙𝗲𝗲𝗹, 𝗵𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘀𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗯𝗹𝗮𝗱𝗲𝘀
Ice detection  // Lightning detection  // Blade damage detection  // Temperature measurement for preventive heating  // Pitch angle measurements  and many more  – with our ON-TOWER, IN-BLADE and ON-BLADE solutions.

𝗧𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘆𝗼𝘂:
 Detect problems early (lightning strikes, damages, etc.)
 Avoid misdiagnosis and consequential damages
 Reduce costs (personnel, maintenance etc.)
 Reduce downtimes up to 80%
 Extend the service life of your wind turbines
 Improve the availability of the turbines

Our solutions are suitable for every wind turbine in every lifetime period. They can be retrofitted very easily.

What can you do now? – Click on connect and let us know what your expectations are for your wind turbine.

That’s what our customers say:
 Verbund's Ice Control project has shown a savings potential of up to 50% in downtime.
 One of our customers reduced its downtime by 180 hours per winter season.
 Another is amazed by the system’s fast and accurate response.

Find more success stories here: https://www.eologix.com-ping/en/references/
Are you our next success story?
Description (2):
EOLOGIX-PING is the specialist for continuous blade monitoring with innovative ON-BLADE, ON-TOWER and IN-BLADE sensor systems for 𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝘁𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝗮𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁, 𝗯𝗹𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗱𝗮𝗺𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠.

Our goal is to support the generation of wind energy by developing innovative sensor solutions and enabling permanent and accurate monitoring of rotor blade condition and operation to achieve the best performance for our customers.

Our motivated team is committed to ensuring the best possible performance and capability of wind turbines worldwide.

The patented and DNV certified ON-BLADE solution is mounted directly on the blade surface. With its innovative technology, the sensor system is able to reliably detect icing, measure surface temperature for preventive heating. Furthermore, it detects even the smallest rotor blade misalignment under all turbine operating conditions.

The ON-TOWER system continuously measures and analyzes changes in the sound generated by blade damage. It is attached magnetically to the base of the tower of the wind turbine at a height of approximately four meters. Through an add-on, it can detect not only blade damage but also lightning strikes through magnetic field measurements and provide data for setting appropriate measures.

The acoustic IN-BLADE system is installed at the blade access panel or within the blade depending on the preference. There it uses sound emission to detect root zone structural damage.

All sensor solutions are suitable for new installations as well as for simple retrofitting on existing wind turbines.
Headline: Leader in wind industry - Helping wind turbines to maximize output, lower downtime and reduce O&M costs

Title: President & CFO, Co-Founder
Summary:
Matt is the President and CFO of Lumata Health, where he leads the company’s operations and financial strategy. He has 15 years of experience as a co-founder and executive at high-growth startups, bringing deep expertise in scaling operations, financial management, and organizational leadership. As a co-founder and architect of Lumata’s operations team, Matt has been pivotal in expanding the company’s ability to deliver intelligent eye care solutions nationwide.

Before Lumata, Matt co-founded and led a specialty infusion pharmacy, playing a key role in building it into a best-in-class provider with a national presence. He was instrumental in developing its operational infrastructure and negotiating foundational partnerships with pharmaceutical manufacturers, positioning the company for long-term growth and success. That company, along with a previous foodservice startup he helped build, were both acquired by national industry leaders.

His early career in investment banking provided a strong foundation in financial strategy, capital allocation, and M&A execution, while his designation as a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) deepened his expertise in investment analysis, risk management, and operational efficiency. These skills have been instrumental in his success scaling tech-enabled healthcare startups and driving transformative growth.

Matt has a BA in religion from Oklahoma City University and an MBA in international business and finance obtained overseas through a joint program between Oklahoma City University and the Tianjin University of Finance and Economics in China.

Matt is a community service advocate and believes in giving back. For several years, he has raised funds and awareness for Children’s Hospital Foundation in Oklahoma City and served on multiple boards within the organization.  Matt led a fundraising campaign during the COVID pandemic that raised over $75,000 to purchase meals from local restaurants and deliver them to frontline healthcare workers and at-risk youth.
Description (2):
At Lumata, we believe that proactive management of eye health is more important than ever. Our team transforms lives by preventing vision loss from chronic eye conditions like glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, and macular degeneration. Our unique and innovative ophthalmology care management platform addresses complex barriers to treatment adherence, ensuring better clinical outcomes for thousands of patients—and we’re just getting started.

With a growing team of dedicated professionals across 40+ states, our employees make a difference every day. Our certified ophthalmic technicians and assistants work remotely as an extension of in-clinic staff, working closely with patients to provide personalized support. From managing treatment fatigue and navigating insurance issues to coordinating care and accessing social services, our team ensures patients have the tools, knowledge, and motivation needed to adhere to their care plans, improve their quality of life, and preserve their vision.

At Lumata, we celebrate the expertise and dedication of our team, with care coaches averaging over 12 years of in-clinic ophthalmology experience and specialized training in social work and case management.

Our employees’ health and happiness is important to us. We offer comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance for full-time employees, paid holidays and time off, 401(k), life insurance, flexible spending account, parental leave, employee wellness, flexible schedules, bonus structure, and professional development opportunities.

Our Culture
Lumata's remote work environment is dynamic, inclusive, and supportive. We foster a culture of compassion, growth, and collaboration, where each employee plays a vital role in our mission to preserve vision. Join Lumata and be part of a team that’s innovating, educating, and creating a future where everyone has the opportunity for a healthy mind and body. We’re helping people see the world—one patient at a time.
Headline: President, CFO & Co-founder at Lumata Health

Description: CEO and Co-founder of Kaiterra
Title: WELL Air & Performance Advisories, WELL Faculty
Summary:
Here are 3 things you might hear me talk about endlessly:

1. Air quality is a global killer

- 7 million deaths each year
- Millions of health-related complications
- Only 0.001% of people breathe air that meets WHO standards

2. Monitoring and improving IAQ has a solid ROI (even if IMO that should NOT matter)

- Good IAQ improves health & well-being, which increases productivity
- A small increase in employee productivity is more impactful than a 100x increase in energy savings
- But breathing clean air should be a right, not an office perk

3. Data is useless unless you know what to do with it

- You need data — lots of it, rather than an annual test — to improve IAQ
- But knowing you have 12 ug/m3 of PM2.5 gets you nowhere
- You need serious analytics beyond line charts to extract insights and get tangible outcomes (Hint: that’s what we do at Kaiterra)
Description (2): Kaiterra provides a complete air quality optimization platform leveraging hardware, software and a team of experienced professionals to help companies assess and improve their indoor air quality for better workplace experience and occupant wellbeing. Kaiterra’s solutions can be found in many of the world’s most iconic buildings and workplaces, such as the Empire State Building and the Burj Khalifa.
Headline: I talk about why indoor air matters more than you think. Sharing data-driven insights on healthy buildings. WELL Faculty, Commissioner on the Global Commission for Healthy Indoor Air & Clean Air Advocate @ Kaiterra

Description: 🍄 Chief Mushroom Funguy @real_mushrooms
Title: Chief Mushroom Funguy
Summary:
Since 1989, Nammex has pioneered the development and manufacture of medicinal mushroom extracts for the nutritional supplement industry. Nammex specializes in medicinal mushroom products and is the premier supplier of organically certified mushroom extracts to nutraceutical and nutritional supplement companies. Our commitment to quality and 35 years of mushroom growing experience is your guarantee of a safe, certain and highly effective product.

Because we focus entirely on mushrooms, we have been able to identify the active compounds in our products with an aggressive program of research and development. Our mushroom extracts are defined by scientific analysis. This means that you can guarantee to your customers that the important active compounds for which mushrooms are well known will be present. The Nammex mushroom testing fingerprint is fast becoming the industry standard.

Our medicinal mushroom product line is a complete source for wholesale distribution to nutraceutical, functional food, and tonic drink manufacturers. We offer guaranteed quality standards based on accredited Good Manufacturing Practices. We have a complete line of Organically Certified mushroom powders and extracts and we offer quick and reliable shipment within North America. Medicinal mushrooms are our speciality. We can help your company make the right decision.

Org: Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site, Inc
Enrich Company: Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site, Inc
Description (2):
Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site preserves America’s first penitentiary as a powerful, thought-provoking space for learning and reflection. Opened in 1829 with a revolutionary vision for criminal justice reform, the site operated until 1971 and now serves as a museum and national historic landmark. Through exhibitions, guided tours, and public programs, we use the power of place to explore the legacy of incarceration in the United States and its continuing impact today.

The Eastern State Center for Justice Education is our hub for deepening understanding of the criminal justice system and inspiring a more just future. Through public events, educational initiatives, and workforce development programs, we encourage the free-flowing exchange of ideas to inspire a more just, equitable world.

Together, the Historic Site and the Center for Justice Education invite visitors and communities across the country to learn from the past, engage with the present, and imagine a more just future.
Headline: Manager of Events & Operations at Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site

Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
I followed the blueprint for success—earn degrees, land prestigious roles at Fortune 100 companies, and climb the corporate ladder. But despite checking all the right boxes, I wasn’t fulfilled.

Rather than climbing higher, I wanted to own the ladder. I had worked with high-performing teams, but I always felt disconnected—from the mission, from leadership, and from my ability to truly influence outcomes.

I craved something bigger. My colleagues were content with slow promotions, but I wanted control. I wanted ownership.

From the outside, everything looked great—steady paychecks, career growth, a strong resume. But behind the scenes, I knew I was just another cog in the machine. I was tired of building someone else’s dream.

Then came the breaking point.

My wife suffered a miscarriage. The next day, I was sent across the country for a board meeting. Sitting in that room, pretending business as usual, I had a moment of clarity: I couldn’t do this anymore.

When I got home, I quit. No backup plan. No safety net. Just a gut feeling that there had to be a better way.

I surrounded myself with real entrepreneurs—people who built businesses from the ground up. Unlike in business school, where we learned theory, these people took action and created opportunities.

Then, I heard a Tony Robbins podcast where someone was asked, "What’s your favorite piece of technology?"

His answer? Cryotherapy.

That one word sent me down an unexpected path.

Six months later, I signed my first franchise lease. Over the next six years, I opened 15+ locations, testing different strategies, financing models, and operations. I learned firsthand what scaling a business really takes.

 I won awards.
 I helped close 200+ franchise sales.
 I found my passion—helping others do the same.

Now, I work with:
 Entrepreneurs looking to buy, launch, or scale a business.
 Franchise brands wanting to accelerate growth and attract the right franchisees.
 Investors seeking smart, scalable opportunities in franchising.

If you’re ready to build, buy, or scale a business, let’s connect.

 DM me and let’s talk about your next move.
Location Name: Salt Lake City Metropolitan Area, United States
Headline: I Help Ambitious Entrepreneurs Create Freedom & Wealth Through Smart Franchise Investments  | 15X Franchise Owner | 200+ Franchise Sales

Title: CoFounder and CEO
Summary:
I never expected to be an entrepreneur or to transform an industry, let alone twice, but here we are. Most importantly, I’m a dad of two wonderful kids and very happily married to Jen.

I started Mizzen+Main from an idea to use advanced performance fabrics in traditional dress shirts. We were laughed at by all the industry experts who told us no one would ever wear that. Today, Mizzen+Main has done hundreds of millions in revenue, is stocked in a dozen stores and 1,000 partner locations, and is well known for its incredible products that transformed an industry. Our endorsements with JJ Watt & Phil Mickelson are legendary.

I took everything I learned from Mizzen+Main with the goal to help parents and kids get more sleep based on my own experience. Yet again, industry experts told us we were crazy. Yet again, they were wrong.

Shortly after my son was born, the leading “baby monitor” on the market (Nanit) failed our family. I’ve wanted to fix this problem for years. Harbor is a camera and dedicated 10" tablet that connect directly to each other without internet while both devices also connect to the cloud, giving parents remote access via our app along with record and rewind functionality. All parents' memories are stored on the camera locally and all AI processing is done at the edge on device, meaning unlike Nanit, Owlet or other WiFi cameras, we don't process or store ANY of our customers' data.

The opportunity to help parents has become even greater. Our revolutionary baby monitor has enabled Harbor to create a Remote Night Nanny bringing 95% of the benefit of an in-home night nanny for just 5% of the cost. We’re democratizing sleep expertise and changing lives.

Harbor’s mission is happier parents and healthier families, one restful night a time.

Professionally, my life’s work is to build ground breaking products that improve people’s lives, create value for our investors and teams, and change perception of what’s possible. Personally, I aim to raise exceptional children in a loving home with my beautiful bride. And sometimes shoot a decent score on the golf course…
Description (2):
Happier Parents. Healthier Families.
We're on a mission to redefine what it means to be a happy, healthy family. Science shows that better sleep is the foundation for health and happiness. We're here to help you get all of it.
Industry: Retail Health and Personal Care Products
Headline: Giving tired parents 1 Billion hours of sleep || Invented world’s best baby monitor & Remote Night Nanny (Harbor) and first performance fabric dress shirt (Mizzen+Main) || 9 figure revenue || Father, Husband, 2x Founder

Title: Founder/Trial Lawyer
Summary:
"You need a kidney transplant."

There is a sentence you never expect to hear directed at you. After the initial shock subsided a bit, I decided that I wasn't going to let that keep me from living a full and amazing life...and here I am.

After 4 years flying all over the U.S. defending auto manufacturers in product liability cases, I decided I knew enough to go start a plaintiff personal injury firm. So, another guy and myself quite our good-paying jobs in 2008 (the worst economy I had ever seen) and decided to hang our shingle.

We found out that there was, in fact, a lot we did not know, but we managed to learn and create a successful firm anyway. Then the time came for us to go our separate ways.

On September 1, 2017, I founded Snellings Law in Frisco, Texas. Two months later, on October 31, 2017, I was rolled back to the operating room right after my best friend, and I received his kidney. It was pretty surreal not just to be getting a kidney transplant, but to have it done on Halloween morning.

As we have grown the firm, I have found a passion for business and running/growing a law firm. I have had a tremendous amount of support, and I love supporting others. I post a lot of content about running a law firm, including what I do that works and doesn't work.

I also have a podcast, The Driven Crowd, where driven people go to learn from other driven people. I would love it if you tuned in on your favorite podcast app!
Address - Locations: 5750 Genesis Ct, Suite 205, Frisco, Tx 75034, US
Description (2): At Snellings Law PC, our practice focuses solely on personal injury claims. We defend our clients from insurance companies and adjusters trying to limit their claims on a daily basis. We have successfully handled cases of all sizes, up to and including, catastrophic injury and wrongful death claims. If you or a loved one has been injured due to someone else’s negligence, call Snellings Law PC to set up your free consultation today.
Headline: Personal Injury Law Firm Owner | Podcaster | Kidney Transplant Recipient

Based in Las Vegas, with over 150 restaurants across the country, Capriotti’s is truly a national phenomenon. Boasting “Best of” awards in Delaware, Las Vegas, Dallas, Quad Cities, Eastern Shore, San Diego and having been named one of USA Today’s “10 Great Places for a Surprising Sandwich,” our reputation for excellence is unrivaled.

So what makes our food so special?  We roast whole, all-natural turkeys and premium roast beef in-house daily to make award-winning subs like our signature Bobbie, which was voted, “The Greatest Sandwich in America” by thousands of AOL readers. Title: Co-Founder, CEO
Summary: Every healthcare provider should be empowered to run a tech-enabled practice that offers a seamless experience for patients and prevents provider burnout without needing an engineering team.
Description (2):
With Morf, we're making it easy for digital healthcare companies to quickly setup and maintain patient data integrations across their tech stack — e.g. easily send structured data from patient intake forms into a EMR. Morf integrates with the tools digital healthcare companies use to deliver care, unifies and normalizes the data from these tools, and then sends the data where it needs to go. It’s like Zapier or Segment, but built for PHI and health data.

Morf is going to improve patient experiences by being at the forefront of a wave of change in healthcare IT. Healthcare spend in the US is approximately USD $ $4 trillion per year. However patient outcomes aren’t improving as that number continues to rise. Some of this spend increase is due to complexity and momentum in the US healthcare system making it difficult to innovate in order to improve efficiency. We are working to change this.
Headline: Co-founder, CEO of Morf Health | Healthcare Automation

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
Builder. Entrepreneur. Investor. Advocate for shifting humanity’s perspective from disease management to proactive health optimization.

I'm Boomer Anderson, CEO of Smarter Not Harder (SNH) and deeply passionate about redefining how we approach health. I believe we've collectively taken health for granted far too long, only reacting once it's compromised. My mission—and the ethos behind everything I do—is to catalyze a global shift: from treating diseases to optimizing health proactively.

At the heart of this movement is our nonprofit, Health Optimization Medicine and Practice (HOMeHOPe). Here, we train doctors and healthcare practitioners to prioritize health over illness. Our core analytical module, Metabolomics, equips clinicians with tools to understand health at its biochemical core. Upon mastering Metabolomics, practitioners advance through a rigorous curriculum covering Chronobiology, Exposomics, Bioenergetics, Evolutionary Medicine, Epigenetics, and the Gut-Immune System, emerging as certified pioneers in the health optimization field.

Smarter Not Harder isn't just a name—it's a promise. Under its umbrella is Troscriptions, a disruptive nutraceutical brand that's as obsessed with quality and effectiveness as entrepreneurs are with growth. Our goal isn't simply to move products; it's to revolutionize personal health practices through novel ingredients and groundbreaking delivery methods. Sure, profits matter—but our primary currency is impact. And that impact has captured attention worldwide, placing Troscriptions in global media spotlights.

My side obsession? The health of entrepreneurs themselves. Entrepreneurship often falls prey to survivorship bias; we celebrate successes while ignoring the toll this path takes. I work individually with driven entrepreneurs, helping them optimize their health so they can sustainably pursue their visions—and change the world while they're at it.

After living overseas for 13 years, I now proudly call Chicago home. I'm deeply entrenched in its vibrant culture and passionately loyal to its sports scene (for better or worse—mostly worse these days).

Follow me if you're passionate about health innovation, entrepreneurship, creating impactful movements, or just want some straight-up truth about how to live healthier, build stronger businesses, and thrive longer.
Description (2):
Physician-formulated, pharmaceutical grade, precision-dosed health optimization formulations delivered through a buccal troche. Troscriptions provides “cheat codes” (i.e. troches) that improve mitochondrial health, brain function, relieve stress and tension, help you sleep, decrease pain, and more.
Dynamic equanimity is just a troche away.

Mission: To help evolve a non-reciprocal altruistic species by decreasing suffering in ourselves and decreasing suffering in others, realizing that there are no others.
Headline: CEO @ SNH, Troscriptions, Health Optimization Medicine and Practice

Description: CEO at @useyardstick. We measure soil carbon. Also: Fostering/adoption, Jesus, redemptive capitalism (?!), holding paradox, crying at work. Likely wrong.
Title: Executive Coach
Summary:
Climate change threatens all humanity. I want to help fix it. I run Yard Stick PBC; we measure soil carbon.

--

Yard Stick provides easy, accurate, and affordable quantification of soil carbon stocks. Our mission is to enable gigaton-scale agricultural carbon sequestration via scalable, trustworthy measurement solutions. We are the measurement backbone of soil carbon.

Scientists and farmers alike have known for decades that climate-friendly agricultural practices have the potential to remove atmospheric GHGs at gigaton/year scale. But significant measurement challenges have held soil carbon back - until now. By reducing the cost of statistically-sound and agronomically-legitimate soil carbon measurement by 90%+, Yard Stick will dramatically expand the opportunities for evidence-based regenerative agriculture and ranching practices to simultaneously improve ecosystem health, increase farmer/rancher livelihoods, and combat climate change.

--

My jam is science commercialization with a strong brand and customer experience lens. Though formally trained as a designer (RISD undergrad), I now focus on being "the business guy" founding a company alongside awesome technical/scientific co-founders.

Until 2020, I was the CEO and Co-Founder of Sundaily. We made skincare gummies based on peer-reviewed, published, human clinical data. We were acquired by Grove Collaborative in June 2020. I still have a lot of gummies in my basement.

I also mentor a variety of startups in the Boston area and love helping other founders. I'm especially interested in mentorship among underrepresented founder communities (e.g. female and nonbinary, BIPOC, immigrant). If you're a founder wondering if I can help you, please hit me up and let's find out!
Description (2):
Yard Stick measures soil carbon. Scientists and farmers alike know that climate-friendly agricultural practices have the potential to remove atmospheric CO2 at gigaton/year scale. When these practices are adopted, more carbon is stored in soils, improving soil health and fighting climate change. But significant measurement challenges have held soil carbon efforts back - until now.

By reducing the cost of soil carbon measurement by 90%+, Yard Stick will dramatically expand the opportunities for evidence-based regenerative practices to simultaneously improve ecosystem health, increase farmer income, and combat climate change.
Headline: CEO at Yard Stick PBC (soil carbon measurement)

Description: Founder, Law Firm Alchemy | Proud father of two daughters | Husband to an awesome wife | #entrepreneur #creator #maker

Summary:
Highlights for my client include:
 Doubling personal injury revenue in less than 12 months (specifically new client intake - not just collecting what was already in the firm)

 Adding $300,000 in new revenue to a six-figure criminal defense firm

 Launching one of the top podcasts on estate planning in the country (which brings in actual clients, not just listeners)

 Tripling average client value for multiple estate planning firms

 Coached numerous firms from six figures to their first million dollar year

 Grew a $1.1 million personal injury firm to $3.1 million (and counting!)

I wasn't brought into the legal profession as a lawyer... I started in marketing and learned everything I could about what it takes to build and grow an exceptional, high-profit law firm. Today, I coach a select group of law firm owners to 2X-5X their firms and grow as LEADERS. I also publish market-leading courses on growth tools for law firms.

 YOUR JOURNEY as a leader and growth engine is the #1 key to unlocking the full potential of your law firm. We can easily increase revenues while you live a better life by following the 7 Stages of Law Firm Leadership, my coaching road map developed specifically for law firms.

With 13+ years working in, for, with, and on exclusively law firms, I have seen it all.

Better yet, I saw the PATTERNS...

There are consistent challenges faced by growing law firms, from marketing to hiring to leading a growth-oriented team. These challenges evolve as the firm evolves, which is why we work with the 7 Stages of Law Firm Leadership. By focusing on change we can control (how you operate as the owner), we affect change through the whole organization!

The real secret...

is NOT a marketing strategy... or management system... or goal-setting... or any one thing.

It's understanding the WHOLE BUSINESS and getting it to work in concert!

Together, we will scale your firm and produce a transformation you may see as "impossible" today. Soon, it will be your reality!

Here is what others have said:

"Charley is a rarity and truly peerless. In an industry rife with charlatans, separating the wheat from the chaff can sometimes be difficult. It's abundantly clear that he is the genuine article. Professional without preaching, Charley commands authority naturally. I listen to this man intently. He is my coach and a true friend. Charley is the type of person you want in your inner circle."

"Charley is best in class. Can't thank him enough for always bringing out the best in me. If you listen to his suggestions and then implement, you will soar."

Title: Founder & Lead Creative
Summary:
Are you struggling to find your personal or your brand's unique voice in your competitive space? To position yourself as the obvious "go-to" preeminent choice?

Or better yet...

Struggling to rise above the noise and sameness in your space and to be seen and heard by your ideal customers and audiences that matter to you?

If you're nodding along whispering "yes" thus far, then congratulations!

We may just be the perfect fit!

Hi there, my name is Stephan.

To date, the stories we've created with our clients have...
 won an EMMY Award (for our documentary work with a Hawaii Tour Boat operator),
 brought their content to Broadcast television,
 have helped non-profit organizations break through their fundraising goals by 250%,
have worked with prestigious national brands.

Today my team and I help ethical brands with soul create wonderful stories that rise above the noise & engage in profitable communications through the craft of storytelling.

Before that I worked in business consulting for local Hawaii brands translating business needs with tech solutions, film production on feature films, hospitality management at Four Seasons Resorts and Hotels, web development and PR for an Olympic Gold medalist skier and a brief stint in book publishing.

That was all started through my educational background at a German Foreign School in New York, as well as a bachelor or arts degree at Columbia College in the City of New York.

My offer to you?

We embark on a storytelling adventure. Together. I will listen to your wants, needs, desires, goals, opportunities, challenges, vision, etc... and will respect your time and business. I expect that you will be fully present in our endeavor together and respect our time and expertise as well.

Our time together isn't a magic pill you can take in which I do everything for you. No.

Our time together will be magical, because of what happens when we engage in the creative process to uncover your or your brand's one-of-a-kind stories, your differentiating factors and USP. No one else has those and that's how we authentically cut through the noise and find separation from the competition.

I've spent tens of thousands of hours interviewing, story-finding, and organizing massive amounts of data points into story structure designed to move an audience.
I've touched every aspect of filmmaking on feature film sets, indie sets, and corporate brand short films.
I've generated creative approved for national brands and Emmy Award Winning production studios.

I've put in all this work, so that you don't have to.
Description (2):
We help ethical brands with soul create wonderful stories that cut through the noise & engage in profitable communications through the craft and science of storytelling.

Wouldn’t you agree that the world is filled with noise?

There are the dry business cases, product/ service feature and benefit listings, interruption ads and vacuous videos with no goal and no structure. They all in one way or another lean on fact-based messaging.

Facts don’t move people to action.

People make decisions on a subconscious level, on an emotional level. That is the level of storytelling.

At the heart of what we do is a systematic process that first seeks to understand your specific needs, challenges, or opportunities, as well as your audience. Armed with story, you end up making a bigger impact for all involved in your brand’s orbit.
Headline: EMMY Award Winning Filmmaker & Story Strategist for Brands who want to tell great stories.

Description: Co-founder, @beaconsai (YC S19) Class of 2022 @ForbesUnder30 Genomics and machine learning PhD @Stanford
Title: Cofounder, Chief Product Officer
Summary:
I’m the cofounder and CPO at Beacons, where we’re building AI-powered tools to help over 8 million creators earn through brand deals, affiliate links, digital products, and more.

With tools like link-in-bio, media kits, affiliate links, and email marketing powered by AI, Beacons acts as a smart teammate—connecting data across the creator business to boost creator success.

We also support top agencies and management companies with tools to manage rosters, pitch campaigns, and streamline reporting.

We started Beacons in 2019 as four friends with a hunch that creators would shape the next layer of the internet. Before Beacons, I earned my PhD in Electrical Engineering at Stanford, where I worked on deep learning and single-cell genomics in David Tse’s lab and helped design a data science course.

We’re backed by a16z, The Chainsmokers, Naval Ravikant, and other amazing partners. Our hybrid team is ~40 people with offices in SF and NYC.

 Check out our open roles at: http://careers.beacons.ai/

DM me if you’re:
– A creator or manager or brand looking to level up your workflow
– Working in AI or the creator economy (or both!)
– Building something fun and want to jam

Description: Passionate about small business and US manufacturing. Lead the team @fireclay
Title: Member
Summary:
I am currently the CEO of Fireclay Tile in San Francisco, CA. I joined Fireclay in January 2009 to help reshape the company into a leading, growing, profitable design brand. Fireclay is an amazing organization where we make and sell the world’s most beautiful tile, and we focus on both residential and commercial projects that span from small decorative pieces to massive projects for folks like Google, Whole Foods, and Starbucks. In this role I have the most fun I have ever had in a job. I run all aspects of our business and work with a team of people who motivate me to work hard and provide amazing customer service to all of those with whom we work. Together, we have been able to grow Fireclay from 20 to over 280 Teammates while helping to disintermediate the tile world by bringing our products direct from maker to your home or project. We are the first US Certified B Corp tile brand, we are 30% Employee Owned, and I'm passionate about using Business as Force for Good, local manufacturing, and challenger brands! If you need any tile for any reason, please let me know!

Before Fireclay I graduated from the Stanford Graduate School of Business ('07). I had previously specialized in biopharmaceutical and medtech investing at Lehman Brothers as part of a 3-person team making venture capital and special situations investments. I am passionate about helping others and finding unique solutions to big problems, and I love challenging the status quo, supporting small business, and B Corps.

I actively invest in and help support other small, growing businesses, as well as am a member of YPO (SFBay Chapter) and serve on the YPO Regional Board.

Lastly, I love to run and am always up for training and competing in crazy races. One day I hope to get a lottery spot in the Western States 100. Until then I will continue to run the hills of Mill Valley and spend time outside with my two beautiful daughters and amazing wife.

Tile to the People!
Description (2):
Tile Made for Good
We're committed to doing Tile differently. Since 1986, we’ve been handcrafting beautiful, sustainable Ceramic, Brick, and Glass Tile. We’re proud to be the first Certified B Corp Tile company, recognized for our responsibility to our teammates, our environment, and our community.

Sustainable by Design
Our passion for sustainability is at the core of everything we do. We create our Tile with 100% renewable energy, and ensure that every scrap and drop of water used in our production process finds its way back into our manufacturing line. Our sustainable Tile meets industry-leading certifications, including LEED, and we're Climate Neutral certified. We continually hold ourselves accountable to meet the requirements of the climate crisis.

Made in the USA
We pride ourselves in creating handcrafted American Made Tile in our sustainable California and Washington Tile Factories and we’re committed to empowering the artisans responsible for producing the best Tile with the best practices. Fireclay Tile is employee-owned and each and every team member at Fireclay earns a fair wage with competitive benefits.

Rooted in Innovation
We're not content with the status quo. From installing on-site solar to continuing to shorten the distances we source materials from, we're constantly pushing the boundaries of what's possible. We keep ourselves on the cutting edge of progress because innovation is in our DNA.
Headline: CEO at Fireclay Tile - We're Hiring!

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
I believe in the power of empathy, teamwork, and determination to improve healthcare access and delivery. Curious about multi-omics and the intricacies of biology, I thrive in complex stakeholder environments and focus my energy on translating technologies at the intersection of biology and computation into clinical value. I bring interdisciplinary experience as an early-stage operator, entrepreneur, and team-builder.

I am currently thinking about how we can better harness nature's original information storage solutions (nucleic acids) to power precision medicine. We're looking for talented individuals to bring our vision to life at Cache DNA, so please get in touch: https://www.cache-dna.com/.

More broadly, I am interested in the evolution of healthcare to improve patient outcomes at lower costs. I recently served as a Fellow with Northpond Ventures. If you're working on something interesting in medicine, translational science, or biotechnology, I'd love to chat and find ways to help you build a better tomorrow!
Address - Locations: 733 Industrial Rd, San Carlos, California 94070, US
Description (2):
At Cache, we are on a mission to store the biomolecules of today to unlock the possibilities of tomorrow.

We believe that nucleic acids are the new bits of the 21st century, so harnessing the information stored in them will help usher in the future of precision medicine and biological computing.

Our vision is to create a scalable, sustainable, and standardized platform for reliable storage and access of biomolecules by combining chemistry, biology, automation, and computational tools.
Headline: CEO @ Cache | The path toward a cure starts with samples
