Description: Founder @CubbyBeds, a dtc med device startup. Exploring the intersection of ecom, manufacturing & health technology. Over 5 million nights slept ☁️
Title: Member
Summary:
Founder and CEO of Cubby Beds - we're on a mission to improve sleep and safety for millions of people with complex conditions and special needs. If you're interested in joining us, we're hiring!

If you're interested in learning more about me, here's my story.

I fell in love with business at an early age and opened an eCommerce store when I was 15. By 16, I was running a six-figure online marketing and wholesale business and knew that I'd be building "stuff" for the rest of my life.

After some early business learnings, I volunteered in Guatemala + Canada for a year and then studied at the University of Waterloo. During this time I managed a team of 20+ sales reps for a travel startup and founded an events company that brought thousands of people to events across Canada.

I then joined SendGrid to help companies like Uber, Spotify, and Airbnb send their most critical communications. I rode the rollercoaster of startup -> IPO -> $3B+ acquisition by Twilio.

Cubby Beds is my life mission, inspired by a childhood friend with special needs. We manufacture and deliver smart sensory beds to improve sleep and safety for people with cognitive conditions like Autism, Epilepsy, and Dementia. We have shipped thousands of beds to all 50 states, have over 1,000 5 star reviews, and partnered with Joyance Venture Capital, Arc Capital, Stanford & LA Children's Hospital.

We are changing lives + this industry for thousands of families and having a lot of fun doing it. Want to talk startups or about building better solutions for special needs communities? Reach out!
Description (2): We manufacture and sell smart beds to improve sleep, safety, and sensory control for people with complex conditions and special needs.
Headline: Helping Kids Get Safer Sleep - DTC Med Tech Founder

Description: I help designers make more money and get their flowers. Ran @superfriendlyco for a decade then sold it.
Title: Founder
Summary:
On February 1, 2012, I challenged myself to take my professional destiny into my own hands.

I opened my own agency. I believed I could make more on my own—and on my own terms—than any employer would be willing to pay me.

Today—more than thirteen years later—that challenge still hasn’t ended. I’m still betting on myself. And it continues to pay off… literally.

• In 2012, I made $416,636.
• In 2013, I made $613,826.
• In 2014, I made $384,638.
• In 2015, I made $334,175.
• In 2016, I made $841,438.
• In 2017, I made $1,098,084.
• In 2018, I made $846,623.
• In 2019, I made $1,197,715.
• In 2020, I made $2,938,409.
• In 2021, I made $896,127.
• In 2022, I made $529,775.
• In 2023, I made $397,609.
• In 2024, I made $684,192.

As you’ll notice, this isn’t one of those smooth “up-and-to-the-right” charts entrepreneurs love to post. It's a real one. Like most of us, my journey has had its highs and lows.

But all of it still allows me to live the life I want to live. I still have goals I’m chasing, and I get to pursue them from a place of privilege, intention, and abundance.

These days, I focus on helping other designers do the same.

I believe financial success starts by *talking* about money: openly, honestly, without shame. If we can’t even talk about it, how are we supposed to make more of it?

I’m sharing everything I know about running a lucrative, profitable, calm business that runs on purpose in my Make More Money 3-month group coaching program.

But don’t just take my word for it.

Let me help you make some money first.

Take my free “6-Day Revenue Roadmap” email course at https://makemoremoney.design/6-day-revenue-roadmap (or click my LinkedIn profile buttons above).
Description (2):
Running a design business doesn’t have to mean late nights, low-paying projects, and constant hustle.

We teach design freelancers, studios, and agency owners how to:

 Raise rates and win premium clients
 Build predictable revenue
 Work fewer hours without sacrificing profit

Our 3-month coaching program and free resources like the 6-Day Revenue Roadmap provide practical frameworks and personalized coaching to help you earn more while working less.

Founded by Dan Mall, a designer and entrepreneur who grew his agency to $3M in revenue with one full-time employee—while taking 7 weeks off per year—we’ve helped hundreds of designers break the feast-or-famine cycle.

Ready to level up your business? Apply to join at makemoremoney.design.
Headline: I help designers make more money and get their flowers.

Description: Founder of @Mobble_app. Obsessed with innovation and agriculture. Family farm in the hills near Avenel VIC.
Title: Entrepreneur In Residence
Summary:
I grew up on a mixed livestock farm in Victoria, where I saw first-hand how complex and disconnected farm operations can be. After studying engineering at the University of Melbourne and working on farms across Australia, I came back home to the same problem: messy records and poor communication.

That was the seed for Mobble. What began as a simple way to centralise livestock records has grown into the operating system for livestock enterprises, now trusted by thousands of farmers and large-scale operations across Australia, New Zealand, the US and Canada.

Our mission is simple: make farming easier, more connected, and more successful. By bringing grazing, livestock records, compliance, and team communication into one place, we help farmers improve efficiency, collaboration, and long-term sustainability.

I’m passionate about the intersection of agriculture and technology, building tools that drive operational efficiency and the future of livestock farming.
Address - Locations: 890 Lambing Gully Rd, Avenel, Victoria 3664, AU

Description: Nerd in Business Attire. Tinkering in the Venn-Diagram of Marketing, Data & Technology. Founder of @data_to_value
Title: Principal Consultant
Summary:
Data has no intrinsic value. Action does. At Data to Value, we work with ambitious marketing teams to close the loop between data and decisions. Most companies get stuck collecting and analyzing data, we help you activate it.

We believe data-driven marketing isn't about having perfect data; it's about making better decisions, faster.

We use a hypothesis-driven approach: Test → Learn (whether you win or lose) → Scale or Reverse → Repeat.

Here's how we work:

 Situation Analysis — Where are you now?
 Strategic Framework — What does success look like? (using our IMPACT model)
 Execution — Getting your first loops closed quickly to build momentum
 Culture — Building a team that acts on data, not just reports on it

We're a fully remote team of Senior Consultants (only!) across Europe.

We can do the work for you, with you, or guide you to do it yourself.

Either way, we're focused on one thing: turning your data into competitive advantage through decisive action.

Summary:
I am a purpose-driven executive with two decades of leadership at the intersection of health, policy, media, and social impact. I’ve raised more than $100M for national health initiatives, led multi-million-dollar advocacy campaigns (including a 2024 Super Bowl ad), and built coalitions that shape both public opinion and public policy.

My expertise spans capital raising, nonprofit and PAC leadership, strategic partnerships, and high-stakes communications. I’ve served as CEO, Chief Impact Officer, and Founder across organizations advancing cancer, autism, women’s health, and consumer health innovation. In each role, I’ve blended business acumen with mission-driven execution from driving M&A integrations and building revenue streams to producing media campaigns that shift national conversations.

My work has been featured in Forbes, Fortune, The New York Times, Good Morning America, ABC, E!, and the New York Post. I serve as both strategist and spokesperson, able to mobilize capital, media, and stakeholders around topics that matter.

Today, I focus on scaling ventures and alliances that redefine health for future generations, championing innovation, advancing bipartisan women’s health policy, advising boards and leadership teams on aligning capital, governance, and strategy to drive lasting societal impact.

Core Strengths: Executive Leadership, Fundraising, Strategic Partnerships, Media & Communications, Political Advocacy, Social Impact Strategy

Summary:
I am a serial builder who loves integrating business with social impact.

Currently I am Co-Founder and CEO at Barti, where we make software that enables optometrists to focus on their patients.

Previously, I spent two years as a management consultant and intrapreneur at Bain & Co where I developed new software for Fortune 500 organizational transformations and also built my own ML-focused venture within the firm’s accelerator, the Baincubator.

The first company I built was CheckTheQ (now Qstodian) in 2016, which helped more than 50 venues like St. Louis Airport to reduce wait times with queue-management software.

During my internship with Bain & Co, I determined that an authentic approach to social impact required different experience, and I wanted to help provide the type of education that enabled my own success as a first-gen college student. I joined Teach for America and worked as a high school math and special education teacher before returning to Bain. While helping my students beat city and state growth averages, I also earned a Master of Teaching degree.

I was honored to graduate Magna Cum Laude from Washu and win recognition by the national publication Poets & Quants as a Top 100 business student in the country.

Title: Founder
Summary:
From buying a camera at Best Buy on the way to my first wedding to creating Emmy-winning films for the NFL, Apple, and Four Seasons

Most filmmakers are stuck in the "tripod for hire" trap → competing on price, working crazy hours, and never quite breaking through to those dream projects and premium budgets.

I was there too. Psychology student who couldn't get anyone to care about the fascinating research I was obsessed with. Until one wedding changed everything.

That "smelly" first wedding video (my words, not theirs! ) went viral. Canon turned it into a national commercial. The NFL called next. Suddenly, I had a 200-day contract and was learning that stories don't just entertain - they transform businesses.

Over 15 years, I've traveled 1.5M miles across 100+ countries, creating films that've generated millions in revenue for the world's most demanding brands. Won multiple Emmys. Spoke at the UN in Geneva. But here's what I'm most proud of:

 32 filmmakers in our mentorship have landed their largest projects ever - not just in revenue, but with dream clients who value them as creative partners.

"Patrick's process transformed how I approach every client. Went from $600 day rates to a $25,000 project in 90 days." - Alex S.

"Used his frameworks to secure a $96,500 retainer by shifting to value-based pricing." - Mo T.

Ready to stop competing on price and start commanding premium rates?

 World-Changing Filmmaker Program - Complete system for storytelling mastery, cinematic techniques, and profitable business strategies

 Science of Storytelling Course - The proven 4-step process I use with Fortune 500 brands

 1:1 Mentorship - Direct access to strategies that land six and seven-figure projects

Remarkable ones create value that can't be ignored.
Headline: 5-time Emmy winner who's traveled 1.5M miles creating films for Fortune 500 brands — now teaching filmmakers the science behind $500K storytelling

Description: Co Founder, Advisory & Alumni Chair @Andela Formerly @MCFoundation @ClintonGlobal in US, China, West Bank, Kenya, Nigeria & Uganda.
Title: President & CEO
Summary:
Christina Sass is a lifelong champion of youth and a fierce advocate for women and diverse leaders across the globe. She brings a wealth of experience in global development and youth employment as the President and Chief Executive Officer of IYF.

Prior to joining IYF, Christina co-founded Andela in 2014, an on-ramp to the digital economy for thousands of young technologists across the globe. Christina served as Andela’s COO and President, where she played a pivotal role in scaling Andela to six countries in Africa, selecting, training, and placing developers as full-time team members in growing tech companies around the world. Together with her co-founder, she raised over $181M in venture capital, growing from two people to over 2,000 employees and acquiring 200+ clients, achieving a $50M annual revenue run rate in six years. Today, Andela is the world’s largest private marketplace of skilled technical talent, operating in over 150 countries. Christina has demonstrated her commitment to driving positive change and fostering innovation as an active investor in impact-oriented, early-stage Future of Work companies, both as an angel and through Dive In, a fund which invests and offers extensive executive coaching to founding teams.

Christina has also held pivotal positions at renowned organizations dedicated to advancing education and employment opportunities for youth. Notably, she directed the Program department of the Clinton Global Initiative and provided strategic counsel to the President and CEO of The MasterCard Foundation, a $30B global foundation committed to enhancing education and financial inclusion for African youth.

Christina's dedication to youth empowerment extends beyond her professional endeavors. She has built education and employment programs in diverse regions, including China, Gaza and the West Bank, Kenya, and Nigeria, reflecting her commitment to expanding opportunities for young people worldwide. Christina serves on the Advisory Council of the NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights and the board of Global Give Back Circle, a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering at-risk adolescent girls.

Christina holds a BA in Ancient Philosophy from the University of Georgia (Go Dawgs) and an MA in International Law and Diplomacy from The Fletcher School at Tufts University.
Address - Locations: 1 E. Pratt St., Baltimore, MD 21202, US
Description (2):
We believe that educated, employed, and engaged young people possess the power to solve the world’s toughest problems.

IYF is a registered United States 501(c)3 nonprofit organization. Tax Exemption ID: 382935397

Description (2):
Flight Centre Travel Group (FCTG) is one of the world’s largest travel companies, employing 15,000 like-minded individuals – known as ‘Flighties’.

Our story dates to 1973, when founder Graham Turner (aka “Skroo") and friend Geoff “Spy” Lomas buy a double-decker bus and take off on their first tour around Spain, Portugal and Morrocco, 3 years later forming the first business, Top Deck. After flight deregulations in the 80s our first retail "Flight Centre" stores opened in Australia in 1982, London in 1984, and NZ in 1987.

1987 was also the year we held our first “Global Gathering”, our infamous awards event celebrating our amazing people, a tradition that continues to this day.

We’re in our 40s now and a lot has changed! With global headquarters in Brisbane, Australia, our company owned leisure and corporate travel businesses span three major regions: APAC (Australia, New Zealand, and Asia), The Americas (USA, Canada, and Mexico), and EMEA (UK, South Africa, Ireland, Europe, and the UAE).

Our flagship corporate travel management brand, FCM, extends our reach even further through a network covering over 100 countries via both company-owned operations and independent licensees.

With 30 brands across our global footprint, our team spans from customer-facing to internal support roles. The opportunities just as diverse – from a Travel Consultant at Flight Centre or Envoyage, to a Machine Learning Scientist in one of our tech pillars.

Together, we live and breathe our number one philosophy, Our People, driven by our purpose ‘To open up the world for those who want to see’.

Our values are simple and powerful - Ownership, Egalitarianism and Irreverence.

We support our people with opportunities to help you thrive, connect, give, move and be rewarded. Our people have access to a suite of curated benefits to ensure holistic wellbeing – from mental and physicalhealth to financial freedom.

Navigate your Career. Explore the World.
Headline: Hotel Product Management | Hotel Revenue Optimization | Multi-source Hotel Distribution | NDC for Hotels

Title: Founder
Summary: Yann de Rochefort is a New York-based restaurateur, husband, father of two boys, and the founder/CEO of Boqueria. Born and raised in France, Yann’s longstanding connection to Spain and its cuisine stems from years spent living in Barcelona and exploring the local food markets. Yann later moved to NYC to work as a corporate marketing executive before ultimately deciding to “quit his day job” and pursue the opportunity to create something significant. He embraced his entrepreneurial spirit, love affair with Spain, and passion for design in 2006, when he opened Boqueria’s flagship restaurant in NYC’s Flatiron neighborhood. Twelve years later, Boqueria has become an institution, with seven locations spread throughout Chicago, Washington D.C. and Manhattan.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Address - Locations: 53 West 19th Street, New York, NY 10011, US
Description (2):
The culture at Boqueria is driven by a set of core values that empower employees to leave their egos at the door, embracing rigor, collaboration, and an entrepreneurial spirit. Boqueria enjoys an industry leading retention rate and is committed to providing opportunities for advancement at all levels. Our employees also enjoy the learning opportunities the unique food and beverage training programs provide.

Founded in 2006, Boqueria is an homage to founder Yann de Rochefort’s childhood summers spent exploring Barcelona’s local food markets. To bring to life his vision, Yann partnered with Spanish Chefs including Marc Vidal to develop a menu that marries classic Spanish dishes with seasonal, local market ingredients.  Fourteen years later, Boqueria has become an institution, with locations across Washington D.C., Manhattan, and Chicago. Each location is a unique reflection of Yann’s passion for Spain and architectural design.

Description: Pushing kilos ✨ @nguyencoffeeNYC⚡️ Robusta is the future of coffee.
Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
I'm a passionate entrepreneur & storyteller who loves to push the limits of possibility.

Through my current startup, Nguyen Coffee Supply, my mission is to build the most influential Vietnamese coffee brand in the world while promoting diversity, sustainability & cultural integrity.  As direct trade importers and roasters, we offer whole beans, ground coffee and ready-to-drink Vietnamese coffee. Our products are sold nationwide at Whole Foods Market, Target, Albertsons, Walmart, Gopuff, Amazon and on our website. We've been featured in The Wall Street Journal, Los Angeles Times, New York Times, Good Morning America, CBS News, CNN and more.

For my game changing work with Nguyen Coffee Supply, I've been honored with:
2019 StarChefs Rising Star
2020 Imbibe Magazine's "75 Tastemakers"
2020 Gold House Collective's Gold Rush Cohort for Food & Beverage
2021 Food & Wine Cover, "The Gamechangers" Issue
2023 Crain's New York "Emerging Leader"
2023 Inc Magazine Cover, "200 Female Founders"
2023 Fast Company's "Brands That Matter"

--- Previously --
Prior to starting Nguyen Coffee Supply, I had an extensive career as an award-winning writer, filmmaker, director, and journalist committed to producing uplifting and empowering content for the world. Beats included racial justice, immigration, women's empowerment, activism, and the Asian American community.

My documentary created for NBC News titled "Deported," follows the grassroots fight to end deportation of Cambodian Americans from the U.S. to Cambodia. I led a crew to film in four U.S. cities and abroad in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, capturing a historical meeting between activists, deportees, and the Cambodian government in a discussion to revise the Repatriation Agreement between the two countries and end deportation.

“Deported” won the 2018 NAMIC Vision Award for Best Digital Media, Long Form (The National Association for Multi-Ethnicity in Communications).

My documentary series for NBC News, “Self-Starters,” celebrates Asian American trailblazers around the country. “Self-Starters” was the first series to launched the video platform for NBC Asian America and was nominated for the LA Press Club and EPPY Awards alongside TIME, CNN, and ESPN.

Both of my parents are Vietnamese refugees who fled Vietnam by boat after the war. I'm here to create world-shifting narratives. Let's work together!
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Description (2):
Nguyen Coffee Supply is the first Vietnamese-American & woman-owned importer and roaster of specialty coffee beans from Vietnam in the U.S.

We are proud to partner with a 4th generation farmer who owns and operates his family farm in Vietnam’s famed Central Highlands. Together, we set out on an unprecedented mission: bring his organic, green beans to the U.S. for people to enjoy fresh roasted and in a variety of brew styles.

Nguyen Coffee Supply was founded by Sahra Nguyen, a first generation Vietnamese American and a quintessential Millennial of the “Slash Generation.” Her multifaceted creative career includes award-winning documentary filmmaker behind NBC News’ “Deported,” co-founder of New York Times reviewed restaurant “Lucy’s Vietnamese Kitchen,” co-founder of podcasting agency “Listening Party,” and a 2018 Google Next Gen Tech Policy Leader. Nguyen is the daughter of Vietnamese refugees, who fled their country by boat after the Vietnam War, and eventually settled in Boston, MA, where she was born and raised.

Through coffee, Nguyen is telling a new story and creating new opportunities for people within the global coffee community -- from the farmers to consumers.

We've built our own direct trade coffee network to import green beans and fresh roast in Brooklyn, NY. While Vietnam is the second largest coffee producer in the world, and the largest producer of robusta beans -- Nguyen Coffee Supply builds on this market potential by existing as one of the only places for fresh roasted Vietnamese coffee beans in the U.S.

Nguyen Coffee Supply is expanding third-wave coffee culture by celebrating diversity in the coffee community, offering sustainably sourced coffee beans, and championing the people behind the world’s second largest coffee production. The brand slogan, “For the People’s Grind,” reflects our mission to inspire and fuel the universal grind.
Headline: Founder & CEO at Nguyen Coffee Supply

Andy Zemon works as the Branch Manager and Loan Officer in the Crozet VA branch of Novus Home Mortgage. He is responsible for the significant growth of this branch and offers his in-depth industry knowledge to assist many of the regions’ homebuyers. Andy’s passion is providing mortgage-based financial plans and is the preferred lender for some of the area’s top builders and Realtors. Andy is one of only three Certified Mortgage Planning Specialists in the Central Virginia area.

In addition to running his own team, Andy provides continuing education courses through the Charlottesville Area Association of Realtors. He also offers seminars through the local Chamber of Commerce as well as for many local real estate offices on the finer points of owning and growing their businesses. Andy has also been featured on the WINA live morning show and the local NBC affiliate as a lending and financial expert.

Andy is a 15+ year graduate of an elite coaching group, The CORE, which only accepts the top 1% of mortgage professionals and Realtors in the country.

Before moving back to his hometown of Charlottesville, Andy worked in business development in the Washington DC area. He received his degree in Consumer Affairs at The Ohio State University. He is a past player of the Virginia Mens Rugby Football Club and spent more than 10 years as a volunteer with the Seminole Trail Volunteer Fire Department and another local volunteer departmanet as both a Driver and Fire Fighter.

Andy is married to his beautiful wife, Chanda, an orthodontist in the area and together they have four wonderful children.

Title: Resident
Summary:
Seasoned nonprofit leader with a track record of building standards, shaping policy, and forging consensus on the responsible use of complex, emerging technologies. As co-founder and CEO of Reflective, I steer efforts to accelerate rigorous sunlight reflection research—delivering the data and tools decision-makers need to judge its safety and efficacy for mitigating near-term climate risks.

Earlier roles span privacy-preserving digital identity, equitable vaccine access, and venture philanthropy.
Description (2):
Sunlight reflection may be the only available option, alongside dramatic emissions reductions, adaptation, and rapid scaling of carbon removal, to rapidly limit many climate impacts over the coming decades.  But we don’t know nearly enough about it to make a scientifically-informed decision about potential deployment – and we’re not on a trajectory for rapid, legitimate decision making.

Reflective is a philanthropically-funded initiative to develop the necessary knowledge base and do the requisite technology research and development, urgently and responsibly.
Headline: CEO @ Reflective and Resident @ Astera | Accelerating responsible research on sunlight reflection

Title: Investor & Board Member
Summary:
I am an entrepreneur and venture capitalist focused on early-stage technology. I've been involved with some great companies but my first investment in Turnstyle Solutions as the founding investor influenced me the most. From the early days at Turnstyle, I helped bring an idea to life and watched my initial investment turn into a 50 person company that was eventually acquired by a US public company in 2017.

I know the risk entrepreneurs take when starting a company, and I understand what helps them succeed at the earliest stage. I have hands-on experience in selling enterprise SaaS solutions to the top financial institutions globally. I see the importance of working with trusted advisors and partners early to help scale a business faster. Finally, I know what helps add value to a company in the beginning and what is just for show.

I founded Ripple Ventures in 2018 to help entrepreneurs and start-ups learn from my experiences while giving them more than just capital to succeed. With our 'Operators-First' approach, we work with companies every day not just every quarter. That is why we opened 'The Tank', our incubator space to offer start-ups a turnkey office space to scale their businesses with advisors and mentors surrounding them every day to help them succeed.

Title: Principal | Executive Vice President, Total Rewards
Summary:
Employee benefit programs can feel overwhelming for companies moving from startup mode to public/global organizations. There are many factors to focus on: funding, how the plans are designed, inclusivity, and compliance, to name a few.

Each growth stage brings new challenges and priorities in each category.

The complexity is stifling for many HR and Financial executives that are traditionally understaffed and overworked.

The goal is to build a comprehensive employee benefits program that meets their employees' needs while being budget-friendly.

Getting there is the challenge.

That is where I come in.

I primarily help companies in four different areas:

1. Optimizing the Benefits Experience for HR and employees by reducing the administrative burdens for HR and creating an intuitive holistic benefits platform for employees.

2. Transitioning companies from fully insured to self-funded. For companies already self-funded, I reverse language within the self-funded vendor contracts to favor my clients rather than further line the pockets of the benefit providers.

3. Leading successful and smooth PEO extractions by breaking down the transition into four project tracks: HR Processes & Systems, Employee Benefits, Business Insurance, and Retirement. Each track has a change management plan and project leader.

4. Building and managing Health & Welfare Benefit programs for PEOs, including creating and launching Health & Welfare Benefit programs for virgin PEOs.

In all four cases, I develop a multi-year benefits strategy that increases the employee experience and wellbeing. As a result, I produce significant savings and eliminate wasted costs within the healthcare system that cost companies millions over the years.

If your company is in the startup phase, experiencing growth, or getting ready to go public, I am happy to discuss what employee benefits options make the most sense, not just for where you are currently but where you ultimately want to be.

Getting started is easy — the fastest way to reach me is by email (paul.martinez@newfront.com) or phone (415-651-2327).

Description: Co-Founder @Lightricks 8 years. 0-$200m rev, first $10m bootstrap(🥵). investing $2-30m per team. Lead investor: @frame_io @forterglobal @gcashoffical & others.
Title: Investor
Summary:
Co-Founder at Lightricks, a unicorn in the creativity software space. Since we founded the company in January 2013 and for about seven years, that was my focus. Today the business is a >400 people company, with ~$200m in revenue and offices in several countries. We raised >$200m from Insight & Goldman, and done >$100m of liquidity cumulatively (not just for us founders). Learned some things through the journey. Still on the board. Stepped off as an employee end of 2019.

I started investing and supporting other entrepreneurs around 2018. Ro Health (5B), Frame.io (Sold to Adobe recently @ 1.3b) & Forter (3B) have been my main private investments. I do very few things. In 2018-2020 I have deployed >$90m into nine companies - primarily into B-pre IPO rounds, and always alongside institutional venture/growth equity firms, acting flexibly as either lead or meaningful co-investor. Good companies often want branded rounds. It is fulfilling to help craft those, when you've done a lot of them yourself and understand what it's like on the fundraising side.

In 2019 I led my first $50m Series C round, into Frame.io, and joined the board on behalf of Insight. If we talk about my investing in your company with Insight I'll provide full details on how that works.

In 2020 I led Homesome's $6.7m Series A with several Unicorn execs/founders, and Forter's $120m Series E on a TS I issued, with Bessemer and Felix joining.

I enjoy working alongside founder CEOs and look to do few, concentrated, big things that allow me to spend a lot of time with a small group. Yes, this isn't a normal set up. Normal doesn't achieve outlier results.

Ask the VC selling you if they've ever actually made >$10m as a founder. Or if they have an audited IRR >100%. Better yet, ask them how they earned the right to deploy capital in the first place - If it's not a grueling story, something is off - they had it too easy ;-)

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
Blockchains, cryptocurrencies, and other shared ledger technologies are changing the world's financial infrastructure for the better. Financial regulators are now requiring the same level of compliance with anti-money laundering laws as traditional institutions have done.

Complying can be difficult for companies who haven't had to deal with this in the past but is a sign that the technology is maturing and is proving itself.

I have always had a strong interest in financial innovation and believe it is a precursor for real financial inclusion. I have worked in the field for more than 20 years and am really excited by what I believe will happen in the next five years.

My team at Notabene is bringing our experience in this field as well as our prior work in decentralized identity systems to allow the next generation of financial companies (and smart established ones) to manage regulatory risk.

Title: Co-founder & CEO
Summary:
We help developers integrate with every video conferencing platform.

︎ Who gets results working with us
∙ Product teams at fast-growing startups who want to go to market in days instead of months.
∙ Engineering teams that don't want to burn engineering hours maintaining their meeting bot integrations, and want to focus on their core competency instead.

︎ Here’s what we do
We provide one API for meeting bots on every video conferencing platform. We abstract over differences between meeting platforms (even for platforms that don’t have an APIs). We run, monitor, and scale the complex real-time video infrastructure.

︎ Interested in learning more?
Check out our website: https://recall.ai
Description (2):
Recall.ai is the API to get recordings, transcripts, and metadata from Zoom, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, Webex, Slack, In-person meetings, and more.

We support several form factors to capture meeting data:

1. Meeting Bot API: Through Recall.ai's API and fully managed bot infrastructure, you can easily white-label bots and send them to meetings to capture the audio, video, transcriptions, and metadata from the meeting-all through a simple API.

2. Desktop Recording SDK: Use our Desktop Recording SDK to get meeting data without a bot joining the call.

3. Mobile Recording SDK (coming soon): Use our Mobile Recording SDK to record phone calls and in-person meetings.
Headline: CEO at Recall.ai | One API for all your meeting integrations

Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
"Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much." - Helen Keller

I’ve thrived on bringing people together since early childhood. When I was in junior kindergarten, I remember nervously walking into class on my first day of school and seeing all the unfamiliar faces. To calm my nerves, I started building a spaceship with some large blocks. Eventually, another curious kid joined in and soon the entire class was working on it. Our teacher even took a photo of us in front of the finished product, and it hung on the school’s wall for years after. That experience sparked my passion for organizing people and working collaboratively, which has stayed with me throughout my life.

As children, we learn the importance of teamwork and play before we even learn to read and write. It's an essential aspect of our humanity and necessary for tackling the difficult challenges we face, such as climate change and pandemics. No single profession or country can solve these issues alone. We need to unite and work together to overcome them.

In 2016, I founded Makers, which is a first-of-its-kind collective of producers from different sectors of the business and entertainment world. As of September 2022, Makers has brought together 11,000+ producers from 170+ countries. Our goal is to tackle projects that seem impossible, using collaboration and unconventional thinking. We build customized teams for each partnership, and we commit to the highest level of craftsmanship. Our producers serve as our client’s direct partner, execution superpower, and carry zero bias, so they always have your best interests in mind.Together, we have worked with global clients such as Canada Goose, RBC, Credit Karma, PepsiCo, Sephora, Amazon, and Habitat for Humanity,  and many more.

I want people to associate the title of Producer with someone who creates an environment where deep knowledge experts are motivated to work together. Producers can be a catalyst for teamwork and collaboration in many industries beyond arts and entertainment. Every day I strive to raise the bar of what it means to be a Producer and popularize this incredibly important discipline in the world.
Description (2): Turn messy client requests into briefs, budgets, and timelines - assisted by AI - and go from zero to production in minutes.
Headline: Founder & CEO, Makers → MakeOS

Prior to Instacart, she was the Vice President, Global Business Group at Facebook (Meta) where she led a team of over 4,000 people in over 55 countries and was responsible for over $60B in revenue.

She sits on the private boards of The Knot Worldwide, Comment Sold, GWI and Unitary. Carolyn is also an Advisor for Visible Ventures. Carolyn is a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, as well as a member of the 2017 Class of Henry Crown Fellows within the Aspen Global Leadership Network at the Aspen Institute.

Carolyn has been named to AdWeek’s “AdWeek 50” since 2013. In 2015, she was named to the top of Business Insider’s list of the Most Powerful Women in Advertising. Carolyn was twice included on Fortune’s “40 Under 40.”

Carolyn holds a bachelor’s degree in liberal arts and communications from Villanova University, from which she graduated Summa Cum Laude. Create a wealthy, flourishing family for your grandkids’ grandkids.
We can help you steward your resources for generations to come by building what we call the 100-year family operating system.

What is the 100-year family?

Just as in professional sports, talent and intention alone aren’t enough to guarantee a win. Everyone wants to succeed, but only a few do—and in the world of wealth, the stakes are even higher.

The sobering reality is that 90% of ultra-wealthy families lose their wealth by the third generation. Our mission is to ensure you’re part of the 10% who break that cycle, building and sustaining a legacy of wealth that flourishes for generations.

That’s why we focus on the essential elements that transform families into multi-generational, flourishing dynasties. This isn’t just about financial wealth—it’s about cultivating the character, discipline, and skills needed to navigate the complex landscape of wealth creation, family stewardship, and social impact.

Description: Truth Seeker, Yogi, Nutrition PhD @cornellnutri, Postdoctoral Fellow @Stanford Genetics studying Precision Health and Thriving
Title: Advisor
Summary:
While medicine has made leaps and bounds in the past century, we have yet to see major breakthroughs in the diagnosis and treatment of mental health. Yet mental health defines the quality of our lives. We know that mental health is closely intertwined with physical health, and it’s not yet clear the extent to which mental health drives physical disease, or how improving mental state can improve physical health. This area holds real promise for unlocking human potential in terms of satisfaction, fulfillment, and physical functioning.

As a Postdoctoral Fellow in Genetics working with Dr. Michael Snyder, Chair of Genetics and Personalized Medicine at Stanford, my work applies Precision Health techniques for understanding and improving human mental health. In particular, focusing on positive non-pharmaceutical approaches to thriving and awareness programs. I am particularly interested in these approaches that gave me back my own ability to be present and grateful.

My research aims to identify more effective strategies to improve depression, anxiety, stress, and well-being, as well as so understand whether the mind body connection can be leveraged to prevent and overcome disease. This shift in our understanding of the mind as a fundamental part of physical health comes at a critical time, as the World Health Organization predicts that mental health will be the leading cause of disease by 2030.

I have a PhD in Molecular Nutrition with a focus on Precision Nutrition, Chemistry, and Biochemistry from Cornell University. I'm excited about personalized approaches to nutrition, wellness, and personal growth, including challenging the way that people (including myself) see the world and bringing more kindness and compassion to the way we relate to ourselves and others. Today the wellness industry is largely separate from clinical medicine, however, they are growing closer together every day.

My purpose is to show up with love, kindness, and service for the people around me. My mission is to integrate wellness-based approaches to mental health and thriving into clinical treatment paradigms.

Abganz@stanford.edu

Title: Chief People Experience Officer
Summary:
I’ve always believed that People are People and not Resources. In my extensive career as a senior executive and as a management consultant I always saw myself as the Chief People Officer and not the Chief Human Resource Officer.

This is an important distinction because it shapes the way we see the people we work with.

I’m a veteran of five IPO’s and have intimate experience with the opportunities and challenges that come when organizations go through significant transformation.

I use a term called Corporate Courage that identifies when a company or organization is able to put their people first, even in the midst of organizational disruption. It isn’t easy, but in my career working with some of the finest companies in the world, I’ve discovered that when an organization puts their people first, they are able to weather the challenges and emerge stronger than before because of the strength of their people.

I believe in humor and live by the philosophy that if I can see the punchline, I will see the solution;  and thus I default to comedy as the first approach in most situations.

Sometimes, based upon my experience or my sense of humor, I am asked to speak to groups of people about a variety topics such as:  the future of work; the future of human resources, organizational dislocation; corporate courage; humor in the workplace; innovation and social consciousness in business.

I spend my time away from work trying to give back a bit and have participated in the Board of Regents at Holy Names College and Board of Advisors to the Cameron School of Business at UNCW.

One of the great joys of my life has been recognition for my contributions as a recipient of the 2023 HROToday CHRO of the Year for Innovation, named as one of the 2021 Top 100 HR Tech Influencers by HR Executive, received the 2014 "Stevie Award" for Women in High Tech, and named by the Silicon Valley Business Journal in 2015 as one of the "100 Women of Influence" in Silicon Valley.

But my greatest joy in life is my marriage to Kem Hauge an award winning composer, and our son Andy, his wife Ginger, and their children Drew and Charlotte.

Pronouns: she and her

Description: Founder @EverTrue. Building the category-leading donor experience platform with support from Rubicon Technology Partners and @BainCapVC. Iowa native.
Title: Founder & President
Summary:
As Founder & President of EverTrue, I’m building the leading donor experience platform for higher ed, K-12, and nonprofit fundraising. We’re bridging the technology gap between the nonprofit and for-profit sectors—so more students have access to education and institutions can thrive in a digital-first world.

Since founding EverTrue out of HBS, we’ve grown from a startup in Techstars Boston and MassChallenge to a category leader backed by Bain Capital Ventures. In 2021, we joined forces with ThankView to create the first true donor experience platform. Today, we’re proudly backed by Rubicon Technology Partners and serve thousands of institutions nationwide.

Outside of EverTrue, I’ve invested in and advised early-stage consumer and fintech companies including Drizly (acquired by Uber), Bonobos, Chubbies, OwnUp, and LovePop. I’m also a limited partner in Techstars and Background Capital, and have led several AngelList syndicates. Like any good investor, I’ve had my share of misses—and learned just as much from them.

I remain deeply connected to Brown, having served on the Board of Governors for the Alumni Association and as VP of the Brown Football Association. In 2022, my wife Katie and I moved our family to Puerto Rico, where we’re embracing remote work, raising three adventurous boys, and making the most of island life.
Description (2):
EverTrue’s software and data empower higher ed and independent school advancement teams to create personalized experiences for donors. Hundreds of teams use EverTrue’s network of social and demographic data sources and modern, mobile-first software to reach more donors and increase fundraising. In

October 2021, EverTrue merged with ThankView to form the leading donor engagement platform. ThankView is the most popular personalized video solution for education and nonprofit organizations, enabling them to steward and engage donors with 1:1 and 1:many videos. The joint company is backed by Rubicon Technology Partners and serves more than 1,700 nonprofit customers.

Visit http://www.evertrue.com and http://www.thankview.com for more information.

Description: CEO & Founder @Optery | Co-Founder @Screenleap | W22 & W12 @YCombinator | Alum @Stanford & @DukeFuqua & @StartX
Title: CEO & Founder
Summary:
Lawrence is CEO and Founder of Optery (Y Combinator W22, StartX F21), whose mission is to put consumers in control of their personal data. Optery is automated opt out software that automatically removes you from hundreds of data brokers posting and selling your information online. Lawrence presented Optery at TechCrunch Disrupt Startup Battlefield (2022) and as a finalist at SWSX Pitch (2023). Hundreds of thousands of people use Optery to prevent attacks and keep their personal information off the Internet.

Optery was awarded "Editors' Choice" by PCMag.com as the most outstanding product in the personal data removal category in 2022, 2023, 2024 and 2025, and Fast Company’s Next Big Things in Tech for security and privacy in 2023. Optery received the Cybersecurity Excellence Awards for Attack Surface Management, Digital Footprint Management, and Employee Privacy Protection in 2024 and 2025, the Top InfoSec Innovator Award and Best Service for Attack Surface Management by Cyber Defense Magazine in 2025, and the Fortress Cybersecurity Award for Privacy Enhancing Technologies in 2025. Optery was ranked the #1 most effective of all personal data removal services tested in a 2024 study by Consumer Reports, and was named one of Business Insider’s Top 30 Future Unicorns in 2025.

Prior to founding Optery, Lawrence led Accenture’s Data Management Platforms (DMP) practice in North America. Prior to Accenture he was a Product Management and Technical Consulting leader at Oracle and BlueKai (acquired by Oracle for $400MM+).

As an entrepreneur, Lawrence has been founding innovative companies since he was an undergraduate at Stanford and first featured in Business Week magazine at age 20. During college in the year 1999, Lawrence launched a popular web site called Steamtunnels with Stanford classmates Aaron Bell and Tuyen Truong. The site included an online facebook for Stanford undergraduates that pre-dated Mark Zuckerberg’s Facebook at Harvard by five years. The trio ran into similar difficulties with the school administration over allegations of copyright violation when posting student photos, and ultimately took the site down due to mounting University pressure. The story received coverage in the national press. Tuyen and Lawrence teamed up again in 2011 to pioneer frictionless screen sharing as founders of Screenleap (Y Combinator W12).
Description (2):
Optery is at the forefront of personal data protection, offering state-of-the-art removal software that empowers users – from individuals to large enterprises – to take control of their online information. We opt you out of all the top data brokers that trade in your personal information and post sensitive details like home addresses, emails, phone numbers, and other private info online. Leveraging the most advanced data broker scanning software in the world, Optery far surpasses Google and other services in uncovering user profiles.

Combining sophisticated automation with our Privacy Agents' expertise, we ensure the industry's highest quality results in PII removal from over 600+ data broker sites. Our service features monthly automated scans and visual, evidence-based reporting for continual data removal and clear before-and-after results. Whether for personal use or enterprise-level deployment, Optery equips users with a robust defense against escalating PII-based threats such as phishing, social engineering, identity theft, doxing, and harassment.

Optery has completed its AICPA SOC 2, Type II security certification, and distinguishes itself with unparalleled search technology, data removal automation, visual evidence-based before-and-after reporting, data broker coverage, and API integration options.

Optery was awarded “Editors’ Choice” by PCMag.com as the most outstanding product in the personal data removal category in 2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025, was named winner in the Employee Privacy Protection, Attack Surface Management, and Digital Footprint Management categories of the 2024 Cybersecurity Excellence Awards, received the Top InfoSec Innovator Award for Attack Surface Management by Cyber Defense Magazine in 2024, and received Fast Company’s Next Big Things in Tech award for security and privacy in 2023.

Hundreds of thousands of people and hundreds of businesses use Optery to prevent attacks and keep their personal information off the Internet.
Headline: CEO & Founder at Optery (YC W22)

Description (2): Dimension Labs is the missing layer of the modern data stack — the language data infrastructure for enterprises. Most customer truth lives in unstructured conversations (calls, chats, surveys), but this data is messy, unlabeled, and invisible to analytics. Dimension Labs ingests, transforms, and enriches that language into clean, queryable tables enriched with AI-driven signals like product issues, customer effort, and churn risk. Think of it as dbt for unstructured data: governed pipelines that plug directly into Snowflake, Databricks, or your BI tools — giving data teams full visibility into the customer story for faster, smarter decisions.

"Always grateful. Always curious," and "Obsessed with Impact." These are my core convictions, and I weave them into everything I do.

I believe that mortgage professionals are on the frontline of the financial literacy battle in America, so I founded Mortgage Coach to help lenders provide the best financial advice to borrowers. As Chief Growth Officer of TrustEngine–the industry's first borrower intelligence platform–my mission has evolved. I've conducted over 1,000 interviews with top industry leaders, leveraging YouTube as a sales training platform and making the Mortgage Coach YouTube channel a "Netflix" for loan officers and mortgage executives.

I've been married to my amazing wife, Kelly, for 32 years, and we're the proud parents of Jack and Syd. I'm also a co-founder of FirstHome IQ, a nonprofit dedicated to solving the financial literacy gap for Gen Z and first-time home buyers who want to buy their first home.

I believe in a few basic tenets:

Title: Partner
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Address - Locations: 550 High St., 3rd Fl., Palo Alto , CA 94301, US
Description (2):
Foundation Capital was founded in 1995. As an early-stage venture capital firm, our fintech, enterprise, and consumer investments have reinvented industries and defined new markets. For over a quarter of a century—through boom and bust, prosperity or calamity—Foundation Capital has endured, evolved, and thrived, with over $3B assets under management, 34 IPOs and ICOs, and 80+ acquisitions to our name. Building companies is in our bones.

We back individuals who want to nudge the world ahead in some way, using a transformative business as their fulcrum. Great companies, like Apple or Amazon or Netflix, aren’t formed from code and corporate charters. They’re built on a foundation of dreams and desires; raised up through struggle and sacrifice. For such companies to succeed, the people who start and lead them have to want success badly. It has to come from the deepest part of them—a hunger to create something consequential, something lasting; a need to prove themselves, whether out of a sense of mission, or a yearning for significance, or a heart full for disobedience. We look for people who believe—even if they would never speak it out loud—that the purpose of life is to be briefly extraordinary.

We think that since the beginning of invention, humanity has advanced because the remarkable have pushed us forward. Because select women and men of their times have dared to think different, to build it better, to do what’s never been done. Across the ages, we’ve had many names for these people. Today, at Foundation Capital: we call them founders.
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

My goal is simple: bring clarity, trust, and technical know-how to help design and construction teams overcome challenges and deliver successful projects.

As Principal of the All Things Facades Group, I work at the intersection of business development and technical execution — representing leading façade manufacturers and advising project teams across the following:

- Windows - existing buildings & new construction
- Unitized - window wall, curtain wall, bypass
- Architectural Glass - high performance, oversized, curved, laminated, thin triple/quad assemblies
- Metal - louvers, sunshades, screens, decorative/ornamental

My role blends independent manufacturer representation with hands-on advisory support for developers, architects, contractors, glaziers, and consultants. Whether it’s early-stage concept, specification support, or project delivery, I help teams win better work, avoid costly mistakes, and build façades that perform.

Alongside project work, I run the All Things Facades educational platform, where I share daily insights, annotated field details, and podcast conversations with industry leaders.

My mission is to raise the bar for façade education and create a trusted hub for professionals across the building envelope world.

If you’re looking to:
• Advance a project with technical advisory
• Explore manufacturer representation
• Collaborate on education or brand positioning

Description (2):
Foundation Capital was founded in 1995. As an early-stage venture capital firm, our fintech, enterprise, and consumer investments have reinvented industries and defined new markets. For over a quarter of a century—through boom and bust, prosperity or calamity—Foundation Capital has endured, evolved, and thrived, with over $3B assets under management, 34 IPOs and ICOs, and 80+ acquisitions to our name. Building companies is in our bones.

We back individuals who want to nudge the world ahead in some way, using a transformative business as their fulcrum. Great companies, like Apple or Amazon or Netflix, aren’t formed from code and corporate charters. They’re built on a foundation of dreams and desires; raised up through struggle and sacrifice. For such companies to succeed, the people who start and lead them have to want success badly. It has to come from the deepest part of them—a hunger to create something consequential, something lasting; a need to prove themselves, whether out of a sense of mission, or a yearning for significance, or a heart full for disobedience. We look for people who believe—even if they would never speak it out loud—that the purpose of life is to be briefly extraordinary.

We think that since the beginning of invention, humanity has advanced because the remarkable have pushed us forward. Because select women and men of their times have dared to think different, to build it better, to do what’s never been done. Across the ages, we’ve had many names for these people. Today, at Foundation Capital: we call them founders.

Title: Senior Vice President & Global Head of Sustainability
Summary:
I am a first-generation Harvard MBA (2021) with a deep passion for sustainability, nature conservation, architecture, and design – interests that have blended into a career at the intersection of real estate, hospitality, environmental and social impact.

My family’s story has also shaped the lens through which I see the world and understand my role in it. I was born in Pereira, Colombia – where I lived until my family immigrated to the U.S. in 1999, fleeing decades of internal civil war, social unrest, and economic inequality.

With only an elementary school education, my parents found work in construction, housekeeping, and custodian services. We fought a decade-long immigration adjustment process during which we experienced life as undocumented immigrants. Through a mix of luck, perseverance, hard work, and support from many generous individuals along the way – the course of my life and that of my family drastically changed for the better.

I attended Georgetown University on a scholarship, began my finance career at Goldman Sachs with the support of incredible mentors, and expanded my awareness of the business world's ability to deliver profit with purpose at Harvard Business School – all unlikely outcomes for someone of my background. Today, my life’s purpose is to extend similar opportunities to people around the world and to advance environmental conservation initiatives in the commercial real estate industry without compromising on financial value creation.

Note: the posts, comments, and views shared on my profile are separate from those of my employer, Starwood Capital Group. They are, however, part of my attempt to raise awareness and contribute towards the creation of a more sustainable and inclusive global economy.

Title: Director of Operations
Summary:
Simply trying to defend the American Dream.

In the past, that’s been through broadening access to excellent education (Teach For America) and high-paying careers in tech (SV Academy). Now, I’m working to democratize access to capital at Wefunder.
Description (2):
We’re the Robinhood for pre-IPO startups.  Everyone can angel invest $100 in a Community Round.

On May 16, 2016, it became legal for everyday people to invest as little as $100 in startups and small businesses.  Since then, we’ve helped 1,860 founders raise almost $500M from their community - for flying cars, coffee shops, and everything in between.

We’re a Public Benefit Corporation with a mission to revitalize capitalism and keep the American dream alive. GDP growth is slowing. Wealth inequality is increasing. Entrepreneurship is dying across America; falling from 10.6% to 3.6% among those under 30 since 1989. We’re reversing these trends by funding more deserving businesses across all of America, not solely tech startups in Silicon Valley.

Want to help? Join us! We’re a team of founder types: enjoy autonomy, responsibility, the opportunity to learn, and no red tape. Just make it happen.

I’m a People & Operations Sr. Leader and a results-driven culture architect. HOW I LEAD
I’ve built a reputation for leading with vision, authenticity and an intrinsic commitment to making things better. Whether it’s transforming workplace culture, designing high-impact programs, or building high-performing and high-thriving teams, I bring energy, clarity and a results-driven mindset to everything I do. My leadership philosophy is part Coach, part Pace-Setter. I think big, move fast, motivate teams & partners, and deliver results that matter at scale. Oh, and I like to make sure we have a lot of *fun* while doing it!

WHAT DRIVES ME
Purpose-Driven Leadership: I don’t believe in doing things just because “that’s how they’ve always been done.” I challenge the status quo to create strategies that actually work - for people and for business.
Authenticity & Connection: People work best when they feel seen, heard and empowered. I build high-trust environments where people bring their full & best selves to the table.
Bold, Impactful Execution: I love to GSD, but it's more than that. It's about moving with intention, cutting through inefficiency and delivering results that matter on a large scale. It's combining vision with rigor so ideas become something tangible: measurable and high-value outcomes.

PERSONAL VALUES
Purpose | Transparency | Integrity | Accountability | Impact | Enthusiasm | Quality | Authenticity

CORE AREAS OF EXPERTISE

Description: Storyteller for moonshots at X - self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet, & more.
Title: Advisor
Summary:
Launching self-driving cars, Internet balloons, delivery drones, smart contact lenses, and many other out-there technologies, Courtney spent 10+ years building Google X, the world’s first moonshot factory.  She was part of the founding executive team that got the keys to the “lab of wildest dreams” when Alphabet was formed in 2015 and X became an Other Bet.

Prior to her adventures at X, Courtney hopscotched the globe and Google’s emerging markets (particularly in Asia-Pacific) helping the company’s innovations – from Search to Google Apps to Android to Chrome to YouTube to Google Fiber – launch and thrive in new communities of users. The common theme across Courtney’s 20+ year career: scrappy, startuppy, radically creative environments with sci-fi-sounding science/tech, high stakes, and only the haziest sense of what the path ahead might hold.

She's now founded un/owned, a new kind of innovation lab and consultancy set up to tackle "ownerless" problems – like microplastics, fashion waste, urban heat islands, and the way our digital lives are upending our real lives -- that fall between the cracks in organizations, industries, and capital types. Follow her for updates.

Courtney has given dozens of talks and workshops for thousands of people around the world about innovation and "moonshot thinking," with a particular focus on the organizational, cultural, and psychological underpinnings of environments whose “product” is 10x thinking and radical new ideas.
Address - Locations: San Francisco Bay Area, California, US
Description (2):
Microplastics. Fashion waste. Urban heat islands. Digital mental health. Despite ample resources and desire, our slowness in tackling problems like this has become its own crisis – both practically and emotionally.

These are “unowned problems” – wicked, systemic issues that fall between the cracks in organizations, industries, and types of capital. Worse, unowned problems usually can’t be addressed effectively by the systems that helped to create them. They’re orphans of progress.

We’ve founded un/owned, a new kind of innovation lab and strategic consultancy to take responsibility for moving ownerless problems from intractable to tractable.

Our specialty is socio-technical problems, where we’re unafraid to reimagine and collaboratively design how human systems could operate differently, and where we bring existing, perhaps overlooked technologies to the table in new ways.

Our most important goal: rekindling a sense of agency and hope among millions who currently believe a better future is beyond reach, or “someone else’s responsibility.” We’re trying to engineer a culture of ownership that many more of us can participate in meaningfully, to build the tomorrows we’re excited to live in.

Not everyone wants to do this work, but those who can are everywhere. Please follow us on LinkedIn for updates on how you can venture with us into the great unowned.
Headline: Founder, un/owned. Ex-Google X. Navigator of innovation’s riskiest, foggiest, steepest paths. Generator & nurturer of courage and 10X visions. Chaos pilot.

Description: Founder @Aquariaawg, Previously investor @theFreshVC,
Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
In 2014, the water reservoir in São Paulo, dipped below 4% capacity due to drought, pollution, and poor planning — that’s over 12 million people.

In 2018, Cape Town was forced to severely ration water use to 50 liters per day as city's water supply was projected to run dry — that’s over 4.8 million people.

Today, Mexico City is facing water shortages due to over-extraction of groundwater and the population growth — that’s over 22 million people.

Notice a trend?

Every year, more and more people, in 10s of millions, are being affected by extreme weather, climate change, and increasing demand.

How do you fix this problem?

The options so far have been:

 Delivering water in trucks

 Building mass-scale desalination plants

 Digging newer deeper wells as existing ones are drying

What would actually be a good solution is something that’s:

- Easy to install
- Fast to deploy
- Affordable

The truth is that most homeowners and businesses do agree that water security is an increasing issue and needs solving.

But unfortunately the existing solutions are neither sustainable nor good for the environment:

 Digging wells is uncertain, prohibitively expensive or not allowed

 Trucking water in is becoming more expensive and unsustainable

 Municipal restrictions are increasing and what used to work no longer works

 Availability of clean water supply has more recently decreased due to drought, contamination or other effects of climate change.

For years, I’ve seen communities struggling with these problems.

Until my brother, Eric, and I decided to partner up and start Aquaria.

In simple terms, we pull clean water out of the air with our Atmospheric Water Generation (AWG) tech.

We’re on a mission to serve up to 1 million people in the most affected areas in the next decade.

And we’ve already worked with a wide variety of homeowners, commercial companies, and developers.

We’ve also set up The Aquaria Frontier Access Program — our in-house social program to provide subsidized atmospheric water generators to communities in need. As a Public Benefit Corporation, we actively seek to partner with:

- Water-related NGOs, charitable groups
- Community project developers
- Social & sustainable development groups
- Communities and projects to deploy

If you’re interested in learning more, click “Visit my website” at the top of my profile to book a call with an Aquaria advisor.
Description (2):
Aquaria taps into the humidity in the air as a new and renewable source of water. Our mission is to safeguard access to water against droughts and other effects of climate change.

Aquaria's atmospheric water generators (AWGs) act as a backup or alternative watery supply that can be installed on-site in hours. Aquaria puts control back to the consumers, crucial for those who are facing water stress challenges, access challenges, or contamination.
Headline: Building the future of Air Water Infrastructure | Supplying: Homes , Communities , Municipalities , Cities  | Co-Founder & CEO @ Aquaria | Forbes 30U30

Title: Advisor
Summary:
Every CEO, founder or investor wants more velocity, less friction. Language is the leverage that unlocks both. In an AI world, language is the last defensible moat. The hidden multiplier behind growth, valuation, and transformation. When you fix the story, you fix the system.

I advise executives, founders and funds at moments of inflection: new investment, new strategy, new phase shift. The work is focused but broad: architecting the language that aligns teams, wins buy-in, and accelerates execution. This isn’t just coaching. It’s a Narrative operating system built for the AI era and the demands of scaling.

My work has powered billion-dollar initiatives, driven adoption across 100M+ users, and shaped category narratives for Meta, Google, Salesforce, Genentech, and NASA. Since 2002, I’ve helped 350+ organizations build storytelling as a strategic capability. My focus: how to tell the story of innovation and disruption — at the system, category, or planetary scale. I help leaders make sense of what’s next because the future is built through the language and frames we choose to use.

I’m the son of a mad scientist and a teacher-artist, trained as a cultural anthropologist and entrepreneur.

Active focus areas
- Fintech, biotech, AI/ML, data science, drones, creator economy, longevity
- Advisory across big tech, deep tech, and health innovation ecosystems
- Early-stage equity advisor (Pre-Seed → Series A+)

If you’re leading at the edge and need more leverage, speed, and defensibility, let’s talk.

Title: Founder & CEO
Summary:
Talent is everywhere, but opportunity is not. My mission is to change that.

I’m the Founder & CEO of Zero Gravity, a tech startup that unlocks potential by powering students from low-opportunity areas into uni, work, and life.

Here’s my journey so far:

 I grew up in a single-parent family in a small town in West Yorkshire. I made the journey from state schools to Oxford University, and saw first-hand just how high the barriers are for students like me to break into elite institutions.

 Oxford introduced me to a new world of possibilities I never knew existed. I realised that whilst talent is everywhere, opportunity is not. So when I graduated, I turned down my corporate job offers and set out to level the playing field.

 I launched Zero Gravity from my bedroom with the last £200 of my student loan. The platform identifies talented students from low-opportunity areas and powers them into top universities and careers.

 And the platform really works! Zero Gravity has supported 15,000+ students into top universities, and our members’ stories have been featured in BBC News, Channel 4, Sky News, and The Times, amongst others.

 Zero Gravity has deployed £2.3m of scholarships to low-income students to make university affordable to all. Zero Gravity now manages one of the UK’s largest scholarship funds for low-income students.

 But going to university is just the beginning. We’ve now partnered with leading employers such as HSBC, Morgan Stanley, KPMG, Snapchat, and Rolls Royce to power thousands of students into elite careers through our platform.

 Zero Gravity has picked up over 40 awards, and I've somehow managed to snag a bit of the limelight myself. I've ended up on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list, bagged a social impact award from the Prime Minister, and even been honoured with a British Empire Medal by King Charles.

 I’ve raised £6.5m from Europe’s leading tech investors to build a talented team of 25 individuals based out of Zero Gravity HQ in Central London. We're all working hard to create a world where talent matches opportunity.

——

It’s been an incredible ride so far, but I know this is just the beginning!

So as I start my next chapter, I’ll be sharing behind-the-scenes access to my journey building Zero Gravity and the lessons I learn along the way.

For personal and Zero Gravity enquires, contact  neza@zerogravity.co.uk
Address - Locations: Zero Gravity HQ, 55 Bartholomew Close, London, England EC1A 7ES, GB
Description (2):
At Zero Gravity, we’re here to break the link between background and opportunity. Our mission? To unlock potential by empowering ambitious students from low-opportunity areas to secure the universities and careers they deserve.

Since 2019, we’ve built the UK’s leading tech platform for social mobility. Zero Gravity is packed with features designed to take talent to the top - from mentoring, masterclasses, scholarships, to exclusive internship and job opportunities.

Here’s the impact so far:

 We’ve supported 8,000+ students to secure spots at top universities, including Oxford, Cambridge, and the Russell Group.
 We’ve deployed £1.8 million in scholarships to low-income students, ensuring finances don’t stand in the way of ambition.
 Through partnerships with leading employers (think HSBC, KPMG, Morgan Stanley, and Jaguar Land Rover) we’re propelling students into elite careers, building pathways to lasting success.

We don’t want to sound too grand; but we believe that Zero Gravity isn’t just a platform - it’s a movement. We’re reimagining a world where no student’s future is limited by their postcode, school, or bank balance.

Want to learn more about how Zero Gravity can unlock your potential? Visit zerogravity.co.uk.

To partner with us, reach out at hello@zerogravity.co.uk.
Headline: Founder & CEO of Zero Gravity • Talent is everywhere, opportunity is not - we’re changing that  Forbes 30 Under 30 • Sunday Times Young Power List • Tech Entrepreneur of the Year • King’s Birthday Honours

Title: Co-Founder and CEO
Summary:
I first experienced the health care system as a caregiver – my dad had ALS (a rare neurodegenerative condition). Through this experience I learned that finding community and navigating medical information could be dramatically improved. That’s why I started Roon.

We’ve brought together a multidisciplinary team of scientists, doctors, engineers, designers, and storytellers to reimagine the experience of health online. Today, Roon has two sides: for patients, it’s a trusted place to navigate conditions with expert guidance; and for physicians, the Roon Doctor app is a private, physician-only community to share evolving knowledge, connect with peers, and shape the future of medical practice.

Before Roon, I spent several years at Pinterest in a variety of key roles (product, marketing, sales, partnerships, creators) and had a front row seat in shaping Pinterest and seeing it go from idea to IPO and beyond. I love building things that have a transformative impact on people.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States

Title: Information Security Architect
Description (2):
Bank és biztosítás. Ez a két fogalom összeforr a K&H nevével. Magyarország egyik vezető bankcsoportjaként átfogó pénzügyi szolgáltatásokat és megoldásokat kínálunk ügyfeleinknek- azért, hogy tanácsainkkal segítséget nyújtsunk az okos döntések meghozatalában.
Folyamatosan tökéletesítjük termékeinket és szolgáltatásainkat, melyek évtizedek óta a magyar piac meghatározó szereplőjévé tesznek minket. Megbízható és innovatív megoldásaink kapcsán támaszkodunk tulajdonosunk, a belga KBC Bank és a nemzetközi biztosítási csoport tapasztalataira, valamint több mint 4000 alkalmazottunk elkötelezett, magas színvonalú munkájára.
A K&H Csoport termékskálája a hagyományos kiskereskedelmi és vállalati banki termékeken kívül kiterjed a prémium banki szolgáltatásokra, a befektetési alapkezelésre, a lízingre, az életbiztosításra, a vagyon- és felelősségbiztosításra valamint az értékpapír kereskedelemre is.
Pénzügyi szolgáltatásaink nyújtása mellett felelős szervezetként, a társadalmi felelősségvállalásra is kiemelt hangsúlyt fektetünk, melynek keretében támogatjuk a vállalkozásokat, az egészségmegőrzést és a pénzügyi tudatosság növelését, valamint a környezettudatosságot is szem előtt tartjuk.

Szívesen dolgoznál velünk? Akkor látogass el karrier portálunkra!

Description: Dad of 3 amazing girls, married to an incredible woman, founder of Win By Noon & Chairman of the Bookspan Baker Team. Life is good.
Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
Todd has 25 years of experience as an entrepreneur and a business leader. He is the founder of Win By Noon, the Chairman of the Bookspan Baker team., and the co-founder of FirstHome IQ - a non-profit focused on teaching financial literacy in high schools and colleges.

For the past twenty-five years, as a mortgage originator, Todd has proven successful in cultivating both teams and branch offices. Working alongside his wife Tara, Todd successfully helped grow the Arizona region of a mortgage bank from five to eighty-five employees at four branches. He also took the lead role in developing and designing a coaching program for originators. Following this program, Todd coached groups of loan officers for several years, helping them expand their personal and team production.

During this time, Todd also successfully grew his own mortgage team into a cohesive fifteen-member group. With Todd's outstanding leadership, he led his team into the top 30 rankings for closed mortgage loans in 2015, yielding more than 550 closed loans and $113 million in volume.

He has a passion for entrepreneurship which started at a young age. At 22, Todd opened two bicycle stores, including one on the campus of University of Arizona. Within his first year in business, Todd's store was selected as a top 100 bicycle store in the country by industry members.

He graduated from the University of Arizona with an undergraduate degree in General Business, and successfully completed the school's Entrepreneurship Program during its flagship year. Todd later went on to earn his Masters of Business Administration from the W.P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University.

Todd lives in Phoenix, Arizona with his wife, Tara. Together they have three beautiful daughters – one in college, one who teaches school in NYC, and one who is married and is a therapist in California.  Todd enjoys running, hiking, traveling, and spending time with his family.

Description:
CEO coach for start-up founders ($7B total valuations)
Former CEO of @somawater
Husband, father, surfer, Catholic
Title: CEO Coach
Summary:
I never thought I would crash and burn.

Especially after raising $10M from top VCs, building a coveted brand, and being featured in dream publications like The New York Times and Tim Ferriss' book Tools of Titans.

But after nearly 10 years in Silicon Valley, I was completely burnt out. I made all the classic mistakes: imposter syndrome, trying to do everything myself, not asking for help. I wrecked my health, my happiness, and the results I was achieving as a founder and CEO.

The surprising thing that got me though the tough times - and helped me turn everything around - was hiring a CEO coach. I was skeptical at first, but working with a coach changed my life and my career.

After crawling my way out of burn out, I had the honor of advising and coaching start-ups that in just 5 years grew from Seed stage to $3B in total valuations. I became a Venture Partner at a VC fund aligned with my values. And most importantly, I learned to enjoy the ride.

Today, I coach a select group of founders that are ambitious, ethical, and have a voracious appetite to improve themselves. We typically start after Series A funding and our goal is to take it all they way to IPO or acquisition.

When I'm not coaching founders, you can find me snowboarding, mountain biking, or having the time of my life with my wife and two young children.

A.M.D.G.

My goal: "Be humble and gentle. Be patient. Bear with one another in love." Ephesians 4:2
Headline: CEO Coach for VC-backed founders | $7B total client valuations | 3x Founder including Soma (acquired)
