Amazon is guided by four principles: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking. We are driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that change lives. We embrace new ways of doing things, make decisions quickly, and are not afraid to fail. We have the scope and capabilities of a large company, and the spirit and heart of a small one.

Together, Amazonians research and develop new technologies from Amazon Web Services to Alexa on behalf of our customers: shoppers, sellers, content creators, and developers around the world.

Our mission is to be Earth's most customer-centric company. Our actions, goals, projects, programs, and inventions begin and end with the customer top of mind.

You'll also hear us say that at Amazon, it's always "Day 1." What do we mean? That our approach remains the same as it was on Amazon's very first day - to make smart, fast decisions, stay nimble, invent, and focus on delighting our customers.
Headline: Technical Project Management, Solution Architecture

Title: Executive and Life Coach
Summary: I’m a Certified Executive Coach, recognized by Forbes for leadership and career coaching and named a Top 100 Empowerment Speaker by Engage. I bring over 20 years of experience across tech, DEI, education, and wellness, supporting people in leadership through growth, transition, and recalibration.I’ve founded and led several companies including Beat The GMAT (EdTech), Awaken (DEI education), and Parent Refresh (wellness for caregivers). I’ve coached inside organizations and served as a group coach at Stanford Graduate School of Business. My work is shaped by my identities, my past experiences in customer success, change management, and team development, and built on training in Co-Active coaching, systems work, somatics, and the Enneagram.I hold a BA from Stanford University and a PCC credential from the International Coaching Federation.
Location Name: San Francisco Bay Area, United States
Address - Locations: 16 Trillium Ln, San Carlos, California 94070, US
Description (2):
People often seek coaching for many reasons: they lack a clear vision of what they want, or their vision is so large they feel overwhelmed; they feel stuck in an area of their life; they want to invest in their personal growth; they want to gain more confidence. Simply put, people want to raise the ceiling of their potential and live their dreams.

My method of co-active coaching means that the coach and the client are equal partners. You are the expert in your life. I am the expert in helping you uncover what you want and how to get there. Here are 3 main reasons why people should have a life coach:

Achieve fulfillment.
- Discover your values. You are what you value.
- Uncover your life purpose. Why were you placed on this earth?
- Coax and nourish your inner leader.

View your circumstances from other perspectives.
- Realize that your truth is not the truth.
- Learn to separate facts from your interpretation of those facts.

Discover the depths of your emotional self.
- People don't like feeling sad, disappointed, frustrated, angry; so they usually do everything they can to avoid them. But through coaching, it's important to resolve those feelings and understand that your ability to process your lowest moments enables you to experience your highest joys.

To learn more or for a free discovery session, visit beakim.com.
Headline: Executive & Life Coach | Top 100 Empowerment Speaker by Engage | Forbes List for Leadership & Career Coaching

Description: CEO & co-founder @theappsmith: open-source AI-native internal tools with 37 k★ on GitHub. Raised $50 M+. Built Bicycle AI (YC W17). India → SF
Title: CEO & Co-Founder
Summary: Twitter: twitter.com/arey_abhishek
Description (2):
Appsmith helps organizations embrace AI at work with low-code tools to build, deploy, and maintain custom agents and applications. With Appsmith, organizations can streamline operations, automate processes, and quickly integrate a wide range of applications and data to unlock productivity for operations, go-to-market, people, data, and engineering teams.

Appsmith Agents is an agentic AI platform that integrates the latest AI models with private and proprietary data at scale — inside the tools and systems that teams use every day. By giving continuous context to these AI models, Appsmith Agents lets teams ask questions and configure automations specific to their business without model fine-tuning or complex RAG implementations.

The Appsmith low-code platform is an open-source application platform that simplifies custom application development for businesses. With integrations across AI models, Appsmith makes it easy for teams to build applications and interfaces for AI actions like text analysis and summary, image classification, and semantic search. Unlike traditional low-code platforms, the Appsmith platform is lightweight, extremely developer-friendly, and designed to fully integrate within modern SDLC processes.

Appsmith allows full-stack and backend developers, systems administrators, and data teams to quickly build agents that embed within their existing tools (Salesforce, Zendesk, Slack, Gmail, etc.), dashboards, admin panels, customer 360, IT automation, and service management applications that span multiple data sources.
Headline: Build the best internal apps with Appsmith

Title: Co-Founder & CEO

Description (2):
InHouse transforms how multifamily property operators and residents design and furnish living spaces. Through AI-powered solutions, shoppable floorplans, and exclusive pricing on millions of premium products, InHouse elevates the residential experience for long-term tenants while driving additional revenue for landlords.

Our platform offers bespoke design plans, VIP shopping perks, and seamless furnishing solutions to tenants, making move-ins stress-free and homes truly personalized. Summary: I lead the fundraising team at Wefunder. We help founders raise capital from their customers and community, as well as rich people. And let anyone invest in startups they love.
Description (2):
We’re the Robinhood for pre-IPO startups.  Everyone can angel invest $100 in a Community Round.

On May 16, 2016, it became legal for everyday people to invest as little as $100 in startups and small businesses.  Since then, we’ve helped 1,860 founders raise almost $500M from their community - for flying cars, coffee shops, and everything in between.

We’re a Public Benefit Corporation with a mission to revitalize capitalism and keep the American dream alive. GDP growth is slowing. Wealth inequality is increasing. Entrepreneurship is dying across America; falling from 10.6% to 3.6% among those under 30 since 1989. We’re reversing these trends by funding more deserving businesses across all of America, not solely tech startups in Silicon Valley.

Want to help? Join us! We’re a team of founder types: enjoy autonomy, responsibility, the opportunity to learn, and no red tape. Just make it happen.

I am proud to serve Practical Venture Capital (PVC) in the role of Investor Relations. Venture Secondary combines the fast growth of private tech companies with the shorter liquidity profile of private equity. Title: Distinguished Technical Fellow
Summary:
Sally-Ann Williams is an Australian business leader with extensive experience in deep technology, innovation, and STEM advocacy. She is currently focused on non-executive director roles and supporting deep tech innovation and inclusion in STEM at scale.

Sally  was instrumental in transforming Cicada Innovations into a national deep tech powerhouse. Under her leadership, Cicada expanded its footprint with new hubs like Jumar Bioincubator and the HealthTech Hub, launched the National Space Industry Hub, and developed leading deep tech commercialization programs. She also integrated Tech23, solidifying Cicada's central role in the innovation ecosystem. Her contributions helped Cicada-supported ventures raise over $6.1 billion and achieve $1.4 billion in exits, addressing critical challenges in health, climate, energy, and more.

Her current board appointments include Bank Australia, the Australian Research Council, and AusOcean, a not-for-profit organisation dedicated to ocean research and conservation through technology. She also engages with the technology and innovation landscape through advisory capacities, serving as a member of the NSW Innovation Council and on the Heavy Ion Accelerators Board.

Previously, Sally spent over a decade at Google, where she spearheaded R&D collaborations, facilitated engagement with the startup community, and pioneered Computer Science and STEM education initiatives.

In public policy, she chaired the Federal Government's Pathway to Diversity in STEM Review. Her past contributions include involvement with COAG's STEM Partnership Forum and StartupAUS.
Sally is a Fellow of the Australian Academy of Technological Sciences & Engineering (ATSE) and a member of Chief Executive Women (CEW).

She received an honorary Doctorate from Griffith University in 2023, and an honorary Doctor of Technology from the University of Technology Sydney  in 2025.

Sally is a frequent speaker on leadership, technology, deep tech, innovation, and inclusion. Her work consistently reflects a dedication to empowering individuals and organisations to address global challenges through scientific advancement and collaborative efforts.
Description (2):
As a customer-owned bank with B Corp credentials, we’re the bank for people who want their money to be a force for good.

Many people don’t realise that the money in your bank account doesn’t just sit there. Banks use it to lend and invest. So your money is already shaping the world that future generations will inherit.

Our responsible banking policy underpins what we do and don’t fund with our customers’ money. We don’t fund the fossil fuel industry, arms industry, gambling, tobacco or live animal exports; and we do fund our everyday customers, clean energy transition, affordable and accessible housing and green and sustainable investments.

We’ve set a target of net zero emissions by 2035, which is the most ambitious of any Australian bank. A portion of our profits goes to support projects in areas our customers care most about, including providing community customer grants, and helping care for a 2,117 hectare conservation reserve on Wotjobaluk Country in Western Victoria – home to endangered species like the Red-tailed Black Cockatoo.

We’ve been around since 1957, when we were the CSIRO Co-operative Credit Society, and have since joined with over 70 other credit unions and co-operatives, becoming Bank Australia in 2015.

In July 2025 Qudos Bank and Bank Australia merged to create one of Australia's largest customer-owned banks with over $17.5 billion in assets and branches across NSW, VIC, QLD and ACT. With over 900 employees serving 300,000 members across Australia, we’re committed to offering even better products, services, and banking experiences - while continuing to grow the impact we can make on behalf of our customers well into the future.

Our contact centres, lending operations and processing, and other teams are based across the Latrobe Valley, Bendigo, Brisbane, Sydney and our head office in Collingwood, Melbourne. We also have branches in Melbourne and regional Victoria, Brisbane, Canberra and Sydney.
Headline: Non-Executive Director | Deep Tech & Innovation Leader | Champion for STEM Inclusion

Description: founder: https://t.co/A4xpEYhG0F https://t.co/MzzgOOPPi6 https://t.co/WwbH5XZfSY | @TradingVCs a very bad VC secondary podcast | alum: JHU PayPal FoundersFund | fanboi: DrSeuss Muppets SesameSt
Title: Podcast Host
Summary:
I've been an engineer, entrepreneur and investor in Silicon Valley for 30 years. I founded Practical Venture Capital and 500 Startups (now 500 Global), and worked at Founders Fund and PayPal. I’ve invested in hundreds of startups around the world, including 40+ unicorns and 10+ IPOs. I've also invested in over 50 VC funds. I made the Forbes Midas List of top 100 global VCs in 2016 and 2017. I have a BS in Engineering and Applied Mathematics from Johns Hopkins University. I'm a nerd.

[Practical Venture Capital]
In 2019 I founded Practical Venture Capital, a VC secondary firm that buys secondary in both VC funds and later-stage companies. We specialize in LP / GP fund interests in microVC funds at years 7-10 (“Skip the J-curve”), and direct secondary in companies doing $50M+ revenue.

[500 Startups / 500 Global]
In 2010 I founded 500 Startups, a Silicon Valley VC firm with over $2B AUM that has invested in 3,500 companies and 5,000 founders across 80 countries. Investments include 35+ unicorns and 10+ IPOs: TWLO (IPO 2016), SEND (IPO 2017), REAL (IPO 2019), Credit Karma (acq INTU $8B 2020), FLYW (IPO 2021), BARK (IPO 2021), GRAB (IPO 2021), GTLB (IPO 2021), UDMY (IPO 2021), Paidy (acq PYPL $2.7B 2022), Canva, TalkDesk, Lucid, Intercom, Innovacer, Algolia, Solana. We created 20 VC funds under the 500 brand, and invested in 20 other VC funds globally.

[Founders Fund, Facebook fbFund]
From 2008-10 I was a VC at Founders Fund with Peter Thiel and Sean Parker. I made seed-stage investments in 42 companies resulting in 5 unicorns / 4 IPOs (TWLO, SEND, LYFT, LIF, Credit Karma), and I led the seed round in Credit Karma (acq INTU, >400X return). The $3M portfolio I managed returned >$180M (~60X, fully realized).

[PayPal, Aslan, Johns Hopkins]
In 2001 I joined PayPal as Director of Marketing. Before PayPal I was founder/CEO of Aslan Computing (acq by Servinet, 1998). I graduated from Johns Hopkins University in 1988 with a BS in engineering and applied mathematics, and played lots of ultimate frisbee with other engineers and CS nerds.

I was born in Morgantown, WV and also grew up in Columbia, MD.  I’m a fan of Dr. Seuss, Sesame Street, Schoolhouse Rock, and Free to Be You & Me.

Description (2):
The trucking and logistics industry provides the backbone of the economy. But the payments infrastructure on which it runs is from the past century and broken. For the hard-working men and women of this sector, the existing suite of payment tools is outdated, difficult to use, prone to fraud, and saddled with shady fee structures. The incumbent players in this space often overlook the economic and practical needs of this user base.

We're changing that. AtoB is modernizing the payments infrastructure for trucking and logistics. Supply chains rely on the timely movement of capital to function efficiently. Our end game is a world in which that capital movement occurs reliably, instantly and fairly.

Our history and background
Our founding team has backgrounds in payments, working on electric and autonomous vehicles at Cruise Automation, leading ops and growth for Uber. We have senior engineers and operators from Google, Uber, Meta, Amazon, Shopify, Stripe, Revolut, Chime, Shell, McKinsey, BCG and other leading companies.

We have raised $125 million+ from investors such as General Catalyst, Elad Gil, Bloomberg Beta, Y Combinator, XYZ; founders and CEOs of companies such as Google (Eric Schmidt), Salesforce (Marc Benioff), Coinbase (Brian Armstrong), DoorDash (Tony Xu), Stripe, Instacart, Gusto; strategic investors like Mastercard.

We were named to Forbes annual Next Billion-Dollar Startup List, and have just recently been selected to join the World Economic Forum as a Global Innovator.

Title: Alumni Training Facilitator and Coach
Summary:
I'm building Sparkwise to make top-quality professional development accessible to everyone.

Online learning isn't going anywhere, but it's broken today.
Either scalable but dull, or impactful but pricey.   We need a better way to learn, together.

What busy leaders need is a learning solution that is actually impactful, affordable, and easy to implement—all at the same time.

WE'VE REINVENTED LEARNING
so it’s live and multiplayer, builds new work habits, and you can use it on demand.

 Hands-on and in a small group. No lecturing: you’re actively getting reps at new work skills, sharing with and learning from others.
 Rooted in the science of how adults learn best: problem-based, social, easy to remember and apply.
 Connected to real-life: we encourage learners & their managers to make a tangible commitment to change with spaced reminders.

Pick from our growing library of 100+ topics: communication, problem solving, leadership, professional effectiveness, and more.


FROM OUR CLIENTS:

 "I've just seen my team improve by leaps and bounds—on written, email, and verbal communication, on meeting organization, and more" - Jwala, EVP, Hydrafacial
 "What makes Sparkwise different is the style of learning. It automates away the manual effort of expensive in-person training but is much more engaging than the online modules you click through." - Ian, CEO, Soar Autism Center
 "I see folks coming out of the sessions feeling like they had actionable takeaways. Concrete strategies and tools they can implement." - Amie, Head of DEI, Clever


EXPERIENCE IT FOR YOURSELF:

Sparkwise is best experienced, so I’m offering you a first session for 3 or 4 people, at no charge. Just send me a message and we'll set it up, and get your team started on a growth journey.

You can also email me at romain@sparkwise.co
Description (2):
Sparkwise delivers live group learning on demand, at limitless scale, for 80%+ lower cost — by automating structured collaboration for critical thinking, practice, and action.

Our AI-enabled, patent-pending platform forms small groups, guides rigorous activities, and synthesizes collective insights — without the cost or complexity of manual facilitation.

Sparkwise is trusted by leading organizations, including McKinsey Academy, Harvard Business Impact, Google, Financial Times, and the Virginia DMV.

Organizations use Sparkwise to scale live cohort-based learning (from new hires to middle managers), collaborative practice, peer coaching, enterprise transformations, and more.

< SPARKWISE ORIGIN STORY >
Sparkwise was founded by former McKinsey transformation and talent development specialists who saw firsthand how hard it is to scale effective capability building. They've built Sparkwise to unleash the "McKinsey magic" and help every organization build world-class capabilities.

I'm the founder/CEO of Soraban, an admin AI assistant for accounting firms. We were part of Y Combinator S21: https://www.ycombinator.com/.

Before starting Soraban, I was fortunate to be part of several teams building various complex applications for many startups and public companies as a freelance software engineer. After saving tens of thousands of dollars by setting up an S-Corporation in 2018 with an help of a CPA, I realized that many self-employed/consultants were missing out on a lot of tax savings. With this insight, I started a tech-enabled accounting firm focused on self-employed individuals (S-Corps) and small businesses. After spending two years closely working with CPA firms, I've decided to follow my passion of building software and completely restarted the business as a software company in 2021.

TrueMed is a payments tool (think PayPal for HSA/FSA) that enables health and wellness brands to accept pre-tax HSA/FSA payments for eligible products.

We partner with leading brands such as CrossFit, Magic Mind, and DB Method to help drive higher AOV (30%+ for many merchants), better month-two retention (40% increase), and greater LTV.

Our integrations are simple, through an official Shopify payments app or lightweight code snippets, and typically take less than 30 minutes to set up, with no engineering required.

Our mission is to unlock access to the $150B in HSA/FSA funds for qualifying health and wellness purchases, making it easy for customers to use tax-advantaged dollars on eligible products that support real medical needs.

TrueMed was developed in collaboration with federal policy leaders on HSA/FSA modernization and top health experts including Dr. Mark Hyman.

Description: founder @datchsystems. 🇦🇺 ✈
Title: Advisor
Summary:
As an engineer-turned-tech CEO with over 13 years of industry experience, I have witnessed the rise of AI and big data, and their ability to transform the way we work.

However, I also noticed that most enterprises were still relying on low-tech processes that were holding their frontline workers back.

This realization led me to co-found Datch, an innovative AI company whose mission is to radically simplify frontline work for industrial enterprises worldwide.

My journey began in Australia as an aerospace engineer and later took me to the UK, where I worked across the entire manufacturing process - from engineering design, testing, validating, to working with customers through deployment.

It was during this time that I noticed how much time frontline workers were spending on repetitive work management tasks like completing work orders, capturing safety information, and carrying out procedures. This was holding them back and bleeding away their productivity, without them even realizing it.

To unlock the true potential of an organization's data, frontline workers needed a solution that could guide them intuitively and converse with them.

As a builder obsessed with applying tech to real-world needs, I saw this as a chance to bring AI into the familiar but often overlooked world of the industrial frontline.

So I grabbed my friend (and by then, co-founder) Ben Purcell by the collar, and spent a month traveling all over the UK and Ireland to investigate. We spoke to countless frontline managers to understand the struggles industrial enterprises faced in their daily work. This is when we discovered the "input problem" - that countless hours were spent interacting with important legacy systems and eating up valuable time.

Today, Datch enables customers across various industries, including manufacturing, energy & utility, and mining, to make faster and better decisions with intelligent insights.

By simplifying their work and making it more intuitive, we boost efficiency for our customers while increasing the quality of knowledge gathered from the frontline.

When I am not thinking all things Datch or technology, you’ll find me writing music, playing my guitar, and experimenting with all kinds of genres - from blues to EDM.

To get in touch, connect with me here on LinkedIn!
Address - Locations: 134 N 4th St, Brooklyn, New York 11249, US
Description (2):
Datch is a platform that leverages AI to capture highly detailed, structured human-centric data while surfacing asset insights for decision-making and resource management. Our goal is to cut deep into the availability shortfall by providing the data and intelligence needed to decrease asset MTTR, increase MTBF, support better planning and allow for faster decision making.

In order to support the asset availability goals across resource management, reporting, planning, scheduling, and reliability, the product is designed around a single value proposition: ”perfect data”. By perfect data, we mean complete, highly accurate, context rich reports coming in from the frontline, and perfect recall and distillation of data to the right people at the right time. Data capture is achieved through a combination of worker enablement capabilities, such as speech-to-text, real-time translation, and conversational AI, and data enrichment, through features that add context and guidance to transform the data as it’s captured. Data accessibility and asset insights are tools that are underpinned by generative search trained on the company’s document management system, work management history, and other language-rich data sources related to assets.
Headline: Leading the Charge on AI Solutions that Transform Industrial Frontline Work & Drive Productivity | CEO at Datch | Enterprise Systems | Business Intelligence

Title: Co-Founder
Summary:
For more than two decades, I've been driven by a simple principle: Just start.

Where many see barriers, I see opportunities. This led me to begin my career in Shanghai and its real estate market. Through determination and an immersive approach to understanding Chinese culture and business—including learning Mandarin thanks to friendly Shanghai taxi drivers—I pioneered several groundbreaking projects and founded China's first carbon-neutral hotel brand, URBN Hotels and Resorts.

Today, I bring this global perspective with local insight to Los Angeles as co-founder of Relevant Partners. My approach combines disciplined thinking with creative freedom, always seeking undersupplied markets and asking not just “What's missing?” but “What's possible?” This philosophy has served me well across Southeastern Asia and now California.

In real estate development, I've learned that true luxury isn't about lavish amenities—it's about creating spaces that foster connection and enrich lives.

Our latest project, The Ranch at Coachella Valley, embodies this vision perfectly. Just two hours from Southern California and neighboring the iconic Coachella Music Festival grounds, it exemplifies what community can become when we blur the lines between home and hospitality. Modern housing should do more than provide shelter—it should create communities that enrich lives, where luxury and community coexist harmoniously.

As an active member of the Entrepreneurs' Organization since 2002, including serving as Shanghai Chapter President in 2015, I've experienced firsthand how powerful community and knowledge sharing can be. I'm focused on bringing hospitality DNA to traditional real estate, transforming spaces into experiences that inspire connection.

After all, creating community isn't just another residential development—it's the future of real estate. Interested in hearing more about Relevant Partners and our projects? Let’s connect.
Description (2):
OUR STORY

Relevant Partners is a Los Angeles–based real estate development and investment firm reimagining how people live. Rooted in hospitality and guided by design, we create residential communities that bring intention, belonging, and long-term value to every stakeholder.

HOSPITALITY AT THE CORE

The principals of Relevant Partners are also the visionaries behind Relevant Group, a vertically integrated real estate firm known for shaping landmark lifestyle destinations in Los Angeles. We bring that same hospitality-driven expertise into the multifamily sector, ensuring every project delivers thoughtful design, activated spaces, and a sense of connection.

REINVENTING RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITIES

Drawing on decades of hospitality experience, we craft residential environments that feel curated, intentional, and alive. Our communities combine architectural excellence, dynamic amenities, and curated programming—bringing hospitality-rooted design and service into everyday living.

POSITIVE IMPACT

Our developments are guided by four core principles: sustainability, wellness, affordability, and community. Each project is crafted to generate lasting social, cultural, and lifestyle value…—improving the lives of residents, strengthening communities, and contributing to a more sustainable future.

GLOBAL EXPERIENCE & NETWORK

With more than 25 years of global investment experience and a trusted network of partners, our leadership team has executed 20+ projects and raised over $3B across diverse asset classes, consistently delivering innovation and value.

RELATIONSHIPS FIRST

At Relevant, relationships are foundational. We build trust through candor, transparency, and partnership—creating long-term connections that extend far beyond individual projects. For us, every collaboration is an opportunity to deliver something meaningful together.
Headline: Co-Founder Relevant Partners • Infusing Hospitality DNA into Traditional Real Estate • Global Markets Expert • Community Builder

Title: Strategic Advisor
Summary:
When I first got into sales, I had a similar path as most. I was trying to figure out how to sell, and once I did that had my eye on being the top performer on my team, so I would be thought of as a leader and have a chance to be promoted into management.

A short year and a half later, I did all of that and was promoted. I was going to change everyone's life and get to teach the low performers how to be successful and sell. About a month and a half later, I was wondering what happened. Nobody seemed to be listening to me or at least improving like I thought they should. I was really good at chasing and closing deals because that is all I knew how to do. My boss kept telling me you are trying to be a hero "You can't save everyone."

My problem was I was subjective and emotional about everything. I had no management process. It wasn't until I figured out that I had to take the emotion out of it and make everything objective that I started to see results.

Fast Forward 10 years later, with many successes and failures I created a 6 step process that helps takes the complication out of managing salespeople with a heavy focus on your team's Structure vs Pipeline:

1. ATM Approach- Where am I at with my team today
2. Interview Process- How do I hire more awesome Reps
3. Onboarding- How do I get new reps to revenue faster
4. Expectations- Set clear expectations so people know if they are good at their job or not
5. Coaching- How do I develop people using data
6. Ideal Customer Profile- Who are your target accounts

If interested in learning more you can visit my website to book a call or download my e-book on the ATM Approach.

mattdferguson.com

Title: Managing Partner & Co-Founder
Summary:
I began my career at a small New England ISP in 1995 as a teenager. Moved to California to become Netscape's youngest employee in 1996. Co-founded Tellme with Mike McCue in 1999; acquired by Microsoft in 2007. Founded Upserve in 2009, acquired by Lightspeed Commerce in 2020. Joined Foundation Capital in 2019 to invest in founders. In addition to that, I'm co-founder of Mind the Product, an international product management community and series of events for fellow product people. Description: Entrepreneur & Investor. Investor @opportunityfund
Title: Chairman and Managing Partner
Summary:
Dr. Paul Judge is a technology entrepreneur and investor. He is Chairman and Managing Partner of Open Opportunity Fund.

As an entrepreneur, Paul is cofounder of Pindrop.  Pindrop’s voice security technology protects some of the largest enterprises in the world and has received over $200 million of venture capital funding. In 2015, paul cofounded TechSquare Labs a company building studio and venture fund based in Atlanta. He was also the co-founder of Luma Home, a consumer WiFi company. Paul has invested in over 100 companies technology startups.


From 2009-2014 Paul was the Chief Research Officer and VP at Barracuda Networks. In 2007 he founded Purewire and served as Chief Technology Officer until Purewire was acquired by Barracuda Networks in 2009.  Prior to that Paul was the Chief Technology Officer at CipherTrust until it was acquired by Secure Computing in 2006 for $270M. There he served as Chief Technology Officer and Senior Vice President, directing the research and product management teams while also the lead inventor on all patented messaging security technologies. Prior to his tenure at CipherTrust, Dr. Judge worked briefly with IBM and NASA.


Paul has received many accolades including being named to Fortune Magazine’s “40 Under 40” list, MIT’s Technology Review Magazine’s “Top 100 Innovators under 35”, Black Enterprise’s “50 Most Powerful Players Under 40”, and InfoWorld’s “Top 25 CTOs”. He is a member of the 2016 Class of Henry Crown Fellows and the Aspen Global Leadership Network at the Aspen Institute. Dr. Judge holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Morehouse College and earned his Ph.D. and M.S. in Computer Science from Georgia Tech.
Description (2): Open Opportunity Fund is a technology venture capital firm focused on investing in software companies founded by outstanding overlooked founders. Open Opportunity Fund's portfolio spans B2B SaaS, enterprise IT, artificial intelligence, fintech, and health tech. Opportunity Fund 1 is a $100 million fund with SoftBank as an anchor LP. The firm has invested in 75 tech companies including Atomic, Brex, Cityblock Health, Eight Sleep, Esusu, Lumu, Paystand, QuickNode, Squire, and Subject. The fund has achieved seven portfolio company exits. In 2023, the team led by Paul Judge and Marcelo Claure acquired the Fund from SoftBank and announced Fund 2 to continue to execute the thesis.
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
Headline: Tech Investor

Description (2):
Clipboard connects healthcare facilities and schools with local professionals who can work unfilled shifts. Patients and students get improved care, and professionals get more flexibility and higher pay. Professionals can compare work details and pay rates (or negotiate for more) in an open, transparent marketplace.

Today, healthcare facilities and schools are understaffed, which can result in poor patient care, student outcomes, and employee burnout. Meanwhile, local professionals have time and want to pick up extra shifts. These two parties don’t know each other and aren’t sure if they can work together (licenses, qualifications, or even trust might get in the way). Clipboard exists to solve this problem.

Summary: I am focused on aligning sustainable choices with best-value decisions.
Description (2):
At Axiom Cloud, our mission is to use software and automation to transform how the world’s cooling systems are powered, operated, and maintained, in order to generate significant climate and financial impact.

We provide value to our customers and make cooling systems more sustainable in the following ways:

- By predicting equipment issues and making cooling systems more efficient, we lower maintenance costs and reduce the energy required to achieve the same amount of cooling.
- By adding power flexibility and energy storage to cooling systems, we generate revenue for our customers and enable higher penetrations of intermittent renewables (solar, wind, etc.) onto the grid.
- By identifying and curtailing refrigerant leaks early, we help reduce the amount of high-GWP refrigerants released into the atmosphere.

Axiom’s team of refrigeration experts, data scientists, energy nerds, and software developers solves retail grocery’s biggest energy and maintenance challenges by layering intelligence onto their existing refrigeration systems. Experience with commercial refrigeration systems is at our core, and we plan to leverage this experience across multiple industry categories to make the world’s cooling systems more sustainable.
Headline: CEO, Co-Founder at Axiom Cloud Inc.

His clients consistently rave about his deeply analytical approach to understanding overall market trends and competitive value for individual properties, his masterful approach to negotiation with others involved in a transaction, his responsive and creative approach to solving problems that come up, and his direct but supportive style in coaching his real estate clients to success in the areas they care most about. Title: Senior Vice President - Business Insurance
Summary:
You don't have to deal with dinosaurs anymore.

Insurance is fundamental to society, but that doesn't mean it needs to function like its 1981, the year of the first personal PC.

Our world has way too much technology to put our clients through the administrative burden of placing insurance policies.

As an insurtech broker at a top firm in the country, Newfront is changing the rules to this very old game.

Simply put, we say "no!"

 No to being on the rat wheel of constant "paper" pushing

 No to requesting the same information every single year

 * Market Watch: Stay on top of category-level and competitive shifts with timely, easy-to-digest market insights.

At Datavations, we turn complex retail data into clear, prescriptive actions — helping manufacturers build stronger retail partnerships and outperform the competition.

Title: Co-founder and Principal
Summary:
Kristen Berman studies how people actually act in the marketplace, as opposed to how they should or would perform if they were completely rational.

Kristen co-founded Irrational Labs, a behavioral product design company, with Dan Ariely in 2013. Irrational Labs helps companies understand and leverage behavioral economics to design and grow products that change behavior. Irrational Labs has designed features and products that drove significant outcomes for Lyft, Google, One Medical, Discover and many more top tier companies.

She also co-founded Common Cents Lab, a Duke University initiative dedicated to improving the financial well-being for low to middle Americans. Under her leadership, Common Cents launched over 50 experiments with companies, touching hundreds of thousands of people.

She was on the founding team for the behavioral economics group at Google, a group that touched over 26 teams across Google, and hosted ones of the top behavioral change conferences globally, StartupOnomics.
She co-authored a series of workbooks called Hacking Human Nature for Good: A practical guide to changing behavior, with Dan Ariely. These workbooks are being used at companies like Google, Intuit, Neflix, Fidelity, Lending Club for business strategy and design work.

Kristen is an advisor for Loop Commerce, Code For America Accelerator and the Genr8tor Incubator and has spoken at Google, Facebook, Fidelity, Equifax, Stanford, Bay Area Computer Human Interaction seminar and more.
Address - Locations: 1885 Mission St, San Francisco, California, US
Description (2):
We use behavioral science to make people happier, healthier & wealthier.

How? By applying behavioral economics findings to product, marketing, and organizational design problems. By designing the environment and creating thoughtful interventions, we improve decision-making in a way that benefits both companies and their customers.

Is your organization changing the world for the better? We'd like to work with you.

https://irrationallabs.com
Headline: CEO & Co-Founder at Irrational Labs | Behavioral Economics

Summary: Baratunde Thurston is a storyteller exploring interdependence across our relationships with each other, nature, and technology. He is an Emmy-nominated host, writer, public speaker, and proud Earthling. His newest creation is Life With Machines, a YouTube podcast focusing on the human side of the A.I. revolution. He is also host and executive producer of the PBS TV series America Outdoors, creator and host of the How To Citizen podcast, and a founding partner and writer at Puck. His comedic memoir, How To Be Black, is a New York Times best-seller. In 2019, he delivered what MSNBC’s Brian Williams called “one of the greatest TED talks of all time.” Baratunde is unique in his ability to integrate and synthesize different and difficult topics in a style that’s intelligent, compassionate, and humorous. Baratunde serves on the boards of Civics Unplugged and the Brooklyn Public Library and lives in Southern California.

Title: Head of Product
Summary:
Chris York helps teams apply behavioral science to build more impactful products, with a specialization in digitally-driven behavior change. The scope of these behaviors has been wide-ranging—from  voter turnout to medication adherence to maximizing contributions to savings accounts.

In 2012, Chris founded Cognitive, an award-winning strategy and design consulting firm that has worked with some of the world’s top startups, leading multinationals, and most renowned universities and medical institutions. The firm helps organizations execute at unprecedented levels in changing human behavior and driving complex outcomes. Its team has worked on products with Illumina, Salesforce, Target, Novartis, Healthline, UCSF, Harvard, the Mayo Clinic, US Presidential campaigns, governments, and Y-Combinator startups. This work and its results have been chronicled by the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, and peer-reviewed journals like the American Journal of Preventive Medicine, Frontiers in Psychology, and Nature.

In the world of startups, Chris provided key product and design leadership contributions with teams like WellnessFX, Rise, 100plus, Keas, and 10 other exited startups prior to their acquisitions. He is also an active investor and advisor (incl. Cleo, Elementus, and Vital Labs). Chris also advises Common Cents Lab, a fintech non-profit founded by behavioral economist Dan Ariely, and lectures at Behavioral Economics Bootcamp, an intensive program for product leaders (incl. Slack, Facebook, Lyft, Aetna, Intuit, and the World Bank).

He has spoken on topics ranging from habit formation and behavioral science to investing and marketplace design at places like Stanford, Cornell Tech, Adaptive Path, and IDEO.

Chris is noted for his interdisciplinary toolkit, which includes applied psychology, behavioral economics, cognitive science, gaming mechanics, design methodologies, and AI/automation.

Chris' current focus is applying behavioral economics approaches to investing and making behavioral science more accessible through the Behavior Institute, a big data approach to aggregating interventions on human behavior change.

Description (2):
WorkStep is AI-powered employee engagement software designed for distributed frontline teams. It helps HR and Operations leaders move beyond measuring sentiment to driving real-time action with smart surveys, built-in communication tools and AI-driven insights and coaching.

WorkStep's employee experience solution provides comprehensive employee listening, engagement, voice of the employee, and communication functionality including:

*Employee Feedback: WorkStep collects real-time insights from employees through milestone pulse, always-on, annual surveys, and bi-directional feedback channels.

*Employee Reporting: Reporting provides HR and Ops leaders with data on employee behavior which can be segmented by various filters including role type, location, demographics and tenure, to identify trends and patterns that may impact retention

*Predictive Analytics: WorkStep utilizes machine learning to determine the top areas of improvement, at facility or role level, and suggest high-impact actions to reduce employee turnover

*Impact Analysis: Employers can measure the success of any initiative implemented by tracking the change in employee sentiment and retention across the impacted population

*Communication: Leaders can reply to urgent comments and alerts while maintaining employee anonymity or broadly communicate to segments of the workforce to bring attention to new programs, share critical updates, celebrate teams, or solicit feedback.

Combining real-time data with AI-powered analytics and built-in communication tools, WorkStep helps eHR & Operations leaders identify and directly address opportunities in their frontline operations. This results in improved retention rates, increased productivity, and reduced costs.

Description:
Co-founder, CEO of Talus Bio

illuminating the regulome | controlling the genome | drugging the 'undruggable'

#proteomics, #teammassspec, #chembio
Title: Co-Founder, CEO
Summary:
I'm a scientist studying how cancer drugs work within complex cellular networks and how to discover new drugs most efficiently.

In previous research, I've
- Developed and released software to model transcriptional networks that has been used for drug re-purposing in cancer and understanding cell of origin for rare cancer types.
- Analyzed real-world clinical EMR data to understand clinical responses to immunotherapy
- Led a small team engineering new gene editing reagents for applications in T cell therapy.
- Developed a new, highly scalable proteomics method to to measure DNA-bound protein complexes at a systems level
- Characterized the response of human immune cells to next-generation BET inhibitors to prioritize further clinical development
- Contributed to the screening, medicinal chemistry and cellular characterization of lead compounds that inhibit the chromatin regulators DOT1L, EZH2, CBX chromodomains, YEATS domain proteins and BET bromodomains

Competencies:
[Bioinformatics] Gene expression analysis (RNA-seq), epigenomics assays (ChIP-seq, DNAme), genome accessibility (DNaseI-seq, ATAC-seq), nascent transcription (GRO-seq), proteomics (data-independent acquisition, targeted proteomics)
[Lab] Protein biochemistry, high-throughput chemical screening, cell biology, molecular biology, mass spectrometry
[Programming] Python, R, Bash, SQL
[Data Science] numpy, scipy, pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch
[Misc] Schrödinger, Adobe Illustrator, Google Cloud, AWS, Snowflake, Tableau
Description (2):
Talus Bio is making the regulome visible and druggable. We are building the first platform to map, model, and ultimately write the regulome, unlocking thousands of previously undruggable targets, including transcription factors that drive cancer, autoimmunity, and neurodegeneration.

Our platform measures the regulome directly in living human cells, generating functional datasets at scale for the first time. These data fuel AI models that learn the logic of genome regulation and predict how to modulate it with precision.
Headline:
Co-Founder and CEO at Talus Bio -

Measuring the regulome.

Re-wiring the genome.

Therapeutics for 'undruggable' transcription factors.

Description: building @blockpartyapp_ to help you deep clean your social media. previously eng @pinterest @usds @quora ➡️ https://t.co/n7C9S0SR6o on bsky
Title: Shorenstein Fellow
Summary:
Tracy Chou is an entrepreneur and software engineer known for her work advocating for diversity and inclusion in tech. She is currently the founder and CEO of Block Party, which builds tools for online safety, privacy and anti-harassment.

Block Party has been recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, highlighted in an amicus brief for the Supreme Court as an example of the future of social media, and the product described by Washington Post’s tech journalist as “one of the most useful tools I’ve come across in years”. Block Party works with individuals, enterprises, and resellers to protect people’s online data from being weaponized against them.

From 2011 to 2016 Tracy was an engineer and tech lead at Pinterest, with roles on home feed and recommendations, ads products, web, infrastructure, API, email, and growth. Before Pinterest, she worked at Quora, also as an early engineer there. During the Obama federal administration she was on reserve with the U.S. Digital Service as a technical consultant.

Alongside her engineering career, Tracy is most well-known for her work pushing for diversity in tech. In 2013, she helped to kick off the wave of tech company diversity data disclosures with a Github repository collecting numbers on women in engineering. Tracy is now a founding member of Project Include and focused on driving solutions in the space. For her advocacy and activism work, she has appeared on the covers of The Atlantic, WIRED, and MIT Technology Review; been named TIME Women of the Year, Forbes Tech 30 under 30, MIT Technology Review 35 Innovators under 35, and Fast Company Most Creative People in Business; and been profiled in Vogue, ELLE, and other media outlets.

Tracy is an investment scout, advisor, and/or LP with various Bay Area venture capital firms and enjoys working with startups on engineering, product, culture, and diversity.

She is also an affiliate of the Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society at Harvard University and a Shorenstein Fellow with the Shorenstein Center on Media, Politics and Public Policy at the Harvard Kennedy School.

Tracy graduated from Stanford with an M.S. in Computer Science and a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, where she was a Terman Scholar and Mayfield Fellow and elected to Phi Beta Kappa and Tau Beta Pi.
Org: Shorenstein Center on Media, Politics and Public Policy at Harvard Kennedy School

Description (2):
WorkStep is AI-powered employee engagement software designed for distributed frontline teams. It helps HR and Operations leaders move beyond measuring sentiment to driving real-time action with smart surveys, built-in communication tools and AI-driven insights and coaching.

WorkStep's employee experience solution provides comprehensive employee listening, engagement, voice of the employee, and communication functionality including:

*Employee Feedback: WorkStep collects real-time insights from employees through milestone pulse, always-on, annual surveys, and bi-directional feedback channels.

*Employee Reporting: Reporting provides HR and Ops leaders with data on employee behavior which can be segmented by various filters including role type, location, demographics and tenure, to identify trends and patterns that may impact retention

*Predictive Analytics: WorkStep utilizes machine learning to determine the top areas of improvement, at facility or role level, and suggest high-impact actions to reduce employee turnover

*Impact Analysis: Employers can measure the success of any initiative implemented by tracking the change in employee sentiment and retention across the impacted population

*Communication: Leaders can reply to urgent comments and alerts while maintaining employee anonymity or broadly communicate to segments of the workforce to bring attention to new programs, share critical updates, celebrate teams, or solicit feedback.

Combining real-time data with AI-powered analytics and built-in communication tools, WorkStep helps eHR & Operations leaders identify and directly address opportunities in their frontline operations. This results in improved retention rates, increased productivity, and reduced costs.
Headline: Operations, Customer Experience, People

Description: CEO of @wonderschools, using economics & finance to ensure every child has access to child care. Into catan & investing @port_strategy
Title: SF Bay Chapter
Summary: I am the Founder and CEO of Wonderschool, a technology company working to ensure all children have access to quality childcare within five minutes from home. You can learn about our work by watching my TED Talk: "A Close-To-Home Solution for Accessible Childcare." We're growing our team and customer base; visit us at www.wonderschool.com to learn more.
Description (2):
Wonderschool is an AI-powered marketplace solving the child care crisis by connecting governments, providers, parents, teachers, and nonprofits on one integrated platform.

There is a nationwide shortage of child care and preschool options, and we believe one of the most effective ways to expand access is by helping teachers and caregivers start and grow successful programs—especially home-based child care businesses.

For providers, Wonderschool offers comprehensive support to launch and operate high-quality programs. We assist with licensing, classroom setup, pricing strategy, website creation, enrollment support, daily operations, and more. Our platform is designed to let educators focus on what they do best: caring for and educating children.

For governments, we offer AI-powered tools to help manage and expand early education ecosystems. Our technology helps states and municipalities identify child care deserts, support local providers, increase quality, and ensure families can access programs that meet their needs. By unifying data, services, and funding mechanisms, we help public agencies scale solutions effectively and equitably.

We are proud to partner with leaders across sectors—from families and educators to policymakers and nonprofits—to create a future where every child has access to early learning.

Wonderschool is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Goldman Sachs, First Round Capital, Lerer Ventures, Imaginable Futures, and Long Journey Ventures.
Headline: CEO at Wonderschool

I believe the digital world can — and must — be built for belonging. I’m committed to actively building a future we all want to live in.

• Modernize ADA-paratransit systems with streamlined eligibility, booking, and payments

Description (2): The Treasury Department is the executive agency responsible for promoting economic prosperity and ensuring the financial security of the United States. The Department is responsible for a wide range of activities such as advising the President on economic and financial issues, encouraging sustainable economic growth, and fostering improved governance in financial institutions. The Department of the Treasury operates and maintains systems that are critical to the nation's financial infrastructure, such as the production of coin and currency, the disbursement of payments to the American public, revenue collection, and the borrowing of funds necessary to run the federal government. The Department works with other federal agencies, foreign governments, and international financial institutions to encourage global economic growth, raise standards of living, and to the extent possible, predict and prevent economic and financial crises. The Treasury Department also performs a critical and far-reaching role in enhancing national security by implementing economic sanctions against foreign threats to the U.S., identifying and targeting the financial support networks of national security threats, and improving the safeguards of our financial systems.
Headline: CIO at Treasury; Board Member at Levels

Summary:
Rachael Neumann plays across many parts of the startup ecosystem, chiefly as Head of Startups in Australia & New Zealand for Amazon Web Services - Amazon’s technology and services business serving millions of customers around the world.  In this role, Rachael is charged with growing out the market, driving quantity and quality of startups in the region.  To this end, Rachael is a strategic advisor and investor to a number of founders and their early stage companies and is a Partner in Startmate, Australia’s most ambitious accelerator. She’s passionate about helping companies scale and increase their impact impact through differentiated customer experiences and new product development.

Rachael also works to create the right policy environment that’s conducive to a thriving sector, and serves as Chair of the Board for StartupAus - Australia's national startup advocacy and lobby group - and has a federal ministerial appointment distributing commercialisation and acceleration funding on behalf of the Department of Industry, Innovation and Science.

Previously, Rachael was the Managing Director of Eventbrite Australia, launching the Melbourne-based office to further serve the ANZ market. Before stepping into the MD role, Rachael served as Eventbrite’s Director of Customer Experience Strategy.  Prior to this, Rachael was a Case Team Leader at at Bain & Company in Silicon Valley and throughout Australia, advising Technology, Private Equity, Consumer Products and Retail businesses.

Rachael was also a founding Board Member of LaunchVic, a $60m venture seeking to solidify Victoria as a global destination of choice for entrepreneurs, startups, and innovative companies.

Educated in the States with an undergraduate degree from Stanford University and two Masters degrees from Columbia University, Rachael has bounced between Australia and the US for the last ten years and now proudly calls Melbourne home, alongside her partner and two children.

Title: Chief Executive Officer
Summary:
Life is too short for Linkedin, but I'm here anyway.

I wrote The Almanack of Naval Ravikant, which has now sold more than 1 million copies worldwide.

Scribe Media helped me publish that book, and I became a huge believer in their vision and professional self-publishing as the best choice for most authors. After the company went through a tough transition, I joined as CEO to build the ultimate next-generation publishing company.

I also invest in obsessive geniuses building utopian technologies (space mining, nuclear reactors, robotics, etc) through Rolling.fun
Address - Locations: 507 Calles St, Suite 107, Austin, Texas 78702, US
Description (2):
Scribe helps busy professionals write the books they've been thinking, talking, and dreaming about for years—without them needing to type a single word.

We're obsessed with Unlocking the World's Wisdom. No, really, that's our mission statement. And it applies to everything we do. We believe everyone has a story to tell. The only thing more important to us than those stories are the People telling them.

Scribe bridges the gap between who they are right now and the Author they want to be.

That may sound complicated, but it's actually very simple.

Our Authors have already done the hard work. They've spent their lives learning and adapting—gaining priceless wisdom and expertise. They want to share this one-of-a-kind knowledge. So, we hone that experience. We provide the platform, the soapbox, and the microphone for their story. Literally.

But, it doesn't stop there. We're not just a book writing or publishing company.

We're a People company. We don't just tell stories. We connect those stories with the people who need them most. Our Authors can't sit in the room one-on-one with every person they want to reach, but their book can. So we create and execute a plan to do just that—get an Author's book in the perfect reader's hands (and ears).

And we're not concerned with immediate returns—though our Authors see their fair share. It's about being part of an ecosystem that evolves with and sustains Authors. Putting a book in the hands of the perfect reader isn't the end goal. It's just the beginning.

The dream, the reason we do this, the reason Scribe exists, is the cumulative effect of Unlocking the World's Wisdom. It's sharing those experiences, and that expertise, with the people who need it most.

It's about helping people, one book at a time.
Headline: CEO at Scribe Media, Author of The Almanack of Naval Ravikant

Description: Alleviating global poverty with startup cities @PronomosVC; previously founded @Seasteading @Ephemerisle
Title: General Partner
Summary:
COLD PITCHES FOR CHARTER CITIES ONLY - I do not invest in random tech, FinTech, AI, network states, etc.

I'm the guy who's spent 20 years saying the world needs startup countries to get innovation & customer-focus in the governance industry. After all, innovation requires trying new things, which is almost impossible in governance. And monopoly providers like today's countries have little incentive to serve their customer-citizens well. That's why startup cities, territories, and eventually countries are the answer.

In the early 2000s I created this theory, and looked to ocean cities as the answer, writing a book on seasteading and then (with funding from Peter Thiel) starting the non-profit Seasteading Institute in 2008. When the Honduran ZEDE program started in 2011, I pivoted to charter cities on land, as it seemed much more tractable. I started the first modern co in the space, Future Cities Development, and then in 2017 began developing the first investment fund for the space, Pronomos Capital.

Other work I'm proud of includes starting intentional communities in 2000 & 2005, coding for 10 years at Google (from 2004), writing the first breakeven AI poker bot (2005, w/ Adam Bliss & Mike Maurer), founding the Ephemerisle festival (15y: 2009-present), and proposing a decentralized network of open-source nodes validating cryptocurrency transactions by majority vote in 2002 in a paper read by absolutely no one.

If we haven't directly interacted, please follow me here or on Twitter (https://twitter.com/patrissimo) rather than sending a request.
Description (2): Our mission is to build prosperous cities that grow to empower entire nations. We do this by partnering with citizens, states, and developers to upgrade institutions so we can improve the lives of millions.

My passion for data and problem-solving has brought me to leading a group of talented individuals at First Resonance - a company I co-founded.

Ever since my early days engineering consumer electronics at Motorola, I've been obsessed with leveraging data to solve problems. More recently, I have built data and automation systems to enable rocket reusability at SpaceX.

Description:

more fun = Threads (voxmatt)

Title: Co-Founder & CEO
Summary:
Today: Co-founder and CEO at Clockwise. How I got here: leveraging my very predictable and linear career path from die-hard Apple nerd to AM radio host to corporate lawyer to software engineering to startup founder.

At Clockwise, we've spent years building the world's most advanced scheduling brain and pioneering how AI will fundamentally reshape workplace productivity. So, it’s a bit amazing to watch the AI ecosystem explode, with every company under the sun releasing an “assistant,” but then failing at the most basic assistant task: scheduling meetings.

We're fixing that.
Address - Locations: 2261 Market St, 5100, San Francisco, California 94114, US
Description (2):
Clockwise is an AI-powered calendar assistant that builds smarter schedules for everyone by coordinating the way individuals, teams, and companies prefer to work.

Clockwise is a new way of working. It’s driven by smart technology and inspired by a simple idea—that the best way to work together is for our schedules to do the same. Consider it a workday that allows us to actually work during the day, simply by making time each day for us to focus.

Clockwise’s mission is to help people make time for what matters, and we've done so by creating 6 million hours of time for focused work. Today, over 40,000 organizations, including Atlassian, Asana, Reddit, and Zoom, run on Clockwise.
Headline: CEO at Clockwise | The world’s most powerful scheduling brain

Description: President of ProInsurance, Father, Husband, Avid Outdoorsman, Fisherman, & Beekeeper.
Title: President/CEO
Summary:
While the insurance industry is complex and rapidly changing, our client’s needs are as well.  The people on the ProInsurance team embody what it means to be passionate about what you do.  That means our clients experience the excellent service and work ethic I get to see every day.

We take enormous pride in being welcomed into discussions with individuals, business leaders, investors, boards and employees to strategize on some of the most important decisions facing our clients.  Asking important, often difficult, questions, listening and applying our processes, procedures and industry knowledge is what allows our team to deliver the right product at the right time.  As the CEO and President of ProInsurance, I encourage every team member to take initiaive in their position, and give them the tools to do so.

In the Marin community, I am involved in many organizations including the Young Presidents Organization (YPO), Center for Volunteer and Nonprofit Leadership (CVNP), and Marin Economic Forum (MEF).

I am always on the lookout for strategic partnerships, so please feel free to message me!
Headline: President/CEO at ProInsurance Associates, LLC

Title: Strategic Projects Lead
Summary:
I'm obsessed with customer obsession. We should build products, communities, and companies that speak up to our users—and that's what I'm here to do.

Most companies view support as drag they have to overcome just to launch new products—it's a big reason you see companies using noreply@, focusing on reducing contact rate. To survive, they bluntly stop hearing from most of their customers.

By building a great support *system*, we can create an environment that's observable, resilient, and tunable. Great support at scale isn't about hearing less from people; rather, scaled stellar support allows you to hear your customers better. Support should be an accelerant to launching and iterating on great new products, and bringing your customers' voice to the forefront—whether it's user #1 or #1,000,000. Your product and engineering teams should be looking to your support team to hear what customers are asking for, what hacky ways they're using your APIs for clever new things, what limitations hold them back (and opportunities for better features exist).

Power to the people—let's build for humanity's full potential.
Location Name: New York, New York, United States
Description (2):
OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core. OpenAI is dedicated to putting that alignment of interests first — ahead of profit.

To achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity. Our investment in diversity, equity, and inclusion is ongoing, executed through a wide range of initiatives, and championed and supported by leadership.

At OpenAI, we believe artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges, and we want the upside of AI to be widely shared. Join us in shaping the future of technology.
Headline: Building OpenAI on OpenAI

Title: Chair of the Board of Directors (Member Volunteer)
Summary:
As President of the Digital ID & Authentication Council of Canada (DIACC), Joni builds on 20 years of experience in digital identity innovations, frameworks, standards, policy, and business development. She helps DIACC fulfill its vision of unlocking the interoperability of public and private sector capabilities by establishing a trust assurance and risk management framework that will grow Canada's economy. Joni builds impactful relationships and formalizes strategic partnerships between and across public and private sector organizations.

Joni is honoured to serve as an individual representative of Canada in the G7 Digital Governance Task Force. She also serves as co-Chair of CANARIE's Trust and Identity Advisory Committee. Joni previously served as co-Chair of Working Group 1 of the Standards Council of Canada's Data Governance Standardization Collaboration.

She has participated in committees and initiatives worldwide, including OECD-ITAC, ISOC, IEEE, OASIS-SSTC, and ISO SC27 WG5, and testified before the US Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology Security and Privacy (ONC HITSP). Joni is recognized as One World IIdentity'stop 100 global influencers of Identity.

Before joining DIACC, Joni was Kantara Initiative's Executive Director, driving business, legal, and technology interoperability programs to connect entities and individuals in a more trustworthy environment. Joni led Kantara Initiative as the United States' premiere trust framework provider delivering value to multiple industry sectors. Joni helped to ensure the Kantara Initiative program is aligned with multiple eGovernment strategies from economic regions, including Canada, New Zealand, Sweden, and the United Kingdom.

Joni Brennan previously served as the first-ever IEEE-SA Technology Evangelist for Internet Identity and Trust, focusing on governance, policy, and technology development issues that touch digital Identity, personally identifiable information, and trust services.

When not connecting the digital identity world for the better, Joni can be found creating future-thinking musical collaborations. She can also be found skiing in beautiful British Columbia, Canada.
Description (2):
IDPro is the organization that:
* helps define, support, and improve the digital identity profession globally
* facilitates identity practitioners interacting with, learning from, and giving back to their professional community
* enables identity technology and service providers to interact with identity professionals in thoughtful, respectful, and valuable ways
*provides a collective voice for the digital identity and access management industry to policy makers
Headline: President at DIACC

The Company is a fully-integrated office REIT that owns, develops, acquires, leases and manages properties primarily in the best business districts (BBDs) of Atlanta, Charlotte, Dallas, Nashville, Orlando, Pittsburgh, Raleigh, Richmond and Tampa.
